ï»¿RODERICK HUDSON

CHAPTER I. [Rowland

Mallet]281-rowland had made [his]342-his arrangements to sail for [Europe]1-europe on the first of September , and having in the interval a fortnight to spare , [he]342-his determined to spend it with [[his]342-his cousin]343-his cousin [Cecilia]169-cecilia , [the widow of a nephew of [[his]342-his father]345-his father]344-the widow of a nephew of his father . [He]342-his was urged by the reflection that an affectionate farewell might help to exonerate [him]342-his from the charge of neglect frequently preferred by [this lady]346-this lady . It was not that [the young man]347-the young man disliked [her]346-this lady ; on the contrary , [he]342-his regarded [her]346-this lady with a tender admiration , and [he]342-his had not forgotten how , when [[his]342-his cousin]343-his cousin had brought [her]346-this lady [home]349-home on [her]346-this lady marriage , [he]342-his had seemed to feel the upward sweep of the empty bough from which the golden fruit had been plucked , and had then and there accepted the prospect of bachelorhood . The truth was , that , as it will be part of the entertainment of this narrative to exhibit , [Rowland Mallet]281-rowland had an uncomfortably sensitive conscience , and that , in spite of the seeming paradox , [his]342-his visits to [Cecilia]169-cecilia were rare because [she]169-cecilia and [her]169-cecilia misfortunes were often uppermost in it . [Her]169-cecilia misfortunes were three in number : first , [she]169-cecilia had lost [[her]169-cecilia husband]350-her husband ; second , [she]169-cecilia had lost [her]169-cecilia money or the greater part of it ; and third , [she]169-cecilia lived at [Northampton]2-northampton , [Massachusetts]3-massachusetts . [Mallet]170-mr. mallet 's compassion was really wasted , because [Cecilia]169-cecilia was [a very clever woman]351-a very clever woman , and [a most skillful counter - plotter to adversity]352-a most skillful counter - plotter to adversity . [She]169-cecilia had made [herself]169-cecilia a charming [home]349-home , [her]169-cecilia economies were not obtrusive , and there was always a cheerful flutter in the folds of [her]169-cecilia crape . It was the consciousness of all this that puzzled [Mallet]170-mr. mallet whenever [he]170-mr. mallet felt tempted to put in [his]170-mr. mallet oar . [He]170-mr. mallet had money and [he]170-mr. mallet had time , but [he]170-mr. mallet never could decide just how to place these gifts gracefully at [Cecilia]169-cecilia 's service . [He]170-mr. mallet no longer felt like marrying [her]169-cecilia : in these eight years that fancy had died a natural death . And yet [her]169-cecilia extreme cleverness seemed somehow to make charity difficult and patronage impossible . [He]170-mr. mallet would rather chop off [his]170-mr. mallet hand than offer [her]169-cecilia a check , a piece of useful furniture , or a black silk dress ; and yet there was some sadness in seeing such [a bright , proud woman]354-a bright , proud woman living in such a small , dull way . [Cecilia]169-cecilia had , moreover , a turn for sarcasm , and [her]169-cecilia smile , which was [her]169-cecilia pretty feature , was never so pretty as when [her]169-cecilia sprightly phrase had a lurking scratch in it . [Rowland]281-rowland remembered that , for [him]170-mr. mallet , [she]169-cecilia was all smiles , and suspected , awkwardly , that [he]170-mr. mallet ministered not a little to [her]169-cecilia sense of the irony of things . And in truth , with [his]170-mr. mallet means , [his]170-mr. mallet leisure , and [his]170-mr. mallet opportunities , what had [he]170-mr. mallet done ? [He]170-mr. mallet had an unaffected suspicion of [his]170-mr. mallet uselessness . [Cecilia]169-cecilia , meanwhile , cut out [her]169-cecilia own dresses , and was personally giving [[her]169-cecilia little girl]355-her little girl the education of [a princess]356-a princess .

This time , however , [he]170-mr. mallet presented [himself]170-mr. mallet bravely enough ; for in the way of activity it was something definite , at least , to be going to [Europe]1-europe and to be meaning to spend the winter in [Rome]4-rome . [Cecilia]169-cecilia met [him]170-mr. mallet in the early dusk at the gate of [[her]169-cecilia little garden]357-her little garden , amid a studied combination of floral perfumes . [A rosy widow of twenty - eight]358-a rosy widow of twenty - eight , [half cousin]359-half cousin , [half hostess]360-half hostess , doing the honors of [an odorous cottage]361-an odorous cottage on a midsummer evening , was a phenomenon to which [the young man]347-the young man 's imagination was able to do ample justice . [Cecilia]169-cecilia was always gracious , but this evening [she]169-cecilia was almost joyous . [She]169-cecilia was in a happy mood , and [Mallet]170-mr. mallet imagined there was a private reason for it - a reason quite distinct from [her]169-cecilia pleasure in receiving [[her]169-cecilia honored kinsman]363-her honored kinsman . The next day [he]170-mr. mallet flattered [himself]170-mr. mallet [he]170-mr. mallet was on the way to discover it .

For the present , after tea , as [they]364-they sat on [the rose - framed porch]365-the rose - framed porch , while [Rowland]281-rowland held [[his]170-mr. mallet younger cousin]366-his younger cousin between [his]170-mr. mallet knees , and [she]169-cecilia , enjoying [her]169-cecilia situation , listened timorously for the stroke of bedtime , [Cecilia]169-cecilia insisted on talking more about [[her]169-cecilia visitor]367-her visitor than about [herself]169-cecilia .

" What is it [you]170-mr. mallet mean to do in [Europe]1-europe ? "[169-cecilia] [she]169-cecilia asked , lightly , giving a turn to the frill of [her]169-cecilia sleeve - just such a turn as seemed to [Mallet]170-mr. mallet to bring out all the latent difficulties of the question .

" Why , very much what [I]170-mr. mallet do here , "[170-mr. mallet] [he]170-mr. mallet answered . " No great harm . "[170-mr. mallet]

" Is it true , "[169-cecilia] [Cecilia]169-cecilia asked , " that here [you]170-mr. mallet do no great harm ? Is not [a man like [you]170-mr. mallet]3092-a man like you doing harm when [he]3092-a man like you is not doing positive good ? "[169-cecilia]

" [Your]169-cecilia compliment is ambiguous , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland .

" No , "[368-the widow] answered [the widow]368-the widow , " [you]170-mr. mallet know what [I]368-the widow think of [you]170-mr. mallet . [You]170-mr. mallet have a particular aptitude for beneficence . [You]170-mr. mallet have it in the first place in [your]170-mr. mallet character . [You]170-mr. mallet are [a benevolent person]3093-a benevolent person . Ask [Bessie]171-bessie if [you]170-mr. mallet do n't hold [her]171-bessie more gently and comfortably than any of [[her]171-bessie other admirers]3094-her other admirers . "[368-the widow]

" [He]172-mr. hudson holds [me]171-bessie more comfortably than [Mr. Hudson]172-mr. hudson , "[171-bessie] [Bessie]171-bessie declared , roundly .

[Rowland]281-rowland , not knowing [Mr. Hudson]172-mr. hudson , could but half appreciate the eulogy , and [Cecilia]169-cecilia went on to develop [her]169-cecilia idea . " [Your]170-mr. mallet circumstances , in the second place , suggest the idea of social usefulness . [You]170-mr. mallet are intelligent , [you]170-mr. mallet are well - informed , and [your]170-mr. mallet charity , if one may call it charity , would be discriminating . [You]170-mr. mallet are rich and unoccupied , so that it might be abundant . Therefore , [I]169-cecilia say , [you]170-mr. mallet are [a person to do something on a large scale]3095-a person to do something on a large scale . Bestir [yourself]170-mr. mallet , dear [Rowland]281-rowland , or [we]3096-we may be taught to think that virtue [herself]3097-herself is setting a bad example . "[169-cecilia]

" Heaven forbid , "[281-rowland] cried [Rowland]281-rowland , " that [I]281-rowland should set the examples of virtue ! [I]281-rowland am quite willing to follow [them]3098-them , however , and if [I]281-rowland do n't do something on the grand scale , it is that [my]281-rowland genius is altogether imitative , and that [I]281-rowland have not recently encountered any very striking models of grandeur . Pray , what shall [I]281-rowland do ? Found [an orphan asylum]3099-an orphan asylum , or build [a dormitory for [Harvard College]5-harvard college]3100-a dormitory for harvard college ? [I]281-rowland am not rich enough to do either in an ideally handsome way , and [I]281-rowland confess that , yet awhile , [I]281-rowland feel too young to strike [my]281-rowland grand coup . [I]281-rowland am holding [myself]281-rowland ready for inspiration . [I]281-rowland am waiting till something takes [my]281-rowland fancy irresistibly . If inspiration comes at forty , it will be a hundred pities to have tied up [my]281-rowland money - bag at thirty . "[281-rowland]

" Well , [I]169-cecilia give [you]171-bessie till forty , "[169-cecilia] said [Cecilia]169-cecilia . " It 's only a word to [the wise]3101-the wise , a notification that [you]171-bessie are expected not to run [your]171-bessie course without having done something handsome for [[your]171-bessie fellow - men]3102-your fellow - men . "[169-cecilia]

Nine o'clock sounded , and [Bessie]171-bessie , with each stroke , courted a closer embrace . But a single winged word from [[her]171-bessie mother]369-her mother overleaped [her]171-bessie successive intrenchments . [She]171-bessie turned and kissed [[her]171-bessie cousin]370-her cousin , and deposited an irrepressible tear on [his]370-her cousin moustache . Then [she]171-bessie went and said [her]171-bessie prayers to [[her]171-bessie mother]369-her mother : it was evident [she]171-bessie was being admirably brought up . [Rowland]281-rowland , with the permission of [[his]370-her cousin hostess]372-his hostess , lighted a cigar and puffed it awhile in silence . [Cecilia]169-cecilia 's interest in [his]370-her cousin career seemed very agreeable . That [Mallet]281-rowland was without vanity [I]0-i by no means intend to affirm ; but there had been times when , seeing [him]370-her cousin accept , hardly less deferentially , advice even more peremptory than [the widow]368-the widow 's , [you]374-you might have asked [yourself]374-you what had become of [his]370-her cousin vanity . Now , in the sweet - smelling starlight , [he]370-her cousin felt gently wooed to egotism . There was a project connected with [his]370-her cousin going abroad which it was on [his]370-her cousin tongue 's end to communicate . It had no relation to [hospitals]375-hospitals or [dormitories]376-dormitories , and yet it would have sounded very generous . But it was not because it would have sounded generous that [poor Mallet]281-rowland at last puffed it away in the fumes of [his]370-her cousin cigar . Useful though it might be , it expressed most imperfectly [the young man]347-the young man 's own personal conception of usefulness . [He]370-her cousin was extremely fond of all the arts , and [he]370-her cousin had an almost passionate enjoyment of pictures . [He]370-her cousin had seen many , and [he]370-her cousin judged them sagaciously . It had occurred to [him]370-her cousin some time before that it would be the work of [a good citizen]378-a good citizen to go abroad and with all expedition and secrecy purchase certain valuable specimens of [the Dutch and Italian schools]379-the dutch and italian schools as to which [he]370-her cousin had received private proposals , and then present [his]370-her cousin treasures out of hand to [an American city]380-an american city , not unknown to aesthetic fame , in which at that time there prevailed a good deal of fruitless aspiration toward an art - museum . [He]370-her cousin had seen [himself]370-her cousin in imagination , more than once , in [some mouldy old saloon of [a Florentine palace]382-a florentine palace]381-some mouldy old saloon of a florentine palace , turning toward the deep embrasure of the window some scarcely - faded Ghirlandaio or [Botticelli]173-botticelli , while [a host in reduced circumstances]383-a host in reduced circumstances pointed out the lovely drawing of a hand . But [he]370-her cousin imparted none of these visions to [Cecilia]169-cecilia , and [he]370-her cousin suddenly swept them away with the declaration that [he]370-her cousin was of course [an idle , useless creature]384-an idle , useless creature , and that [he]370-her cousin would probably be even more so in [Europe]1-europe than at [home]349-home . " The only thing is , "[370-her cousin] [he]370-her cousin said , " that there [I]370-her cousin shall seem to be doing something . [I]370-her cousin shall be better entertained , and shall be therefore , [I]370-her cousin suppose , in a better humor with life . [You]3103-you may say that that is just the humor [a useless man]3104-a useless man should keep out of . [He]3104-a useless man should cultivate discontentment . [I]370-her cousin did a good many things when [I]370-her cousin was in [Europe]1-europe before , but [I]370-her cousin did not spend a winter in [Rome]4-rome . [Every one]3105-every one assures [me]370-her cousin that this is a peculiar refinement of bliss ; [most people]3106-most people talk about [Rome]4-rome in the same way . It is evidently only a sort of idealized form of loafing : a passive life in [Rome]4-rome , thanks to the number and the quality of [one]3107-one 's impressions , takes on a very respectable likeness to activity . It is still lotus - eating , only [you]3103-you sit down at table , and the lotuses are served up on rococo china . It 's all very well , but [I]370-her cousin have a distinct prevision of this - that if Roman life does n't do something substantial to make [you]3103-you happier , it increases tenfold [your]3103-you liability to moral misery . It seems to [me]370-her cousin a rash thing for a sensitive soul deliberately to cultivate its sensibilities by rambling too often among [the ruins of [the Palatine]6-the palatine]3108-the ruins of the palatine , or riding too often in the shadow of [the aqueducts]3109-the aqueducts . In such recreations the chords of feeling grow tense , and after - life , to spare [your]3103-you intellectual nerves , must play upon them with a touch as dainty as the tread of [Mignon]174-mignon when [she]174-mignon danced [her]174-mignon egg - dance . "[370-her cousin]

" [I]169-cecilia should have said , [[my]169-cecilia dear]3110-my dear [Rowland]281-rowland , "[169-cecilia] said [Cecilia]169-cecilia , with a laugh , " that [your]281-rowland nerves were tough , that [your]281-rowland eggs were hard ! "[169-cecilia]

" That being stupid , [you]281-rowland mean , [I]370-her cousin might be happy ? Upon [my]370-her cousin word [I]370-her cousin am not . [I]370-her cousin am clever enough to want more than [I]370-her cousin ' ve got . [I]370-her cousin am tired of [myself]370-her cousin , [my]370-her cousin own thoughts , [my]370-her cousin own affairs , [my]370-her cousin own eternal company . True happiness , [we]3111-we are told , consists in getting out of [one]3107-one 's self ; but the point is not only to get out - [you]281-rowland must stay out ; and to stay out [you]281-rowland must have some absorbing errand . Unfortunately , [I]370-her cousin ' ve got no errand , and [nobody]3113-nobody will trust [me]370-her cousin with one . [I]370-her cousin want to care for something , or for some one . And [I]370-her cousin want to care with [a certain ardor]3114-a certain ardor ; even , if [you]281-rowland can believe it , with a certain passion . [I]370-her cousin ca n't just now feel ardent and passionate about [a hospital]3115-a hospital or [a dormitory]3116-a dormitory . Do [you]281-rowland know [I]370-her cousin sometimes think that [I]370-her cousin ' m [a man of genius , half finished]3117-a man of genius , half finished ? [The genius]3118-the genius has been left out , the faculty of expression is wanting ; but the need for expression remains , and [I]370-her cousin spend [my]370-her cousin days groping for the latch of a closed door . "[370-her cousin]

" What an immense number of words , "[169-cecilia] said [Cecilia]169-cecilia after a pause , " to say [you]281-rowland want to fall in love ! [I]169-cecilia ' ve no doubt [you]281-rowland have as good a genius for that as [any one]3119-any one , if [you]281-rowland would only trust it . "[169-cecilia]

" Of course [I]370-her cousin ' ve thought of that , and [I]370-her cousin assure [you]281-rowland [I]370-her cousin hold [myself]370-her cousin ready . But , evidently , [I]370-her cousin ' m not inflammable . Is there in [Northampton]2-northampton some perfect epitome of the graces ? "[370-her cousin]

" Of the graces ? "[169-cecilia] said [Cecilia]169-cecilia , raising [her]169-cecilia eyebrows and suppressing too distinct a consciousness of being [herself]169-cecilia a rosy embodiment of several . " The household virtues are better represented . There are [some excellent girls]3120-some excellent girls , and there are [two or three very pretty ones]3121-two or three very pretty ones . [I]169-cecilia will have [them]3121-two or three very pretty ones here , one by one , to tea , if [you]281-rowland like . "[169-cecilia]

" [I]370-her cousin should particularly like it ; especially as [I]370-her cousin should give [you]281-rowland a chance to see , by the profundity of [my]370-her cousin attention , that if [I]370-her cousin am not happy , it 's not for want of taking pains . "[370-her cousin]

[Cecilia]169-cecilia was silent a moment ; and then , " On the whole , "[169-cecilia] [she]169-cecilia resumed , " [I]169-cecilia do n't think there are any worth asking . There are none so very pretty , none so very pleasing . "[169-cecilia]

" Are [you]169-cecilia very sure ? "[347-the young man] asked [the young man]347-the young man , rising and throwing away [his]347-the young man cigar - end .

" Upon [my]169-cecilia word , "[169-cecilia] cried [Cecilia]169-cecilia , " one would suppose [I]169-cecilia wished to keep [you]281-rowland for [myself]169-cecilia . Of course [I]169-cecilia am sure ! But as the penalty of [your]281-rowland insinuations , [I]169-cecilia shall invite [the plainest and prosiest damsel that can be found]3122-the plainest and prosiest damsel that can be found , and leave [you]281-rowland alone with [her]3122-the plainest and prosiest damsel that can be found . "[169-cecilia]

[Rowland]281-rowland smiled . " Even against [her]3122-the plainest and prosiest damsel that can be found , "[347-the young man] [he]347-the young man said , " [I]347-the young man should be sorry to conclude until [I]347-the young man had given [her]3122-the plainest and prosiest damsel that can be found [my]347-the young man respectful attention . "[347-the young man]

This little profession of ideal chivalry which closed the conversation was not quite so fanciful on [Mallet]281-rowland 's lips as it would have been on those of [many another man]387-many another man ; as a rapid glance at [his]347-the young man antecedents may help to make [the reader]388-the reader perceive . [His]347-the young man life had been a singular mixture of the rough and the smooth . [He]347-the young man had sprung from [a rigid Puritan stock]389-a rigid puritan stock , and had been brought up to think much more intently of the duties of this life than of its privileges and pleasures . [[His]347-the young man progenitors]390-his progenitors had submitted in the matter of dogmatic theology to the relaxing influences of recent years ; but if [Rowland]281-rowland 's youthful consciousness was not chilled by the menace of long punishment for brief transgression , [he]347-the young man had at least been made to feel that there ran through all things a strain of right and of wrong , as different , after all , in [their]391-their complexions , as the texture , to the spiritual sense , of Sundays and week - days . [[His]347-the young man father]345-his father was [a chip of the primal Puritan block]393-a chip of the primal puritan block , [a man with an icy smile and a stony frown]394-a man with an icy smile and a stony frown . [He]345-his father had always bestowed on [[his]345-his father son]395-his son , on principle , more frowns than smiles , and if [the lad]396-the lad had not been turned to stone [himself]396-the lad , it was because nature had blessed [him]396-the lad , inwardly , with a well of vivifying waters . [Mrs. Mallet]175-mrs. mallet had been a [Miss Rowland]176-miss rowland , [the daughter of [a retired sea - captain , once famous on the ships that sailed from [Salem]7-salem and [Newburyport]8-newburyport]398-a retired sea - captain , once famous on the ships that sailed from salem and newburyport]397-the daughter of a retired sea - captain , once famous on the ships that sailed from salem and newburyport . [He]345-his father had brought to port many a cargo which crowned the edifice of fortunes already almost colossal , but [he]345-his father had also done a little sagacious trading on [his]345-his father own account , and [he]345-his father was able to retire , prematurely for so sea - worthy a maritime organism , upon a pension of [his]345-his father own providing . [He]345-his father was to be seen for a year on [the Salem wharves]399-the salem wharves , smoking the best tobacco and eying [the seaward horizon]400-the seaward horizon with an inveteracy which [superficial minds]401-superficial minds interpreted as a sign of repentance . At last , one evening , [he]345-his father disappeared beneath [it]402-it , as [he]345-his father had often done before ; this time , however , not as [a commissioned navigator]403-a commissioned navigator , but simply as [an amateur of an observing turn]404-an amateur of an observing turn likely to prove oppressive to [the officer in command of [the vessel]406-the vessel]405-the officer in command of the vessel . Five months later [[his]345-his father place at [home]349-home]407-his place at home knew [him]345-his father again , and made the acquaintance also of [a handsome , blonde young woman , of redundant contours , speaking a foreign tongue]409-a handsome , blonde young woman , of redundant contours , speaking a foreign tongue . The foreign tongue proved , after much conflicting research , to be the idiom of [Amsterdam]177-amsterdam , and [the young woman]410-the young woman , which was stranger still , to be [[Captain Rowland]281-rowland 's wife]411-captain rowland 's wife . Why [he]345-his father had gone forth so suddenly across [the seas]412-the seas to marry [her]410-the young woman , what had happened between [them]413-them before , and whether - though it was of questionable propriety for [a good citizen]378-a good citizen to espouse [a young person of mysterious origin]415-a young person of mysterious origin , who did [her]410-the young woman hair in fantastically elaborate plaits , and in whose appearance " figure "[416-an irresponsible bachelor] enjoyed such striking predominance - [he]345-his father would not have had a heavy weight on [his]345-his father conscience if [he]345-his father had remained [an irresponsible bachelor]416-an irresponsible bachelor ; these questions and many others , bearing with varying degrees of immediacy on the subject , were much propounded but scantily answered , and this history need not be charged with resolving them . [Mrs. Rowland]179-mrs. rowland , for [so handsome a woman]417-so handsome a woman , proved [a tranquil neighbor]418-a tranquil neighbor and [an excellent housewife]419-an excellent housewife . [Her]179-mrs. rowland extremely fresh complexion , however , was always suffused with an air of apathetic homesickness , and [she]179-mrs. rowland played [her]179-mrs. rowland part in American society chiefly by having the little squares of brick pavement in front of [[her]179-mrs. rowland dwelling]420-her dwelling scoured and polished as nearly as possible into the likeness of Dutch tiles . [Rowland Mallet]281-rowland remembered having seen [her]179-mrs. rowland , as [a child]421-a child - [an immensely stout , white - faced lady , wearing a high cap of very stiff tulle , speaking English with a formidable accent , and suffering from dropsy]422-an immensely stout , white - faced lady , wearing a high cap of very stiff tulle , speaking english with a formidable accent , and suffering from dropsy . [Captain Rowland]281-rowland was [a little bronzed and wizened man , with eccentric opinions]423-a little bronzed and wizened man , with eccentric opinions . [He]345-his father advocated the creation of [a public promenade along [the sea]425-the sea]424-a public promenade along the sea , with arbors and little green tables for the consumption of beer , and [a platform , surrounded by Chinese lanterns , for dancing]426-a platform , surrounded by chinese lanterns , for dancing . [He]345-his father especially desired [the town library]427-the town library to be opened on Sundays , though , as [he]345-his father never entered [it]427-the town library on week - days , it was easy to turn the proposition into ridicule . If , therefore , [Mrs. Mallet]175-mrs. mallet was [a woman of an exquisite moral tone]428-a woman of an exquisite moral tone , it was not that [she]179-mrs. rowland had inherited [her]179-mrs. rowland temper from [an ancestry with a turn for casuistry]429-an ancestry with a turn for casuistry . [Jonas Mallet]180-jonas mallet , at the time of [his]180-jonas mallet marriage , was conducting with silent shrewdness a small , unpromising business . Both [his]180-jonas mallet shrewdness and [his]180-jonas mallet silence increased with [his]180-jonas mallet years , and at the close of [his]180-jonas mallet life [he]180-jonas mallet was [an extremely well - dressed , well - brushed gentleman , with a frigid gray eye , who said little to [anybody]431-anybody , but of whom [everybody]432-everybody said that [he]180-jonas mallet had a very handsome fortune]430-an extremely well - dressed , well - brushed gentleman , with a frigid gray eye , who said little to anybody , but of whom everybody said that he had a very handsome fortune . [He]180-jonas mallet was not [a sentimental father]433-a sentimental father , and the roughness [I]0-i just now spoke of in [Rowland]281-rowland 's life dated from [his]180-jonas mallet early boyhood . [Mr. Mallet]170-mr. mallet , whenever [he]170-mr. mallet looked at [[his]170-mr. mallet son]395-his son , felt extreme compunction at having made a fortune . [He]170-mr. mallet remembered that the fruit had not dropped ripe from the tree into [his]170-mr. mallet own mouth , and determined it should be no fault of [his]170-mr. mallet if [the boy]435-the boy was corrupted by luxury . [Rowland]281-rowland , therefore , except for a good deal of expensive instruction in foreign tongues and abstruse sciences , received the education of [[a poor man]436-a poor man 's son]437-a poor man 's son . [His]180-jonas mallet fare was plain , [his]180-jonas mallet temper familiar with the discipline of patched trousers , and [his]180-jonas mallet habits marked by an exaggerated simplicity which it really cost a good deal of money to preserve unbroken . [He]180-jonas mallet was kept in [the country]438-the country for months together , in the midst of [[servants]439-servants who had strict injunctions to see that [he]180-jonas mallet suffered no serious harm , but were as strictly forbidden to wait upon [him]180-jonas mallet]440-servants who had strict injunctions to see that he suffered no serious harm , but were as strictly forbidden to wait upon him . As [no school]441-no school could be found conducted on principles sufficiently rigorous , [he]180-jonas mallet was attended at [home]349-home by [a master]443-a master who set a high price on the understanding that [he]180-jonas mallet was to illustrate the beauty of abstinence not only by precept but by example . [Rowland]281-rowland passed for [a child of ordinary parts]444-a child of ordinary parts , and certainly , during [his]180-jonas mallet younger years , was an excellent imitation of [a boy who had inherited nothing whatever that was to make life]445-a boy who had inherited nothing whatever that was to make life easy . [He]180-jonas mallet was passive , pliable , frank , extremely slow at [his]180-jonas mallet books , and inordinately fond of trout - fishing . [His]180-jonas mallet hair , a memento of [his]180-jonas mallet Dutch ancestry , was of the fairest shade of yellow , [his]180-jonas mallet complexion absurdly rosy , and [his]180-jonas mallet measurement around the waist , when [he]180-jonas mallet was about ten years old , quite alarmingly large . This , however , was but an episode in [his]180-jonas mallet growth ; [he]180-jonas mallet became afterwards [a fresh - colored , yellow - bearded man]446-a fresh - colored , yellow - bearded man , but [he]180-jonas mallet was never accused of anything worse than a tendency to corpulence . [He]180-jonas mallet emerged from childhood [a simple , wholesome , round - eyed lad]447-a simple , wholesome , round - eyed lad , with no suspicion that a less roundabout course might have been taken to make [him]180-jonas mallet happy , but with a vague sense that [his]180-jonas mallet young experience was not a fair sample of human freedom , and that [he]180-jonas mallet was to make a great many discoveries . When [he]180-jonas mallet was about fifteen , [he]180-jonas mallet achieved a momentous one . [He]180-jonas mallet ascertained that [[his]180-jonas mallet mother]448-his mother was [a saint]449-a saint . [She]448-his mother had always been a very distinct presence in [his]180-jonas mallet life , but so ineffably gentle a one that [his]180-jonas mallet sense was fully opened to it only by the danger of losing [her]448-his mother . [She]448-his mother had an illness which for many months was liable at any moment to terminate fatally , and during [her]448-his mother long - arrested convalescence [she]448-his mother removed the mask which [she]448-his mother had worn for years by [[her]448-his mother husband]350-her husband 's order . [Rowland]281-rowland spent [his]180-jonas mallet days at [her]448-his mother side and felt before long as if [he]180-jonas mallet had made [a new friend]451-a new friend . All [his]180-jonas mallet impressions at this period were commented and interpreted at leisure in the future , and it was only then that [he]180-jonas mallet understood that [[his]180-jonas mallet mother]448-his mother had been for fifteen years [a perfectly unhappy woman]453-a perfectly unhappy woman . [Her]448-his mother marriage had been an immitigable error which [she]448-his mother had spent [her]448-his mother life in trying to look straight in the face . [She]448-his mother found nothing to oppose to [[her]448-his mother husband]350-her husband 's will of steel but the appearance of absolute compliance ; [her]448-his mother spirit sank , and [she]448-his mother lived for a while in a sort of helpless moral torpor . But at last , as [[her]448-his mother child]455-her child emerged from babyhood , [she]448-his mother began to feel a certain charm in patience , to discover the uses of ingenuity , and to learn that , somehow or other , [one]3107-one can always arrange [one]3107-one 's life . [She]448-his mother cultivated from this time forward a little private plot of sentiment , and it was of [this secluded precinct]458-this secluded precinct that , before [her]448-his mother death , [she]448-his mother gave [[her]448-his mother son]459-her son the key . [Rowland]281-rowland 's allowance at college was barely sufficient to maintain [him]459-her son decently , and as soon as [he]459-her son graduated , [he]459-her son was taken into [[[his]459-her son father]345-his father 's counting - house]461-his father 's counting - house , to do small drudgery on a proportionate salary . For three years [he]459-her son earned [his]459-her son living as regularly as [the obscure functionary in [fustian who swept the office]463-fustian who swept the office]462-the obscure functionary in fustian who swept the office . [Mr. Mallet]170-mr. mallet was consistent , but the perfection of [his]170-mr. mallet consistency was known only on [his]170-mr. mallet death . [He]170-mr. mallet left but a third of [[his]170-mr. mallet property]464-his property to [[his]170-mr. mallet son]395-his son , and devoted the remainder to various public institutions and local charities . [Rowland]281-rowland 's third was an easy competence , and [he]459-her son never felt a moment 's jealousy of [[his]459-her son fellow - pensioners]466-his fellow - pensioners ; but when one of the establishments which had figured most advantageously in [[his]459-her son father]345-his father 's will bethought itself to affirm the existence of a later instrument , in which it had been still more handsomely treated , [the young man]347-the young man felt a sudden passionate need to repel the claim by process of law . There was a lively tussle , but [he]347-the young man gained [his]347-the young man case ; immediately after which [he]347-the young man made , in another quarter , a donation of the contested sum . [He]347-the young man cared nothing for the money , but [he]347-the young man had felt an angry desire to protest against a destiny which seemed determined to be exclusively salutary . It seemed to [him]347-the young man that [he]347-the young man would bear a little spoiling . And yet [he]347-the young man treated [himself]347-the young man to a very modest quantity , and submitted without reserve to the great national discipline which began in 1861 . When the Civil War broke out [he]347-the young man immediately obtained a commission , and did [his]347-the young man duty for three long years as [a citizen soldier]469-a citizen soldier . [His]347-the young man duty was obscure , but [he]347-the young man never lost a certain private satisfaction in remembering that on two or three occasions it had been performed with something of an ideal precision . [He]347-the young man had disentangled [himself]347-the young man from business , and after the war [he]347-the young man felt a profound disinclination to tie the knot again . [He]347-the young man had no desire to make money , [he]347-the young man had money enough ; and although [he]347-the young man knew , and was frequently reminded , that [a young man]470-a young man is the better for a fixed occupation , [he]470-a young man could discover no moral advantage in driving a lucrative trade . Yet [few young men of means and leisure]471-few young men of means and leisure ever made less of a parade of idleness , and indeed idleness in any degree could hardly be laid at the door of [a young man who took life in the serious , attentive , reasoning fashion]472-a young man who took life in the serious , attentive , reasoning fashion of [[our]473-our friend]474-our friend . It often seemed to [Mallet]170-mr. mallet that [he]347-the young man wholly lacked the prime requisite of [a graceful flaneur]475-a graceful flaneur - the simple , sensuous , confident relish of pleasure . [He]347-the young man had frequent fits of extreme melancholy , in which [he]347-the young man declared that [he]347-the young man was neither fish nor flesh nor good red herring . [He]347-the young man was neither an irresponsibly contemplative nature nor [a sturdily practical one]476-a sturdily practical one , and [he]347-the young man was forever looking in vain for the uses of the things that please and the charm of the things that sustain . [He]347-the young man was [an awkward mixture of strong moral impulse and restless aesthetic curiosity]477-an awkward mixture of strong moral impulse and restless aesthetic curiosity , and yet [he]347-the young man would have made [a most ineffective reformer]478-a most ineffective reformer and [a very indifferent artist]479-a very indifferent artist . It seemed to [him]347-the young man that the glow of happiness must be found either in action , of some immensely solid kind , on behalf of an idea , or in producing a masterpiece in one of the arts . Oftenest , perhaps , [he]347-the young man wished [he]347-the young man were [a vigorous young man of genius , without a penny]480-a vigorous young man of genius , without a penny . As it was , [he]347-the young man could only buy pictures , and not paint them ; and in the way of action , [he]347-the young man had to content [himself]347-the young man with making a rule to render scrupulous moral justice to handsome examples of it in others . On the whole , [he]347-the young man had an incorruptible modesty . With [his]347-the young man blooming complexion and [his]347-the young man serene gray eye , [he]347-the young man felt the friction of existence more than was suspected ; but [he]347-the young man asked no allowance on grounds of temper , [he]347-the young man assumed that fate had treated [him]347-the young man inordinately well and that [he]347-the young man had no excuse for taking an ill - natured view of life , and [he]347-the young man undertook constantly to believe that [all women]481-all women were fair , [all men]482-all men were brave , and [the world]483-the world was a delightful place of sojourn , until the contrary had been distinctly proved .

[The lad]396-the lad was squarely planted on [his]396-the lad feet , with [his]396-the lad legs a little apart ; [his]396-the lad back was slightly hollowed , [his]396-the lad head thrown back , and both hands raised to support the rustic cup . " Oh , never mind [him]501-him ! "[171-bessie] said [Bessie]171-bessie , with the brevity of contempt .

" [You]347-the young man speak as if [you]347-the young man did n't like [him]501-him . "[171-bessie]

" [I]171-bessie do n't ! "[171-bessie] [Bessie]171-bessie affirmed , and put [Rowland]281-rowland to bed again .

The hammock was swung at the end of [the veranda]496-the veranda , in the thickest shade of the vines , and this fragment of dialogue had passed unnoticed . [Rowland]281-rowland submitted a while longer to be cradled , and contented [himself]281-rowland with listening to [Mr. Hudson]172-mr. hudson 's voice . It was a soft and not altogether masculine organ , and was pitched on this occasion in a somewhat plaintive and pettish key . [The young man]347-the young man 's mood seemed fretful ; [he]347-the young man complained of the heat , of the dust , of a shoe that hurt [him]347-the young man , of having gone on an errand a mile to [the other side of [the town]507-the town]506-the other side of the town and found [the person [he]347-the young man was in search of]508-the person he was in search of had left [Northampton]2-northampton an hour before .

" Wo n't [you]281-rowland have a cup of tea ? "[169-cecilia] [Cecilia]169-cecilia asked . " Perhaps that will restore [your]281-rowland equanimity . "[169-cecilia]

" Aye , by keeping [me]172-mr. hudson awake all night ! "[172-mr. hudson] said [Hudson]172-mr. hudson . " At the best , it 's hard enough to go down to [the office]3142-the office . "[172-mr. hudson]

" [[Your]281-rowland mother]3145-your mother is well , [I]169-cecilia hope . "[169-cecilia]

[The young man]347-the young man sprang up with alacrity , and [Rowland]281-rowland , coming forward to shake hands , had a good look at [him]347-the young man in the light projected from the parlor window . " [Your]281-rowland statuette seems to [me]281-rowland very good , "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland said gravely . " It has given [me]281-rowland extreme pleasure . "[281-rowland]

" Ah , to [Europe]1-europe ! "[172-mr. hudson] [Hudson]172-mr. hudson exclaimed with a melancholy cadence , as [they]510-they sat down . " [Happy man]3151-happy man ! "[172-mr. hudson]

But the note seemed to [Rowland]281-rowland to be struck rather at random , for [he]172-mr. hudson perceived no echo of it in the boyish garrulity of [his]172-mr. hudson later talk . [Hudson]172-mr. hudson was [a tall , slender young fellow , with a singularly mobile and intelligent face]511-a tall , slender young fellow , with a singularly mobile and intelligent face . [Rowland]281-rowland was struck at first only with its responsive vivacity , but in a short time [he]172-mr. hudson perceived it was remarkably handsome . The features were admirably chiseled and finished , and a frank smile played over them as gracefully as a breeze among flowers . The fault of [the young man]347-the young man 's whole structure was an excessive want of breadth . The forehead , though it was high and rounded , was narrow ; the jaw and the shoulders were narrow ; and the result was an air of insufficient physical substance . [But Mallet]170-mr. mallet afterwards learned that [this fair , slim youth]513-this fair , slim youth could draw indefinitely upon a mysterious fund of nervous force , which outlasted and outwearied the endurance of many a sturdier temperament . And certainly there was life enough in [his]347-the young man eye to furnish an immortality ! It was a generous dark gray eye , in which there came and went a sort of kindling glow , which would have made a ruder visage striking , and which gave at times to [Hudson]172-mr. hudson 's harmonious face an altogether extraordinary beauty . There was to [Rowland]281-rowland 's sympathetic sense a slightly pitiful disparity between [the young sculptor]492-the young sculptor 's delicate countenance and the shabby gentility of [his]347-the young man costume . [He]347-the young man was dressed for a visit - a visit to [a pretty woman]515-a pretty woman . [He]347-the young man was clad from head to foot in a white linen suit , which had never been remarkable for the felicity of its cut , and had now quite lost that crispness which garments of this complexion can as ill spare as the back - scene of a theatre the radiance of the footlights . [He]347-the young man wore a vivid blue cravat , passed through a ring altogether too splendid to be valuable ; [he]347-the young man pulled and twisted , as [he]347-the young man sat , a pair of yellow kid gloves ; [he]347-the young man emphasized [his]347-the young man conversation with great dashes and flourishes of a light , silver - tipped walking - stick , and [he]347-the young man kept constantly taking off and putting on one of those slouched sombreros which are the traditional property of [the Virginian or Carolinian of romance]516-the virginian or carolinian of romance . When this was on , [he]347-the young man was very picturesque , in spite of [his]347-the young man mock elegance ; and when it was off , and [he]347-the young man sat nursing it and turning it about and not knowing what to do with it , [he]347-the young man could hardly be said to be awkward . [He]347-the young man evidently had a natural relish for brilliant accessories , and appropriated what came to [his]347-the young man hand . This was visible in [his]347-the young man talk , which abounded in the florid and sonorous . [He]347-the young man liked words with color in them .

[Rowland]281-rowland , who was but [a moderate talker]517-a moderate talker , sat by in silence , while [Cecilia]169-cecilia , who had told [him]347-the young man that [she]169-cecilia desired [his]347-the young man opinion upon [[her]169-cecilia friend]518-her friend , used a good deal of characteristic finesse in leading [the young man]347-the young man to expose [himself]347-the young man . [She]169-cecilia perfectly succeeded , and [Hudson]172-mr. hudson rattled away for an hour with a volubility in which boyish unconsciousness and manly shrewdness were singularly combined . [He]172-mr. hudson gave [his]172-mr. hudson opinion on twenty topics , [he]172-mr. hudson opened up an endless budget of local gossip , [he]172-mr. hudson described [his]172-mr. hudson repulsive routine at [the office of [Messrs. Striker]183-messrs. striker and [Spooner]184-spooner]520-the office of messrs. striker and spooner , [counselors at law]521-counselors at law , and [he]172-mr. hudson gave with great felicity and gusto an account of the annual boat - race between [Harvard]17-harvard and [Yale]18-yale , which [he]172-mr. hudson had lately witnessed at [Worcester]19-worcester . [He]172-mr. hudson had looked at [the straining oarsmen]522-the straining oarsmen and [the swaying crowd]523-the swaying crowd with the eye of [the sculptor]524-the sculptor . [Rowland]281-rowland was a good deal amused and not a little interested . Whenever [Hudson]172-mr. hudson uttered some peculiarly striking piece of youthful grandiloquence , [Cecilia]169-cecilia broke into a long , light , familiar laugh .

" What are [you]169-cecilia laughing at ? "[347-the young man] [the young man]347-the young man then demanded . " Have [I]347-the young man said anything so ridiculous ? "[347-the young man]

" Go on , go on , "[169-cecilia] [Cecilia]169-cecilia replied . " [You]172-mr. hudson are too delicious ! Show [Mr. Mallet]170-mr. mallet how [Mr. Striker]185-mr. striker read the Declaration of Independence . "[169-cecilia]

[Hudson]172-mr. hudson , like [most men with a turn for the plastic arts]526-most men with a turn for the plastic arts , was [an excellent mimic]527-an excellent mimic , and [he]172-mr. hudson represented with a great deal of humor the accent and attitude of [a pompous country lawyer]528-a pompous country lawyer sustaining the burden of this customary episode of [our]529-our national festival . The sonorous twang , the see - saw gestures , the odd pronunciation , were vividly depicted . But [Cecilia]169-cecilia 's manner , and [the young man]347-the young man 's quick response , ruffled a little poor [Rowland]281-rowland 's paternal conscience . [He]172-mr. hudson wondered whether [[his]172-mr. hudson cousin]343-his cousin was not sacrificing the faculty of reverence in [[her]343-his cousin clever protege]532-her clever protege to [her]343-his cousin need for amusement . [Hudson]172-mr. hudson made no serious rejoinder to [Rowland]281-rowland 's compliment on [his]172-mr. hudson statuette until [he]172-mr. hudson rose to go . [Rowland]281-rowland wondered whether [he]172-mr. hudson had forgotten it , and supposed that the oversight was a sign of the natural self - sufficiency of genius . But [Hudson]172-mr. hudson stood a moment before [he]172-mr. hudson said good night , twirled [his]172-mr. hudson sombrero , and hesitated for the first time . " Very likely , "[170-mr. mallet] said [Mallet]170-mr. mallet . When the war broke out [he]187-hudson found that the [New England]20-new england blood ran thicker in [his]187-hudson veins than [the Virginian]188-the virginian , and immediately obtained a commission . [He]187-hudson fell in some Western battle and left [[his]187-hudson mother]448-his mother inconsolable . [Roderick]186-roderick , however , has given [her]448-his mother plenty to think about , and [she]448-his mother has induced [him]187-hudson , by some mysterious art , to abide , nominally at least , in a profession that [he]187-hudson abhors , and for which [he]187-hudson is about as fit , [I]281-rowland should say , as [I]281-rowland am to drive [a locomotive]3182-a locomotive . [He]187-hudson grew up a la grace de Dieu , and was horribly spoiled .
