Since then [he]187-hudson has been reading law , at the rate of a page a day . If [he]187-hudson is ever admitted to practice [I]281-rowland ' m afraid [my]281-rowland friendship wo n't avail to make [me]281-rowland give [him]187-hudson [my]281-rowland business . Good , bad , or indifferent , [the boy]435-the boy is essentially [an artist]3186-an artist - [an artist to [his]435-the boy fingers]3187-an artist to his fingers ' ends . "[281-rowland]

" Why , then , "[281-rowland] asked [Rowland]281-rowland , " does n't [he]187-hudson deliberately take up the chisel ? "[281-rowland]

" For several reasons . In the first place , [I]281-rowland do n't think [he]187-hudson more than half suspects [his]187-hudson talent . The flame is smouldering , but it is never fanned by the breath of criticism . [He]187-hudson sees nothing , hears nothing , to help [him]187-hudson to self - knowledge . [He]187-hudson 's hopelessly discontented , but [he]187-hudson does n't know where to look for help . Then [[his]187-hudson mother]448-his mother , as [she]448-his mother one day confessed to [me]281-rowland , has a holy horror of a profession which consists exclusively , as [she]448-his mother supposes , in making figures of [people]3189-people without [their]3189-people clothes on . Sculpture , to [her]448-his mother mind , is an insidious form of immorality , and for [a young man of a passionate disposition]3190-a young man of a passionate disposition [she]448-his mother considers the law a much safer investment . [[Her]448-his mother father]3191-her father was [a judge]3192-a judge , [she]448-his mother has [two brothers at the bar]3193-two brothers at the bar , and [[her]448-his mother elder son]3194-her elder son had made a very promising beginning in the same line . [She]448-his mother wishes the tradition to be perpetuated . [I]281-rowland ' m pretty sure the law wo n't make [Roderick]186-roderick 's fortune , and [I]281-rowland ' m afraid it will , in the long run , spoil [his]186-roderick temper . "[281-rowland]

" What sort of a temper is it ? "[281-rowland]

" [One]3107-one to be trusted , on the whole . It is quick , but it is generous . [I]281-rowland have known it to breathe flame and fury at ten o'clock in the evening , and soft , sweet music early on the morrow . It 's a very entertaining temper to observe . [I]281-rowland , fortunately , can do so dispassionately , for [I]281-rowland ' m [the only person in [the place]3197-the place [he]186-roderick has not quarreled with]3196-the only person in the place he has not quarreled with . "[281-rowland]

" Has [he]186-roderick then [no society]3198-no society ? Who is [Miss Garland]182-miss garland , whom [you]281-rowland asked about ? "[281-rowland]

" [A young girl staying with [[his]186-roderick mother]448-his mother]3199-a young girl staying with his mother , [a sort of far - away cousin]3201-a sort of far - away cousin ; [a good plain girl]3202-a good plain girl , but not [a person to delight [a sculptor]3131-a sculptor 's eye]3203-a person to delight a sculptor 's eye . [Roderick]186-roderick has a goodly share of the old Southern arrogance ; [he]186-roderick has the aristocratic temperament . [He]186-roderick will have nothing to do with [the small towns - people]3205-the small towns - people ; [he]186-roderick says [they]3205-the small towns - people 're ' ignoble . ' [He]186-roderick can not endure [[his]186-roderick mother 's friends]3206-his mother 's friends - [the old ladies]3207-the old ladies and [the ministers]3208-the ministers and [the tea - party people]3209-the tea - party people ; [they]3206-his mother 's friends bore [him]186-roderick to death . So [he]186-roderick comes and lounges here and rails at everything and every one . "[281-rowland]

[This graceful young scoffer]534-this graceful young scoffer reappeared a couple of evenings later , and confirmed the friendly feeling [he]534-this graceful young scoffer had provoked on [Rowland]281-rowland 's part . [He]534-this graceful young scoffer was in an easier mood than before , [he]534-this graceful young scoffer chattered less extravagantly , and asked [Rowland]281-rowland a number of rather naif questions about the condition of the fine arts in [New York]21-new york and [Boston]22-boston . [Cecilia]169-cecilia , when [he]534-this graceful young scoffer had gone , said that this was the wholesome effect of [Rowland]281-rowland 's praise of [his]534-this graceful young scoffer statuette . [Roderick]186-roderick was acutely sensitive , and [Rowland]281-rowland 's tranquil commendation had stilled [his]186-roderick restless pulses . [He]186-roderick was ruminating the full - flavored verdict of culture . [Rowland]281-rowland felt an irresistible kindness for [him]186-roderick , a mingled sense of [his]186-roderick personal charm and [his]186-roderick artistic capacity . [He]186-roderick had an indefinable attraction - the something divine of unspotted , exuberant , confident youth . The next day was Sunday , and [Rowland]281-rowland proposed that [they]535-they should take a long walk and that [Roderick]186-roderick should show [him]186-roderick [the country]438-the country . [The young man]347-the young man assented gleefully , and in the morning , as [Rowland]281-rowland at the garden gate was giving [[his]186-roderick hostess]372-his hostess Godspeed on [her]372-his hostess way to [church]539-church , [he]186-roderick came striding along [the grassy margin of [the road]541-the road]540-the grassy margin of the road and out - whistling the music of the church bells . It was one of those lovely days of August when [you]542-you feel the complete exuberance of summer just warned and checked by autumn . " Remember the day , and take care [you]542-you rob [no orchards]3210-no orchards , "[169-cecilia] said [Cecilia]169-cecilia , as [they]535-they separated .

[The young men]543-the young men walked away at a steady pace , over [hill and dale]544-hill and dale , through woods and [fields]545-fields , and at last found [themselves]543-the young men on [a grassy elevation studded with mossy rocks and red cedars]546-a grassy elevation studded with mossy rocks and red cedars . Just beneath [them]543-the young men , in a great shining curve , flowed [the goodly Connecticut]547-the goodly connecticut . [They]543-the young men flung [themselves]543-the young men on the grass and tossed stones into [the river]548-the river ; [they]543-the young men talked like [old friends]549-old friends . [Rowland]281-rowland lit a cigar , and [Roderick]186-roderick refused one with a grimace of extravagant disgust . [He]186-roderick thought [them]543-the young men vile things ; [he]186-roderick did n't see how [decent people]550-decent people could tolerate [them]543-the young men . [Rowland]281-rowland was amused , and wondered what it was that made this ill - mannered speech seem perfectly inoffensive on [Roderick]186-roderick 's lips . [He]186-roderick belonged to [the race of mortals]551-the race of mortals , to be pitied or envied according as [we]552-we view the matter , who are not held to a strict account for [their]551-the race of mortals aggressions . Looking at [him]186-roderick as [he]186-roderick lay stretched in the shade , [Rowland]281-rowland vaguely likened [him]186-roderick to some beautiful , supple , restless , bright - eyed animal , whose motions should have no deeper warrant than the tremulous delicacy of its structure , and be graceful even when they were most inconvenient . [Rowland]281-rowland watched the shadows on [Mount Holyoke]23-mount holyoke , listened to the gurgle of [the river]548-the river , and sniffed the balsam of the pines . A gentle breeze had begun to tickle [their]543-the young men summits , and brought the smell of the mown grass across from [the elm - dotted river meadows]554-the elm - dotted river meadows . [He]186-roderick sat up beside [[his]186-roderick companion]555-his companion and looked away at the far - spreading view . It seemed to [him]186-roderick beautiful , and suddenly a strange feeling of prospective regret took possession of [him]186-roderick . Something seemed to tell [him]186-roderick that later , in [a foreign land]556-a foreign land , [he]186-roderick would remember it lovingly and penitently .

" It 's a wretched business , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick said , " this practical quarrel of [ours]3211-ours with [[our]3211-ours own country]3212-our own country , this everlasting impatience to get out of it . Is one 's only safety then in flight ? This is an American day , an American landscape , an American atmosphere . It certainly has its merits , and some day when [I]186-roderick am shivering with ague in classic [Italy]24-italy , [I]186-roderick shall accuse [myself]186-roderick of having slighted [them]3213-them . "[186-roderick]

[Roderick]186-roderick kindled with a sympathetic glow , and declared that [America]25-america was good enough for [him]186-roderick , and that [he]186-roderick had always thought it the duty of [an honest citizen]557-an honest citizen to stand by [[his]186-roderick own country]558-his own country and help it along . [He]186-roderick had evidently thought nothing whatever about it , and was launching [his]186-roderick doctrine on the inspiration of the moment . The doctrine expanded with the occasion , and [he]186-roderick declared that [he]186-roderick was above all an advocate for American art . [He]186-roderick did n't see why [we]559-we should n't produce the greatest works in [the world]483-the world . [We]559-we were [the biggest people]561-the biggest people , and [we]559-we ought to have the biggest conceptions . The biggest conceptions of course would bring forth in time the biggest performances . [We]559-we had only to be true to [ourselves]559-we , to pitch in and not be afraid , to fling [Imitation]189-imitation overboard and fix [our]559-we eyes upon [our]559-we National Individuality . " [I]186-roderick declare , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick cried , " there 's a career for [a man]3214-a man , and [I]186-roderick ' ve twenty minds to decide , on the spot , to embrace it - to be [the consummate , typical , original , national American artist]3215-the consummate , typical , original , national american artist ! It 's inspiring ! "[186-roderick]

[Rowland]281-rowland burst out laughing and told [him]186-roderick that [he]186-roderick liked [his]186-roderick practice better than [his]186-roderick theory , and that a saner impulse than this had inspired [[his]186-roderick little Water - drinker]562-his little water - drinker . [Roderick]186-roderick took no offense , and three minutes afterwards was talking volubly of some humbler theme , but half heeded by [[his]186-roderick companion]555-his companion , who had returned to [his]186-roderick cogitations . At last [Rowland]281-rowland delivered [himself]281-rowland of the upshot of these . " How would [you]281-rowland like , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick suddenly demanded , " to go to [Rome]4-rome ? "[186-roderick]

[Hudson]172-mr. hudson stared , and , with a hungry laugh which speedily consigned [our]564-our National Individuality to perdition , responded that [he]172-mr. hudson would like it reasonably well . " And [I]172-mr. hudson should like , by the same token , "[172-mr. hudson] [he]172-mr. hudson added , " to go to [Athens]26-athens , to [Constantinople]27-constantinople , to [Damascus]28-damascus , to [the holy city of Benares]3216-the holy city of benares , where there is a golden statue of [Brahma]190-brahma twenty feet tall . "[172-mr. hudson]

" Nay , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland soberly , " if [you]281-rowland were to go to [Rome]4-rome , [you]281-rowland should settle down and work . [Athens]26-athens might help [you]281-rowland , but for the present [I]281-rowland should n't recommend [Benares]29-benares . "[281-rowland]

" It will be time to arrange details when [I]172-mr. hudson pack [my]172-mr. hudson trunk , "[172-mr. hudson] said [Hudson]172-mr. hudson .

" If [you]281-rowland mean to turn [sculptor]3217-sculptor , the sooner [you]281-rowland pack [your]281-rowland trunk the better . "[281-rowland]

" Oh , but [I]281-rowland ' m [a practical man]3218-a practical man ! What is the smallest sum per annum , on which one can keep alive the sacred fire in [Rome]4-rome ? "[281-rowland]

" What is the largest sum at [your]281-rowland disposal ? "[281-rowland]

[Roderick]186-roderick stroked [his]186-roderick light moustache , gave it a twist , and then announced with mock pomposity : " Three hundred dollars ! "[186-roderick]

" The money question could be arranged , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland . " There are ways of raising money . "[281-rowland]

" [I]281-rowland should like to know a few ! [I]281-rowland never yet discovered one . "[281-rowland]

" One consists , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland , " in having [a friend]3219-a friend with a good deal more than [he]3219-a friend wants , and not being too proud to accept a part of it . "[281-rowland]

[Roderick]186-roderick stared a moment and [his]186-roderick face flushed . " Do [you]281-rowland mean - do [you]281-rowland mean ? "[186-roderick] .... [he]186-roderick stammered . [He]186-roderick was greatly excited .

[Rowland]281-rowland got up , blushing a little , and [Roderick]186-roderick sprang to [his]186-roderick feet . " In three words , if [you]186-roderick are to be [a sculptor]3131-a sculptor , [you]186-roderick ought to go to [Rome]4-rome and study the antique . To go to [Rome]4-rome [you]186-roderick need money . [I]186-roderick ' m fond of fine statues , but unfortunately [I]186-roderick ca n't make them [myself]186-roderick . [I]186-roderick have to order them . [I]186-roderick order a dozen from [you]186-roderick , to be executed at [your]186-roderick convenience . To help [you]186-roderick , [I]186-roderick pay [you]186-roderick in advance . "[186-roderick]

[Roderick]186-roderick pushed off [his]186-roderick hat and wiped [his]186-roderick forehead , still gazing at [[his]186-roderick companion]555-his companion . " [You]281-rowland believe in [me]186-roderick ! "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick cried at last .

" Allow [me]281-rowland to explain , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland . " [I]281-rowland believe in [you]186-roderick , if [you]186-roderick are prepared to work and to wait , and to struggle , and to exercise a great many virtues . And then , [I]281-rowland ' m afraid to say it , lest [I]281-rowland should disturb [you]186-roderick more than [I]281-rowland should help [you]186-roderick . [You]186-roderick must decide for [yourself]186-roderick . [I]281-rowland simply offer [you]186-roderick an opportunity . "[281-rowland]

[Hudson]172-mr. hudson stood for some time , profoundly meditative . " [You]281-rowland have not seen [my]172-mr. hudson other things , "[172-mr. hudson] [he]172-mr. hudson said suddenly . " Come and look at them . "[172-mr. hudson]

" Now ? "[172-mr. hudson]

" Yes , [we]566-they 'll walk [home]349-home . [We]566-they 'll settle the question . "[172-mr. hudson]

[He]172-mr. hudson passed [his]172-mr. hudson hand through [Rowland]281-rowland 's arm and [they]566-they retraced [their]566-they steps . [They]566-they reached [the town]507-the town and made [their]566-they way along [a broad country street]568-a broad country street , dusky with the shade of magnificent elms . [Rowland]281-rowland felt [[his]172-mr. hudson companion]555-his companion 's arm trembling in [his]172-mr. hudson own . [They]566-they stopped at [a large white house]570-a large white house , flanked with melancholy hemlocks , and passed through [a little front garden]571-a little front garden , paved with moss - coated bricks and ornamented with parterres bordered with high box hedges . [The mansion]572-the mansion had an air of antiquated dignity , but [it]572-the mansion had seen [its]572-the mansion best days , and evidently sheltered [a shrunken household]573-a shrunken household . [Mrs. Hudson]191-mrs. hudson , [Rowland]281-rowland was sure , might be seen in the garden of a morning , in a white apron and a pair of old gloves , engaged in frugal horticulture . [[Roderick]186-roderick 's studio]574-roderick 's studio was behind , in [the basement]575-the basement ; [a large , empty room , with the paper peeling off the walls]576-a large , empty room , with the paper peeling off the walls . This represented , in the fashion of fifty years ago , a series of small fantastic landscapes of a hideous pattern , and [the young sculptor]492-the young sculptor had presumably torn it away in great scraps , in moments of aesthetic exasperation . On a board in a corner was a heap of clay , and on the floor , against the wall , stood some dozen medallions , busts , and figures , in various stages of completion . To exhibit them [Roderick]186-roderick had to place [them]578-them one by one on the end of a long packing - box , which served as a pedestal . [He]186-roderick did so silently , making no explanations , and looking at them [himself]186-roderick with a strange air of quickened curiosity . Most of the things were portraits ; and the three at which [he]186-roderick looked longest were finished busts . One was a colossal head of [a negro , tossed back , defiant , with distended nostrils]579-a negro , tossed back , defiant , with distended nostrils ; one was the portrait of [a young man whom [Rowland]281-rowland immediately perceived , by the resemblance , to be [[his]186-roderick deceased brother]581-his deceased brother]580-a young man whom rowland immediately perceived , by the resemblance , to be his deceased brother ; the last represented [a gentleman with a pointed nose , a long , shaved upper lip , and a tuft on the end of]582-a gentleman with a pointed nose , a long , shaved upper lip , and a tuft on the end of [his]582-a gentleman with a pointed nose , a long , shaved upper lip , and a tuft on the end of chin . This was a face peculiarly unadapted to sculpture ; but as a piece of modeling it was the best , and it was admirable . It reminded [Rowland]281-rowland in its homely veracity , its artless artfulness , of the works of the early Italian Renaissance . On the pedestal was cut the name - [Barnaby Striker]185-mr. striker , Esq . [Rowland]281-rowland remembered that this was the appellation of [the legal luminary from whom [[his]186-roderick companion]555-his companion had undertaken to borrow a reflected ray , and although in the bust there was naught flagrantly set down in malice]583-the legal luminary from whom his companion had undertaken to borrow a reflected ray , and although in the bust there was naught flagrantly set down in malice , it betrayed , comically to [one who could relish the secret , that the features of the original]585-one who could relish the secret , that the features of the original had often been scanned with an irritated eye . Besides these there were several rough studies of the nude , and [two or three figures of a fanciful kind]586-two or three figures of a fanciful kind . The most noticeable and it had singular beauty was a small modeled design for [a sepulchral monument]587-a sepulchral monument ; that , evidently , of [Stephen Hudson]187-hudson . [The young soldier]588-the young soldier lay sleeping eternally , with [his]588-the young soldier hand on [his]588-the young soldier sword , like [an old crusader in [a Gothic cathedral]590-a gothic cathedral]589-an old crusader in a gothic cathedral .

[Rowland]281-rowland made no haste to pronounce ; too much depended on [his]186-roderick judgment . " Upon [my]187-hudson word , "[187-hudson] cried [Hudson]187-hudson at last , " [they]591-they seem to [me]187-hudson very good . "[187-hudson]

And in truth , as [Rowland]281-rowland looked , [he]186-roderick saw [they]591-they were good . [They]591-they were youthful , awkward , and ignorant ; the effort , often , was more apparent than the success . But the effort was signally powerful and intelligent ; it seemed to [Rowland]281-rowland that it needed only to let itself go to compass great things . Here and there , too , success , when grasped , had something masterly . [Rowland]281-rowland turned to [[his]186-roderick companion]555-his companion , who stood with [his]588-the young soldier hands in [his]588-the young soldier pockets and [his]588-the young soldier hair very much crumpled , looking at [him]186-roderick askance . The light of admiration was in [Rowland]281-rowland 's eyes , and it speedily kindled a wonderful illumination on [Hudson]187-hudson 's handsome brow . [Rowland]281-rowland said at last , gravely , " [You]281-rowland have only to work ! "[281-rowland]

" [I]186-roderick think [I]186-roderick know what that means , "[186-roderick] [Roderick]186-roderick answered . [He]186-roderick turned away , threw [himself]186-roderick on a rickety chair , and sat for some moments with [his]186-roderick elbows on [his]186-roderick knees and [his]186-roderick head in [his]186-roderick hands . " Work - work ? "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick said at last , looking up , " ah , if [I]186-roderick could only begin ! "[186-roderick] [He]186-roderick glanced round [the room]487-the room a moment and [his]186-roderick eye encountered on the mantel - shelf the vivid physiognomy of [Mr. Barnaby Striker]185-mr. striker . [His]186-roderick smile vanished , and [he]186-roderick stared at it with an air of concentrated enmity . " [I]186-roderick want to begin , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick cried , " and [I]186-roderick ca n't make a better beginning than this ! Good - by , [Mr. Striker]185-mr. striker ! "[186-roderick] [He]186-roderick strode across [the room]487-the room , seized a mallet that lay at hand , and before [Rowland]281-rowland could interfere , in the interest of art if not of morals , dealt a merciless blow upon [Mr. Striker]185-mr. striker 's skull . The bust cracked into a dozen pieces , which toppled with a great crash upon the floor . [Rowland]281-rowland relished neither the destruction of the image nor [[his]186-roderick companion]555-his companion 's look in working it , but as [he]186-roderick was about to express [his]186-roderick displeasure the door opened and gave passage to [a young girl]596-a young girl . [She]596-a young girl came in with a rapid step and startled face , as if [she]596-a young girl had been summoned by the noise . Seeing the heap of shattered clay and the mallet in [Roderick]186-roderick 's hand , [she]596-a young girl gave a cry of horror . [Her]596-a young girl voice died away when [she]596-a young girl perceived that [Rowland]281-rowland was [a stranger]597-a stranger , but [she]596-a young girl murmured reproachfully , " Why , [Roderick]186-roderick , what have [you]186-roderick done ? "[596-a young girl]

[Roderick]186-roderick gave a joyous kick to the shapeless fragments . " [I]186-roderick ' ve driven [the money - changers]3222-the money - changers out of [the temple]3223-the temple ! "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick cried .

The traces retained shape enough to be recognized , and [she]596-a young girl gave a little moan of pity . [She]596-a young girl seemed not to understand [the young man]347-the young man 's allegory , but yet to feel that it pointed to some great purpose , which must be an evil one , from being expressed in such a lawless fashion , and to perceive that [Rowland]281-rowland was in some way accountable for it . [She]596-a young girl looked at [him]347-the young man with a sharp , frank mistrust , and turned away through the open door . [Rowland]281-rowland looked after [her]596-a young girl with extraordinary interest .

CHAPTER II . [Roderick]186-roderick

Early on the morrow [Rowland]281-rowland received a visit from [[his]347-the young man new friend]599-his new friend . [Roderick]186-roderick was in a state of extreme exhilaration , tempered , however , by a certain amount of righteous wrath . [He]186-roderick had had a domestic struggle , but [he]186-roderick had remained master of the situation . [He]186-roderick had shaken the dust of [[Mr. Striker]185-mr. striker 's office]600-mr. striker 's office from [his]186-roderick feet .

" [I]186-roderick had it out last night with [[my]186-roderick mother]3224-my mother , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick said . " [I]601-i dreaded the scene , for [she]3224-my mother takes things terribly hard . [She]3224-my mother does n't scold nor storm , and [she]3224-my mother does n't argue nor insist . [She]3224-my mother sits with [her]3224-my mother eyes full of tears that never fall , and looks at [me]601-i , when [I]601-i displease [her]3224-my mother , as if [I]601-i were [a perfect monster of depravity]3225-a perfect monster of depravity . And the trouble is that [I]601-i was born to displease [her]3224-my mother . [She]3224-my mother does n't trust [me]601-i ; [she]3224-my mother never has and [she]3224-my mother never will . [I]601-i do n't know what [I]601-i have done to set [her]3224-my mother against [me]601-i , but ever since [I]601-i can remember [I]601-i have been looked at with tears . The trouble is , "[601-i] [he]601-i went on , giving a twist to [his]601-i moustache , " [I]601-i ' ve been too absurdly docile . [I]601-i ' ve been sprawling all [my]601-i days by the maternal fireside , and [[my]601-i dear mother]3226-my dear mother has grown used to bullying [me]601-i . [I]601-i ' ve made [myself]601-i cheap ! If [I]601-i ' m not in [[my]601-i bed]3227-my bed by eleven o'clock , [the girl]3228-the girl is sent out to explore with a lantern . When [I]601-i think of it , [I]601-i fairly despise [my]601-i amiability . It 's rather a hard fate , to live like [a saint]449-a saint and to pass for [a sinner]3230-a sinner ! [I]601-i should like for six months to lead [Mrs.]3231-mrs. Hudson the life [some fellows]3232-some fellows lead [[their]3232-some fellows mothers]3233-their mothers ! "[601-i]

" Allow [me]281-rowland to believe , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland , " that [you]3228-the girl would like nothing of the sort . If [you]3228-the girl have been [a good boy]3234-a good boy , do n't spoil it by pretending [you]3228-the girl do n't like it . [You]3228-the girl have been very happy , [I]281-rowland suspect , in spite of [your]3228-the girl virtues , and there are worse fates in [the world]483-the world than being loved too well . [I]281-rowland have not had the pleasure of seeing [[your]3228-the girl mother]3145-your mother , but [I]281-rowland would lay [you]3228-the girl a wager that that is the trouble . [She]3145-your mother is passionately fond of [you]3228-the girl , and [her]3145-your mother hopes , like all intense hopes , keep trembling into fears . "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland , as [he]602-i spoke , had an instinctive vision of how [such a beautiful young fellow]603-such a beautiful young fellow must be loved by [[his]603-such a beautiful young fellow female relatives]604-his female relatives .

[Roderick]186-roderick frowned , and with an impatient gesture , " [I]186-roderick do [her]3145-your mother justice , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick cried . " May [she]3145-your mother never do [me]186-roderick less ! "[186-roderick] Then after a moment 's hesitation , " [I]602-i 'll tell [you]3228-the girl the perfect truth , "[602-i] [he]602-i went on . " [I]602-i have to fill a double place . [I]602-i have to be [[my]602-i brother]3237-my brother as well as [myself]602-i . It 's a good deal to ask of [a man]3214-a man , especially when [he]3214-a man has so little talent as [I]602-i for being what [he]3214-a man is not . When [we]3239-we were both young together [I]602-i was [the curled darling]3240-the curled darling . [I]602-i had the silver mug and the biggest piece of pudding , and [I]602-i stayed in - doors to be kissed by [the ladies]3241-the ladies while [he]3214-a man made mud - pies in [the garden]3242-the garden and was never missed , of course . Really , [he]3214-a man was worth fifty of [me]602-i ! When [he]3214-a man was brought [home]349-home from [Vicksburg]30-vicksburg with a piece of shell in [his]3214-a man skull , [[my]602-i poor mother]3144-my poor mother began to think [she]3144-my poor mother had n't loved [him]3214-a man enough . [I]602-i remember , as [she]3144-my poor mother hung round [my]602-i neck sobbing , before [his]3214-a man coffin , [she]3144-my poor mother told [me]602-i that [I]602-i must be to [her]3144-my poor mother everything that [he]3214-a man would have been . [I]602-i swore in tears and in perfect good faith that [I]602-i would , but naturally [I]602-i have not kept [my]602-i promise . [I]602-i have been utterly different . [I]602-i have been idle , restless , egotistical , discontented . [I]602-i have done no harm , [I]602-i believe , but [I]602-i have done no good . [[My]602-i brother]3237-my brother , if [he]3237-my brother had lived , would have made fifty thousand dollars and put gas and water into [the house]3246-the house . [[My]602-i mother]3224-my mother , brooding night and day on [her]3224-my mother bereavement , has come to fix [her]3224-my mother ideal in offices of that sort . Judged by that standard [I]602-i ' m nowhere ! "[602-i]

[Rowland]281-rowland was at loss how to receive this account of [[his]605-you friend]606-his friend 's domestic circumstances ; it was plaintive , and yet the manner seemed to [him]605-you over - trenchant . " [You]605-you must lose no time in making a masterpiece , "[605-you] [he]605-you answered ; " then with the proceeds [you]605-you can give [her]3224-my mother gas from golden burners . "[605-you]

" So [I]281-rowland have told [her]3224-my mother ; but [she]3224-my mother only half believes either in masterpiece or in proceeds . [She]3224-my mother can see no good in [my]281-rowland making statues ; they seem to [her]3224-my mother a snare of [the enemy]3248-the enemy . [She]3224-my mother would fain see [me]281-rowland all [my]281-rowland life tethered to the law , like a browsing goat to a stake . In that way [I]281-rowland ' m in sight . ' It 's a more regular occupation ! ' that 's all [I]281-rowland can get out of [her]3224-my mother . A more regular damnation ! Is it a fact that [artists]3249-artists , in general , are [such wicked men]3250-such wicked men ? [I]281-rowland never had the pleasure of knowing one , so [I]281-rowland could n't confute [her]3224-my mother with an example . [She]3224-my mother had the advantage of [me]281-rowland , because [she]3224-my mother formerly knew [a portrait - painter at [Richmond]31-richmond]3251-a portrait - painter at richmond , who did [her]3224-my mother miniature in black lace mittens [you]3252-you may see it on the parlor table , who used to drink raw brandy and beat [[his]3251-a portrait - painter at richmond wife]3167-his wife . [I]281-rowland promised [her]3224-my mother that , whatever [I]281-rowland might do to [[my]281-rowland wife]3254-my wife , [I]281-rowland would never beat [[my]281-rowland mother]3224-my mother , and that as for brandy , raw or diluted , [I]281-rowland detested it . [She]3224-my mother sat silently crying for an hour , during which [I]281-rowland expended treasures of eloquence . It 's a good thing to have to reckon up [one]3107-one 's intentions , and [I]281-rowland assure [you]3252-you , as [I]281-rowland pleaded [my]281-rowland cause , [I]281-rowland was most agreeably impressed with the elevated character of [my]281-rowland own . [I]281-rowland kissed [her]3224-my mother solemnly at last , and told [her]3224-my mother that [I]281-rowland had said everything and that [she]3224-my mother must make the best of it . This morning [she]3224-my mother has dried [her]3224-my mother eyes , but [I]281-rowland warrant [you]3252-you it is n't [a cheerful house]3257-a cheerful house . [I]281-rowland long to be out of it ! "[281-rowland]

" [I]281-rowland ' m extremely sorry , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland , " to have been the prime cause of so much suffering . [I]281-rowland owe [[your]3252-you mother]3145-your mother some amends ; will it be possible for [me]281-rowland to see [her]3224-my mother ? "[281-rowland]

" If [you]3252-you 'll see [her]3224-my mother , it will smooth matters vastly ; though to tell the truth [she]3224-my mother 'll need all [her]3224-my mother courage to face [you]3252-you , for [she]3224-my mother considers [you]3252-you an agent of [the foul fiend]3259-the foul fiend . [She]3224-my mother does n't see why [you]3252-you should have come here and set [me]281-rowland by the ears : [you]3252-you are made to ruin [ingenuous youths]3260-ingenuous youths and [desolate doting mothers]3261-desolate doting mothers . [I]281-rowland leave it to [you]3252-you , personally , to answer these charges . [You]3252-you see , what [she]3224-my mother ca n't forgive - what [she]3224-my mother 'll not really ever forgive - is [your]3252-you taking [me]281-rowland off to [Rome]4-rome . [Rome]4-rome is an evil word , in [[my]281-rowland mother]3224-my mother 's vocabulary , to be said in a whisper , as [you]3252-you 'd say ' damnation . ' [Northampton]2-northampton is in [the centre of [the earth]3264-the earth]3263-the centre of the earth and [Rome]4-rome far away in outlying dusk , into which it can do no [Christian]192-christina any good to penetrate . And there was [I]281-rowland but yesterday [a doomed habitue of that repository of every virtue]3265-a doomed habitue of that repository of every virtue , [[Mr. Striker]185-mr. striker 's office]600-mr. striker 's office ! "[281-rowland]

" And does [Mr. Striker]185-mr. striker know of [your]281-rowland decision ? "[281-rowland] asked [Rowland]281-rowland .

" To a certainty ! " Decidedly not ! "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland , with a good deal of emphasis . It was evident that [Cecilia]169-cecilia was not judicious , and that [her]169-cecilia good sense , habitually rigid under the demands of domestic economy , indulged itself with a certain agreeable laxity on this particular point . [She]169-cecilia liked [[her]169-cecilia young friend]615-her young friend just as [he]615-her young friend was ; [she]169-cecilia humored [him]615-her young friend , flattered [him]615-her young friend , laughed at [him]615-her young friend , caressed [him]615-her young friend - did everything but advise [him]615-her young friend . [She]169-cecilia was too old to let [him]615-her young friend fall in love with [her]169-cecilia , which might have done [him]615-her young friend good ; and [her]169-cecilia inclination was to keep [him]615-her young friend young , so that the nonsense [he]615-her young friend talked might never transgress a certain line . It was quite conceivable that [poor Cecilia]169-cecilia should relish a pastime ; but if [one]3107-one had philanthropically embraced the idea that something considerable might be made of [Roderick]186-roderick , it was impossible not to see that [her]169-cecilia friendship was not what might be called tonic . So [Rowland]281-rowland reflected , in the glow of [his]615-her young friend new - born sympathy . " Not that one , "[630-a full , grave voice] said [a full , grave voice]630-a full , grave voice ; whereupon [he]620-he perceived that a quantity of sewing - silk had been suspended and entangled over the back , preparatory to being wound on reels . For all reply to this sally [he]620-he received a stare of undisguised amazement from [Miss Garland]182-miss garland , who then looked across at [Mrs. Hudson]191-mrs. hudson with a glance which plainly said : " [You]281-rowland see [he]620-he 's quite [the insidious personage [we]3313-we feared]3312-the insidious personage we feared . "[191-mrs. hudson] [The elder lady]632-the elder lady , however , sat with [her]632-the elder lady eyes fixed on the ground and [her]632-the elder lady two hands tightly clasped . But touching [her]632-the elder lady [Rowland]281-rowland felt much more compassion than resentment ; [her]632-the elder lady attitude was not coldness , it was a kind of dread , almost a terror . [She]632-the elder lady was [a small , eager woman]633-a small , eager woman , with a pale , troubled face , which added to [her]632-the elder lady apparent age . After looking at [her]632-the elder lady for some minutes [Rowland]281-rowland saw that [she]632-the elder lady was still young , and that [she]632-the elder lady must have been [a very girlish bride]634-a very girlish bride . [She]632-the elder lady had been [a pretty one]635-a pretty one , too , though [she]632-the elder lady probably had looked terribly frightened at the altar . [She]632-the elder lady was very delicately made , and [Roderick]186-roderick had come honestly by [his]186-roderick physical slimness and elegance . [She]632-the elder lady wore no cap , and [her]632-the elder lady flaxen hair , which was of extraordinary fineness , was smoothed and confined with Puritanic precision . [She]632-the elder lady was excessively shy , and evidently very humble - minded ; it was singular to see [a woman to whom the experience of life]636-a woman to whom the experience of life had conveyed so little reassurance as to [her]632-the elder lady own resources or the chances of things turning out well . [Rowland]281-rowland began immediately to like [her]632-the elder lady , and to feel impatient to persuade [her]632-the elder lady that there was no harm in [him]186-roderick , and that , twenty to one , [[her]632-the elder lady son]459-her son would make [her]632-the elder lady [a well - pleased woman]638-a well - pleased woman yet . [He]186-roderick foresaw that [she]632-the elder lady would be easy to persuade , and that a benevolent conversational tone would probably make [her]632-the elder lady pass , fluttering , from distrust into an oppressive extreme of confidence . But [he]186-roderick had an indefinable sense that [the person who was testing that strong young eyesight of [hers]632-the elder lady in the dim candle - light]639-the person who was testing that strong young eyesight of hers in the dim candle - light was less readily beguiled from [her]632-the elder lady mysterious feminine preconceptions . [Miss Garland]182-miss garland , according to [Cecilia]169-cecilia 's judgment , as [Rowland]281-rowland remembered , had not a countenance to inspire [a sculptor]3131-a sculptor ; but it seemed to [Rowland]281-rowland that [her]632-the elder lady countenance might fairly inspire [a man who was far from being a sculptor]641-a man who was far from being a sculptor . [She]632-the elder lady was not pretty , as the eye of habit judges prettiness , but when [you]642-you made the observation [you]642-you somehow failed to set it down against [her]632-the elder lady , for [you]642-you had already passed from measuring contours to tracing meanings . In [Mary Garland]193-mary garland 's face there were many possible ones , and [they]643-they gave [you]642-you the more to think about that it was not - like [Roderick Hudson]644-roderick hudson 's , for instance - a quick and mobile face , over which expression flickered like a candle in a wind . [They]643-they followed [each other]645-each other slowly , distinctly , gravely , sincerely , and [you]642-you might almost have fancied that , as [they]643-they came and went , [they]643-they gave [her]632-the elder lady a sort of pain . [She]632-the elder lady was tall and slender , and had an air of maidenly strength and decision . [She]632-the elder lady had a broad forehead and dark eyebrows , a trifle thicker than those of classic beauties ; [her]632-the elder lady gray eye was clear but not brilliant , and [her]632-the elder lady features were perfectly irregular . [Her]632-the elder lady mouth was large , fortunately for the principal grace of [her]632-the elder lady physiognomy was [her]632-the elder lady smile , which displayed itself with magnificent amplitude . [Rowland]281-rowland , indeed , had not yet seen [her]632-the elder lady smile , but something assured [him]646-i that [her]632-the elder lady rigid gravity had a radiant counterpart . [She]632-the elder lady wore a scanty white dress , and had a nameless rustic air which would have led [one]3107-one to speak of [her]632-the elder lady less as [a young lady]648-a young lady than as [a young woman]649-a young woman . [She]632-the elder lady was evidently [a girl of a great personal force]650-a girl of a great personal force , but [she]632-the elder lady lacked pliancy . [She]632-the elder lady was hemming a kitchen towel with the aid of a large steel thimble . [She]632-the elder lady bent [her]632-the elder lady serious eyes at last on [her]632-the elder lady work again , and let [Rowland]281-rowland explain [himself]281-rowland .

" [I]646-i have become suddenly so very intimate with [[your]191-mrs. hudson son]3314-your son , "[646-i] [he]646-i said at last , addressing [himself]646-i to [Mrs. Hudson]191-mrs. hudson , " that it seems just [I]646-i should make [your]191-mrs. hudson acquaintance . "[646-i]

" Very just , "[651-the poor lady] murmured [the poor lady]651-the poor lady , and after a moment 's hesitation was on the point of adding something more ; but [Mr. Striker]185-mr. striker here interposed , after a prefatory clearance of the throat .

" [I]646-i should like to take the liberty , "[646-i] [he]646-i said , " of addressing [you]191-mrs. hudson a simple question . "[678-the poor little lady]

[Rowland]281-rowland replied that , evidently , [she]281-rowland had done [the world]483-the world but scanty justice . " No , "[182-miss garland] objected [Miss Garland]182-miss garland , after a pause , " it is like something in a fairy tale . "[182-miss garland]

" What , pray ? "[182-miss garland]

" [Your]281-rowland coming here all unknown , so rich and so polite , and carrying off [[my]182-miss garland cousin]3148-my cousin in a golden cloud . "[182-miss garland]

If this was badinage [Miss Garland]182-miss garland had the best of it , for [Rowland]281-rowland almost fell a - musing silently over the question whether there was a possibility of irony in that transparent gaze . Before [he]680-he withdrew , [Mrs. Hudson]191-mrs. hudson made [him]680-he tell [her]191-mrs. hudson again that [Roderick]186-roderick 's powers were extraordinary . [He]680-he had inspired [her]191-mrs. hudson with a clinging , caressing faith in [his]680-he wisdom . " [He]680-he will really do great things , "[191-mrs. hudson] [she]191-mrs. hudson asked , " the very greatest ? "[191-mrs. hudson]

" [I]191-mrs. hudson see no reason in [his]680-he talent itself why [he]680-he should not . "[191-mrs. hudson]

" Well , [we]3396-we 'll think of that as [we]3396-we sit here alone , "[191-mrs. hudson] [she]191-mrs. hudson rejoined . " [Mary]193-mary garland and [I]191-mrs. hudson will sit [here]3130-here and talk about it . So [I]191-mrs. hudson give [him]680-he up , "[191-mrs. hudson] [she]191-mrs. hudson went on , as [he]680-he was going . " [I]191-mrs. hudson ' m sure [you]680-he 'll be [the best of friends]3398-the best of friends to [him]680-he , but if [you]680-he should ever forget [him]680-he , or grow tired of [him]680-he , or lose [your]680-he interest in [him]680-he , and [he]680-he should come to any harm or any trouble , please , [sir]3318-sir , remember "[191-mrs. hudson] - And [she]191-mrs. hudson paused , with a tremulous voice .

" Remember , [[my]191-mrs. hudson dear madam]3342-my dear madam ? "[191-mrs. hudson]

" That [he]680-he is all [I]191-mrs. hudson have - that [he]680-he is everything - and that it would be very terrible . "[191-mrs. hudson]

" In so far as [I]281-rowland can help [him]680-he , [he]680-he shall succeed , "[281-rowland] was all [Rowland]281-rowland could say . [He]681-he turned to [Miss Garland]182-miss garland , to bid [her]182-miss garland good night , and [she]182-miss garland rose and put out [her]182-miss garland hand . [She]182-miss garland was very straightforward , but [he]681-he could see that if [she]182-miss garland was too modest to be bold , [she]182-miss garland was much too simple to be shy . " Have [you]182-miss garland no charge to lay upon [me]681-he ? "[681-he] [he]681-he asked - to ask [her]182-miss garland something .

[She]182-miss garland looked at [him]681-he a moment and then , although [she]182-miss garland was not shy , [she]182-miss garland blushed . " Make [him]681-he do [his]681-he best , "[182-miss garland] [she]182-miss garland said .

[Rowland]281-rowland noted the soft intensity with which the words were uttered . " Do [you]182-miss garland take a great interest in [him]681-he ? "[681-he] [he]681-he demanded .

" Certainly . "[281-rowland]

" Then , if [he]681-he will not do [his]681-he best for [you]182-miss garland , [he]681-he will not do it for [me]182-miss garland . "[182-miss garland] [She]182-miss garland turned away with another blush , and [Rowland]281-rowland took [his]681-he leave .

[He]681-he walked homeward , thinking of many things . [The great Northampton elms]682-the great northampton elms interarched far above in the darkness , but the moon had risen and through scattered apertures was hanging [the dusky vault]683-the dusky vault with silver lamps . There seemed to [Rowland]281-rowland something intensely serious in the scene in which [he]681-he had just taken part . [He]681-he had laughed and talked and braved it out in self - defense ; but when [he]681-he reflected that [he]681-he was really meddling with the simple stillness of [this little New England]684-this little new england home , and that [he]681-he had ventured to disturb so much living security in the interest of a far - away , fantastic hypothesis , [he]681-he paused , amazed at [his]681-he temerity . It was true , as [Cecilia]169-cecilia had said , that for [an unofficious man]685-an unofficious man it was a singular position . There stirred in [his]681-he mind an odd feeling of annoyance with [Roderick]186-roderick for having thus peremptorily enlisted [his]186-roderick sympathies . As [he]681-he looked up and down [the long vista]686-the long vista , and saw [the clear white houses]687-the clear white houses glancing here and there in the broken moonshine , [he]681-he could almost have believed that the happiest lot for [any man]688-any man was to make the most of life in [some such tranquil spot as that]689-some such tranquil spot as that . Here were kindness , comfort , safety , the warning voice of duty , the perfect hush of temptation . And as [Rowland]281-rowland looked along the arch of silvered shadow and out into the lucid air of [the American]34-the american night , which seemed so doubly vast , somehow , and strange and nocturnal , [he]681-he felt like declaring that here was beauty too - beauty sufficient for [an artist]3186-an artist not to starve upon it . As [he]681-he stood , lost in the darkness , [he]681-he presently heard a rapid tread on the other side of [the road]541-the road , accompanied by a loud , jubilant whistle , and in a moment a figure emerged into an open gap of moonshine . [He]681-he had no difficulty in recognizing [Hudson]191-mrs. hudson , who was presumably returning from a visit to [Cecilia]169-cecilia . [Roderick]186-roderick stopped suddenly and stared up at the moon , with [his]186-roderick face vividly illumined . [He]186-roderick broke out into a snatch of song : -

" The splendor falls on castle walls And snowy summits old in story ! "[186-roderick]

And with a great , musical roll of [his]186-roderick voice [he]186-roderick went swinging off into the darkness again , as if [his]186-roderick thoughts had lent [him]186-roderick wings . [He]186-roderick was dreaming of the inspiration of [foreign lands]692-foreign lands , - of castled crags and historic landscapes . What a pity , after all , thought [Rowland]281-rowland , as [he]681-he went [his]681-he own way , that [he]681-he should n't have a taste of it !

It had been a very just remark of [Cecilia]169-cecilia 's that [Roderick]186-roderick would change with a change in [his]186-roderick circumstances . [Rowland]281-rowland had telegraphed to [New York]21-new york for another berth on [[his]681-he steamer]693-his steamer , and from the hour the answer came [Hudson]191-mrs. hudson 's spirits rose to incalculable heights . [He]186-roderick was radiant with good - humor , and [his]186-roderick kindly jollity seemed the pledge of a brilliant future . [He]186-roderick had forgiven [[his]186-roderick old enemies]694-his old enemies and forgotten [his]186-roderick old grievances , and seemed every way reconciled to [a world in which [he]186-roderick was going to count as an active force]695-a world in which he was going to count as an active force . [He]186-roderick was inexhaustibly loquacious and fantastic , and as [Cecilia]169-cecilia said , [he]186-roderick had suddenly become so good that it was only to be feared [he]186-roderick was going to start not for [Europe]1-europe but for [heaven]696-heaven . [He]186-roderick took long walks with [Rowland]281-rowland , who felt more and more the fascination of what [he]186-roderick would have called [his]186-roderick giftedness . [Rowland]281-rowland returned several times to [[Mrs. Hudson]191-mrs. hudson 's]697-mrs. hudson 's , and found [the two ladies]656-the two ladies doing [their]656-the two ladies best to be happy in [[their]656-the two ladies companion]699-their companion 's happiness . [Miss Garland]182-miss garland , [he]186-roderick thought , was succeeding better than [her]182-miss garland demeanor on [his]186-roderick first visit had promised . [He]186-roderick tried to have some especial talk with [her]182-miss garland , but [her]182-miss garland extreme reserve forced [him]186-roderick to content [himself]186-roderick with such response to [his]186-roderick rather urgent overtures as might be extracted from a keenly attentive smile . It must be confessed , however , that if the response was vague , the satisfaction was great , and that [Rowland]281-rowland , after [his]186-roderick second visit , kept seeing a lurking reflection of this smile in the most unexpected places . It seemed strange that [she]182-miss garland should please [him]186-roderick so well at so slender a cost , but please [him]186-roderick [she]182-miss garland did , prodigiously , and [his]186-roderick pleasure had a quality altogether new to [him]186-roderick . It made [him]186-roderick restless , and a trifle melancholy ; [he]186-roderick walked about absently , wondering and wishing . [He]186-roderick wondered , among other things , why fate should have condemned [him]186-roderick to make the acquaintance of [a girl whom [he]186-roderick would make a sacrifice to know better , just as [he]186-roderick was leaving [the country]438-the country for years]700-a girl whom he would make a sacrifice to know better , just as he was leaving the country for years . It seemed to [him]186-roderick that [he]186-roderick was turning [his]186-roderick back on a chance of happiness - happiness of a sort of which the slenderest germ should be cultivated . [He]186-roderick asked [himself]186-roderick whether , feeling as [he]186-roderick did , if [he]186-roderick had only [himself]186-roderick to please , [he]186-roderick would give up [his]186-roderick journey and - wait . [He]186-roderick had [Roderick]186-roderick to please now , for whom disappointment would be cruel ; but [he]186-roderick said to [himself]186-roderick that certainly , if there were no [Roderick]186-roderick in the case , [the ship]702-the ship should sail without [him]186-roderick . [He]186-roderick asked [Hudson]191-mrs. hudson several questions about [[his]186-roderick cousin]343-his cousin , but [Roderick]186-roderick , confidential on most points , seemed to have reasons of [his]186-roderick own for being reticent on this one . [His]186-roderick measured answers quickened [Rowland]281-rowland 's curiosity , for [Miss Garland]182-miss garland , with [her]182-miss garland own irritating half - suggestions , had only to be a subject of guarded allusion in others to become intolerably interesting . [He]186-roderick learned from [Roderick]186-roderick that [she]343-his cousin was [the daughter of [a country minister]705-a country minister]704-the daughter of a country minister , [a far - away cousin of [[his]186-roderick mother]448-his mother , settled in [another part of [the State]709-the state]708-another part of the state]706-a far - away cousin of his mother , settled in another part of the state ; that [she]343-his cousin was one of [a half - a - dozen daughters]710-a half - a - dozen daughters , that [the family]711-the family was very poor , and that [she]343-his cousin had come a couple of months before to pay [[his]186-roderick mother]448-his mother a long visit . " It is to be a very long one now , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick said , " for it is settled that [she]343-his cousin is to remain while [I]186-roderick am away . "[186-roderick]

The fermentation of contentment in [Roderick]186-roderick 's soul reached its climax a few days before [the young men]543-the young men were to make [their]543-the young men farewells . [He]186-roderick had been sitting with [[his]186-roderick friends]714-his friends on [[Cecilia]169-cecilia 's veranda]715-cecilia 's veranda , but for half an hour past [he]186-roderick had said nothing . Lounging back against a vine - wreathed column and gazing idly at the stars , [he]186-roderick kept caroling softly to [himself]186-roderick with that indifference to ceremony for which [he]186-roderick always found allowance , and which in [him]186-roderick had a sort of pleading grace . At last , springing up : " [I]186-roderick want to strike out , hard ! "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick exclaimed . " [I]186-roderick want to do something violent , to let off steam ! "[186-roderick]

" [I]169-cecilia 'll tell [you]186-roderick what to do , this lovely weather , "[169-cecilia] said [Cecilia]169-cecilia . " Give a picnic . [Roderick]186-roderick laughed uproariously at [Cecilia]169-cecilia 's very practical remedy for [his]186-roderick sentimental need , but a couple of days later , nevertheless , the picnic was given . "[186-roderick] [The young lady]716-the young lady thus denominated formed , with [Mrs. Hudson]191-mrs. hudson , [Miss Garland]182-miss garland , and [Cecilia]169-cecilia , [the feminine half of [the company]718-the company]717-the feminine half of the company . [Roderick]186-roderick had chosen [the feasting - place]720-the feasting - place ; [he]186-roderick knew [it]720-the feasting - place well and had passed many a summer afternoon there , lying at [his]186-roderick length on the grass and gazing at the blue undulations of the horizon . It was a cloudless August day ; [Rowland]281-rowland always remembered it , and the scene , and everything that was said and done , with extraordinary distinctness . [Roderick]186-roderick surpassed [himself]186-roderick in friendly jollity , and at one moment , when exhilaration was at the highest , was seen in [Mr. Striker]185-mr. striker 's high white hat , drinking champagne from a broken tea - cup to [Mr. Striker]185-mr. striker 's health . [She]191-mrs. hudson was afraid of an " accident , "[191-mrs. hudson] though unless [Miss Striker]197-miss striker who indeed was [a little of a romp]726-a little of a romp should push [Roderick]186-roderick into [the lake]725-the lake , it was hard to see what accident could occur . [Mrs. Hudson]191-mrs. hudson was as neat and crisp and uncrumpled at the end of the festival as at the beginning . [Rowland]281-rowland had placed [himself]281-rowland near [Miss Garland]182-miss garland , while the feasting went forward on the grass . [She]182-miss garland wore a so - called gypsy hat - a little straw hat , tied down over [her]182-miss garland ears , so as to cast [her]182-miss garland eyes into shadow , by a ribbon passing outside of it . " [You]191-mrs. hudson can give [[your]191-mrs. hudson cousin]3404-your cousin [your]191-mrs. hudson society at any time , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland . " But [me]281-rowland , perhaps , [you]191-mrs. hudson 'll never see again . "[281-rowland]

" Why then should [we]733-we wish to be [friends]3405-friends , if nothing is to come of it ? "[182-miss garland] [she]182-miss garland asked , with homely logic . But by this time [she]182-miss garland had consented , and [they]733-we were treading the fallen pine - needles .

" Do [you]281-rowland expect never to come back to [Northampton]2-northampton again ? "[281-rowland]

" ' Never ' is a good deal to say . But [I]281-rowland go to [Europe]1-europe for a long stay . "[281-rowland]

" Do [you]281-rowland prefer it so much to [[your]281-rowland [own country]3409-own country]3408-your own country ? "[281-rowland]

" [I]281-rowland will not say that . But [I]281-rowland have the misfortune to be [a rather idle man]3410-a rather idle man , and in [Europe]1-europe the burden of idleness is less heavy than here . "[281-rowland]

[She]182-miss garland was silent for a few minutes ; then at last , " In that , then , [we]3411-we are better than [Europe]1-europe , "[182-miss garland] [she]182-miss garland said . " Why , as [you]735-you describe [yourself]735-you . [You]735-you have no duties , no profession , no [home]349-home . [You]735-you live for [your]735-you pleasure . "[182-miss garland]

" That 's all very true . And yet [I]182-miss garland maintain [I]182-miss garland ' m not frivolous . "[182-miss garland]

" [I]182-miss garland hope not , "[182-miss garland] said [Miss Garland]182-miss garland , simply . [They]739-they had reached a point where [the wood - path]740-the wood - path forked and put forth two divergent tracks which lost themselves in a verdurous tangle . [Miss Garland]182-miss garland seemed to think that the difficulty of choice between [them]739-they was a reason for giving [them]739-they up and turning back . [Rowland]281-rowland thought otherwise , and detected agreeable grounds for preference in the left - hand path . As a compromise , [they]739-they sat down on a fallen log . Looking about [him]741-he , [Rowland]281-rowland espied a curious wild shrub , with a spotted crimson leaf ; [he]741-he went and plucked a spray of it and brought it to [Miss Garland]182-miss garland . [He]741-he had never observed it before , but [she]182-miss garland immediately called it by its name . [She]182-miss garland expressed surprise at [his]741-he not knowing it ; it was extremely common . [He]741-he presently brought [her]182-miss garland a specimen of another delicate plant , with a little blue - streaked flower . " [I]741-he suppose that 's common , too , "[741-he] [he]741-he said , " but [I]741-he have never seen it - or noticed it , at least . "[741-he] [She]182-miss garland answered that this one was rare , and meditated a moment before [she]182-miss garland could remember its name . At last [she]182-miss garland recalled it , and expressed surprise at [his]741-he having found the plant in [the woods]742-the woods ; [she]182-miss garland supposed it grew only in [open marshes]743-open marshes . [Rowland]281-rowland complimented [her]182-miss garland on [her]182-miss garland fund of useful information .

" It 's not especially useful , "[182-miss garland] [she]182-miss garland answered ; " but [I]182-miss garland like to know the names of plants as [I]182-miss garland do those of [[my]182-miss garland acquaintances]3424-my acquaintances . When [we]3425-we walk in [the woods]742-the woods at [home]349-home - which [we]3425-we do so much - it seems as unnatural not to know what to call the flowers as it would be to see [some one in [the town]507-the town with whom [we]3425-we were not on speaking terms]3428-some one in the town with whom we were not on speaking terms . "[182-miss garland]

" Apropos of frivolity , "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland said , " [I]281-rowland ' m sure [you]182-miss garland have very little of it , unless at [West Nazareth]36-west nazareth it is considered frivolous to walk in [the woods]742-the woods and nod to the nodding flowers . Do kindly tell [me]281-rowland a little about [yourself]182-miss garland . "[281-rowland] And to compel [her]182-miss garland to begin , " [I]744-you know [you]182-miss garland come of [a race of [theologians]3432-theologians]3431-a race of theologians , "[744-you] [he]744-you went on .

" No , "[182-miss garland] [she]182-miss garland replied , deliberating ; " [they]3431-a race of theologians are not [theologians]3432-theologians , though [they]3431-a race of theologians are [ministers]3434-ministers . [We]3425-we do n't take a very firm stand upon doctrine ; [we]3425-we are practical , rather . [We]3425-we write sermons and preach them , but [we]3425-we do a great deal of hard work beside . "[182-miss garland]

" And of this hard work what has [your]744-you share been ? "[281-rowland]

" The hardest part : doing nothing . "[182-miss garland]

" What do [you]744-you call nothing ? "[281-rowland]

" [I]182-miss garland taught [school]3435-school a while : [I]182-miss garland must make the most of that . But [I]182-miss garland confess [I]182-miss garland did n't like it . Otherwise , [I]182-miss garland have only done little things at [home]349-home , as they turned up . "[182-miss garland]

" What kind of things ? "[281-rowland]

" Oh , every kind . If [you]744-you had seen [[my]182-miss garland [home]349-home]3437-my home , [you]744-you would understand . "[182-miss garland]

[Rowland]281-rowland would have liked to make [her]745-i specify ; but [he]746-he felt a more urgent need to respect [her]745-i simplicity than [he]746-he had ever felt to defer to the complex circumstance of [certain other women]747-certain other women . " To be happy , [I]746-he imagine , "[746-he] [he]746-he contented [himself]746-he with saying , " [you]744-you need to be occupied . [You]744-you need to have something to expend [yourself]744-you upon . "[746-he]

" That is not so true as it once was ; now that [I]745-i am older , [I]745-i am sure [I]745-i am less impatient of leisure . Certainly , these two months that [I]745-i have been with [Mrs. Hudson]191-mrs. hudson , [I]745-i have had a terrible amount of it . And yet [I]745-i have liked it ! And now that [I]745-i am probably to be with [her]191-mrs. hudson all the while that [[her]191-mrs. hudson son]459-her son is away , [I]745-i look forward to more with a resignation that [I]745-i do n't quite know what to make of . "[745-i]

" It is settled , then , that [you]745-i are to remain with [[your]745-i cousin]3404-your cousin ? "[746-he]

" It depends upon [their]3441-their writing from [home]349-home that [I]748-her may stay . But that is probable . Only [I]748-her must not forget , "[748-her] [she]748-her said , rising , " that the ground for [my]748-her doing so is that [she]191-mrs. hudson be not left alone . "[748-her]

" [I]281-rowland am glad to know , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland , " that [I]281-rowland shall probably often hear about [you]748-her . [I]281-rowland assure [you]748-her [I]281-rowland shall often think about [you]748-her ! "[281-rowland] These words were half impulsive , half deliberate . They were the simple truth , and [he]749-he had asked [himself]749-he why [he]749-he should not tell [her]748-her the truth . And yet they were not all of it ; [her]748-her hearing the rest would depend upon the way [she]748-her received this . [She]748-her received it not only , as [Rowland]281-rowland foresaw , without a shadow of coquetry , of any apparent thought of listening to it gracefully , but with a slight movement of nervous deprecation , which seemed to betray itself in the quickening of [her]748-her step . Evidently , if [Rowland]281-rowland was to take pleasure in hearing about [her]748-her , it would have to be a highly disinterested pleasure . [She]748-her answered nothing , and [Rowland]281-rowland too , as [he]749-he walked beside [her]748-her , was silent ; but as [he]749-he looked along the shadow - woven wood - path , what [he]749-he was really facing was a level three years of disinterestedness . [He]749-he ushered [them]750-them in by talking composed civility until [he]749-he had brought [Miss Garland]182-miss garland back to [[her]748-her companions]751-her companions .

[He]749-he saw [her]748-her but once again . [He]749-he was obliged to be in [New York]21-new york a couple of days before sailing , and it was arranged that [Roderick]186-roderick should overtake [him]749-he at the last moment . The evening before [he]749-he left [Northampton]2-northampton [he]749-he went to say farewell to [Mrs. Hudson]191-mrs. hudson . The ceremony was brief . [Rowland]281-rowland soon perceived that [the poor little lady]678-the poor little lady was in the melting mood , and , as [he]749-he dreaded [her]678-the poor little lady tears , [he]749-he compressed a multitude of solemn promises into a silent hand - shake and took [his]749-he leave . [Miss Garland]182-miss garland , [she]182-miss garland had told [him]749-he , was in [the back - garden]753-the back - garden with [Roderick]186-roderick : [he]749-he might go out to [them]754-them . [He]749-he did so , and as [he]749-he drew near [he]749-he heard [Roderick]186-roderick 's high - pitched voice ringing behind the shrubbery . In a moment , emerging , [he]749-he found [Miss Garland]182-miss garland leaning against a tree , with [[her]182-miss garland cousin]370-her cousin before [her]182-miss garland talking with great emphasis . [He]749-he asked pardon for interrupting [them]754-them , and said [he]749-he wished only to bid [her]182-miss garland good - by . [She]182-miss garland gave [him]749-he [her]182-miss garland hand and [he]749-he made [her]182-miss garland [his]749-he bow in silence . " Do n't forget , "[749-he] [he]749-he said to [Roderick]186-roderick , as [he]749-he turned away . " And do n't , in this company , repent of [your]186-roderick bargain . "[749-he]

" [I]182-miss garland shall not let [him]749-he , "[182-miss garland] said [Miss Garland]182-miss garland , with something very like gayety . " [I]182-miss garland shall see that [he]749-he is punctual . [He]749-he must go ! [I]182-miss garland owe [you]186-roderick an apology for having doubted that [he]749-he ought to . "[182-miss garland] And in spite of the dusk [Rowland]281-rowland could see that [she]182-miss garland had an even finer smile than [he]749-he had supposed .

[Roderick]186-roderick was punctual , eagerly punctual , and [they]756-they went . [Rowland]281-rowland for several days was occupied with material cares , and lost sight of [his]749-he sentimental perplexities . But [they]756-they only slumbered , and [they]756-they were sharply awakened . The weather was fine , and [the two young men]608-the two young men always sat together upon [deck]758-deck late into the evening . One night , toward the last , [they]608-the two young men were at the stern of [the great ship]759-the great ship , watching [her]182-miss garland grind the solid blackness of [the ocean]760-the ocean into phosphorescent foam . [They]608-the two young men talked on these occasions of everything conceivable , and had the air of having no secrets from [each other]645-each other . But it was on [Roderick]186-roderick 's conscience that this air belied [him]186-roderick , and [he]186-roderick was too frank by nature , moreover , for permanent reticence on any point .

" [I]186-roderick must tell [you]281-rowland something , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick said at last . " [I]186-roderick should like [you]281-rowland to know it , and [you]281-rowland will be so glad to know it . Besides , it 's only a question of time ; three months hence , probably , [you]281-rowland would have guessed it . [I]186-roderick am engaged to [Mary Garland]193-mary garland . "[186-roderick]

[Rowland]281-rowland sat staring ; though [the sea]425-the sea was calm , it seemed to [him]186-roderick that [the ship]702-the ship gave a great dizzying lurch . But in a moment [he]186-roderick contrived to answer coherently : " Engaged to [Miss Garland]182-miss garland ! [I]186-roderick never supposed - [I]186-roderick never imagined "[186-roderick] -

" That [I]186-roderick was in love with [her]182-miss garland ? "[186-roderick] [Roderick]186-roderick interrupted . " Neither did [I]186-roderick , until this last fortnight . But [you]281-rowland came and put [me]186-roderick into such ridiculous good - humor that [I]186-roderick felt an extraordinary desire to tell [some woman]3443-some woman that [I]186-roderick adored [her]182-miss garland . [Miss Garland]182-miss garland is [a magnificent girl]3444-a magnificent girl ; [you]281-rowland know [her]182-miss garland too little to do [her]182-miss garland justice . [I]186-roderick have been quietly learning to know [her]182-miss garland , these past three months , and have been falling in love with [her]182-miss garland without being conscious of it . It appeared , when [I]186-roderick spoke to [her]182-miss garland , that [she]182-miss garland had a kindness for [me]186-roderick . So the thing was settled . [I]186-roderick must of course make some money before [we]3445-we can marry . It 's rather droll , certainly , to engage [[one]3107-one 's self]3447-one 's self to a girl whom [one is going to leave the next day]3448-one is going to leave the next day , for years . [We]3445-we shall be condemned , for some time to come , to do a terrible deal of abstract thinking about [each other]645-each other . But [I]186-roderick wanted [her]182-miss garland blessing on [my]186-roderick career and [I]186-roderick could not help asking for it . Unless [a man]3214-a man is unnaturally selfish [he]3214-a man needs to work for some one else than [himself]3214-a man , and [I]186-roderick am sure [I]186-roderick shall run a smoother and swifter course for knowing that [that fine creature]3451-that fine creature is waiting , at [Northampton]2-northampton , for news of [my]186-roderick greatness . If ever [I]186-roderick am [a dull companion]3452-a dull companion and over - addicted to moping , remember in justice to [me]186-roderick that [I]186-roderick am in love and that [[my]186-roderick sweetheart]3453-my sweetheart is five thousand miles away . "[186-roderick]

[Rowland]281-rowland listened to all this with a sort of feeling that fortune had played [him]764-him an elaborately - devised trick . It had lured [him]764-him out into [mid - ocean]765-mid - ocean and smoothed [the sea]425-the sea and stilled the winds and given [him]764-him [a singularly sympathetic comrade]767-a singularly sympathetic comrade , and then it had turned and delivered [him]764-him a thumping blow in mid - chest . " Yes , "[764-him] [he]764-him said , after an attempt at the usual formal congratulation , " [you]186-roderick certainly ought to do better - with [Miss Garland]182-miss garland waiting for [you]186-roderick at [Northampton]2-northampton . "[764-him]

[Roderick]186-roderick , now that [he]186-roderick had broken ground , was eloquent and rung a hundred changes on the assurance that [he]186-roderick was [a very happy man]768-a very happy man . Then at last , suddenly , [his]186-roderick climax was a yawn , and [he]186-roderick declared that [he]186-roderick must go to bed . [Rowland]281-rowland let [him]186-roderick go alone , and sat there late , between [sea and sky]769-sea and sky .

CHAPTER III . [Rome]4-rome

One warm , still day , late in the Roman autumn , [[our]770-our two young men]771-our two young men were sitting beneath one of the high - stemmed pines of [the Villa Ludovisi]38-the villa ludovisi . [They]771-our two young men had been spending an hour in [the mouldy little garden - house]772-the mouldy little garden - house , where the colossal mask of [the famous Juno]773-the famous juno looks out with blank eyes from that dusky corner which must seem to [her]773-the famous juno the last possible stage of a lapse from [Olympus]39-olympus . Then [they]771-our two young men had wandered out into [the gardens]774-the gardens , and were lounging away the morning under the spell of [their]771-our two young men magical picturesqueness . [Roderick]186-roderick declared that [he]186-roderick would go nowhere else ; that , after [the Juno]199-the juno , it was a profanation to look at anything but sky and trees . There was a fresco of [Guercino]40-guercino , to which [Rowland]281-rowland , though [he]186-roderick had seen it on [his]186-roderick former visit to [Rome]4-rome , went dutifully to pay [his]186-roderick respects . But [Roderick]186-roderick , though [he]186-roderick had never seen it , declared that it could n't be worth a fig , and that [he]186-roderick did n't care to look at ugly things . [He]186-roderick remained stretched on [his]186-roderick overcoat , which [he]186-roderick had spread on the grass , while [Rowland]281-rowland went off envying the intellectual comfort of genius , which can arrive at serene conclusions without disagreeable processes . When [the latter]652-the latter came back , [[his]186-roderick friend]606-his friend was sitting with [his]186-roderick elbows on [his]186-roderick knees and [his]186-roderick head in [his]186-roderick hands . [Rowland]281-rowland , in the geniality of a mood attuned to the mellow charm of [a Roman villa]777-a roman villa , found a good word to say for [the Guercino]40-guercino ; but [he]186-roderick chiefly talked of the view from [the little belvedere on the roof of [the casino]779-the casino]778-the little belvedere on the roof of the casino , and how [it]778-the little belvedere on the roof of the casino looked like the prospect from [a castle turret]780-a castle turret in a fairy tale .

" Very likely , "[186-roderick] said [Roderick]186-roderick , throwing [himself]186-roderick back with a yawn . " But [I]186-roderick must let it pass . [I]186-roderick have seen enough for the present ; [I]186-roderick have reached [the top of [the hill]3455-the hill]3454-the top of the hill . [I]186-roderick have an indigestion of impressions ; [I]186-roderick must work them off before [I]186-roderick go in for any more . [I]186-roderick do n't want to look at any more of [other people]3286-other people 's works , for a month - not even at [Nature]201-nature 's own . [I]186-roderick want to look at [Roderick Hudson]3457-roderick hudson 's . The result of it all is that [I]186-roderick ' m not afraid . [I]186-roderick can but try , as well as the rest of [them]3286-other people ! [The fellow who did that gazing [goddess yonder]202-goddess yonder]3458-the fellow who did that gazing goddess yonder only made an experiment . The other day , when [I]186-roderick was looking at [[Michael Angelo]203-michael angelo 's Moses]41-michael angelo 's moses , [I]186-roderick was seized with a kind of defiance - a reaction against all this mere passive enjoyment of grandeur . It was a rousing great success , certainly , that rose there before [me]186-roderick , but somehow it was not an inscrutable mystery , and it seemed to [me]186-roderick , not perhaps that [I]186-roderick should some day do as well , but that at least [I]186-roderick might ! "[186-roderick]

" As [you]281-rowland say , [you]281-rowland can but try , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland . " Success is only passionate effort . "[281-rowland]

" Well , the passion is blazing ; [we]3459-we have been piling on fuel handsomely . It came over [me]186-roderick just now that it is exactly three months to a day since [I]186-roderick left [Northampton]2-northampton . [I]186-roderick ca n't believe it ! "[186-roderick]

" It certainly seems more . "[281-rowland]

" It seems like ten years . What an exquisite ass [I]186-roderick was ! "[186-roderick]

" Do [you]281-rowland feel so wise now ? "[281-rowland]

" Verily ! Do n't [I]186-roderick look so ? Surely [I]186-roderick have n't the same face . Have n't [I]186-roderick a different eye , a different expression , a different voice ? "[186-roderick]

" [I]281-rowland can hardly say , because [I]281-rowland have seen the transition . But it 's very likely . [You]281-rowland are , in the literal sense of the word , more civilized . [I]281-rowland dare say , "[281-rowland] added [Rowland]281-rowland , " that [Miss Garland]182-miss garland would think so . "[281-rowland]

" That 's not what [she]182-miss garland would call it ; [she]182-miss garland would say [I]186-roderick was corrupted . "[186-roderick]

[Rowland]281-rowland asked few questions about [Miss Garland]182-miss garland , but [he]781-he always listened narrowly to [[his]781-he companion]555-his companion 's voluntary observations .

" Are [you]281-rowland very sure ? "[781-he] [he]781-he replied .

" Why , [she]182-miss garland 's [a stern moralist]3460-a stern moralist , and [she]182-miss garland would infer from [my]186-roderick appearance that [I]186-roderick had become [a cynical sybarite]3461-a cynical sybarite . "[186-roderick] [Roderick]186-roderick had , in fact , a Venetian watch - chain round [his]186-roderick neck and a magnificent Roman intaglio on the third finger of [his]186-roderick left hand .

" Will [you]186-roderick think [I]281-rowland take a liberty , "[281-rowland] asked [Rowland]281-rowland , " if [I]281-rowland say [you]186-roderick judge [her]182-miss garland superficially ? "[281-rowland]

" For heaven 's sake , "[186-roderick] cried [Roderick]186-roderick , laughing , " do n't tell [me]186-roderick [she]182-miss garland 's not [a moralist]3462-a moralist ! It was for that [I]186-roderick fell in love with [her]182-miss garland , and with rigid virtue in [her]182-miss garland person . "[186-roderick]

" [She]182-miss garland is [a moralist]3462-a moralist , but not , as [you]186-roderick imply , a narrow one . That 's more than a difference in degree ; it 's a difference in kind . [I]281-rowland do n't know whether [I]281-rowland ever mentioned it , but [I]281-rowland admire [her]182-miss garland extremely . There is nothing narrow about [her]182-miss garland but [her]182-miss garland experience ; everything else is large . [My]281-rowland impression of [her]182-miss garland is of [a person of great capacity , as yet wholly unmeasured and untested]3464-a person of great capacity , as yet wholly unmeasured and untested . Some day or other , [I]281-rowland ' m sure , [she]182-miss garland will judge fairly and wisely of everything . "[281-rowland]

" Stay a bit ! "[186-roderick] cried [Roderick]186-roderick ; " [you]186-roderick 're [a better Catholic]3465-a better catholic than [the Pope]3466-the pope . [I]186-roderick shall be content if [she]182-miss garland judges fairly of [me]186-roderick - of [my]186-roderick merits , that is . The rest [she]182-miss garland must not judge at all . [She]182-miss garland 's [a grimly devoted little creature]3467-a grimly devoted little creature ; may [she]182-miss garland always remain so ! Changed as [I]186-roderick am , [I]186-roderick adore [her]182-miss garland none the less . What becomes of all [our]3468-our emotions , [our]3468-our impressions , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick went on , after a long pause , " all the material of thought that life pours into [us]3468-our at such a rate during such a memorable three months as these ? There are twenty moments a week - a day , for that matter , some days - that seem supreme , twenty impressions that seem ultimate , that appear to form an intellectual era . But others come treading on [their]3469-their heels and sweeping [them]3469-their along , and [they]3469-their all melt like water into water and settle the question of precedence among [themselves]3469-their .
