The curious thing is that the more the mind takes in , the more it has space for , and that [all one]3470-all one 's ideas are like [the Irish people at [home]349-home who live in the different corners of [a room]3473-a room]3471-the irish people at home who live in the different corners of a room , and take [boarders]3474-boarders . "[186-roderick]

" [I]281-rowland fancy it is [our]3468-our peculiar good luck that [we]3468-our do n't see the limits of [our]3468-our minds , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland . " [We]3468-our are young , compared with what [we]3468-our may one day be . That belongs to [youth]3475-youth ; it is perhaps the best part of it . [They]3476-they say that [old people]3477-old people do find [themselves]3477-old people at last face to face with a solid blank wall , and stand thumping against it in vain . It resounds , it seems to have something beyond it , but it wo n't move ! That 's only a reason for living with open doors as long as [we]3468-our can ! "[281-rowland]

" Open doors ? "[186-roderick] murmured [Roderick]186-roderick . " Yes , let [us]3468-our close no doors that open upon [Rome]4-rome . For this , for the mind , is eternal summer ! But though [my]186-roderick doors may stand open to - day , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick presently added , " [I]186-roderick shall see [no visitors]3478-no visitors . [I]186-roderick want to pause and breathe ; [I]186-roderick want to dream of a statue . [I]186-roderick have been working hard for three months ; [I]186-roderick have earned a right to a reverie . "[186-roderick]

[Rowland]281-rowland , on [his]186-roderick side , was not without provision for reflection , and [they]783-they lingered on in broken , desultory talk . [Rowland]281-rowland felt the need for intellectual rest , for a truce to present care for [churches]784-churches , statues , and pictures , on even better grounds than [[his]186-roderick companion]555-his companion , inasmuch as [he]186-roderick had really been living [Roderick]186-roderick 's intellectual life the past three months , as well as [his]186-roderick own . As [he]186-roderick looked back on these full - flavored weeks , [he]186-roderick drew a long breath of satisfaction , almost of relief . [Roderick]186-roderick , thus far , had justified [his]186-roderick confidence and flattered [his]186-roderick perspicacity ; [he]186-roderick was rapidly unfolding into an ideal brilliancy . [He]186-roderick was changed even more than [he]186-roderick [himself]186-roderick suspected ; [he]186-roderick had stepped , without faltering , into [his]186-roderick birthright , and was spending money , intellectually , as lavishly as [a young heir who has just won an obstructive lawsuit]786-a young heir who has just won an obstructive lawsuit . [Roderick]186-roderick 's glance and voice were the same , doubtless , as when [they]787-they enlivened the summer dusk on [[Cecilia]169-cecilia 's veranda]715-cecilia 's veranda , but in [his]186-roderick person , generally , there was an indefinable expression of experience rapidly and easily assimilated . [Rowland]281-rowland had been struck at the outset with the instinctive quickness of [his]186-roderick observation and [his]186-roderick free appropriation of whatever might serve [his]186-roderick purpose . [He]186-roderick had not been , for instance , half an hour on [English soil]789-english soil before [he]186-roderick perceived that [he]186-roderick was dressed like [a rustic]790-a rustic , and [he]186-roderick had immediately reformed [his]186-roderick toilet with the most unerring tact . [His]186-roderick appetite for novelty was insatiable , and for everything characteristically foreign , as it presented itself , [he]186-roderick had an extravagant greeting ; but in half an hour the novelty had faded , [he]186-roderick had guessed the secret , [he]186-roderick had plucked out the heart of the mystery and was clamoring for a keener sensation . At the end of a month , [he]186-roderick presented , mentally , a puzzling spectacle to [[his]186-roderick companion]555-his companion . [He]186-roderick had caught , instinctively , the key - note of [the old world]792-the old world . [He]186-roderick observed and enjoyed , [he]186-roderick criticised and rhapsodized , but though all things interested [him]186-roderick and many delighted [him]186-roderick , none surprised [him]186-roderick ; [he]186-roderick had divined [their]793-their logic and measured [their]793-their proportions , and referred [them]793-their infallibly to [their]793-their categories . Witnessing the rate at which [he]186-roderick did intellectual execution on the general spectacle of European life , [Rowland]281-rowland at moments felt vaguely uneasy for the future ; [the boy]435-the boy was living too fast , [he]186-roderick would have said , and giving alarming pledges to ennui in [his]186-roderick later years . But [we]795-we must live as [our]795-we pulses are timed , and [Roderick]186-roderick 's struck the hour very often . [He]186-roderick was , by imagination , though [he]186-roderick never became in manner , [a natural man of]796-a natural man of [the world]483-the world ; [he]186-roderick had intuitively , as [an artist]3186-an artist , what [one may call the historic consciousness]799-one may call the historic consciousness . [He]186-roderick had a relish for social subtleties and mysteries , and , in perception , when occasion offered [him]186-roderick an inch [he]186-roderick never failed to take an ell . A single glimpse of a social situation of [the elder type]800-the elder type enabled [him]186-roderick to construct the whole , with all its complex chiaroscuro , and [Rowland]281-rowland more than once assured [him]186-roderick that [he]186-roderick made [him]186-roderick believe in the metempsychosis , and that [he]186-roderick must have lived in European society , in the last century , as [a gentleman in a cocked hat and brocaded waistcoat]801-a gentleman in a cocked hat and brocaded waistcoat . [Hudson]191-mrs. hudson asked [Rowland]281-rowland questions which poor [Rowland]281-rowland was quite unable to answer , and of which [he]186-roderick was equally unable to conceive where [he]186-roderick had picked up the data . [Roderick]186-roderick ended by answering them [himself]186-roderick , tolerably to [his]186-roderick satisfaction , and in a short time [he]186-roderick had almost turned the tables and become in [their]802-their walks and talks the accredited source of information . [Rowland]281-rowland told [him]186-roderick that when [he]186-roderick turned sculptor [a capital novelist]803-a capital novelist was spoiled , and that to match [his]186-roderick eye for social detail one would have to go to [Honore de Balzac]204-honore de balzac . In all this [Rowland]281-rowland took a generous pleasure ; [he]186-roderick felt an especial kindness for [[his]186-roderick comrade]804-his comrade 's radiant youthfulness of temperament . [He]186-roderick was so much younger than [he]186-roderick [himself]186-roderick had ever been ! And surely youth and genius , hand in hand , were the most beautiful sight in [the world]483-the world . [Roderick]186-roderick added to this the charm of [his]186-roderick more immediately personal qualities . The vivacity of [his]186-roderick perceptions , the audacity of [his]186-roderick imagination , the picturesqueness of [his]186-roderick phrase when [he]186-roderick was pleased , - and even more when [he]186-roderick was displeased , - [his]186-roderick abounding good - humor , [his]186-roderick candor , [his]186-roderick unclouded frankness , [his]186-roderick unfailing impulse to share every emotion and impression with [[his]186-roderick friend]606-his friend ; all this made comradeship a pure felicity , and interfused with a deeper amenity [their]807-their long evening talks at cafe doors in [Italian towns]808-italian towns .

[They]807-their had gone almost immediately to [Paris]9-paris , and had spent [their]807-their days at [the Louvre]11-the louvre and [their]807-their evenings at [the theatre]809-the theatre . [Roderick]186-roderick was divided in mind as to whether [Titian]205-titian or [Mademoiselle Delaporte]206-mademoiselle was [the greater artist]810-the greater artist . [They]807-their had come down through [France]42-france to [Genoa]43-genoa and [Milan]44-milan , had spent a fortnight in [Venice]45-venice and another in [Florence]46-florence , and had now been a month in [Rome]4-rome . [Roderick]186-roderick had said that [he]186-roderick meant to spend three months in simply looking , absorbing , and reflecting , without putting pencil to paper . [He]186-roderick looked indefatigably , and certainly saw great things - things greater , doubtless , at times , than the intentions of [the artist]3153-the artist . And yet [he]186-roderick made few false steps and wasted little time in theories of what [he]186-roderick ought to like and to dislike . [He]186-roderick judged instinctively and passionately , but never vulgarly . At [Venice]45-venice , for a couple of days , [he]186-roderick had half a fit of melancholy over the pretended discovery that [he]186-roderick had missed [his]186-roderick way , and that the only proper vestment of plastic conceptions was the coloring of [Titian]205-titian and [Paul Veronese]207-paul veronese . Then one morning [the two young men]608-the two young men had [themselves]608-the two young men rowed out to [Torcello]47-torcello , and [Roderick]186-roderick lay back for a couple of hours watching a brown - breasted gondolier making superb muscular movements , in high relief , against the sky of [the Adriatic]48-the adriatic , and at the end jerked [himself]186-roderick up with a violence that nearly swamped [the gondola]813-the gondola , and declared that the only thing worth living for was to make a colossal bronze and set it aloft in the light of [a public square]814-a public square . In [Rome]4-rome [his]186-roderick first care was for [the Vatican]12-the vatican ; [he]186-roderick went [there]3420-there again and again . But [the old imperial]816-the old imperial and [papal city]817-papal city altogether delighted [him]186-roderick ; only [there]3420-there [he]186-roderick really found what [he]186-roderick had been looking for from the first - [the complete antipodes of [Northampton]2-northampton]819-the complete antipodes of northampton . And indeed [Rome]4-rome is [the natural home of those spirits with which [we]821-we just now claimed]820-the natural home of those spirits with which we just now claimed fellowship for [Roderick]186-roderick - the spirits with a deep relish for the artificial element in life and the infinite superpositions of history . [It]4-rome is [the immemorial city of convention]822-the immemorial city of convention . The stagnant Roman air is charged with convention ; it colors the yellow light and deepens the chilly shadows . And in that still recent day the most impressive convention in all history was visible to [men]3287-men 's eyes , in [the Roman streets]824-the roman streets , erect in [a gilded coach drawn by four black horses]825-a gilded coach drawn by four black horses . [Roderick]186-roderick 's first fortnight was a high aesthetic revel . [He]186-roderick declared that [Rome]4-rome made [him]186-roderick feel and understand more things than [he]186-roderick could express : [he]186-roderick was sure that life must have there , for all [one]3107-one 's senses , an incomparable fineness ; that more interesting things must happen to one than anywhere else . And [he]186-roderick gave [Rowland]281-rowland to understand that [he]186-roderick meant to live freely and largely , and be as interested as occasion demanded . [Rowland]281-rowland saw no reason to regard this as a menace of dissipation , because , in the first place , there was in all dissipation , refine it as one might , a grossness which would disqualify it for [Roderick]186-roderick 's favor , and because , in the second , [the young sculptor]492-the young sculptor was [a man]3214-a man to regard all things in the light of [his]492-the young sculptor art , to hand over [his]492-the young sculptor passions to [his]492-the young sculptor genius to be dealt with , and to find that [he]492-the young sculptor could live largely enough without exceeding the circle of wholesome curiosity . [Rowland]281-rowland took immense satisfaction in [[his]186-roderick companion]555-his companion 's deep impatience to make something of all [his]186-roderick impressions . Some of these indeed found [their]830-their way into a channel which did not lead to statues , but it was none the less a safe one . [He]186-roderick wrote frequent long letters to [Miss Garland]182-miss garland ; when [Rowland]281-rowland went with [him]186-roderick to post them [he]186-roderick thought wistfully of the fortune of the great loosely - written missives , which cost [Roderick]186-roderick unconscionable sums in postage . [He]186-roderick received punctual answers of a more frugal form , written in a clear , minute hand , on paper vexatiously thin . If [Rowland]281-rowland was present when [they]831-they came , [he]186-roderick turned away and thought of other things - or tried to . These were the only moments when [his]186-roderick sympathy halted , and they were brief . For the rest [he]186-roderick let the days go by unprotestingly , and enjoyed [Roderick]186-roderick 's serene efflorescence as [he]186-roderick would have done a beautiful summer sunrise . [Rome]4-rome , for the past month , had been delicious . The annual descent of [the Goths]208-the goths had not yet begun , and sunny leisure seemed to brood over [the city]832-the city .

[Roderick]186-roderick had taken out a note - book and was roughly sketching a memento of [the great Juno]833-the great juno . Suddenly there was a noise on the gravel , and [the young men]543-the young men , looking up , saw [three persons]835-three persons advancing . [One]3107-one was [a woman of middle age , with a rather grand air and a great many furbelows]837-a woman of middle age , with a rather grand air and a great many furbelows . [She]3107-one looked very hard at [[our]838-our friends]839-our friends as [she]3107-one passed , and glanced back over [her]3107-one shoulder , as if to hasten the step of [a young girl who slowly followed [her]3107-one]840-a young girl who slowly followed her . [She]3107-one had such an expansive majesty of mien that [Rowland]281-rowland supposed [she]3107-one must have some proprietary right in [the villa]841-the villa and was not just then in a hospitable mood . Beside [her]3107-one walked [a little elderly man]842-a little elderly man , tightly buttoned in a shabby black coat , but with a flower in [his]842-a little elderly man lappet , and a pair of soiled light gloves . [He]842-a little elderly man was [a grotesque - looking personage]843-a grotesque - looking personage , and might have passed for [a gentleman of the old school , reduced by adversity to playing cicerone to foreigners of distinction]844-a gentleman of the old school , reduced by adversity to playing cicerone to foreigners of distinction . [He]842-a little elderly man had a little black eye which glittered like a diamond and rolled about like a ball of quicksilver , and a white moustache , cut short and stiff , like a worn - out brush . [He]842-a little elderly man was smiling with extreme urbanity , and talking in a low , mellifluous voice to [the lady]845-the lady , who evidently was not listening to [him]842-a little elderly man . At a considerable distance behind [this couple]846-this couple strolled [a young girl , apparently of about twenty]847-a young girl , apparently of about twenty . [She]847-a young girl , apparently of about twenty was tall and slender , and dressed with extreme elegance ; [she]847-a young girl , apparently of about twenty led by [a cord a large poodle of the most fantastic aspect]848-a cord a large poodle of the most fantastic aspect . [He]842-a little elderly man was combed and decked like a ram for sacrifice ; [his]842-a little elderly man trunk and haunches were of the most transparent pink , [his]842-a little elderly man fleecy head and shoulders as white as [jeweler]849-jeweler 's cotton , and [his]842-a little elderly man tail and ears ornamented with long blue ribbons . [He]842-a little elderly man stepped along stiffly and solemnly beside [[his]842-a little elderly man mistress]850-his mistress , with an air of conscious elegance . There was something at first slightly ridiculous in the sight of [a young lady gravely appended to an animal of these incongruous attributes]851-a young lady gravely appended to an animal of these incongruous attributes , and [Roderick]186-roderick , with [his]186-roderick customary frankness , greeted the spectacle with a confident smile . [The young girl]659-the young girl perceived it and turned [her]659-the young girl face full upon [him]842-a little elderly man , with a gaze intended apparently to enforce greater deference . It was not deference , however , [her]659-the young girl face provoked , but startled , submissive admiration ; [Roderick]186-roderick 's smile fell dead , and [he]842-a little elderly man sat eagerly staring . [A pair of extraordinary dark blue eyes , a mass of dusky hair over a low forehead , a blooming oval of perfect purity]853-a pair of extraordinary dark blue eyes , a mass of dusky hair over a low forehead , a blooming oval of perfect purity , a flexible lip , just touched with disdain , the step and carriage of [a tired princess]854-a tired princess - these were the general features of [his]842-a little elderly man vision . [The young lady]716-the young lady was walking slowly and letting [her]716-the young lady long dress rustle over the gravel ; [the young men]543-the young men had time to see [her]716-the young lady distinctly before [she]716-the young lady averted [her]716-the young lady face and went [her]716-the young lady way . [She]716-the young lady left a vague , sweet perfume behind [her]716-the young lady as [she]716-the young lady passed .

" Immortal powers ! "[186-roderick] cried [Roderick]186-roderick , " what a vision ! In the name of transcendent perfection , who is [she]716-the young lady ? "[186-roderick] [He]186-roderick sprang up and stood looking after [her]716-the young lady until [she]716-the young lady rounded a turn in [the avenue]857-the avenue . " What a movement , what a manner , what a poise of the head ! [I]186-roderick wonder if [she]716-the young lady would sit to [me]186-roderick . "[186-roderick]

" [You]281-rowland had better go and ask [her]716-the young lady , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland , laughing . " [She]716-the young lady is certainly most beautiful . "[281-rowland]

" Beautiful ? [She]716-the young lady 's beauty itself - [she]716-the young lady 's a revelation . [I]186-roderick do n't believe [she]716-the young lady is living - [she]716-the young lady 's a phantasm , a vapor , an illusion ! "[186-roderick]

" The poodle , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland , " is certainly alive . "[281-rowland]

" Nay , [he]3479-he too may be [a grotesque phantom]3480-a grotesque phantom , like the black dog in [Faust]49-faust . "[186-roderick]

" [I]281-rowland hope at least that [the young lady]716-the young lady has nothing in common with [Mephistopheles]3482-mephistopheles . [She]716-the young lady looked dangerous . "[281-rowland]

" If beauty is immoral , as [people]3189-people think at [Northampton]2-northampton , "[186-roderick] said [Roderick]186-roderick , ' [she]858-she is the incarnation of evil . [The mamma]859-the mamma and [the queer old gentleman]860-the queer old gentleman , moreover , are a pledge of [her]858-she reality . Who are [they all]861-they all ? "[186-roderick]

" [The Prince]3484-the prince and [Princess Ludovisi]209-princess ludovisi and [the principessina]3485-the principessina , "[281-rowland] suggested [Rowland]281-rowland .

" There are [no such people]3486-no such people , "[186-roderick] said [Roderick]186-roderick . " Besides , [the little old man]3487-the little old man is not [the papa]3488-the papa . "[186-roderick] [Rowland]281-rowland smiled , wondering how [he]862-he had ascertained these facts , and [the young sculptor]492-the young sculptor went on . " [The old man]3489-the old man is [a Roman]3490-a roman , [a hanger - on of the mamma]3491-a hanger - on of the mamma , [a useful personage who now and then gets asked to dinner]3492-a useful personage who now and then gets asked to dinner . [The ladies]3241-the ladies are [foreigners]3494-foreigners , from [some Northern country]3495-some northern country ; [I]492-the young sculptor wo n't say which . "[492-the young sculptor]

" Perhaps from [the State of [Maine]50-maine]3496-the state of maine , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland .

" No , [she]492-the young sculptor 's not [an American]3497-an american , [I]864-i 'll lay a wager on that . [She]492-the young sculptor 's [a daughter of [this elder world]3499-this elder world]3498-a daughter of this elder world . [We]3500-we shall see [her]492-the young sculptor again , [I]864-i pray [my]864-i stars ; but if [we]3500-we do n't , [I]864-i shall have done something [I]864-i never expected to - [I]864-i shall have had a glimpse of ideal beauty . "[864-i] [He]864-i sat down again and went on with [his]864-i sketch of [the Juno]865-the juno , scrawled away for ten minutes , and then handed the result in silence to [Rowland]281-rowland . [Rowland]281-rowland uttered an exclamation of surprise and applause . The drawing represented [the Juno]199-the juno as to the position of the head , the brow , and the broad fillet across the hair ; but the eyes , the mouth , the physiognomy were a vivid portrait of [the young girl with the poodle]866-the young girl with the poodle . " [I]186-roderick have been wanting a subject , "[186-roderick] said [Roderick]186-roderick : " there 's one made to [my]186-roderick hand ! And now for work ! "[186-roderick]

[They]867-they saw no more of [the young girl]659-the young girl , though [Roderick]186-roderick looked hopefully , for some days , into [the carriages on [the Pincian]51-the pincian]869-the carriages on the pincian . [She]659-the young girl had evidently been but passing through [Rome]4-rome ; [Naples]52-naples or [Florence]46-florence now happily possessed [her]659-the young girl , and [she]659-the young girl was guiding [[her]659-the young girl fleecy companion]870-her fleecy companion through [the Villa Reale]871-the villa reale or [the Boboli Gardens]872-the boboli gardens with the same superb defiance of irony . [Roderick]186-roderick went to work and spent a month shut up in [[his]186-roderick studio]873-his studio ; [he]186-roderick had an idea , and [he]186-roderick was not to rest till [he]186-roderick had embodied it . [He]186-roderick had established [himself]186-roderick in [the basement of [a huge , dusky , dilapidated old house]875-a huge , dusky , dilapidated old house]874-the basement of a huge , dusky , dilapidated old house , in [that long , tortuous , and preeminently Roman street which leads from [the Corso]53-the corso to [the Bridge of St. Angelo]54-the bridge of st. angelo]876-that long , tortuous , and preeminently roman street which leads from the corso to the bridge of st. angelo . [The black archway which admitted [you]878-you might have served as the portal of [the Augean stables]879-the augean stables]877-the black archway which admitted you might have served as the portal of the augean stables , but [you]878-you emerged presently upon [a mouldy little court , of which the fourth side was formed by a narrow terrace , overhanging [the Tiber]55-the tiber]880-a mouldy little court , of which the fourth side was formed by a narrow terrace , overhanging the tiber . Here , along the parapet , were stationed half a dozen shapeless fragments of sculpture , with a couple of meagre orange - trees in terra - cotta tubs , and an oleander that never flowered . The unclean , [historic river]881-historic river swept beneath ; behind were dusky , reeking walls , spotted here and there with hanging rags and flower - pots in windows ; opposite , at a distance , were the bare brown banks of [the stream]882-the stream , [the huge rotunda of [St. Angelo]56-st. angelo , tipped with [its]883-the huge rotunda of st. angelo , tipped with its seraphic statue , the dome of st. peter 's seraphic statue , the dome of [St. Peter]210-st. peter 's]883-the huge rotunda of st. angelo , tipped with its seraphic statue , the dome of st. peter 's , and the broad - topped pines of [the Villa Doria]884-the villa doria . [The place]3197-the place was crumbling and shabby and melancholy , but [the river]548-the river was delightful , the rent was a trifle , and everything was picturesque . [Roderick]186-roderick was in the best humor with [[his]186-roderick quarters]887-his quarters from the first , and was certain that the working mood there would be intenser in an hour than in twenty years of [Northampton]2-northampton . [[His]186-roderick studio]873-his studio was [a huge , empty room with a vaulted ceiling , covered with vague , dark traces of an old fresco , which [Rowland]281-rowland]889-a huge , empty room with a vaulted ceiling , covered with vague , dark traces of an old fresco , which rowland , when [he]186-roderick spent an hour with [[his]186-roderick friend]606-his friend , used to stare at vainly for some surviving coherence of floating draperies and clasping arms . [Roderick]186-roderick had lodged [himself]186-roderick economically in [the same quarter]891-the same quarter . [He]186-roderick occupied [a fifth floor on [the Ripetta]57-the ripetta]892-a fifth floor on the ripetta , but [he]186-roderick was only at [home]349-home to sleep , for when [he]186-roderick was not at [work]894-work [he]186-roderick was either lounging in [[Rowland]281-rowland 's more luxurious rooms]895-rowland 's more luxurious rooms or strolling through [streets]896-streets and [churches]784-churches and [gardens]898-gardens .

[Rowland]281-rowland had found [a convenient corner in [a stately old palace not far from [the Fountain of Trevi]58-the fountain of trevi]900-a stately old palace not far from the fountain of trevi]899-a convenient corner in a stately old palace not far from the fountain of trevi , and made [himself]281-rowland [a home to which books and pictures and prints and odds and ends of curious furniture]901-a home to which books and pictures and prints and odds and ends of curious furniture gave an air of leisurely permanence . [He]186-roderick had the tastes of [a collector]902-a collector ; [he]186-roderick spent half [his]186-roderick afternoons ransacking the dusty magazines of [the curiosity - mongers]903-the curiosity - mongers , and often made [his]186-roderick way , in quest of a prize , into the heart of impecunious Roman households , which had been prevailed upon to listen - with closed doors and an impenetrably wary smile - to proposals for an hereditary " antique . "[186-roderick] In the evening , often , under the lamp , amid dropped curtains and the scattered gleam of firelight upon polished carvings and mellow paintings , [the two friends]904-the two friends sat with [their]904-the two friends heads together , criticising intaglios and etchings , water - color drawings and illuminated missals . [Roderick]186-roderick 's quick appreciation of every form of artistic beauty reminded [[his]186-roderick companion]555-his companion of the flexible temperament of [those Italian artists of the sixteenth century who were indifferently [painters and sculptors]907-painters and sculptors , [sonneteers and engravers]908-sonneteers and engravers]906-those italian artists of the sixteenth century who were indifferently painters and sculptors , sonneteers and engravers . At times when [he]186-roderick saw how [the young sculptor]492-the young sculptor 's day passed in a single sustained pulsation , while [his]186-roderick own was broken into a dozen conscious devices for disposing of the hours , and intermingled with sighs , half suppressed , some of them , for conscience ' sake , over what [he]186-roderick failed of in action and missed in possession - [he]186-roderick felt a pang of something akin to envy . But [Rowland]281-rowland had two substantial aids for giving patience the air of contentment : [he]186-roderick was [an inquisitive reader]910-an inquisitive reader and [a passionate rider]911-a passionate rider . [He]186-roderick plunged into bulky German octavos on Italian history , and [he]186-roderick spent long afternoons in the saddle , ranging over the grassy desolation of [the Campagna]59-the campagna . As the season went on and [the social groups]912-the social groups began to constitute [themselves]912-the social groups , [he]186-roderick found that [he]186-roderick knew [a great many people]913-a great many people and that [he]186-roderick had easy opportunity for knowing [others]914-others . [He]186-roderick enjoyed a quiet corner of [a drawing - room]915-a drawing - room beside [an agreeable woman]916-an agreeable woman , and although the machinery of what calls itself society seemed to [him]186-roderick to have many superfluous wheels , [he]186-roderick accepted invitations and made visits punctiliously , from the conviction that the only way not to be overcome by the ridiculous side of most of such observances is to take them with exaggerated gravity . [He]186-roderick introduced [Roderick]186-roderick right and left , and suffered [him]186-roderick to make [his]186-roderick way [himself]186-roderick - an enterprise for which [Roderick]186-roderick very soon displayed an all - sufficient capacity . Wherever [he]186-roderick went [he]186-roderick made , not exactly what is called a favorable impression , but what , from a practical point of view , is better - a puzzling one . [He]186-roderick took to evening parties as a duck to water , and before the winter was half over was [the most freely and frequently discussed young man in [the heterogeneous foreign colony]918-the heterogeneous foreign colony]917-the most freely and frequently discussed young man in the heterogeneous foreign colony . [Rowland]281-rowland 's theory of [his]186-roderick own duty was to let [him]186-roderick run [his]186-roderick course and play [his]186-roderick cards , only holding [himself]186-roderick ready to point out shoals and pitfalls , and administer a friendly propulsion through tight places . [Roderick]186-roderick 's manners on [the precincts of the Pincian]919-the precincts of the pincian were quite the same as [his]186-roderick manners on [[Cecilia]169-cecilia 's veranda]715-cecilia 's veranda : that is , they were no manners at all . But it remained as true as before that it would have been impossible , on the whole , to violate ceremony with less of lasting offense . [He]186-roderick interrupted , [he]186-roderick contradicted , [he]186-roderick spoke to [people]3189-people [he]186-roderick had never seen , and left [[his]186-roderick social creditors]922-his social creditors without the smallest conversational interest on [their]922-his social creditors loans ; [he]186-roderick lounged and yawned , [he]186-roderick talked loud when [he]186-roderick should have talked low , and low when [he]186-roderick should have talked loud . [Many people]923-many people , in consequence , thought [him]186-roderick insufferably conceited , and declared that [he]186-roderick ought to wait till [he]186-roderick had something to show for [his]186-roderick powers , before [he]186-roderick assumed the airs of [a spoiled celebrity]924-a spoiled celebrity . But to [Rowland]281-rowland and to [most friendly observers]925-most friendly observers this judgment was quite beside the mark , and [the young man]347-the young man 's undiluted naturalness was its own justification . [He]186-roderick was impulsive , spontaneous , sincere ; there were so many people at dinner - tables and in [studios]927-studios who were not , that it seemed worth while to allow [this rare specimen]928-this rare specimen all possible freedom of action . If [Roderick]186-roderick took the words out of [your]929-your mouth when [you]929-your were just prepared to deliver them with the most effective accent , [he]186-roderick did it with a perfect good conscience and with no pretension of a better right to being heard , but simply because [he]186-roderick was full to overflowing of [his]186-roderick own momentary thought and it sprang from [his]186-roderick lips without asking leave . There were persons who waited on [your]929-your periods much more deferentially , who were a hundred times more capable than [Roderick]186-roderick of a reflective impertinence . [Roderick]186-roderick received from various sources , chiefly feminine , enough finely - adjusted advice to have established [him]186-roderick in life as an embodiment of the proprieties , and [he]186-roderick received it , as [he]186-roderick afterwards listened to criticisms on [his]186-roderick statues , with unfaltering candor and good - humor . Here and there , doubtless , as [he]186-roderick went , [he]186-roderick took in a reef in [[his]186-roderick sail]930-his sail ; but [he]186-roderick was too adventurous a spirit to be successfully tamed , and [he]186-roderick remained at most points [the florid , rather strident young Virginian whose serene inflexibility had been the despair of [Mr. Striker]185-mr. striker]931-the florid , rather strident young virginian whose serene inflexibility had been the despair of mr. striker . All this was what [friendly commentators still chiefly feminine]932-friendly commentators still chiefly feminine alluded to when [they]932-friendly commentators still chiefly feminine spoke of [his]186-roderick delightful freshness , and [critics of harsher sensibilities of the other sex]933-critics of harsher sensibilities of the other sex when [they]932-friendly commentators still chiefly feminine denounced [his]186-roderick damned impertinence . [His]186-roderick appearance enforced these impressions - [his]186-roderick handsome face , [his]186-roderick radiant , unaverted eyes , [his]186-roderick childish , unmodulated voice . Afterwards , when [those who loved [him]186-roderick]934-those who loved him were in tears , there was something in all this unspotted comeliness that seemed to lend a mockery to the causes of [their]934-those who loved him sorrow .

Certainly , among [the young men of genius who , for so many ages]935-the young men of genius who , for so many ages , have gone up to [Rome]4-rome to test [their]935-the young men of genius who , for so many ages powers , none ever made a fairer beginning than [Roderick]186-roderick . [He]186-roderick rode [his]186-roderick two horses at once with extraordinary good fortune ; [he]186-roderick established the happiest modus vivendi betwixt work and play . [He]186-roderick wrestled all day with a mountain of clay in [[his]186-roderick studio]873-his studio , and chattered half the night away in [Roman drawing - rooms]937-roman drawing - rooms . It all seemed part of a kind of divine facility . [He]186-roderick was passionately interested , [he]186-roderick was feeling [his]186-roderick powers ; now that [they]938-they had thoroughly kindled in the glowing aesthetic atmosphere of [Rome]4-rome , [the ardent young fellow]939-the ardent young fellow should be pardoned for believing that [he]186-roderick never was to see the end of [them]938-they . [He]186-roderick enjoyed immeasurably , after the chronic obstruction of [home]349-home , the downright act of production . [He]186-roderick kept models in [[his]186-roderick studio]873-his studio till [they]938-they dropped with fatigue ; [he]186-roderick drew , on other days , at [the Capitol]942-the capitol and [the Vatican]943-the vatican , till [his]186-roderick own head swam with [his]186-roderick eagerness , and [his]186-roderick limbs stiffened with the cold . [He]186-roderick had promptly set up a life - sized figure which [he]186-roderick called an " [Adam]211-the adam , "[186-roderick] and was pushing it rapidly toward completion . There were naturally [a great many wiseheads who smiled at [his]186-roderick precipitancy , and cited [him]186-roderick as one more example of Yankee crudity , a capital recruit to [the great army of [those who wish to dance]946-those who wish to dance before [they]946-those who wish to dance can walk]945-the great army of those who wish to dance before they can walk]944-a great many wiseheads who smiled at his precipitancy , and cited him as one more example of yankee crudity , a capital recruit to the great army of those who wish to dance before they can walk . [They]947-they were right , but [Roderick]186-roderick was right too , for the success of [his]186-roderick statue was not to have been foreseen ; it partook , really , of the miraculous . [He]186-roderick never surpassed it afterwards , and [a good judge here and there]948-a good judge here and there has been known to pronounce it the finest piece of sculpture of [our]949-our modern era . To [Rowland]281-rowland it seemed to justify superbly [his]186-roderick highest hopes of [[his]186-roderick friend]606-his friend , and [he]186-roderick said to [himself]186-roderick that if [he]186-roderick had invested [his]186-roderick happiness in fostering [a genius]951-a genius , [he]186-roderick ought now to be in possession of a boundless complacency . There was something especially confident and masterly in [the artist]3153-the artist 's negligence of all such small picturesque accessories as might serve to label [his]3153-the artist figure to a vulgar apprehension . If it represented [the father of the human race]953-the father of the human race and the primal embodiment of human sensation , it did so in virtue of its look of balanced physical perfection , and deeply , eagerly sentient vitality . [Rowland]281-rowland , in fraternal zeal , traveled up to [Carrara]60-carrara and selected at [the quarries]954-the quarries the most magnificent block of marble [he]186-roderick could find , and when it came down to [Rome]4-rome , [the two young men]608-the two young men had a " celebration . "[608-the two young men] [They]608-the two young men drove out to [Albano]61-albano , breakfasted boisterously in [their]608-the two young men respective measure at [the inn]956-the inn , and lounged away the day in the sun on [the top of [Monte Cavo]62-monte cavo]957-the top of monte cavo . [Roderick]186-roderick 's head was full of ideas for other works , which [he]186-roderick described with infinite spirit and eloquence , as vividly as if [they]958-they were ranged on [their]958-they pedestals before [him]186-roderick . [He]186-roderick had an indefatigable fancy ; things [he]186-roderick saw in [the streets]959-the streets , in [the country]438-the country , things [he]186-roderick heard and read , effects [he]186-roderick saw just missed or half - expressed in the works of [others]914-others , acted upon [his]186-roderick mind as a kind of challenge , and [he]186-roderick was terribly restless until , in some form or other , [he]186-roderick had taken up the glove and set [his]186-roderick lance in rest .

[The Adam]962-the adam was put into marble , and all [the world]483-the world came to see it . Of the criticisms passed upon it this history undertakes to offer no record ; over many of [them]964-them [the two young men]608-the two young men had a daily laugh for a month , and certain of the formulas of [the connoisseurs]966-the connoisseurs , restrictive or indulgent , furnished [Roderick]186-roderick with a permanent supply of humorous catch - words . But [people]3189-people enough spoke flattering good - sense to make [Roderick]186-roderick feel as if [he]186-roderick were already half famous . The statue passed formally into [Rowland]281-rowland 's possession , and was paid for as if an illustrious name had been chiseled on the pedestal . [Poor Roderick]212-poor roderick owed every franc of the money . It was not for this , however , but because [he]186-roderick was so gloriously in the mood , that , denying [himself]186-roderick all breathing - time , on the same day [he]186-roderick had given the last touch to [the Adam]211-the adam , [he]186-roderick began to shape the rough contour of an Eve . This went forward with equal rapidity and success . [Roderick]186-roderick lost [his]186-roderick temper , time and again , with [[his]186-roderick models]968-his models , who offered but a gross , degenerate image of [his]186-roderick splendid ideal ; but [his]186-roderick ideal , as [he]186-roderick assured [Rowland]281-rowland , became gradually such a fixed , vivid presence , that [he]186-roderick had only to shut [his]186-roderick eyes to behold a creature far more to [his]186-roderick purpose than [the poor girl who stood posturing at forty sous an hour]969-the poor girl who stood posturing at forty sous an hour . The Eve was finished in a month , and the feat was extraordinary , as well as the statue , which represented [an admirably beautiful woman]970-an admirably beautiful woman . When the spring began to muffle [the rugged old city]971-the rugged old city with its clambering festoons , it seemed to [him]186-roderick that [he]186-roderick had done a handsome winter 's work and had fairly earned a holiday . [He]186-roderick took a liberal one , and lounged away the lovely Roman May , doing nothing . [He]186-roderick looked very contented ; with [himself]186-roderick , perhaps , at times , a trifle too obviously . But who could have said without good reason ? [He]186-roderick was " flushed with triumph ; "[186-roderick] this classic phrase portrayed [him]186-roderick , to [Rowland]281-rowland 's sense . [He]186-roderick would lose [himself]186-roderick in long reveries , and emerge from [them]972-them with a quickened smile and a heightened color . [Rowland]281-rowland grudged [him]186-roderick none of [his]186-roderick smiles , and took an extreme satisfaction in [his]186-roderick two statues . [He]186-roderick had [the Adam]211-the adam and [the Eve]973-the eve transported to [[his]186-roderick own apartment]974-his own apartment , and one warm evening in May [he]186-roderick gave a little dinner in honor of [the artist]3153-the artist . It was small , but [Rowland]281-rowland had meant it should be very agreeably composed . [He]186-roderick thought over [[his]186-roderick friends]714-his friends and chose four . [They]714-his friends were [all persons with whom [he]186-roderick lived in a certain intimacy]977-all persons with whom he lived in a certain intimacy .

[One of [them]714-his friends]978-one of them was [an American sculptor of French extraction]979-an american sculptor of french extraction , or remotely , perhaps , of Italian , for [he]186-roderick rejoiced in the somewhat fervid name of [Gloriani]213-gloriani . [He]186-roderick was [a man of forty]980-a man of forty , [he]186-roderick had been living for years in [Paris]9-paris and in [Rome]4-rome , and [he]186-roderick now drove a very pretty trade in sculpture of the ornamental and fantastic sort . In [his]186-roderick youth [he]186-roderick had had money ; but [he]186-roderick had spent it recklessly , much of it scandalously , and at twenty - six had found [himself]186-roderick obliged to make capital of [his]186-roderick talent . This was quite inimitable , and fifteen years of indefatigable exercise had brought it to perfection . [Rowland]281-rowland admitted its power , though it gave [him]186-roderick very little pleasure ; what [he]186-roderick relished in [the man]3289-the man was the extraordinary vivacity and frankness , not to call it the impudence , of [his]186-roderick ideas . [He]186-roderick had a definite , practical scheme of art , and [he]186-roderick knew at least what [he]186-roderick meant . In this sense [he]186-roderick was solid and complete . There were so many of the aesthetic fraternity who were floundering in [unknown seas]982-unknown seas , without a notion of which way [their]983-their noses were turned , that [Gloriani]213-gloriani , conscious and compact , unlimitedly intelligent and consummately clever , dogmatic only as to [his]186-roderick own duties , and at once gracefully deferential and profoundly indifferent to those of [others]914-others , had for [Rowland]281-rowland a certain intellectual refreshment quite independent of the character of [his]186-roderick works . These were considered by [most people]3106-most people to belong to a very corrupt , and by [many to a positively indecent school]986-many to a positively indecent school . [Others]914-others thought [them]988-them tremendously knowing , and paid enormous prices for [them]988-them ; and indeed , to be able to point to one of [Gloriani]213-gloriani 's figures in a shady corner of [[your]989-you library]990-your library was tolerable proof that [you]989-you were not [a fool]991-a fool . Corrupt things [they]988-them certainly were ; in the line of sculpture they were quite the latest fruit of time . It was [the artist]3153-the artist 's opinion that there is no essential difference between beauty and ugliness ; that they overlap and intermingle in a quite inextricable manner ; that there is no saying where one begins and the other ends ; that hideousness grimaces at [you]989-you suddenly from out of the very bosom of loveliness , and beauty blooms before [your]989-you eyes in the lap of vileness ; that it is a waste of wit to nurse metaphysical distinctions , and a sadly meagre entertainment to caress imaginary lines ; that the thing to aim at is the expressive , and the way to reach it is by ingenuity ; that for this purpose everything may serve , and that a consummate work is a sort of hotch - potch of the pure and the impure , the graceful and the grotesque . Its prime duty is to amuse , to puzzle , to fascinate , to savor of a complex imagination . [Gloriani]213-gloriani 's statues were florid and meretricious ; they looked like [magnified goldsmith]993-magnified goldsmith 's work . They were extremely elegant , but they had no charm for [Rowland]281-rowland . [He]186-roderick never bought one , but [Gloriani]213-gloriani was such [an honest fellow]994-an honest fellow , and withal was so deluged with orders , that this made no difference in [their]995-their friendship . [The artist]3153-the artist might have passed for [a Frenchman]997-a frenchman . [He]3153-the artist was [a great talker]998-a great talker , and [a very picturesque one]999-a very picturesque one ; [he]3153-the artist was almost bald ; [he]3153-the artist had a small , bright eye , a broken nose , and a moustache with waxed ends . When sometimes [he]3153-the artist received [you]989-you at [[his]3153-the artist lodging]1000-his lodging , [he]3153-the artist introduced [you]989-you to [a lady with a plain face whom [he]3153-the artist called [Madame Gloriani]213-gloriani - which [she]213-gloriani was not]1001-a lady with a plain face whom he called madame gloriani - which she was not .

[[Rowland]281-rowland 's second guest]1002-rowland 's second guest was also [an artist , but of a very different type]1003-an artist , but of a very different type . [[His]1002-rowland 's second guest friends]714-his friends called [him]1002-rowland 's second guest [Sam Singleton]214-singleton ; [he]1002-rowland 's second guest was [an American]3497-an american , and [he]1002-rowland 's second guest had been in [Rome]4-rome a couple of years . [He]1002-rowland 's second guest painted small landscapes , chiefly in water - colors : [Rowland]281-rowland had seen one of them in [a shop]1006-a shop window , had liked it extremely , and , ascertaining [his]1002-rowland 's second guest address , had gone to see [him]1002-rowland 's second guest and found [him]1002-rowland 's second guest established in [a very humble studio near [the Piazza Barberini]63-the piazza barberini , where , apparently , fame and fortune had not yet found [him]1002-rowland 's second guest out]1007-a very humble studio near the piazza barberini , where , apparently , fame and fortune had not yet found him out . [Rowland]281-rowland took a fancy to [him]1002-rowland 's second guest and bought several of [his]1002-rowland 's second guest pictures ; [Singleton]214-singleton made few speeches , but was grateful . [Rowland]281-rowland heard afterwards that when [he]1002-rowland 's second guest first came to [Rome]4-rome [he]1002-rowland 's second guest painted worthless daubs and gave no promise of talent . [Improvement]215-improvement had come , however , hand in hand with patient industry , and [his]1002-rowland 's second guest talent , though of a slender and delicate order , was now incontestable . It was as yet but scantily recognized , and [he]1002-rowland 's second guest had hard work to live . [Rowland]281-rowland hung [his]1002-rowland 's second guest little water - colors on the parlor wall , and found that , as [he]1002-rowland 's second guest lived with [them]1008-them , [he]1002-rowland 's second guest grew very fond of them . [Singleton]214-singleton was [a diminutive , dwarfish personage]1009-a diminutive , dwarfish personage ; [he]214-singleton looked like [a precocious child]1010-a precocious child . [He]214-singleton had a high , protuberant forehead , a transparent brown eye , a perpetual smile , an extraordinary expression of modesty and patience . [He]214-singleton listened much more willingly than [he]214-singleton talked , with a little fixed , grateful grin ; [he]214-singleton blushed when [he]214-singleton spoke , and always offered [his]214-singleton ideas in a sidelong fashion , as if the presumption were against them . [His]214-singleton modesty set [them]1008-them off , and they were eminently to the point . [He]214-singleton was so perfect an example of [the little noiseless , laborious artist whom chance , in the person of [a moneyed patron]1012-a moneyed patron]1011-the little noiseless , laborious artist whom chance , in the person of a moneyed patron , has never taken by the hand , that [Rowland]281-rowland would have liked to befriend [him]214-singleton by stealth . [Singleton]214-singleton had expressed a fervent admiration for [Roderick]186-roderick 's productions , but had not yet met [the young master]1013-the young master . [Roderick]186-roderick was lounging against the chimney - piece when [he]214-singleton came in , and [Rowland]281-rowland presently introduced [him]186-roderick . [The little water - colorist]1014-the little water - colorist stood with folded hands , blushing , smiling , and looking up at [him]214-singleton as if [Roderick]186-roderick were [himself]186-roderick a statue on a pedestal . [Singleton]214-singleton began to murmur something about [his]214-singleton pleasure , [his]214-singleton admiration ; the desire to make [his]214-singleton compliment smoothly gave [him]214-singleton a kind of grotesque formalism . [Roderick]186-roderick looked down at [him]214-singleton surprised , and suddenly burst into a laugh . [Singleton]214-singleton paused a moment and then , with an intenser smile , went on : " Well , [sir]3318-sir , [your]3318-sir statues are beautiful , all the same ! "[214-singleton]

[[Rowland]281-rowland 's two other guests]1015-rowland 's two other guests were [ladies]3327-ladies , and one of [them]1015-rowland 's two other guests , [Miss Blanchard]216-miss blanchard , belonged also to [the artistic fraternity]1017-the artistic fraternity . [She]216-miss blanchard was [an American]3497-an american , [she]216-miss blanchard was young , [she]216-miss blanchard was pretty , and [she]216-miss blanchard had made [her]216-miss blanchard way to [Rome]4-rome alone and unaided . [She]216-miss blanchard lived alone , or with [no other duenna]1019-no other duenna than [a bushy - browed old serving - woman]1020-a bushy - browed old serving - woman , though indeed [she]216-miss blanchard had [a friendly neighbor]1021-a friendly neighbor in the person of [a certain [Madame Grandoni]217-madame grandoni , who in various social emergencies lent [her]216-miss blanchard a protecting wing , and had come with [her]216-miss blanchard to [Rowland]281-rowland 's dinner]1022-a certain madame grandoni , who in various social emergencies lent her a protecting wing , and had come with her to rowland 's dinner . [Miss Blanchard]216-miss blanchard had a little money , but [she]216-miss blanchard was not above selling [her]216-miss blanchard pictures . These represented generally a bunch of dew - sprinkled roses , with the dew - drops very highly finished , or else [a wayside shrine]1023-a wayside shrine , and [a peasant woman]1024-a peasant woman , with [her]1024-a peasant woman back turned , kneeling before it . [She]216-miss blanchard did backs very well , but [she]216-miss blanchard was a little weak in faces . Flowers , however , were [her]216-miss blanchard speciality , and though [her]216-miss blanchard touch was a little old - fashioned and finical , [she]216-miss blanchard painted them with remarkable skill . [Her]216-miss blanchard pictures were chiefly bought by [the English]218-the english . [Rowland]281-rowland had made [her]216-miss blanchard acquaintance early in the winter , and as [she]216-miss blanchard kept a saddle horse and rode a great deal , [he]1025-he had asked permission to be [[her]216-miss blanchard cavalier]1026-her cavalier . In this way [they]1027-they had become almost intimate . [Miss Blanchard]216-miss blanchard 's name was [Augusta]219-augusta blanchard ; [she]216-miss blanchard was slender , pale , and elegant looking ; [she]216-miss blanchard had a very pretty head and brilliant auburn hair , which [she]216-miss blanchard braided with classical simplicity . [She]216-miss blanchard talked in a sweet , soft voice , used language at times a trifle superfine , and made literary allusions . These had often a patriotic strain , and [Rowland]281-rowland had more than once been irritated by [her]216-miss blanchard quotations from [Mrs. Sigourney]220-mrs. sigourney in [the cork - woods of [Monte Mario]64-monte mario]1028-the cork - woods of monte mario , and from [Mr. Willis]221-mr. willis among [the ruins of [Veii]65-veii]1029-the ruins of veii . [Rowland]281-rowland was of a dozen different minds about [her]216-miss blanchard , and was half surprised , at times , to find [himself]281-rowland treating it as a matter of serious moment whether [he]1030-he liked [her]216-miss blanchard or not . [He]1030-he admired [her]216-miss blanchard , and indeed there was something admirable in [her]216-miss blanchard combination of beauty and talent , of isolation and tranquil self - support . [He]1030-he used sometimes to go into [the little , high - niched , ordinary room which served [her]216-miss blanchard as [a studio]1032-a studio]1031-the little , high - niched , ordinary room which served her as a studio , and find [her]216-miss blanchard working at a panel six inches square , at an open casement , profiled against the deep blue Roman sky . [She]216-miss blanchard received [him]1030-he with a meek - eyed dignity that made [her]216-miss blanchard seem like a painted saint on [a church]1033-a church window , receiving the daylight in all [her]216-miss blanchard being . The breath of reproach passed [her]216-miss blanchard by with folded wings . And yet [Rowland]281-rowland wondered why [he]1030-he did not like [her]216-miss blanchard better . If [he]1030-he failed , the reason was not far to seek . There was [another woman whom [he]1030-he liked better , an image in [his]1030-he heart which refused to yield precedence]1034-another woman whom he liked better , an image in his heart which refused to yield precedence .

On that evening to which allusion has been made , when [Rowland]281-rowland was left alone between the starlight and the waves with the sudden knowledge that [Mary Garland]193-mary garland was to become [[another man]1035-another man 's wife]1036-another man 's wife , [he]1030-he had made , after a while , the simple resolution to forget [her]193-mary garland . And every day since , like [a famous philosopher who wished to abbreviate [his]1030-he mourning for [a faithful servant]1038-a faithful servant]1037-a famous philosopher who wished to abbreviate his mourning for a faithful servant , [he]1030-he had said to [himself]1030-he in substance - " Remember to forget [Mary Garland]193-mary garland . "[1030-he] Sometimes it seemed as if [he]1030-he were succeeding ; then , suddenly , when [he]1030-he was least expecting it , [he]1030-he would find [her]193-mary garland name , inaudibly , on [his]1030-he lips , and seem to see [her]193-mary garland eyes meeting [his]1030-he eyes . All this made [him]1030-he uncomfortable , and seemed to portend a possible discord . Discord was not to [his]1030-he taste ; [he]1030-he shrank from imperious passions , and the idea of finding [himself]1030-he jealous of [an unsuspecting friend]1039-an unsuspecting friend was absolutely repulsive . More than ever , then , the path of duty was to forget [Mary Garland]193-mary garland , and [he]1030-he cultivated oblivion , as [we]1040-we may say , in the person of [Miss Blanchard]216-miss blanchard . [Her]193-mary garland fine temper , [he]1030-he said to [himself]1030-he , was a trifle cold and conscious , [her]193-mary garland purity prudish , perhaps , [her]193-mary garland culture pedantic . But since [he]1030-he was obliged to give up hopes of [Mary Garland]193-mary garland , [Providence]222-providence owed [him]1030-he a compensation , and [he]1030-he had fits of angry sadness in which it seemed to [him]1030-he that to attest [his]1030-he right to sentimental satisfaction [he]1030-he would be capable of falling in love with [a woman [he]1030-he absolutely detested , if [she]193-mary garland were the best that came in [his]1030-he way]1041-a woman he absolutely detested , if she were the best that came in his way . And what was the use , after all , of bothering about a possible which was only , perhaps , a dream ? Even if [Mary Garland]193-mary garland had been free , what right had [he]1030-he to assume that [he]1030-he would have pleased [her]193-mary garland ? The actual was good enough . [Miss Blanchard]216-miss blanchard had beautiful hair , and if [she]216-miss blanchard was a trifle old - maidish , there is nothing like matrimony for curing old - maidishness .

[Madame Grandoni]217-madame grandoni , who had formed with [the companion of [Rowland]281-rowland 's]1042-the companion of rowland 's rides an alliance which might have been called defensive on the part of [the former and attractive on that of]1043-the former and attractive on that of [Miss Blanchard]216-miss blanchard , was [an excessively ugly old lady , highly esteemed in Roman society]1044-an excessively ugly old lady , highly esteemed in roman society for [her]217-madame grandoni homely benevolence and [her]217-madame grandoni shrewd and humorous good sense . [She]217-madame grandoni had been [the widow of [a German archaeologist]1046-a german archaeologist , who had come to [Rome]4-rome in the early ages as an attache of [the Prussian legation on [the Capitoline]66-the capitoline]1047-the prussian legation on the capitoline]1045-the widow of a german archaeologist , who had come to rome in the early ages as an attache of the prussian legation on the capitoline . [Her]217-madame grandoni good sense had been wanting on but a single occasion , that of [her]217-madame grandoni second marriage . This occasion was certainly a momentous one , but these , by common consent , are not test cases . A couple of years after [[her]217-madame grandoni first husband]1048-her first husband 's death , [she]217-madame grandoni had accepted the hand and the name of [a Neapolitan music - master]1049-a neapolitan music - master , ten years younger than [herself]217-madame grandoni , and with no fortune but [his]1049-a neapolitan music - master fiddle - bow . The marriage was most unhappy , and [the Maestro Grandoni]223-the maestro grandoni was suspected of using the fiddle - bow as an instrument of conjugal correction . [He]223-the maestro grandoni had finally run off with [a prima donna assoluta]1050-a prima donna assoluta , who , it was to be hoped , had given [him]223-the maestro grandoni a taste of the quality implied in [her]1050-a prima donna assoluta title . [He]223-the maestro grandoni was believed to be living still , but [he]223-the maestro grandoni had shrunk to a small black spot in [Madame Grandoni]217-madame grandoni 's life , and for ten years [she]1050-a prima donna assoluta had not mentioned [his]223-the maestro grandoni name . [She]1050-a prima donna assoluta wore a light flaxen wig , which was never very artfully adjusted , but this mattered little , as [she]1050-a prima donna assoluta made no secret of it . [She]1050-a prima donna assoluta used to say , " [I]1050-a prima donna assoluta was not always so ugly as this ; as [a young girl]596-a young girl [I]1050-a prima donna assoluta had beautiful golden hair , very much the color of [my]1050-a prima donna assoluta wig . "[1050-a prima donna assoluta] [She]1050-a prima donna assoluta had worn from time immemorial an old blue satin dress , and a white crape shawl embroidered in colors ; [her]1050-a prima donna assoluta appearance was ridiculous , but [she]1050-a prima donna assoluta had an interminable Teutonic pedigree , and [her]1050-a prima donna assoluta manners , in every presence , were easy and jovial , as became [a lady whose ancestor]1051-a lady whose ancestor had been [cup - bearer to [Frederick Barbarossa]224-frederick barbarossa]1052-cup - bearer to frederick barbarossa . Thirty years ' observation of [Roman society]1053-roman society had sharpened [her]1050-a prima donna assoluta wits and given [her]1050-a prima donna assoluta an inexhaustible store of anecdotes , but [she]1050-a prima donna assoluta had beneath [her]1050-a prima donna assoluta crumpled bodice a deep - welling fund of Teutonic sentiment , which [she]1050-a prima donna assoluta communicated only to the objects of [her]1050-a prima donna assoluta particular favor . [Rowland]281-rowland had a great regard for [her]1050-a prima donna assoluta , and [she]1050-a prima donna assoluta repaid it by wishing [him]1054-him to get married . [She]1050-a prima donna assoluta never saw [him]1054-him without whispering to [him]1054-him that [Augusta Blanchard]219-augusta blanchard was just [the girl]3228-the girl .

It seemed to [Rowland]281-rowland a sort of foreshadowing of matrimony to see [Miss Blanchard]216-miss blanchard standing gracefully on [his]1054-him hearth - rug and blooming behind the central bouquet at [his]1054-him circular dinner - table . The dinner was very prosperous and [Roderick]186-roderick amply filled [his]186-roderick position as [hero of the feast]1056-hero of the feast . [He]186-roderick had always an air of buoyant enjoyment in [his]186-roderick work , but on this occasion [he]186-roderick manifested a good deal of harmless pleasure in [his]186-roderick glory . [He]186-roderick drank freely and talked bravely ; [he]186-roderick leaned back in [his]186-roderick chair with [his]186-roderick hands in [his]186-roderick pockets , and flung open the gates of [his]186-roderick eloquence . [Singleton]214-singleton sat gazing and listening open - mouthed , as if [Apollo]225-apollo in [person]1057-person were talking . [Gloriani]213-gloriani showed a twinkle in [his]1058-his eye and an evident disposition to draw [Roderick]186-roderick out . [Rowland]281-rowland was rather regretful , for [he]1058-his knew that theory was not [[his]1058-his friend]606-his friend 's strong point , and that it was never fair to take [his]1058-his measure from [his]1058-his talk .

" As [you]186-roderick have begun with [Adam]211-the adam and [Eve]226-eve , "[213-gloriani] said [Gloriani]213-gloriani , " [I]213-gloriani suppose [you]186-roderick are going straight through the Bible . " Very likely , "[186-roderick] said [Roderick]186-roderick . " But it is not the sort of expression [I]186-roderick care for . [I]186-roderick care only for perfect beauty . There it is , if [you]3519-you want to know it ! That 's as good a profession of faith as another . In future , so far as [my]186-roderick things are not positively beautiful , [you]3519-you may set them down as failures . For [me]186-roderick , it 's either that or nothing . It 's against the taste of the day , [I]186-roderick know ; [we]3525-we have really lost the faculty to understand beauty in the large , ideal way . [We]3525-we stand like a race with shrunken muscles , staring helplessly at the weights [[our]3525-we forefathers]3526-our forefathers easily lifted . [I]186-roderick mean to go in for big things ; that 's [my]186-roderick notion of [my]186-roderick art . [I]186-roderick mean to do things that will be simple and vast and infinite . Excuse [me]186-roderick if [I]186-roderick brag a little ; [all those Italian fellows in the Renaissance]3528-all those italian fellows in the renaissance used to brag . There was a sensation once common , [I]186-roderick am sure , in the human breast - a kind of religious awe in the presence of a marble image newly created and expressing the human type in superhuman purity .
