" [The poodle]3860-the poodle , please ! "[659-the young girl] cried [the young girl]659-the young girl .

[Rowland]281-rowland glanced at [the Cavaliere]1279-the cavaliere ; [he]1279-the cavaliere was smiling more blandly than ever .

A few days later [Rowland]281-rowland presented [himself]281-rowland , as civility demanded , at [Mrs. Light]253-mrs. light 's door . [He]1279-the cavaliere found [her]253-mrs. light living in [one of [the stately houses of [the Via dell ' Angelo Custode]1329-the via dell ' angelo custode]1328-the stately houses of the via dell ' angelo custode]1327-one of the stately houses of the via dell ' angelo custode , and , rather to [his]1279-the cavaliere surprise , was told [she]253-mrs. light was at [home]349-home . [He]1279-the cavaliere passed through half [a dozen rooms]1331-a dozen rooms and was ushered into [an immense saloon]1332-an immense saloon , at one end of which sat [the mistress of [the establishment]1334-the establishment]1333-the mistress of the establishment , with a piece of embroidery . [She]253-mrs. light received [him]1279-the cavaliere very graciously , and then , pointing mysteriously to a large screen which was unfolded across the embrasure of one of the deep windows , " [I]253-mrs. light am keeping guard ! "[253-mrs. light] [she]253-mrs. light said . [Rowland]281-rowland looked interrogative ; whereupon [she]253-mrs. light beckoned [him]1279-the cavaliere forward and motioned [him]1279-the cavaliere to look behind the screen . [He]1279-the cavaliere obeyed , and for some moments stood gazing . [Roderick]186-roderick , with [his]186-roderick back turned , stood before an extemporized pedestal , ardently shaping a formless mass of clay . Before [him]1279-the cavaliere sat [Christina Light]192-christina , in a white dress , with [her]192-christina shoulders bare , [her]192-christina magnificent hair twisted into a classic coil , and [her]192-christina head admirably poised . Meeting [Rowland]281-rowland 's gaze , [she]192-christina smiled a little , only with [her]192-christina deep gray eyes , without moving . [She]192-christina looked divinely beautiful .

[CHAPTER V. Christina]264-chapter v. christina

The brilliant Roman winter came round again , and [Rowland]281-rowland enjoyed it , in a certain way , more deeply than before . [He]1279-the cavaliere grew at last to feel that sense of equal possession , of intellectual nearness , which it belongs to the peculiar magic of [the ancient city]1335-the ancient city to infuse into minds of a cast that [she]253-mrs. light never would have produced . [He]1279-the cavaliere became passionately , unreasoningly fond of all Roman sights and sensations , and to breathe the Roman atmosphere began to seem a needful condition of being . [He]1279-the cavaliere could not have defined and explained the nature of [his]1279-the cavaliere great love , nor have made up the sum of it by the addition of [his]1279-the cavaliere calculable pleasures . It was a large , vague , idle , half - profitless emotion , of which perhaps the most pertinent thing that may be said is that it enforced a sort of oppressive reconciliation to the present , the actual , the sensuous - to life on the terms that there offered [themselves]1336-themselves . It was perhaps for this very reason that , in spite of the charm which [Rome]4-rome flings over [one]3107-one 's mood , there ran through [Rowland]281-rowland 's meditations an undertone of melancholy , natural enough in a mind which finds its horizon insidiously limited to the finite , even in very picturesque forms . Whether it is one that tacitly concedes to the Roman Church the monopoly of a guarantee of immortality , so that if [one]3107-one is indisposed to bargain with [her]253-mrs. light for the precious gift , [one]3107-one must do without it altogether ; or whether in an atmosphere so heavily weighted with echoes and memories one grows to believe that there is nothing in [one]3107-one 's consciousness that is not foredoomed to moulder and crumble and become dust for the feet , and possible malaria for the lungs , of future generations - the fact at least remains that one parts half - willingly with one 's hopes in [Rome]4-rome , and misses them only under some very exceptional stress of circumstance . For this reason one may perhaps say that there is no other place in which one 's daily temper has such a mellow serenity , and none , at the same time , in which acute attacks of depression are more intolerable . [Rowland]281-rowland found , in fact , a perfect response to [his]1279-the cavaliere prevision that to live in [Rome]4-rome was an education to [one]3107-one 's senses and [one]3107-one 's imagination , but [he]1279-the cavaliere sometimes wondered whether this was not a questionable gain in case of [one]3107-one 's not being prepared to live wholly by [one]3107-one 's imagination and [one]3107-one 's senses . The tranquil profundity of [his]1279-the cavaliere daily satisfaction seemed sometimes to turn , by a mysterious inward impulse , and face itself with questioning , admonishing , threatening eyes . " But afterwards ... ? "[1279-the cavaliere] it seemed to ask , with a long reverberation ; and [he]1279-the cavaliere could give no answer but a shy affirmation that there was no such thing as afterwards , and a hope , divided against [itself]1346-itself , that [his]1279-the cavaliere actual way of life would last forever . [He]1279-the cavaliere often felt heavy - hearted ; [he]1279-the cavaliere was sombre without knowing why ; there were no visible clouds in [his]1279-the cavaliere heaven , but there were cloud - shadows on [his]1279-the cavaliere mood . Shadows projected , they often were , without [his]1279-the cavaliere knowing it , by an undue apprehension that things after all might not go so ideally well with [Roderick]186-roderick . When [he]1279-the cavaliere understood [his]1279-the cavaliere anxiety it vexed [him]1279-the cavaliere , and [he]1279-the cavaliere rebuked [himself]1279-the cavaliere for taking things unmanfully hard . If [Roderick]186-roderick chose to follow a crooked path , it was no fault of [his]186-roderick ; [he]186-roderick had given [him]186-roderick , [he]186-roderick would continue to give [him]186-roderick , all that [he]186-roderick had offered [him]186-roderick - friendship , sympathy , advice . [He]186-roderick had not undertaken to provide [him]186-roderick with unflagging strength of purpose , nor to stand [bondsman]1347-bondsman for unqualified success .

If [Rowland]281-rowland felt [his]1279-the cavaliere roots striking and spreading in [the Roman soil]1348-the roman soil , [Roderick]186-roderick also surrendered [himself]186-roderick with renewed abandon to the local influence . More than once [he]186-roderick declared to [[his]186-roderick companion]555-his companion that [he]186-roderick meant to live and die within the shadow of [Saint Peter]265-saint peter 's , and that [he]186-roderick cared little if [he]186-roderick never again drew breath in American air . " For [a man of [my]186-roderick temperament]3861-a man of my temperament , [Rome]4-rome is the only possible place , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick said ; " it 's better to recognize the fact early than late . So [I]186-roderick shall never go [home]349-home unless [I]186-roderick am absolutely forced . "[186-roderick]

" What is [your]186-roderick idea of ' force ' ? "[281-rowland] asked [Rowland]281-rowland , smiling . " It seems to [me]281-rowland [you]186-roderick have an excellent reason for going [home]349-home some day or other . "[281-rowland]

" Ah , [you]186-roderick mean [my]186-roderick engagement ? "[186-roderick] [Roderick]186-roderick answered with unaverted eyes . " Yes , [I]186-roderick am distinctly engaged , in [Northampton]2-northampton , and impatiently waited for ! "[186-roderick] And [he]186-roderick gave a little sympathetic sigh . " To reconcile [Northampton]2-northampton and [Rome]4-rome is rather a problem . [Mary]193-mary garland had better come out here . Even at the worst [I]186-roderick have no intention of giving up [Rome]4-rome within six or eight years , and an engagement of that duration would be rather absurd . "[186-roderick]

" [Miss Garland]182-miss garland could hardly leave [[your]186-roderick mother]3145-your mother , "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland observed .

" Oh , of course [[my]186-roderick mother]3224-my mother should come . [I]186-roderick think [I]186-roderick will suggest it in [my]186-roderick next letter . It will take [her]3224-my mother a year or two to make up [her]3224-my mother mind to it , but if [she]3224-my mother consents it will brighten [her]3224-my mother up . It 's too small a life , over there , even for [a timid old lady]3866-a timid old lady . It is hard to imagine , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick added , " any change in [Mary]193-mary garland being a change for the better ; but [I]186-roderick should like [her]3224-my mother to take a look at [the world]483-the world and have [her]3224-my mother notions stretched a little . One is never so good , [I]186-roderick suppose , but that one can improve a little . "[186-roderick]

" If [you]186-roderick wish [[your]186-roderick mother]3145-your mother and [Miss Garland]182-miss garland to come , "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland suggested , " [you]186-roderick had better go [home]349-home and bring [them]3870-them . "[281-rowland]

" Oh , [I]186-roderick ca n't think of leaving [Europe]1-europe , for many a day , "[186-roderick] [Roderick]186-roderick answered . " At present it would quite break the charm . [I]186-roderick am just beginning to profit , to get used to things and take them naturally . [I]186-roderick am sure the sight of [Northampton Main Street]95-northampton main street would permanently upset [me]186-roderick . "[186-roderick]

It was reassuring to hear that [Roderick]186-roderick , in [his]186-roderick own view , was but " just beginning "[186-roderick] to spread [his]186-roderick wings , and [Rowland]281-rowland , if [he]186-roderick had had any forebodings , might have suffered them to be modified by this declaration . This was the first time since [their]1350-their meeting at [Geneva]82-geneva that [Roderick]186-roderick had mentioned [Miss Garland]182-miss garland 's name , but the ice being broken , [he]186-roderick indulged for some time afterward in frequent allusions to [[his]186-roderick betrothed]1351-his betrothed , which always had an accent of scrupulous , of almost studied , consideration . [An uninitiated observer]1352-an uninitiated observer , hearing [him]186-roderick , would have imagined [her]182-miss garland to be [a person of a certain age]1353-a person of a certain age - possibly [an affectionate maiden aunt]1354-an affectionate maiden aunt - who had once done [him]186-roderick a kindness which [he]186-roderick highly appreciated : perhaps presented [him]186-roderick with a check for a thousand dollars . [Rowland]281-rowland noted the difference between [his]186-roderick present frankness and [his]186-roderick reticence during the first six months of [his]186-roderick engagement , and sometimes wondered whether it was not rather an anomaly that [he]186-roderick should expatiate more largely as the happy event receded . [He]186-roderick had wondered over the whole matter , first and last , in a great many different ways , and looked at it in all possible lights . There was something terribly hard to explain in the fact of [his]186-roderick having fallen in love with [[his]186-roderick cousin]343-his cousin . [She]182-miss garland was not , as [Rowland]281-rowland conceived [her]182-miss garland , [the sort of girl [he]186-roderick would have been likely to fancy]1356-the sort of girl he would have been likely to fancy , and the operation of sentiment , in all cases so mysterious , was particularly so in this one . Just why it was that [Roderick]186-roderick should not logically have fancied [Miss Garland]182-miss garland , [[his]186-roderick companion]555-his companion would have been at loss to say , but [I]0-i think the conviction had its roots in an unformulated comparison between [himself]186-roderick and [the accepted suitor]1358-the accepted suitor . [Roderick]186-roderick and [he]186-roderick were as different as [two men]1359-two men could be , and yet [Roderick]186-roderick had taken it into [his]186-roderick head to fall in love with [a woman for whom [he]186-roderick [himself]186-roderick had been keeping in reserve , for years , a profoundly characteristic passion . That if [he]186-roderick chose to conceive a great notion of the merits of [[Roderick]186-roderick 's mistress]1361-roderick 's mistress]1360-a woman for whom he himself had been keeping in reserve , for years , a profoundly characteristic passion . that if he chose to conceive a great notion of the merits of roderick 's mistress , the irregularity here was hardly [Roderick]186-roderick 's , was a view of the case to which poor [Rowland]281-rowland did scanty justice . There were [women]3288-women , [he]186-roderick said to [himself]186-roderick , whom it was [every one]3105-every one 's business to fall in love with a little - [women]3288-women beautiful , brilliant , artful , easily fascinating . [Miss Light]254-miss light , for instance , was one of these ; [every man who spoke to [her]254-miss light]1365-every man who spoke to her did so , if not in the language , at least with something of the agitation , the divine tremor , of [a lover]1366-a lover . There were [other women]1367-other women - [they]1367-other women might have great beauty , [they]1367-other women might have small ; perhaps [they]1367-other women were generally to be classified as plain - whose triumphs in this line were rare , but immutably permanent . [Such a one]1368-such a one preeminently , was [Mary Garland]193-mary garland . Upon the doctrine of probabilities , it was unlikely that [she]254-miss light had had an equal charm for each of [them]1369-them , and was it not possible , therefore , that the charm for [Roderick]186-roderick had been simply the charm imagined , unquestioningly accepted : the general charm of youth , sympathy , kindness - of [the present feminine]1370-the present feminine , in short - enhanced indeed by several fine facial traits ? The charm in this case for [Rowland]281-rowland was - the charm ! - [the mysterious , individual , essential woman]1371-the mysterious , individual , essential woman . There was an element in the charm , as [[his]186-roderick companion]555-his companion saw it , which [Rowland]281-rowland was obliged to recognize , but which [he]186-roderick forbore to ponder ; the rather important attraction , namely , of reciprocity . As to [Miss Garland]182-miss garland being in love with [Roderick]186-roderick and becoming charming thereby , this was a point with which [his]186-roderick imagination ventured to take no liberties ; partly because it would have been indelicate , and partly because it would have been vain . [He]186-roderick contented [himself]186-roderick with feeling that [the young girl]659-the young girl was still as vivid an image in [his]186-roderick memory as [she]659-the young girl had been five days after [he]186-roderick left [her]659-the young girl , and with drifting nearer and nearer to the impression that at just that crisis [any other girl]1374-any other girl would have answered [Roderick]186-roderick 's sentimental needs as well . [Any other girl]1374-any other girl indeed would do so still ! [Roderick]186-roderick had confessed as much to [him]186-roderick at [Geneva]82-geneva , in saying that [he]186-roderick had been taking at [Baden]245-baden - baden the measure of [his]186-roderick susceptibility to female beauty .

[His]186-roderick extraordinary success in modeling the bust of [the beautiful Miss Light]254-miss light was pertinent evidence of this amiable quality . [She]254-miss light sat to [him]186-roderick , repeatedly , for a fortnight , and the work was rapidly finished . On one of the last days [Roderick]186-roderick asked [Rowland]281-rowland to come and give [his]186-roderick opinion as to what was still wanting ; for the sittings had continued to take place in [[Mrs. Light]253-mrs. light 's apartment]1376-mrs. light 's apartment , [the studio]3654-the studio being pronounced too damp for the fair model . When [Rowland]281-rowland presented [himself]281-rowland , [Christina]192-christina , still in [her]192-christina white dress , with [her]192-christina shoulders bare , was standing before a mirror , readjusting [her]192-christina hair , the arrangement of which , on this occasion , had apparently not met [the young sculptor]492-the young sculptor 's approval . [He]186-roderick stood beside [her]192-christina , directing the operation with a peremptoriness of tone which seemed to [Rowland]281-rowland to denote a considerable advance in intimacy . As [Rowland]281-rowland entered , [Christina]192-christina was losing patience . " Do it [yourself]281-rowland , then ! "[192-christina] [she]192-christina cried , and with a rapid movement unloosed the great coil of [her]192-christina tresses and let them fall over [her]192-christina shoulders .

They were magnificent , and with [her]192-christina perfect face dividing their rippling flow [she]192-christina looked like [some immaculate saint of legend being led to martyrdom]1379-some immaculate saint of legend being led to martyrdom . [Rowland]281-rowland 's eyes presumably betrayed [his]186-roderick admiration , but [her]192-christina own manifested no consciousness of it . If [Christina]192-christina was a coquette , as the remarkable timeliness of this incident might have suggested , [she]192-christina was not [a superficial one]1380-a superficial one .

" Is it good , after all ? [Mr. Mallet]170-mr. mallet is [a famous connoisseur]3895-a famous connoisseur ; has [he]170-mr. mallet not come here to pronounce ? "[192-christina]

The bust was in fact a very happy performance , and [Roderick]186-roderick had risen to the level of [his]186-roderick subject . It was thoroughly a portrait , and not a vague fantasy executed on a graceful theme , as the busts of [pretty women]1392-pretty women , in modern sculpture , are apt to be . The resemblance was deep and vivid ; there was extreme fidelity of detail and yet a noble simplicity . [One]3107-one could say of the head that , without idealization , it was a representation of ideal beauty . [Rowland]281-rowland , however , as [we]1394-we know , was not fond of exploding into superlatives , and , after examining the piece , contented [himself]281-rowland with suggesting two or three alterations of detail .

[Miss Light]254-miss light 's bust stood for a while on exhibition in [[Roderick]186-roderick 's studio]574-roderick 's studio , and half [the foreign colony]1416-the foreign colony came to see [it]1417-it . With the completion of [his]1279-the cavaliere work , however , [Roderick]186-roderick 's visits at [the Palazzo F]1418-the palazzo f - - by no means came to an end . [He]186-roderick spent half [his]186-roderick time in [[Mrs. Light]253-mrs. light 's drawing - room]1419-mrs. light 's drawing - room , and began to be talked about as " attentive "[192-christina] to [Christina]192-christina . The success of the bust restored [his]186-roderick equanimity , and in the garrulity of [his]186-roderick good - humor [he]186-roderick suffered [Rowland]281-rowland to see that [she]192-christina was just now the object uppermost in [his]186-roderick thoughts . [Rowland]281-rowland , when [they]1420-they talked of [her]192-christina , was rather listener than [speaker]1421-speaker ; partly because [Roderick]186-roderick 's own tone was so resonant and exultant , and partly because , when [[his]186-roderick companion]555-his companion laughed at [him]186-roderick for having called [her]192-christina unsafe , [he]186-roderick was too perplexed to defend [himself]186-roderick . The impression remained that [she]192-christina was unsafe ; that [she]192-christina was [a complex , willful , passionate creature , who might easily engulf a too confiding spirit in the eddies of [her]192-christina capricious temper]1423-a complex , willful , passionate creature , who might easily engulf a too confiding spirit in the eddies of her capricious temper . And yet [he]186-roderick strongly felt [her]192-christina charm ; the eddies had a strange fascination ! [Roderick]186-roderick , in the glow of that renewed admiration provoked by the fixed attention of portrayal , was never weary of descanting on the extraordinary perfection of [her]192-christina beauty .

" [I]186-roderick had no idea of it , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick said , " till [I]186-roderick began to look at [her]192-christina with an eye to reproducing line for line and curve for curve . [Her]192-christina face is the most exquisite piece of modeling that ever came from creative hands . Not a line without meaning , not a hair 's breadth that is not admirably finished . And then [her]192-christina mouth ! It 's as if a pair of lips had been shaped to utter pure truth without doing it dishonor ! "[186-roderick] Later , after [he]186-roderick had been working for a week , [he]186-roderick declared if [Miss Light]254-miss light were inordinately plain , [she]192-christina would still be the most fascinating of [women]3288-women . " [I]186-roderick ' ve quite forgotten [her]192-christina beauty , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick said , " or rather [I]186-roderick have ceased to perceive it as something distinct and defined , something independent of the rest of [her]192-christina . [She]192-christina is all one , and all consummately interesting ! "[186-roderick]

" What does [she]192-christina do - what does [she]192-christina say , that is so remarkable ? "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland had asked .

" Say ? Sometimes nothing - sometimes everything . [She]192-christina is never the same . Sometimes [she]192-christina walks in and takes [her]192-christina place without a word , without a smile , gravely , stiffly , as if it were an awful bore . [She]192-christina hardly looks at [me]186-roderick , and [she]192-christina walks away without even glancing at [my]186-roderick work . On other days [she]192-christina laughs and chatters and asks endless questions , and pours out the most irresistible nonsense . [She]192-christina is [a creature of moods]3911-a creature of moods ; [you]3912-you ca n't count upon [her]192-christina ; [she]192-christina keeps observation on the stretch . And then , bless [you]3912-you , [she]192-christina has seen such a lot ! [Her]192-christina talk is full of the oddest allusions ! "[186-roderick]

" It is altogether [a very singular type of young lady]3913-a very singular type of young lady , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland , after the visit which [I]0-i have related at length . " It may be a charm , but it is certainly not the orthodox charm of [marriageable maidenhood]3914-marriageable maidenhood , the charm of shrinking innocence and soft docility . [[Our]3915-our American girls]3916-our american girls are accused of being more knowing than [any others]3917-any others , and [Miss Light]254-miss light is nominally [an American]3497-an american . But it has taken twenty years of [Europe]1-europe to make [her]254-miss light what [she]254-miss light is . The first time [we]3915-our saw [her]254-miss light , [I]281-rowland remember [you]281-rowland called [her]254-miss light [a product of [the old world]792-the old world]3919-a product of the old world , and certainly [you]281-rowland were not far wrong . "[281-rowland]

" Ah , [she]254-miss light has an atmosphere , "[186-roderick] said [Roderick]186-roderick , in the tone of high appreciation .

" [Young unmarried women]3921-young unmarried women , "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland answered , ' should be careful not to have too much ! "[281-rowland]

" Ah , [you]281-rowland do n't forgive [her]254-miss light , "[555-his companion] cried [[his]186-roderick companion]555-his companion , " for hitting [you]281-rowland so hard ! " [A man]3214-a man is never flattered at [a woman]3607-a woman 's not liking [him]3214-a man . "[281-rowland]

" Are [you]281-rowland sure [she]254-miss light does n't like [you]281-rowland ? That 's to the credit of [your]281-rowland humility . "[555-his companion]

" [He]3926-a fellow of more vanity would have also , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland , laughing , " to be [a fellow of remarkable ingenuity]3927-a fellow of remarkable ingenuity ! "[281-rowland] [He]186-roderick asked [himself]186-roderick privately how [the deuce Roderick]186-roderick reconciled it to [his]186-roderick conscience to think so much more of [the girl [he]186-roderick was not engaged to than of [the girl [he]186-roderick was]1427-the girl he was]1426-the girl he was not engaged to than of the girl he was . But it amounted almost to arrogance , [you]1428-you may say , in poor Rowland to pretend to know how often [Roderick]186-roderick thought of [Miss Garland]182-miss garland . [He]186-roderick wondered gloomily , at any rate , whether for [men of [[his]186-roderick companion]555-his companion 's large , easy power]1429-men of his companion 's large , easy power , there was not a larger moral law than for narrow mediocrities like [himself]186-roderick , who , yielding Nature a meagre interest on [her]182-miss garland investment such as it was , had no reason to expect from [her]182-miss garland this affectionate laxity as to [their]1431-their accounts . Was it not a part of the eternal fitness of things that [Roderick]186-roderick , while rhapsodizing about [Miss Light]254-miss light , should have it at [his]186-roderick command to look at [you]1428-you with eyes of the most guileless and unclouded blue , and to shake off [your]1428-you musty imputations by a toss of [his]186-roderick picturesque brown locks ? Or had [he]186-roderick , in fact , no conscience to speak of ? [Happy fellow]1432-happy fellow , either way !

[[Our]1433-our friend]474-our friend [Gloriani]213-gloriani came , among others , to congratulate [Roderick]186-roderick on [his]186-roderick model and what [he]186-roderick had made of [her]254-miss light . " Devilish pretty , through and through ! "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick said as [he]186-roderick looked at the bust . " Capital handling of the neck and throat ; lovely work on the nose . [You]186-roderick 're [a detestably lucky fellow]3928-a detestably lucky fellow , [[my]186-roderick boy]3929-my boy ! But [you]186-roderick ought not to have squandered such material on a simple bust ; [you]186-roderick should have made [a great imaginative figure]3930-a great imaginative figure . If [I]186-roderick could only have got hold of [her]254-miss light , [I]186-roderick would have put [her]254-miss light into a statue in spite of [herself]254-miss light . What a pity [she]254-miss light is not a ragged Trasteverine , whom [we]3931-we might have for a franc an hour ! [I]186-roderick have been carrying about in [my]186-roderick head for years a delicious design for a fantastic figure , but it has always stayed there for want of [a tolerable model]3932-a tolerable model . " What is [your]213-gloriani subject ? "[186-roderick] asked [Roderick]186-roderick .

If [Roderick]186-roderick had taken it ill which was unlikely , for [we]1435-we know [he]186-roderick thought [Gloriani]213-gloriani an ass , and expected little of [his]186-roderick wisdom , [he]186-roderick might have been soothed by the candid incense of [Sam Singleton]214-singleton , who came and sat for an hour in a sort of mental prostration before both bust and [artist]1436-artist . " Oh , [I]214-singleton do n't envy [Hudson]3562-the poor fellow anything [he]3562-the poor fellow possesses , "[214-singleton] [Singleton]214-singleton said , " because to take anything away would spoil [his]3562-the poor fellow beautiful completeness . ' Complete , ' that 's what [he]3562-the poor fellow is ; while [we]1435-we little clevernesses are like half - ripened plums , only good eating on the side that has had a glimpse of the sun . Nature has made [him]3562-the poor fellow so , and fortune confesses to it ! [He]3562-the poor fellow is [the handsomest fellow in [Rome]4-rome]3936-the handsomest fellow in rome , [he]3562-the poor fellow has the most genius , and , as a matter of course , [the most beautiful girl in [the world]483-the world]3937-the most beautiful girl in the world comes and offers to be [[his]3562-the poor fellow model]3939-his model . One morning , going into [[Roderick]186-roderick 's studio]574-roderick 's studio , [Rowland]281-rowland found [the young sculptor]492-the young sculptor entertaining [Miss Blanchard]216-miss blanchard - if this is not too flattering a description of [his]492-the young sculptor gracefully passive tolerance of [her]216-miss blanchard presence . [He]492-the young sculptor had once quoted [Tennyson]268-tennyson against [her]216-miss blanchard : -

" And is there any moral shut Within the bosom of the rose ? "[492-the young sculptor]

" In all [Miss Blanchard]216-miss blanchard 's roses [you]216-miss blanchard may be sure there is a moral , "[492-the young sculptor] [he]492-the young sculptor had said . " [You]216-miss blanchard can see it sticking out its head , and , if [you]216-miss blanchard go to smell the flower , it scratches [your]216-miss blanchard nose . "[492-the young sculptor] But on this occasion [she]216-miss blanchard had come with a propitiatory gift - introducing [[her]216-miss blanchard friend]518-her friend [Mr. Leavenworth]269-mr. leavenworth . [Mr. Leavenworth]269-mr. leavenworth was [a tall , expansive , bland gentleman]1443-a tall , expansive , bland gentleman , with a carefully brushed whisker and a spacious , fair , well - favored face , which seemed , somehow , to have more room in it than was occupied by a smile of superior benevolence , so that with [his]269-mr. leavenworth smooth , white forehead it bore a certain resemblance to [a large parlor]1444-a large parlor with a very florid carpet , but no pictures on the walls . [He]269-mr. leavenworth held [his]269-mr. leavenworth head high , talked sonorously , and told [Roderick]186-roderick , within five minutes , that [he]269-mr. leavenworth was [a widower]1445-a widower , traveling to distract [his]269-mr. leavenworth mind , and that [he]269-mr. leavenworth had lately retired from [the proprietorship of [large mines of borax in [Pennsylvania]97-pennsylvania]1447-large mines of borax in pennsylvania]1446-the proprietorship of large mines of borax in pennsylvania . [Roderick]186-roderick supposed at first that , in [his]269-mr. leavenworth character of [depressed widower]1448-depressed widower , [he]269-mr. leavenworth had come to order a tombstone ; but observing then the extreme blandness of [his]269-mr. leavenworth address to [Miss Blanchard]216-miss blanchard , [he]186-roderick credited [him]269-mr. leavenworth with a judicious prevision that by the time the tombstone was completed , a monument of [his]269-mr. leavenworth inconsolability might have become an anachronism . But [Mr. Leavenworth]269-mr. leavenworth was disposed to order something .

" [You]186-roderick will find [me]269-mr. leavenworth eager to patronize [our]3940-our indigenous talent , "[269-mr. leavenworth] [he]269-mr. leavenworth said . " [I]269-mr. leavenworth am putting up [a little shanty in [[my]269-mr. leavenworth native town]3942-my native town]3941-a little shanty in my native town , and [I]269-mr. leavenworth propose to make a rather nice thing of it . It has been the will of [Heaven]244-heaven to plunge [me]269-mr. leavenworth into mourning ; but art has consolations ! In [a tasteful home]3943-a tasteful home , surrounded by the memorials of [my]269-mr. leavenworth wanderings , [I]269-mr. leavenworth hope to take more cheerful views . [I]269-mr. leavenworth ordered in [Paris]9-paris the complete appurtenances of [a dining - room]3944-a dining - room . The subject [I]0-i have already fixed upon . [I]0-i desire an allegorical representation of Culture . Do [you]186-roderick think , now , " asked [Mr. Leavenworth]269-mr. leavenworth , encouragingly , "[186-roderick] [you]186-roderick could rise to the conception ? "[186-roderick]

" A most interesting subject for a truly serious mind , "[216-miss blanchard] remarked [Miss Blanchard]216-miss blanchard .

[Roderick]186-roderick looked at [her]216-miss blanchard a moment , and then - " The simplest thing [I]186-roderick could do , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick said , " would be to make a full - length portrait of [Miss Blanchard]216-miss blanchard . [Miss Blanchard]216-miss blanchard colored ; the compliment might be ironical ; and there was ever afterwards a reflection of [her]216-miss blanchard uncertainty in [her]216-miss blanchard opinion of [Roderick]186-roderick 's genius . "[269-mr. leavenworth]

[Mrs. Light]253-mrs. light , meanwhile , had fairly established [herself]253-mrs. light in Roman society . " [Heaven]244-heaven knows how ! " Oh , [I]217-madame grandoni know it well ; [I]217-madame grandoni had occasion to say so to [myself]217-madame grandoni the other day . [She]216-miss blanchard cried , [herself]216-miss blanchard , profusely , and as naturally as possible . [She]216-miss blanchard said , in so many words , that [[her]216-miss blanchard mother]369-her mother was [an immoral woman]3963-an immoral woman . [Heaven]244-heaven knows what [she]216-miss blanchard meant . [She]216-miss blanchard said the life [they]3961-young men led was horrible ; that it was monstrous [a poor girl]3964-a poor girl should be dragged about [the world]483-the world to be sold to [the highest bidder]3966-the highest bidder . [She]216-miss blanchard was meant for better things ; [she]216-miss blanchard could be perfectly happy in poverty . It was not money [she]216-miss blanchard wanted . [I]217-madame grandoni might not believe [her]216-miss blanchard , but [she]216-miss blanchard really cared for serious things . Sometimes [she]216-miss blanchard thought of taking poison ! "[217-madame grandoni]

" What did [you]217-madame grandoni say to that ? "[281-rowland]

" [I]217-madame grandoni recommended [her]216-miss blanchard , "[217-madame grandoni] said [Madame Grandoni]217-madame grandoni , " to come and see [me]217-madame grandoni instead . [I]217-madame grandoni would help [her]216-miss blanchard about as much , and [I]217-madame grandoni was , on the whole , less unpleasant . About once in two months [I]217-madame grandoni expect [her]216-miss blanchard to reappear , on the same errand , and meanwhile to quite forget [my]217-madame grandoni existence . [I]217-madame grandoni believe [I]217-madame grandoni melted down to the point of telling [her]216-miss blanchard that [I]217-madame grandoni would find [some good , quiet , affectionate husband]3967-some good , quiet , affectionate husband for [her]216-miss blanchard ; but [she]216-miss blanchard declared , almost with fury , that [she]216-miss blanchard was sick unto death of [husbands]3968-husbands , and begged [I]217-madame grandoni would never again mention the word . And , in fact , it was a rash offer ; for [I]217-madame grandoni am sure that there is not [a man of the kind that might really make [a woman]3607-a woman happy but would be afraid to marry [mademoiselle]206-mademoiselle]3969-a man of the kind that might really make a woman happy but would be afraid to marry mademoiselle . Looked at in that way [she]216-miss blanchard is certainly very much to be pitied , and indeed , altogether , though [I]217-madame grandoni do n't think [she]216-miss blanchard either means all [she]216-miss blanchard says or , by a great deal , says all that [she]216-miss blanchard means . [I]217-madame grandoni feel very sorry for [her]216-miss blanchard . "[217-madame grandoni]

[Rowland]281-rowland met [the two ladies]656-the two ladies , about this time , at several entertainments , and looked at [Christina]192-christina with a kind of distant attendrissement . [He]1456-he imagined more than once that there had been a passionate scene between [them]656-the two ladies about coming out , and wondered what [arguments Mrs. Light]253-mrs. light had found effective . But [Christina]192-christina 's face told no tales , and [she]192-christina moved about , beautiful and silent , looking absently over [people]3189-people 's heads , barely heeding [the men who pressed about [her]192-christina]1458-the men who pressed about her , and suggesting somehow that the soul of [a world - wearied mortal]1459-a world - wearied mortal had found its way into the blooming body of [a goddess]3741-a goddess . " Where in [the world]483-the world has [Miss Light]254-miss light been before [she]192-christina is twenty , "[1461-observers] [observers]1461-observers asked , " to have left all [her]192-christina illusions behind ? "[1461-observers] And the general verdict was , that though [she]192-christina was incomparably beautiful , [she]192-christina was intolerably proud . [Young ladies to whom the former distinction was not conceded]1462-young ladies to whom the former distinction was not conceded were free to reflect that [she]192-christina was " not at all liked . "[192-christina]

It would have been difficult to guess , however , how [they]656-the two ladies reconciled this conviction with a variety of conflicting evidence , and , in especial , with the spectacle of [Roderick]186-roderick 's inveterate devotion . All [Rome]4-rome might behold that [he]186-roderick , at least , " liked "[186-roderick] [Christina Light]192-christina . Wherever [she]192-christina appeared [he]186-roderick was either awaiting [her]192-christina or immediately followed [her]192-christina . [He]186-roderick was perpetually at [her]192-christina side , trying , apparently , to preserve the thread of a disconnected talk , the fate of which was , to judge by [her]192-christina face , profoundly immaterial to [the young lady]716-the young lady . [People in general]1202-people in general smiled at the radiant good faith of [the handsome young sculptor]1465-the handsome young sculptor , and asked [each other]645-each other whether [he]186-roderick really supposed that beauties of that quality were meant to [we]1467-we d with [poor artists]1468-poor artists . But although [Christina]192-christina 's deportment , as [I]0-i have said , was one of superb inexpressiveness , [Rowland]281-rowland had derived from [Roderick]186-roderick no suspicion that [he]186-roderick suffered from snubbing , and [he]186-roderick was therefore surprised at an incident which befell one evening at a large musical party . [Roderick]186-roderick , as usual , was in [the field]1288-the field , and , on [the ladies]3241-the ladies taking the chairs which had been arranged for [them]3241-the ladies , [he]186-roderick immediately placed [himself]186-roderick beside [Christina]192-christina . As [most of [the gentlemen]1472-the gentlemen]1471-most of the gentlemen were standing , [his]186-roderick position made [him]186-roderick as conspicuous as [Hamlet]271-hamlet at [Ophelia]272-ophelia 's feet , at the play . [Rowland]281-rowland was leaning , somewhat apart , against the chimney - piece . There was a long , solemn pause before the music began , and in the midst of it [Christina]192-christina rose , left [her]192-christina place , came the whole length of [the immense room]1473-the immense room , with [every one]3105-every one looking at [her]192-christina , and stopped before [him]186-roderick . [She]192-christina was neither pale nor flushed ; [she]192-christina had a soft smile .

" Will [you]186-roderick do [me]192-christina a favor ? "[192-christina] [she]192-christina asked .

" A thousand ! "[192-christina]

" Not now , but at [your]186-roderick earliest convenience . Please remind [Mr. Hudson]172-mr. hudson that [he]172-mr. hudson is not in [a New England village]495-a new england village - that it is not the custom in [Rome]4-rome to address [one]3107-one 's conversation exclusively , night after night , to [the same poor girl]3974-the same poor girl , and that "[192-christina] ....

The music broke out with a great blare and covered [her]192-christina voice . [She]192-christina made a gesture of impatience , and [Rowland]281-rowland offered [her]192-christina [his]186-roderick arm and led [her]192-christina back to [her]192-christina seat .

The next day [he]186-roderick repeated [her]192-christina words to [Roderick]186-roderick , who burst into joyous laughter . " [She]192-christina 's [a delightfully strange girl]3975-a delightfully strange girl ! "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick cried . " [She]192-christina must do everything that comes into [her]192-christina head ! "[186-roderick]

" Had [she]192-christina never asked [you]281-rowland before not to talk to [her]192-christina so much ? "[192-christina]

" On the contrary , [she]192-christina has often said to [me]186-roderick , ' Mind [you]281-rowland now , [I]186-roderick forbid [you]281-rowland to leave [me]186-roderick . Here comes that tiresome So - and - so . ' [She]192-christina cares as little about the custom as [I]186-roderick do . What could be a better proof than [her]192-christina walking up to [you]281-rowland , with [five hundred people]3976-five hundred people looking at [her]192-christina ? " Why , then , should [she]192-christina take such a step ? "[192-christina]

" Because , as [she]192-christina sat there , it came into [her]192-christina head . That 's reason enough for [her]192-christina . "[186-roderick]

[Madame Grandoni]217-madame grandoni had foretold the truth ; [Mrs. Light]253-mrs. light , a couple of weeks later , convoked [all Roman society]1475-all roman society to a brilliant ball . [Rowland]281-rowland went late , and found the staircase so encumbered with flower - pots and [servants]439-servants that [he]1477-he was a long time making [his]1477-he way into the presence of [the hostess]1478-the hostess . At last [he]1477-he approached [her]1478-the hostess , as [she]1478-the hostess stood making courtesies at the door , with [[her]253-mrs. light daughter]491-her daughter by [her]253-mrs. light side . Some of [Mrs. Light]253-mrs. light 's courtesies were very low , for [she]1478-the hostess had the happiness of receiving [a number of [the social potentates of [the Roman world]1482-the roman world]1481-the social potentates of the roman world]1480-a number of the social potentates of the roman world . [She]1478-the hostess was rosy with triumph , to say nothing of a less metaphysical cause , and was evidently vastly contented with [herself]1478-the hostess , with [her]1478-the hostess company , and with the general promise of destiny . [[Her]253-mrs. light daughter]491-her daughter was less overtly jubilant , and distributed [her]1478-the hostess greetings with impartial frigidity . [She]1478-the hostess had never been so beautiful . Dressed simply in vaporous white , relieved with half a dozen white roses , the perfection of [her]1478-the hostess features and of [her]1478-the hostess person and the mysterious depth of [her]1478-the hostess expression seemed to glow with the white light of a splendid pearl . [She]1478-the hostess recognized [no one individually]1484-no one individually , and made [her]1478-the hostess courtesy slowly , gravely , with [her]1478-the hostess eyes on the ground . [Rowland]281-rowland fancied that , as [he]1485-he stood before [her]1478-the hostess , [her]1478-the hostess obeisance was slightly exaggerated , as with an intention of irony ; but [he]1485-he smiled philosophically to [himself]1485-he , and reflected , as [he]1485-he passed into [the room]487-the room , that , if [she]1478-the hostess disliked [him]1485-he , [he]1485-he had nothing to reproach [himself]1485-he with . [He]1485-he walked about , had a few words with [Miss Blanchard]216-miss blanchard , who , with a fillet of cameos in [her]216-miss blanchard hair , was leaning on the arm of [Mr. Leavenworth]269-mr. leavenworth , and at last came upon [the Cavaliere Giacosa]255-the cavaliere , modestly stationed in a corner . [The little gentleman]1487-the little gentleman 's coat - lappet was decorated with an enormous bouquet and [his]1487-the little gentleman neck encased in a voluminous white handkerchief of the fashion of thirty years ago . [His]1487-the little gentleman arms were folded , and [he]1487-the little gentleman was surveying the scene with contracted eyelids , through which [you]1488-you saw the glitter of [[his]1487-the little gentleman intensely dark , vivacious pupil]1489-his intensely dark , vivacious pupil . " [He]186-roderick has made one already ! "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland murmured to [himself]281-rowland . " Very good . [I]192-christina like [your]192-christina frankness . It 's quite true . [You]192-christina see , [I]192-christina am [a strange girl]4022-a strange girl . [Rowland]281-rowland looked at [her]1517-her in some perplexity . Was this touching sincerity , or unfathomable coquetry ?
