"[1518-i]

" Very good . One of the first things one asks of [a friend]3219-a friend is to judge [one]3107-one not by isolated acts , but by [one]3107-one 's whole conduct . [I]192-christina care for [your]4024-a person opinion - [I]192-christina do n't know why . "[192-christina]

" Nor do [I]281-rowland , [I]281-rowland confess , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland with a laugh .

" What do [you]1518-i think of this affair ? "[1517-her] [she]1517-her continued , without heeding [his]1518-i laugh .

" Of [your]1518-i ball ? Why , it 's a very grand affair . "[192-christina]

" It 's horrible - that 's what it is ! It 's [a mere rabble]4036-a mere rabble ! There are people here whom [I]1519-i never saw before , [people who were never asked]4037-people who were never asked . [Mamma]257-mamma went about inviting [every one]3105-every one , asking [other people]3286-other people to invite [any one [they]3286-other people knew]4040-any one they knew , doing anything to have [a crowd]4041-a crowd . [I]1519-i hope [she]257-mamma is satisfied ! It is not [my]1519-i doing . [I]1519-i feel weary , [I]1519-i feel angry , [I]1519-i feel like crying . [I]1519-i have twenty minds to escape into [[my]1519-i room]3272-my room and lock the door and let [mamma]257-mamma go through with it as [she]257-mamma can . By the way , "[1519-i] [she]1519-i added in a moment , without a visible reason for the transition , " can [you]281-rowland tell [me]1519-i something to read ? "[1519-i]

[Rowland]281-rowland stared , at the disconnectedness of the question .

" Can [you]281-rowland recommend [me]1519-i some books ? "[1519-i] [she]1519-i repeated . " [I]1519-i know [you]281-rowland are [a great reader]4043-a great reader . [I]1519-i have [no one else to ask]4044-no one else to ask . [We]4045-we can buy no books . [We]4045-we can make debts for jewelry and bonnets and five - button gloves , but [we]4045-we ca n't spend a sou for ideas . And yet , though [you]281-rowland may not believe it , [I]1519-i like ideas quite as well . "[1519-i]

" [I]281-rowland shall be most happy to lend [you]1519-i some books , "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland said . " [I]281-rowland will pick some out to - morrow and send them to [you]1519-i . "[281-rowland]

" No novels , please ! [I]1519-i am tired of novels . [I]1519-i can imagine better stories for [myself]1519-i than any [I]1519-i read . Some good poetry , if there is such a thing nowadays , and some memoirs and histories and books of facts . "[1519-i]

" [You]1519-i shall be served . [Your]1519-i taste agrees with [my]281-rowland own . "[281-rowland]

[She]281-rowland was silent a moment , looking at [him]1520-him . Then suddenly - " Tell [me]281-rowland something about [Mr. Hudson]172-mr. hudson , "[281-rowland] [she]281-rowland demanded . " [You]1520-him are [great friends]4046-great friends ! "[281-rowland]

" Oh yes , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland ; " [we]1520-him are [great friends]4046-great friends . "[281-rowland]

" Tell [me]281-rowland about [him]172-mr. hudson . Come , begin ! "[281-rowland]

" Where shall [I]281-rowland begin ? [You]281-rowland know [him]172-mr. hudson for [yourself]281-rowland . "[281-rowland]

" No , [I]281-rowland do n't know [him]172-mr. hudson ; [I]281-rowland do n't find [him]172-mr. hudson so easy to know . Since [he]172-mr. hudson has finished [my]281-rowland bust and begun to come [here]3130-here disinterestedly , [he]172-mr. hudson has become [a great talker]998-a great talker . [He]172-mr. hudson says very fine things ; but does [he]172-mr. hudson mean all [he]172-mr. hudson says ? "[281-rowland]

" [Few of [us]4051-us]4050-few of us do that . "[281-rowland]

" [You]281-rowland do , [I]281-rowland imagine . [You]281-rowland ought to know , for [he]172-mr. hudson tells [me]281-rowland [you]281-rowland discovered [him]172-mr. hudson . "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland was silent , and [Christina]192-christina continued , " Do [you]281-rowland consider [him]172-mr. hudson very clever ? "[192-christina]

" Unquestionably . "[192-christina]

" [His]172-mr. hudson talent is really something out of the common way ? "[192-christina]

" So it seems to [me]192-christina . "[192-christina]

" In short , [he]172-mr. hudson 's [a man of genius]3300-a man of genius ? "[192-christina]

" Yes , call it genius . "[192-christina]

" And [you]281-rowland found [him]172-mr. hudson vegetating in [a little village]4053-a little village and took [him]172-mr. hudson by the hand and set [him]172-mr. hudson on [his]172-mr. hudson feet in [Rome]4-rome ? "[192-christina]

" Is that the popular legend ? "[281-rowland] asked [Rowland]281-rowland .

" Oh , [you]281-rowland need n't be modest . There was no great merit in it ; there would have been none at least on [my]192-christina part in the same circumstances . [Real geniuses]4054-real geniuses are not so common , and if [I]192-christina had discovered one in [the wilderness]4055-the wilderness , [I]192-christina would have brought [him]172-mr. hudson out into [the market - place]4056-the market - place to see how [he]172-mr. hudson would behave . It would be excessively amusing . [You]281-rowland must find it so to watch [Mr. Hudson]172-mr. hudson , eh ? Tell [me]192-christina this : do [you]281-rowland think [he]172-mr. hudson is going to be [a great man]3322-a great man - become famous , have [his]172-mr. hudson life written , and all that ? "[192-christina]

" [I]192-christina do n't prophesy , but [I]192-christina have good hopes . "[192-christina]

[Christina]192-christina was silent . [She]192-christina stretched out [her]192-christina bare arm and looked at it a moment absently , turning it so as to see - or almost to see - the dimple in [her]192-christina elbow . This was apparently a frequent gesture with [her]192-christina ; [Rowland]281-rowland had already observed it . It was as coolly and naturally done as if [she]192-christina had been in [[her]192-christina room]1521-her room alone . " So [he]172-mr. hudson 's [a man of genius]3300-a man of genius , "[192-christina] [she]192-christina suddenly resumed . " Do n't [you]281-rowland think [I]192-christina ought to be extremely flattered to have [a man of genius perpetually hanging about]4059-a man of genius perpetually hanging about ? [He]172-mr. hudson is the first [I]192-christina ever saw , but [I]192-christina should have known [he]172-mr. hudson was not [a common mortal]4060-a common mortal . There is something strange about [him]172-mr. hudson . To begin with , [he]172-mr. hudson has no manners . [You]281-rowland may say that it 's not for [me]192-christina to blame [him]172-mr. hudson , for [I]192-christina have none [myself]192-christina . That 's very true , but the difference is that [I]192-christina can have them when [I]192-christina wish to and very charming ones too ; [I]192-christina 'll show [you]281-rowland some day ; whereas [Mr. Hudson]172-mr. hudson will never have them . And yet , somehow , [one]3107-one sees [he]172-mr. hudson 's [a gentleman]4062-a gentleman . [He]172-mr. hudson seems to have something urging , driving , pushing [him]172-mr. hudson , making [him]172-mr. hudson restless and defiant . [You]281-rowland see it in [his]172-mr. hudson eyes . [They]4063-they are the finest , by the way , [I]192-christina ever saw . When [a person]4024-a person has such eyes as that [you]281-rowland can forgive [him]4024-a person [his]4024-a person bad manners . [I]192-christina suppose that is what [they]4063-they call the sacred fire . "[192-christina]

[Rowland]281-rowland made no answer except to ask [her]281-rowland in a moment if [she]281-rowland would have another roll . [She]281-rowland merely shook [her]281-rowland head and went on : -

" Tell [me]281-rowland how [you]281-rowland found [him]172-mr. hudson . Where was [he]172-mr. hudson - how was [he]172-mr. hudson ? "[281-rowland]

" [He]172-mr. hudson was in [a place called [Northampton]2-northampton]4065-a place called northampton . Did [you]281-rowland ever hear of it ? [He]172-mr. hudson was studying law - but not learning it . "[281-rowland]

" It appears it was something horrible , eh ? "[281-rowland]

" Something horrible ? "[281-rowland]

" [This little village]4066-this little village . No society , no pleasures , no beauty , no life . "[281-rowland]

" [You]281-rowland have received a false impression . [Northampton]2-northampton is not as gay as [Rome]4-rome , but [Roderick]186-roderick had [some charming friends]4067-some charming friends . "[281-rowland]

" Tell [me]281-rowland about [them]4067-some charming friends . Who were [they]4067-some charming friends ? "[281-rowland]

" Well , there was [[my]281-rowland cousin]3148-my cousin , through whom [I]281-rowland made [his]186-roderick acquaintance : [a delightful woman]4069-a delightful woman . "[281-rowland]

" Young - pretty ? "[281-rowland]

" Yes , a good deal of both . And very clever . "[281-rowland]

" Did [he]186-roderick make love to [her]4069-a delightful woman ? "[281-rowland]

" Not in the least . "[281-rowland]

" Well , who else ? "[281-rowland]

" [He]186-roderick lived with [[his]186-roderick mother]448-his mother . [She]448-his mother is the best of [women]3288-women . "[281-rowland]

" Ah yes , [I]281-rowland know all that [[one]3107-one 's mother]4073-one 's mother is . But [she]448-his mother does not count as society . And who else ? "[281-rowland]

[Rowland]281-rowland hesitated . [He]1522-he wondered whether [Christina]192-christina 's insistence was the result of a general interest in [Roderick]186-roderick 's antecedents or of a particular suspicion . [He]1522-he looked at [her]192-christina ; [she]192-christina was looking at [him]1522-he a little askance , waiting for [his]1522-he answer . As [Roderick]186-roderick had said nothing about [his]186-roderick engagement to [the Cavaliere]1279-the cavaliere , it was probable that with [this beautiful girl]1524-this beautiful girl [he]186-roderick had not been more explicit . And yet the thing was announced , it was public ; [that other girl]1525-that other girl was happy in it , proud of it . [Rowland]281-rowland felt a kind of dumb anger rising in [his]1522-he heart . [He]1522-he deliberated a moment intently .

" What are [you]281-rowland frowning at ? "[192-christina] [Christina]192-christina asked .

" There was [another person]3277-another person , "[1522-he] [he]1522-he answered , " the most important of all : [the young girl to whom [he]186-roderick is engaged]4075-the young girl to whom he is engaged . "[1522-he]

[Christina]192-christina stared a moment , raising [her]192-christina eyebrows . " Ah , [Mr. Hudson]172-mr. hudson is engaged ? "[192-christina] [she]192-christina said , very simply . " Is [she]4075-the young girl to whom he is engaged pretty ? "[192-christina]

" [She]4075-the young girl to whom he is engaged is not called [a beauty]3823-a beauty , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland . [He]1522-he meant to practice great brevity , but in a moment [he]1522-he added , " [I]1522-he have seen beauties , however , who pleased [me]1522-he less . "[1522-he]

" Ah , [she]4075-the young girl to whom he is engaged pleases [you]281-rowland , too ? Why do n't [they]4077-they marry ? "[281-rowland]

" [Roderick]186-roderick is waiting till [he]186-roderick can afford to marry . "[1522-he]

[Christina]192-christina slowly put out [her]192-christina arm again and looked at the dimple in [her]192-christina elbow . " Ah , [he]186-roderick 's engaged ? "[192-christina] [she]192-christina repeated in the same tone . " [He]186-roderick never told [me]192-christina . "[192-christina]

[Rowland]281-rowland perceived at this moment that [the people about [them]1527-them]1526-the people about them were beginning to return to [the dancing - room]1528-the dancing - room , and immediately afterwards [he]1522-he saw [Roderick]186-roderick making [his]186-roderick way toward [themselves]1526-the people about them . [Roderick]186-roderick presented [himself]186-roderick before [Miss Light]254-miss light .

" [I]186-roderick do n't claim that [you]254-miss light have promised [me]186-roderick the cotillon , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick said , " but [I]186-roderick consider that [you]254-miss light have given [me]186-roderick hopes which warrant the confidence that [you]254-miss light will dance with [me]186-roderick . "[186-roderick]

[Christina]192-christina looked at [him]186-roderick a moment . " Certainly [I]192-christina have made no promises , "[192-christina] [she]192-christina said . " It seemed to [me]192-christina that , as [the daughter of [the house]3246-the house]4078-the daughter of the house , [I]192-christina should keep [myself]192-christina free and let it depend on circumstances . "[192-christina]

" [I]186-roderick beseech [you]254-miss light to dance with [me]186-roderick ! "[186-roderick] said [Roderick]186-roderick , with vehemence .

[Christina]192-christina rose and began to laugh . " [You]186-roderick say that very well , but [the Italians]4080-the italians do it better . "[192-christina]

This assertion seemed likely to be put to the proof . [Mrs. Light]253-mrs. light hastily approached , leading , rather than led by , [a tall , slim young man]1529-a tall , slim young man , of an unmistakably Southern physiognomy . " [[My]253-mrs. light precious love]4081-my precious love , "[253-mrs. light] [she]253-mrs. light cried , " what a place to hide in ! [We]4080-the italians have been looking for [you]347-the young man for twenty minutes ; [I]253-mrs. light have chosen a cavalier for [you]347-the young man , and chosen well ! "[253-mrs. light]

[The young man]347-the young man disengaged [himself]347-the young man , made a ceremonious bow , joined [his]347-the young man two hands , and murmured with an ecstatic smile , " May [I]347-the young man venture to hope , [dear signorina]4082-dear signorina , for the honor of [your]347-the young man hand ? "[347-the young man]

" Of course [you]347-the young man may ! "[253-mrs. light] said [Mrs. Light]253-mrs. light . " The honor is for [us]4080-the italians . "[253-mrs. light]

[Christina]192-christina hesitated but for a moment , then swept [the young man]347-the young man a courtesy as profound as [his]347-the young man own bow . " [You]347-the young man are very kind , but [you]347-the young man are too late . [I]192-christina have just accepted ! "[192-christina]

" Ah , [[my]253-mrs. light own darling]4083-my own darling ! "[253-mrs. light] murmured - almost moaned - [Mrs. Light]253-mrs. light .

[Christina]192-christina and [Roderick]186-roderick exchanged a single glance - a glance brilliant on both sides . [She]192-christina passed [her]192-christina hand into [his]186-roderick arm ; [he]186-roderick tossed [his]186-roderick clustering locks and led [her]192-christina away .

A short time afterwards [Rowland]281-rowland saw [the young man whom [she]281-rowland had rejected]1532-the young man whom she had rejected leaning against a doorway . [He]1532-the young man whom she had rejected was ugly , but what is called distinguished - looking . [He]1532-the young man whom she had rejected had a heavy black eye , a sallow complexion , a long , thin neck ; [his]1532-the young man whom she had rejected hair was cropped en brosse . [He]1532-the young man whom she had rejected looked very young , yet extremely bored . [He]1532-the young man whom she had rejected was staring at the ceiling and stroking an imperceptible moustache . [Rowland]281-rowland espied [the Cavaliere Giacosa]255-the cavaliere hard by , and , having joined [him]255-the cavaliere , asked [him]255-the cavaliere [the young man]347-the young man 's name .

" Oh , "[1279-the cavaliere] said [the Cavaliere]1279-the cavaliere , " [he]1532-the young man whom she had rejected 's a pezzo grosso ! A [Neapolitan]98-neapolitan . [Prince Casamassima]273-prince casamassima . "[1279-the cavaliere]

CHAPTER VI . [Frascati]99-frascati

One day , on entering [[Roderick]186-roderick 's lodging]1535-roderick 's lodging not [the modest rooms on [the Ripetta]57-the ripetta which [he]186-roderick had first occupied]1536-the modest rooms on the ripetta which he had first occupied , but [a much more sumptuous apartment]1537-a much more sumptuous apartment on [the Corso]53-the corso , [Rowland]281-rowland found a letter on the table addressed to [himself]281-rowland . It was from [Roderick]186-roderick , and consisted of but three lines : " [I]186-roderick am gone to [Frascati]99-frascati - for meditation . If [I]186-roderick am not at [home]349-home on Friday , [you]186-roderick had better join [me]186-roderick . "[186-roderick] On Friday [he]186-roderick was still absent , and [Rowland]281-rowland went out to [Frascati]99-frascati . Here [he]186-roderick found [[his]186-roderick friend]606-his friend living at [the inn]956-the inn and spending [his]186-roderick days , according to [his]186-roderick own account , lying under the trees of [the Villa Mondragone]1540-the villa mondragone , reading [Ariosto]274-ariosto . [He]186-roderick was in a sombre mood ; " meditation "[186-roderick] seemed not to have been fruitful . Nothing especially pertinent to [our]1541-our narrative had passed between [the two young men]608-the two young men since [Mrs. Light]253-mrs. light 's ball , save a few words bearing on an incident of that entertainment . [Rowland]281-rowland informed [Roderick]186-roderick , the next day , that [he]186-roderick had told [Miss Light]254-miss light of [his]186-roderick engagement . " [I]186-roderick do n't know whether [you]186-roderick 'll thank [me]186-roderick , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick had said , " but it 's [my]186-roderick duty to let [you]186-roderick know it . [Miss Light]254-miss light perhaps has already done so . "[186-roderick]

[Roderick]186-roderick looked at [him]186-roderick a moment , intently , with [his]186-roderick color slowly rising . " Why should n't [I]186-roderick thank [you]186-roderick ? "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick asked . " [I]186-roderick am not ashamed of [my]186-roderick engagement . "[186-roderick]

" As [you]186-roderick had not spoken of it [yourself]186-roderick , [I]186-roderick thought [you]186-roderick might have a reason for not having it known . "[186-roderick]

" [A man]3214-a man does n't gossip about such a matter with [strangers]4086-strangers , "[186-roderick] [Roderick]186-roderick rejoined , with the ring of irritation in [his]186-roderick voice .

" With [strangers]4086-strangers - no ! "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland , smiling .

[Roderick]186-roderick continued [his]186-roderick work ; but after a moment , turning round with a frown : " If [you]186-roderick supposed [I]186-roderick had a reason for being silent , pray why should [you]186-roderick have spoken ? "[186-roderick]

" [I]186-roderick did not speak idly , [[my]186-roderick dear]3110-my dear [Roderick]186-roderick . [I]186-roderick weighed the matter before [I]186-roderick spoke , and promised [myself]186-roderick to let [you]186-roderick know immediately afterwards . It seemed to [me]186-roderick that [Miss Light]254-miss light had better know that [your]186-roderick affections are pledged . "[186-roderick]

" [The Cavaliere]255-the cavaliere has put it into [your]186-roderick head , then , that [I]186-roderick am making love to [her]254-miss light ? "[186-roderick]

" No ; in that case [I]186-roderick would not have spoken to [her]254-miss light first . "[186-roderick]

" Do [you]186-roderick mean , then , that [she]254-miss light is making love to [me]186-roderick ? "[186-roderick]

" This is what [I]281-rowland mean , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland , after a pause . " [That girl]4089-that girl finds [you]186-roderick interesting , and is pleased , even though [she]4089-that girl may play indifference , at [your]186-roderick finding [her]254-miss light so . [I]281-rowland said to [myself]281-rowland that it might save [her]254-miss light some sentimental disappointment to know without delay that [you]186-roderick are not at liberty to become indefinitely interested in [other women]1367-other women . "[281-rowland]

" [You]186-roderick seem to have taken the measure of [my]186-roderick liberty with extraordinary minuteness ! "[186-roderick] cried [Roderick]186-roderick .

" [You]186-roderick must do [me]281-rowland justice . [I]281-rowland am the cause of [your]186-roderick separation from [Miss Garland]182-miss garland , the cause of [your]186-roderick being exposed to temptations which [she]182-miss garland hardly even suspects . How could [I]281-rowland ever face [her]182-miss garland , "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland demanded , with much warmth of tone , " if at the end of it all [she]182-miss garland should be unhappy ? "[281-rowland]

" [I]281-rowland had no idea that [Miss Garland]182-miss garland had made such an impression on [you]186-roderick . [You]186-roderick are too zealous ; [I]281-rowland take it [she]182-miss garland did n't charge [you]186-roderick to look after [her]182-miss garland interests . "[281-rowland]

" If anything happens to [you]186-roderick , [I]281-rowland am accountable . [You]186-roderick must understand that . "[281-rowland]

" That 's a view of the situation [I]281-rowland ca n't accept ; in [your]186-roderick own interest , no less than in mine . It can only make [us]4091-us both very uncomfortable . [I]281-rowland know all [I]281-rowland owe [you]186-roderick ; [I]281-rowland feel it ; [you]186-roderick know that ! But [I]281-rowland am not [a small boy]4092-a small boy nor [an outer barbarian]4093-an outer barbarian any longer , and , whatever [I]281-rowland do , [I]281-rowland do with [my]281-rowland eyes open . When [I]281-rowland do well , the merit 's mine ; if [I]281-rowland do ill , the fault 's mine ! The idea that [I]281-rowland make [you]186-roderick nervous is detestable . Dedicate [your]186-roderick nerves to some better cause , and believe that if [Miss Garland]182-miss garland and [I]281-rowland have a quarrel , [we]1545-we shall settle it between [ourselves]1545-we . "[281-rowland]

[Rowland]281-rowland had found [himself]281-rowland wondering , shortly before , whether possibly [[his]1543-his brilliant young friend]1544-his brilliant young friend was without a conscience ; now it dimly occurred to [him]1543-his that [he]1543-his was without a heart . [Rowland]281-rowland , as [we]1545-we have already intimated , was [a man with a moral passion]1546-a man with a moral passion , and no small part of it had gone forth into [his]1543-his relations with [Roderick]186-roderick . There had been , from the first , no protestations of friendship on either side , but [Rowland]281-rowland had implicitly offered everything that belongs to friendship , and [Roderick]186-roderick had , apparently , as deliberately accepted it . [Rowland]281-rowland , indeed , had taken an exquisite satisfaction in [[his]1543-his companion]555-his companion 's deep , inexpressive assent to [his]555-his companion interest in [him]555-his companion . " Here is an uncommonly fine thing , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick said to [himself]186-roderick : " a nature unconsciously grateful , [a man in whom friendship]4094-a man in whom friendship does the thing that love alone generally has the credit of - knocks the bottom out of pride ! "[186-roderick] [His]1543-his reflective judgment of [Roderick]186-roderick , as time went on , had indulged in a great many irrepressible vagaries ; but [his]186-roderick affection , [his]186-roderick sense of something in [[his]1543-his companion]555-his companion 's whole personality that overmastered [his]186-roderick heart and beguiled [his]186-roderick imagination , had never for an instant faltered . [He]1543-his listened to [Roderick]186-roderick 's last words , and then [he]1543-his smiled as [he]1543-his rarely smiled - with bitterness .

" [I]1543-his do n't at all like [your]1543-his telling [me]1543-his [I]1543-his am too zealous , "[1543-his] [he]1543-his said . " If [I]1543-his had not been zealous , [I]1543-his should never have cared a fig for [you]1543-his . "[1543-his]

[Roderick]186-roderick flushed deeply , and thrust [his]186-roderick modeling tool up to the handle into the clay . " Say it outright ! [You]1543-his have been a great fool to believe in [me]186-roderick . "[186-roderick]

" [I]281-rowland desire to say nothing of the kind , and [you]186-roderick do n't honestly believe [I]281-rowland do ! "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland . " It seems to [me]281-rowland [I]281-rowland am really very good - natured even to reply to such nonsense . "[281-rowland]

[Roderick]186-roderick sat down , crossed [his]186-roderick arms , and fixed [his]186-roderick eyes on the floor . [Rowland]281-rowland looked at [him]186-roderick for some moments ; it seemed to [him]186-roderick that [he]186-roderick had never so clearly read [[his]186-roderick companion]555-his companion 's strangely commingled character - [his]186-roderick strength and [his]186-roderick weakness , [his]186-roderick picturesque personal attractiveness and [his]186-roderick urgent egoism , [his]186-roderick exalted ardor and [his]186-roderick puerile petulance . It would have made [him]186-roderick almost sick , however , to think that , on the whole , [Roderick]186-roderick was not [a generous fellow]1550-a generous fellow , and [he]186-roderick was so far from having ceased to believe in [him]186-roderick that [he]186-roderick felt just now , more than ever , that all this was but the painful complexity of genius . [Rowland]281-rowland , who had not a grain of genius either to make [one]3107-one say [he]3107-one was [an interested reasoner]1552-an interested reasoner , or to enable [one]3107-one to feel that [he]3107-one could afford a dangerous theory or two , adhered to [his]3107-one conviction of the essential salubrity of genius . Suddenly [he]186-roderick felt an irresistible compassion for [[his]186-roderick companion]555-his companion ; it seemed to [him]186-roderick that [his]186-roderick beautiful faculty of production was a double - edged instrument , susceptible of being dealt in back - handed blows at [its possessor]1555-its possessor . Genius was priceless , inspired , divine ; but it was also , at its hours , capricious , sinister , cruel ; and [men of genius]1556-men of genius , accordingly , were alternately very enviable and very helpless . It was not the first time [he]186-roderick had had a sense of [Roderick]186-roderick 's standing helpless in the grasp of [his]186-roderick temperament . It had shaken [him]186-roderick , as yet , but with a half good - humored wantonness ; but , henceforth , possibly , it meant to handle [him]186-roderick more roughly . These were not times , therefore , for [a friend]3219-a friend to have a short patience .

" When [you]186-roderick err , [you]186-roderick say , the fault 's [your]186-roderick own , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick said at last . " It is because [your]186-roderick faults are [your]186-roderick own that [I]186-roderick care about them . "[186-roderick]

[Rowland]281-rowland 's voice , when [he]186-roderick spoke with feeling , had an extraordinary amenity . [Roderick]186-roderick sat staring a moment longer at the floor , then [he]186-roderick sprang up and laid [his]186-roderick hand affectionately on [[his]186-roderick friend]606-his friend 's shoulder . " [You]281-rowland are [the best man in [the world]483-the world]4095-the best man in the world , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick said , " and [I]186-roderick am [a vile brute]4097-a vile brute . Only , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick added in a moment , " [you]281-rowland do n't understand [me]186-roderick ! "[186-roderick] And [he]186-roderick looked at [him]606-his friend with eyes of such radiant lucidity that [one]3107-one might have said and [Rowland]281-rowland did almost say so , [himself]281-rowland that it was the fault of [one]3107-one 's own grossness if [one]3107-one failed to read to the bottom of that beautiful soul .

[Rowland]281-rowland smiled sadly . " What is it now ? Explain . "[281-rowland]

" Oh , [I]186-roderick ca n't explain ! "[186-roderick] cried [Roderick]186-roderick impatiently , returning to [his]186-roderick work . " [I]186-roderick have only one way of expressing [my]186-roderick deepest feelings - it 's this ! "[186-roderick] And [he]186-roderick swung [his]186-roderick tool . [He]186-roderick stood looking at the half - wrought clay for a moment , and then flung the instrument down . " And even this half the time plays [me]186-roderick false ! "[186-roderick]

[Rowland]281-rowland felt that [his]186-roderick irritation had not subsided , and [he]186-roderick [himself]186-roderick had no taste for saying disagreeable things . Nevertheless [he]186-roderick saw no sufficient reason to forbear uttering the words [he]186-roderick had had on [his]186-roderick conscience from the beginning . " [We]4098-we must do what [we]4098-we can and be thankful , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick said . " And let [me]186-roderick assure [you]186-roderick of this - that it wo n't help [you]186-roderick to become entangled with [Miss Light]254-miss light . "[186-roderick]

[Roderick]186-roderick pressed [his]186-roderick hand to [his]186-roderick forehead with vehemence and then shook it in the air , despairingly ; a gesture that had become frequent with [him]186-roderick since [he]186-roderick had been in [Italy]24-italy . " No , no , it 's no use ; [you]186-roderick do n't understand [me]186-roderick ! But [I]186-roderick do n't blame [you]186-roderick . [You]186-roderick ca n't ! "[186-roderick]

" [You]281-rowland think it will help [you]281-rowland , then ? "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland , wondering .

" [I]186-roderick think that when [you]186-roderick expect [a man]3214-a man to produce beautiful and wonderful works of art , [you]186-roderick ought to allow [him]3214-a man a certain freedom of action , [you]186-roderick ought to give [him]3214-a man a long rope , [you]186-roderick ought to let [him]3214-a man follow [his]3214-a man fancy and look for [his]3214-a man material wherever [he]3214-a man thinks [he]3214-a man may find it ! [A mother]4100-a mother ca n't nurse [[her]4100-a mother child]455-her child unless [she]4100-a mother follows a certain diet ; [an artist]3186-an artist ca n't bring [his]3186-an artist visions to maturity unless [he]3186-an artist has a certain experience . [You]186-roderick demand of [us]4103-us to be imaginative , and [you]186-roderick deny [us]4103-us that which feeds the imagination . In labor [we]4103-us must be as passionate as [the inspired sibyl]4104-the inspired sibyl ; in life [we]4103-us must be [mere machines]4105-mere machines . It wo n't do . When [you]186-roderick have got [an artist to deal with]4106-an artist to deal with , [you]186-roderick must take [him]4106-an artist to deal with as [he]4106-an artist to deal with is , good and bad together . [I]186-roderick do n't say [they]4106-an artist to deal with are [pleasant fellows]4107-pleasant fellows to know or [easy fellows to live with]4108-easy fellows to live with ; [I]186-roderick do n't say [they]4106-an artist to deal with satisfy [themselves]4106-an artist to deal with any better than [other people]3286-other people . [I]186-roderick only say that if [you]186-roderick want [them]4106-an artist to deal with to produce , [you]186-roderick must let [them]4106-an artist to deal with conceive . If [you]186-roderick want a bird to sing , [you]186-roderick must not cover up its cage . Shoot [them]4106-an artist to deal with , [the poor devils]4110-the poor devils , drown [them]4106-an artist to deal with , exterminate [them]4106-an artist to deal with , if [you]186-roderick will , in the interest of public morality ; it may be morality would gain - [I]186-roderick dare say it would ! But if [you]186-roderick suffer [them]4106-an artist to deal with to live , let [them]4106-an artist to deal with live on [their]4106-an artist to deal with own terms and according to [their]4106-an artist to deal with own inexorable needs ! "[186-roderick]

[Rowland]281-rowland burst out laughing . " [I]1562-i have no wish whatever either to shoot [you]281-rowland or to drown [you]281-rowland ! "[1562-i] [he]1562-i said . " Why launch such a tirade against a warning offered [you]186-roderick altogether in the interest of [your]186-roderick freest development ? Do [you]186-roderick really mean that [you]186-roderick have an inexorable need of embarking on a flirtation with [Miss Light]254-miss light ? - a flirtation as to the felicity of which there may be differences of opinion , but which can not at best , under the circumstances , be called innocent . [Your]186-roderick last summer 's adventures were more so ! As for the terms on which [you]186-roderick are to live , [I]1562-i had an idea [you]186-roderick had arranged them otherwise ! "[1562-i]

" [I]1563-i have arranged nothing - thank [God]195-god ! [I]1563-i do n't pretend to arrange . [I]1563-i am young and ardent and inquisitive , and [I]1563-i admire [Miss Light]254-miss light . That 's enough . [I]1563-i shall go as far as admiration leads [me]1563-i . [I]1563-i am not afraid . [[Your]186-roderick genuine artist]4111-your genuine artist may be sometimes half [a madman]4112-a madman , but [he]4111-your genuine artist 's not [a coward]4113-a coward ! "[1563-i]

" Suppose that in [your]186-roderick speculation [you]186-roderick should come to grief , not only sentimentally but artistically ? "[1562-i]

" Come what come will ! If [I]1563-i ' m to fizzle out , the sooner [I]1563-i know it the better . Sometimes [I]1563-i half suspect it . But let [me]1563-i at least go out and reconnoitre for [the enemy]3248-the enemy , and not sit here waiting for [him]3248-the enemy , cudgeling [my]1563-i brains for ideas that wo n't come ! "[1563-i]

Do what [he]1563-i would , [Rowland]281-rowland could not think of [Roderick]186-roderick 's theory of unlimited experimentation , especially as applied in the case under discussion , as anything but a pernicious illusion . But [he]1563-i saw it was vain to combat longer , for inclination was powerfully on [Roderick]186-roderick 's side . [He]1563-i laid [his]1563-i hand on [Roderick]186-roderick 's shoulder , looked at [him]186-roderick a moment with troubled eyes , then shook [his]1563-i head mournfully and turned away .

" [I]186-roderick ca n't work any more , "[186-roderick] said [Roderick]186-roderick . " [You]186-roderick have upset [me]186-roderick ! [I]186-roderick 'll go and stroll on [the Pincian]51-the pincian . "[186-roderick] And [he]186-roderick tossed aside [his]186-roderick working - jacket and prepared [himself]186-roderick for [the street]1564-the street . As [he]186-roderick was arranging [his]186-roderick cravat before the glass , something occurred to [him]186-roderick which made [him]186-roderick thoughtful . [He]186-roderick stopped a few moments afterward , as [they]1565-they were going out , with [his]186-roderick hand on the door - knob . " [You]186-roderick did , from [your]186-roderick own point of view , an indiscreet thing , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick said , " to tell [Miss Light]254-miss light of [my]186-roderick engagement . "[186-roderick]

[Rowland]281-rowland looked at [him]186-roderick with a glance which was partly an interrogation , but partly , also , an admission .

" If [she]254-miss light 's the coquette [you]186-roderick say , "[186-roderick] [Roderick]186-roderick added , " [you]186-roderick have given [her]254-miss light a reason the more . "[186-roderick]

" And that 's [the girl [you]186-roderick propose to devote [yourself]186-roderick to]4115-the girl you propose to devote yourself to ? "[281-rowland] cried [Rowland]281-rowland .

" Oh , [I]281-rowland do n't say it , mind ! [I]281-rowland only say that [she]254-miss light 's the most interesting creature in [the world]483-the world ! The next time [you]186-roderick mean to render [me]281-rowland a service , pray give [me]281-rowland notice beforehand ! "[281-rowland]

It was perfectly characteristic of [Roderick]186-roderick that , a fortnight later , [he]186-roderick should have let [[his]186-roderick friend]606-his friend know that [he]186-roderick depended upon [him]186-roderick for society at [Frascati]99-frascati , as freely as if no irritating topic had ever been discussed between [them]1567-them . [Rowland]281-rowland thought [him]186-roderick generous , and [he]186-roderick had at any rate a liberal faculty of forgetting that [he]186-roderick had given [you]1568-you any reason to be displeased with [him]186-roderick . It was equally characteristic of [Rowland]281-rowland that [he]186-roderick complied with [[his]186-roderick friend]606-his friend 's summons without a moment 's hesitation . [[His]186-roderick cousin]343-his cousin [Cecilia]169-cecilia had once told [him]186-roderick that [he]186-roderick was the dupe of [his]186-roderick intense benevolence . [She]169-cecilia put the case with too little favor , or too much , as [the reader]388-the reader chooses ; it is certain , at least , that [he]186-roderick had a constitutional tendency towards magnanimous interpretations . Nothing happened , however , to suggest to [him]186-roderick that [he]186-roderick was deluded in thinking that [Roderick]186-roderick 's secondary impulses were wiser than [his]186-roderick primary ones , and that the rounded total of [his]186-roderick nature had a harmony perfectly attuned to the most amiable of its brilliant parts . [Roderick]186-roderick 's humor , for the time , was pitched in a minor key ; [he]186-roderick was lazy , listless , and melancholy , but [he]186-roderick had never been more friendly and kindly and appealingly submissive . Winter had begun , by the calendar , but the weather was divinely mild , and [the two young men]608-the two young men took long slow strolls on [the hills]1573-the hills and lounged away the mornings in [the villas]1574-the villas . [The villas at [Frascati]99-frascati]1575-the villas at frascati are delicious places , and replete with romantic suggestiveness . [Roderick]186-roderick , as [he]186-roderick had said , was meditating , and if a masterpiece was to come of [his]186-roderick meditations , [Rowland]281-rowland was perfectly willing to bear [him]186-roderick company and coax along the process . But [Roderick]186-roderick let [him]186-roderick know from the first that [he]186-roderick was in a miserably sterile mood , and , cudgel [his]186-roderick brains as [he]186-roderick would , could think of nothing that would serve for the statue [he]186-roderick was to make for [Mr. Leavenworth]269-mr. leavenworth .

" It is worse out here than in [Rome]4-rome , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick said , " for here [I]186-roderick am face to face with the dead blank of [my]186-roderick mind ! There [I]186-roderick could n't think of anything either , but there [I]186-roderick found things to make [me]186-roderick forget that [I]186-roderick needed to . "[186-roderick] This was as frank an allusion to [Christina Light]192-christina as could have been expected under the circumstances ; it seemed , indeed , to [Rowland]281-rowland surprisingly frank , and a pregnant example of [[his]186-roderick companion]555-his companion 's often strangely irresponsible way of looking at harmful facts . [Roderick]186-roderick was silent sometimes for hours , with a puzzled look on [his]186-roderick face and a constant fold between [his]186-roderick even eyebrows ; at other times [he]186-roderick talked unceasingly , with a slow , idle , half - nonsensical drawl . [Rowland]281-rowland was half a dozen times on the point of asking [him]186-roderick what was the matter with [him]186-roderick ; [he]186-roderick was afraid [he]186-roderick was going to be ill . [Roderick]186-roderick had taken a great fancy to [the Villa Mondragone]100-the villa mondragone , and used to declaim fantastic compliments to [it]100-the villa mondragone as [they]1577-they strolled in the winter sunshine on [the great terrace which looks toward [Tivoli]101-tivoli and [the iridescent Sabine mountains]1579-the iridescent sabine mountains]1578-the great terrace which looks toward tivoli and the iridescent sabine mountains . [He]186-roderick carried [his]186-roderick volume of Ariosto in [his]186-roderick pocket , and took it out every now and then and spouted half a dozen stanzas to [[his]186-roderick companion]555-his companion . [He]186-roderick was , as a general thing , very little of [a reader]1581-a reader ; but at intervals [he]186-roderick would take a fancy to one of the classics and peruse it for a month in disjointed scraps . [He]186-roderick had picked up Italian without study , and had a wonderfully sympathetic accent , though in reading aloud [he]186-roderick ruined the sense of half the lines [he]186-roderick rolled off so sonorously . [Rowland]281-rowland , who pronounced badly but understood everything , once said to [him]186-roderick that [Ariosto]274-ariosto was not [the poet for [a man of [his]186-roderick craft]1583-a man of his craft]1582-the poet for a man of his craft ; [a sculptor]3131-a sculptor should make [a companion of [Dante]275-dante]1585-a companion of dante . So [he]186-roderick lent [him]186-roderick the Inferno , which [he]186-roderick had brought with [him]186-roderick , and advised [him]186-roderick to look into it . [Roderick]186-roderick took it with some eagerness ; perhaps it would brighten [his]186-roderick wits . [He]186-roderick returned it the next day with disgust ; [he]186-roderick had found it intolerably depressing .

" [A sculptor]3131-a sculptor should model as [Dante]275-dante writes - [you]4118-you 're right there , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick said . " But when [his]275-dante genius is in eclipse , [Dante]275-dante is a dreadfully smoky lamp . By what perversity of fate , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick went on , " has it come about that [I]186-roderick am [a sculptor]3131-a sculptor at all ? [A sculptor]3131-a sculptor is such a confoundedly special genius ; there are so few subjects [he]3131-a sculptor can treat , so few things in life that bear upon [his]3131-a sculptor work , so few moods in which [he]3131-a sculptor [himself]3131-a sculptor is inclined to it . "[186-roderick] It may be noted that [Rowland]281-rowland had heard [him]186-roderick a dozen times affirm the flat reverse of all this . " If [I]186-roderick had only been [a painter]3872-a painter - [a little quiet , docile , matter - of - fact painter , like [[our]4123-our friend]474-our friend [Singleton]214-singleton]4122-a little quiet , docile , matter - of - fact painter , like our friend singleton - [I]186-roderick should only have to open [my]186-roderick [Ariosto]274-ariosto here to find a subject , to find color and attitudes , stuffs and composition ; [I]186-roderick should only have to look up from the page at that mouldy old fountain against the blue sky , at [that cypress alley]4125-that cypress alley wandering away like a procession of [priests in couples]4126-priests in couples , at [the crags and hollows of [the Sabine hills]4128-the sabine hills]4127-the crags and hollows of the sabine hills , to find [myself]186-roderick grasping [my]186-roderick brush . Best of all would be to be [Ariosto]274-ariosto [himself]274-ariosto , or [one of [[his]274-ariosto brotherhood]4130-his brotherhood]4129-one of his brotherhood . Then everything in nature would give [you]4131-you a hint , and every form of beauty be part of [your]4131-you stock . [You]4131-you would n't have to look at things only to say , - with tears of rage half the time , - ' Oh , yes , it 's wonderfully pretty , but what [the deuce]3125-the deuce can [I]186-roderick do with it ? ' But [a sculptor]3131-a sculptor , now ! That 's a pretty trade for [a fellow who has got [his]4134-a fellow who has got his living to make and yet is so damnably constituted that he ca n't work to order living to make and yet is so damnably constituted that [he]4134-a fellow who has got his living to make and yet is so damnably constituted that he ca n't work to order ca n't work to order]4134-a fellow who has got his living to make and yet is so damnably constituted that he ca n't work to order , and considers that , aesthetically , clock ornaments do n't pay ! [You]4131-you ca n't model the serge - coated cypresses , nor those mouldering old Tritons and all the sunny sadness of that dried - up fountain ; [you]4131-you ca n't put the light into marble - the lovely , caressing , consenting Italian light that [you]4131-you get so much of for nothing . Say that a dozen times in [his]274-ariosto life [a man]3214-a man has a complete sculpturesque vision - a vision in which the imagination recognizes [a subject]4136-a subject and [the subject]4137-the subject kindles the imagination . It is a remunerative rate of work , and the intervals are comfortable ! "[186-roderick]

One morning , as [the two young men]608-the two young men were lounging on the sun - warmed grass at the foot of [one of the slanting pines of [the Villa Mondragone]1540-the villa mondragone]1587-one of the slanting pines of the villa mondragone , [Roderick]186-roderick delivered [himself]186-roderick of a tissue of lugubrious speculations as to the possible mischances of one 's genius . " What if the watch should run down , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick asked , " and [you]4131-you should lose the key ? What if [you]4131-you should wake up some morning and find it stopped , inexorably , appallingly stopped ? Such things have been , and [the poor devils to whom [they]4138-the poor devils to whom they happened happened]4138-the poor devils to whom they happened have had to grin and bear it . The whole matter of genius is a mystery . It bloweth where it listeth and [we]4139-we know nothing of its mechanism . If it gets out of order [we]4139-we ca n't mend it ; if it breaks down altogether [we]4139-we ca n't set [it]4140-it going again . [We]4139-we must let [it]4140-it choose its own pace , and hold [our]4139-we breath lest it should lose its balance . It 's dealt out in different doses , in big cups and little , and when [you]4131-you have consumed [your]4131-you portion it 's as naif to ask for more as it was for [Oliver Twist]276-oliver twist to ask for more porridge . Lucky for [you]4131-you if [you]4131-you ' ve got one of the big cups ; [we]4139-we drink them down in the dark , and [we]4139-we ca n't tell [their]4141-them size until [we]4139-we tip them up and hear the last gurgle . Those of [some men]4142-some men last for life ; those of [others]914-others for a couple of years . Nay , what are [you]4131-you smiling at so damnably ? "[1589-he] [he]1589-he went on . " Nothing is more common than for [an artist who has set out on [his]4144-an artist who has set out on his journey on a high - stepping horse to find himself all of a sudden dismounted and invited to go his way on foot journey on a high - stepping horse to find [himself]4144-an artist who has set out on his journey on a high - stepping horse to find himself all of a sudden dismounted and invited to go his way on foot all of a sudden dismounted and invited to go [his]4144-an artist who has set out on his journey on a high - stepping horse to find himself all of a sudden dismounted and invited to go his way on foot way on foot]4144-an artist who has set out on his journey on a high - stepping horse to find himself all of a sudden dismounted and invited to go his way on foot . [You]4131-you can number [them]4141-them by the thousand - [the people of two or three successes]4145-the people of two or three successes ; [the poor fellows whose candle burnt out in a night]4146-the poor fellows whose candle burnt out in a night . [Some of [them]4141-them]4147-some of them groped [their]4147-some of them way along without it , [some of [them]4141-them]4147-some of them gave [themselves]4147-some of them up for blind and sat down by the wayside to beg . Who shall say that [I]1590-i ' m not [one of these]4149-one of these ? Who shall assure [me]1590-i that [my]1590-i credit is for an unlimited sum ? Nothing proves it , and [I]1590-i never claimed it ; or if [I]1590-i did , [I]1590-i did so in the mere boyish joy of shaking off the dust of [Northampton]2-northampton . If [you]4131-you believed so , [[my]1590-i dear fellow]3540-my dear fellow , [you]4131-you did so at [your]4131-you own risk ! What am [I]1590-i , what are the best of [us]4151-us , but an experiment ? Do [I]1590-i succeed - do [I]1590-i fail ? It does n't depend on [me]1590-i . [I]1590-i ' m prepared for failure . It wo n't be a disappointment , simply because [I]1590-i sha n't survive it . The end of [my]1590-i work shall be the end of [my]1590-i life . When [I]1590-i have played [my]1590-i last card , [I]1590-i shall cease to care for the game . [I]1590-i ' m not making vulgar threats of suicide ; for destiny , [I]1590-i trust , wo n't add insult to injury by putting [me]1590-i to that abominable trouble . But [I]1590-i have a conviction that if the hour strikes here , "[1590-i] and [he]1590-i tapped [his]1590-i forehead , " [I]1590-i shall disappear , dissolve , be carried off in a cloud ! For the past ten days [I]1590-i have had the vision of some such fate perpetually swimming before [my]1590-i eyes . [My]1590-i mind is like a dead calm in the tropics , and [my]1590-i imagination as motionless as the phantom ship in [the Ancient Mariner]102-the ancient mariner ! "[1590-i]

[Rowland]281-rowland listened to this outbreak , as [he]1590-i often had occasion to listen to [Roderick]186-roderick 's heated monologues , with a number of mental restrictions . Both in gravity and in [gayety]1591-gayety [he]1590-i said more than [he]1590-i meant , and [you]1592-you did [him]1590-i simple justice if [you]1592-you privately concluded that neither the glow of purpose nor the chill of despair was of so intense a character as [his]1590-i florid diction implied . The moods of [an artist]3186-an artist , [his]1590-i exaltations and depressions , [Rowland]281-rowland had often said to [himself]281-rowland , were like the pen - flourishes [a writing - master]1594-a writing - master makes in the air when [he]1594-a writing - master begins to set [his]1594-a writing - master copy . [He]1590-i may bespatter [you]1592-you with ink , [he]1590-i may hit [you]1592-you in the eye , but [he]1590-i writes a magnificent hand . It was nevertheless true that at present [poor Roderick]186-roderick gave unprecedented tokens of moral stagnation , and as for genius being held by the precarious tenure [he]1590-i had sketched , [Rowland]281-rowland was at a loss to see whence [he]1590-i could borrow the authority to contradict [him]1590-i . [He]1590-i sighed to [himself]1590-i , and wished that [[his]1590-i companion]555-his companion had a trifle more of little [Sam Singleton]214-singleton 's evenness of impulse . But then , was [Singleton]214-singleton [a man of genius]3300-a man of genius ? [He]1590-i answered that such reflections seemed to [him]1590-i unprofitable , not to say morbid ; that the proof of the pudding was in the eating ; that [he]1590-i did n't know about bringing a genius that had palpably spent its last breath back to life again , but that [he]1590-i was satisfied that vigorous effort was a cure for a great many ills that seemed far gone . " Do n't heed [your]1592-you mood , "[1590-i] [he]1590-i said , " and do n't believe there is any calm so dead that [your]1592-you own lungs ca n't ruffle it with a breeze . If [you]1592-you have work to do , do n't wait to feel like it ; set to work and [you]1592-you will feel like it . "[1590-i]

" Set to work and produce abortions ! "[186-roderick] cried [Roderick]186-roderick with ire . " Preach that to [others]914-others . Production with [me]1590-i must be either pleasure or nothing . As [I]1590-i said just now , [I]1590-i must either stay in the saddle or not go at all . [I]1590-i wo n't do second - rate work ; [I]1590-i ca n't if [I]1590-i would . [I]1590-i have no cleverness , apart from inspiration . [I]1590-i am not [a Gloriani]4153-a gloriani ! [You]281-rowland are right , "[1590-i] [he]1590-i added after a while ; " this is unprofitable talk , and it makes [my]1590-i head ache . [I]1590-i shall take a nap and see if [I]1590-i can dream of a bright idea or two . "[1590-i]

[He]1590-i turned [his]1590-i face upward to the parasol of the great pine , closed [his]1590-i eyes , and in a short time forgot [his]1590-i sombre fancies . January though it was , the mild stillness seemed to vibrate with faint midsummer sounds . [Rowland]281-rowland sat listening to them and wishing that , for the sake of [his]1597-his own felicity , [Roderick]186-roderick 's temper were graced with a certain absent ductility . [He]186-roderick was brilliant , but was [he]186-roderick , like many brilliant things , brittle ? Suddenly , to [his]1590-i musing sense , the soft atmospheric hum was overscored with distincter sounds . [He]1590-i heard voices beyond a mass of shrubbery , at the turn of [a neighboring path]1598-a neighboring path . In a moment one of [them]1599-them began to seem familiar , and an instant later a large white poodle emerged into view . [He]186-roderick was slowly followed by [[his]186-roderick mistress]850-his mistress . [Miss Light]254-miss light paused a moment on seeing [Rowland]281-rowland and [[his]1597-his companion]555-his companion ; but , though [the former]1602-the former perceived that [he]1590-i was recognized , [she]254-miss light made no bow . Presently [she]254-miss light walked directly toward [him]186-roderick . [He]186-roderick rose and was on the point of waking [Roderick]186-roderick , but [she]254-miss light laid [her]254-miss light finger on [her]254-miss light lips and motioned [him]186-roderick to forbear . [She]254-miss light stood a moment looking at [Roderick]186-roderick 's handsome slumber .

" What delicious oblivion ! "[254-miss light] [she]254-miss light said . " [Happy man]3151-happy man ! [Stenterello]252-stenterello "[254-miss light] - and [she]254-miss light pointed to [his]186-roderick face - " wake [him]186-roderick up ! "[254-miss light]

[The porter of [the villa]841-the villa]1635-the porter of the villa was easily induced to furnish a table and half a dozen chairs , and the repast , when set forth , was pronounced a perfect success ; not so good as to fail of the proper picturesqueness , nor yet so bad as to defeat the proper function of repasts . [Christina]192-christina continued to display the most charming animation , and compelled [Rowland]281-rowland to reflect privately that , think what one might of [her]192-christina , the harmonious gayety of [a beautiful girl]3835-a beautiful girl was the most beautiful sight in nature . " If history could always be taught in this fashion ! "[281-rowland] thought [Rowland]281-rowland . " It 's the ideal - strolling up and down on [the very spot commemorated]4202-the very spot commemorated , hearing sympathetic anecdotes from deeply indigenous lips . "[281-rowland] At last , as [they]1656-they passed , [Rowland]281-rowland observed the mournful physiognomy of [Prince Casamassima]273-prince casamassima , and , glancing toward the other end of [the terrace]1625-the terrace , saw that [Roderick]186-roderick and [Christina]192-christina had disappeared from view . [The young man]347-the young man was sitting upright , in an attitude , apparently habitual , of ceremonious rigidity ; but [his]347-the young man lower jaw had fallen and was propped up with [his]347-the young man cane , and [his]347-the young man dull dark eye was fixed upon the angle of [the villa]841-the villa which had just eclipsed [Miss Light]254-miss light and [[her]254-miss light companion]1131-her companion . [His]347-the young man features were grotesque and [his]347-the young man expression vacuous ; but there was a lurking delicacy in [his]347-the young man face which seemed to tell [you]1661-you that nature had been making [Casamassimas]278-casamassimas for a great many centuries , and , though [she]254-miss light adapted [her]254-miss light mould to circumstances , had learned to mix [her]254-miss light material to an extraordinary fineness and to perform the whole operation with extreme smoothness . [The prince]3484-the prince was stupid , [Rowland]281-rowland suspected , but [he]3484-the prince imagined [he]3484-the prince was amiable , and [he]3484-the prince saw that at any rate [he]3484-the prince had the great quality of regarding [himself]3484-the prince in a thoroughly serious light . [Rowland]281-rowland promptly remarked that this was obvious . [He]1680-he saw that [the lady]845-the lady 's irritated nerves demanded comfort from flattering reminiscence , and [he]1680-he assumed designedly the attitude of [a zealous auditor]1682-a zealous auditor . [She]845-the lady began to retail [her]845-the lady efforts , [her]845-the lady hopes , [her]845-the lady dreams , [her]845-the lady presentiments , [her]845-the lady disappointments , in the cause of [[her]845-the lady daughter]491-her daughter 's matrimonial fortunes . It was a long story , and while it was being unfolded , [the prince]3484-the prince continued to pass to and fro , stiffly and solemnly , like a pendulum marking the time allowed for [the young lady]716-the young lady to come to [her]716-the young lady senses . [Mrs. Light]253-mrs. light evidently , at an early period , had gathered [her]253-mrs. light maternal hopes into a sacred sheaf , which [she]253-mrs. light said [her]253-mrs. light prayers and burnt incense to , and treated like a sort of fetish . [They]1686-they had been [her]253-mrs. light religion ; [she]253-mrs. light had none other , and [she]253-mrs. light performed [her]253-mrs. light devotions bravely and cheerily , in the light of day . The poor old fetish had been so caressed and manipulated , so thrust in and out of its niche , so passed from hand to hand , so dressed and undressed , so mumbled and fumbled over , that it had lost by this time much of its early freshness , and seemed a rather battered and disfeatured divinity . But it was still brought forth in moments of trouble to have [its]1687-its tinseled petticoat twisted about and be set up on [its]1687-its altar . [Rowland]281-rowland observed that [Mrs. Light]253-mrs. light had a genuine maternal conscience ; [she]253-mrs. light considered that [she]253-mrs. light had been performing a sacred duty in bringing up [Christina]192-christina to set [her]253-mrs. light cap for [a prince]3813-a prince , and when the future looked dark , [she]253-mrs. light found consolation in thinking that destiny could never have the heart to deal a blow at so deserving [a person]4024-a person . This conscience upside down presented to [Rowland]281-rowland 's fancy a real physical image ; [he]3813-a prince was on the point , half a dozen times , of bursting out laughing .

" [I]253-mrs. light do n't know whether [you]281-rowland believe in presentiments , "[253-mrs. light] said [Mrs. Light]253-mrs. light , " and [I]253-mrs. light do n't care ! [I]253-mrs. light have had one for the last fifteen years . [People]3189-people have laughed at it , but [they]3189-people have n't laughed [me]253-mrs. light out of it . It has been everything to [me]253-mrs. light . [I]253-mrs. light could n't have lived without it . [One]3107-one must believe in something ! It came to [me]253-mrs. light in a flash , when [Christina]192-christina was five years old . [I]253-mrs. light remember the day and the place , as if it were yesterday . [She]192-christina was [a very ugly baby]4284-a very ugly baby ; for the first two years [I]253-mrs. light could hardly bear to look at [her]192-christina , and [I]253-mrs. light used to spoil [my]253-mrs. light own looks with crying about [her]192-christina . [I]253-mrs. light was just a little silly in those days - surely [I]253-mrs. light may say it now - and [I]253-mrs. light was very fond of being amused . If [[my]253-mrs. light daughter]3672-my daughter was ugly , it was not that [she]3672-my daughter resembled [[her]3672-my daughter mamma]1296-her mamma ; [I]253-mrs. light had no lack of amusement . [People]3189-people accused [me]253-mrs. light , [I]253-mrs. light believe , of neglecting [[my]253-mrs. light little girl]4290-my little girl ; if it was so , [I]253-mrs. light ' ve made up for it since . One day [I]253-mrs. light went to drive on [the Pincio]109-the pincio in very low spirits . [A trusted friend]4291-a trusted friend had greatly disappointed [me]253-mrs. light . Of course [my]253-mrs. light face was sad . [I]253-mrs. light rushed with [[my]253-mrs. light child]3898-my child to [the carriage]3735-the carriage , drove [home]349-home post - haste , pulled off [her]3898-my child rags , and , as [I]253-mrs. light may say , wrapped [her]3898-my child in cotton . [I]253-mrs. light had been blind , [I]253-mrs. light had been insane ; [she]3898-my child was [a creature in ten millions]4311-a creature in ten millions , [she]3898-my child was to be [a beauty of beauties]3806-a beauty of beauties , [a priceless treasure]4313-a priceless treasure ! Every day , after that , the certainty grew . From that time [I]253-mrs. light lived only for [[my]253-mrs. light daughter]3672-my daughter . [I]253-mrs. light watched [her]3898-my child , [I]253-mrs. light caressed [her]3898-my child from morning till night , [I]253-mrs. light worshipped [her]3898-my child . [I]253-mrs. light went to see [doctors]4315-doctors about [her]3898-my child , [I]253-mrs. light took every sort of advice . [I]253-mrs. light was determined [she]3898-my child should be perfection . The things that have been done for [that girl]4089-that girl , [sir]3318-sir - [you]3318-sir would n't believe [them]4318-them ; they would make [you]3318-sir smile ! Nothing was spared ; if [I]253-mrs. light had been told that [she]3898-my child must have a bath every morning of molten pearls , [I]253-mrs. light would have found means to give it to [her]3898-my child . [She]3898-my child never raised a finger for [herself]3898-my child , [she]3898-my child breathed nothing but perfumes , [she]3898-my child walked upon velvet . [She]3898-my child never was out of [my]253-mrs. light sight , and from that day to this [I]253-mrs. light have never said a sharp word to [her]3898-my child . By the time [she]3898-my child was ten years old [she]3898-my child was beautiful as [an angel]3803-an angel , and so noticed wherever [we]4320-we went that [I]253-mrs. light had to make [her]3898-my child wear a veil , like [a woman of twenty]4321-a woman of twenty . [Her]3898-my child hair reached down to [her]3898-my child feet ; [her]3898-my child hands were the hands of [a princess]356-a princess . Then [I]253-mrs. light saw that [she]3898-my child was as clever as [she]3898-my child was beautiful , and that [she]3898-my child had only to play [her]3898-my child cards . [She]3898-my child had [masters]4323-masters , [professors]4324-professors , every educational advantage . [She]3898-my child has a wonderful genius for music , and might make [her]3898-my child fortune as [a pianist]4328-a pianist , if it was not made for [her]3898-my child otherwise ! [I]253-mrs. light traveled all over [Europe]1-europe ; [every one]3105-every one told [me]253-mrs. light [she]3898-my child was [a marvel]4330-a marvel . [The director of the opera in [Paris]9-paris]4331-the director of the opera in paris saw [her]3898-my child dance at [a child]421-a child 's party at [Spa]110-spa , and offered [me]253-mrs. light an enormous sum if [I]253-mrs. light would give [her]3898-my child up to [him]4331-the director of the opera in paris and let [him]4331-the director of the opera in paris have [her]3898-my child educated for the ballet . [I]253-mrs. light said , ' No , [I]253-mrs. light thank [you]4331-the director of the opera in paris , [sir]3318-sir ; [she]3898-my child is meant to be something finer than [a princesse de theatre]4334-a princesse de theatre . ' [I]253-mrs. light had a passionate belief that [she]3898-my child might marry absolutely whom [she]3898-my child chose , that [she]3898-my child might be [a princess out and out]4335-a princess out and out . It has never left [me]253-mrs. light till this hour , and [I]253-mrs. light can assure [you]4331-the director of the opera in paris that it has sustained [me]253-mrs. light in many embarrassments . Financial , some of them ; [I]253-mrs. light do n't mind confessing it ! [I]253-mrs. light have raised money on [that girl]4089-that girl 's face ! [I]253-mrs. light ' ve taken [her]4089-that girl to [the Jews]4337-the jews and bade [her]4089-that girl put up [her]4089-that girl veil , and asked if [the mother of [that young lady]4339-that young lady]4338-the mother of that young lady was not safe ! [She]4089-that girl , of course , was too young to understand [me]253-mrs. light . And yet , as [a child]421-a child , [you]4331-the director of the opera in paris would have said [she]4089-that girl knew what was in store for [her]4089-that girl ; before [she]4089-that girl could read , [she]4089-that girl had the manners , the tastes , the instincts of [a little princess]4341-a little princess . [She]4089-that girl would have nothing to do with shabby things or [shabby people]4342-shabby people ; if [she]4089-that girl stained one of [her]4089-that girl frocks , [she]4089-that girl was seized with a kind of frenzy and tore it to pieces . [She]4089-that girl has played at kissing - games with [people who now stand on the steps of thrones]4346-people who now stand on the steps of thrones ! [I]253-mrs. light have gone so far as to think at times that those childish kisses were a sign - a symbol - a portent . [You]4347-you may laugh at [me]253-mrs. light if [you]4347-you like , but have n't such things happened again and again without half as good a cause , and does n't history notoriously repeat itself ? There was [a little Spanish girl]4348-a little spanish girl at [a second - rate [English boarding - school]4350-english boarding - school]4349-a second - rate english boarding - school thirty years ago ! ... [I]253-mrs. light have refused magnificent offers because [I]253-mrs. light believed that somehow or other - if wars and revolutions were needed to bring it about - [we]4356-we should have nothing less than that . There might be another coup d'etat somewhere , and [another brilliant young sovereign]4357-another brilliant young sovereign looking out for [a wife]4358-a wife ! At last , however , "[253-mrs. light] [Mrs. Light]253-mrs. light proceeded with incomparable gravity , ' since the overturning of [the poor king of [Naples]52-naples]1690-the poor king of naples and [that charming queen]1691-that charming queen , and the expulsion of [all those dear little old - fashioned Italian grand - dukes]1692-all those dear little old - fashioned italian grand - dukes , and the dreadful radical talk that is going on all over [the world]483-the world , it has come to seem to [me]0-i that with [Christina]192-christina in such a position [I]0-i should be really very nervous . "[1695-a nobleman of the highest possible rank]

CHAPTER VII . [Saint Cecilia]169-cecilia 's

[Rowland]281-rowland went often to [the Coliseum]1719-the coliseum ; [he]3484-the prince never wearied of [it]1719-the coliseum . One morning , about a month after [his]3484-the prince return from [Frascati]99-frascati , as [he]3484-the prince was strolling across [the vast arena]1720-the vast arena , [he]3484-the prince observed [a young woman]649-a young woman seated on one of the fragments of stone which are ranged along the line of [the ancient parapet]1722-the ancient parapet . It seemed to [him]3484-the prince that [he]3484-the prince had seen [her]649-a young woman before , but [he]3484-the prince was unable to localize [her]649-a young woman face . Passing [her]649-a young woman again , [he]3484-the prince perceived that [one of [the little red - legged French soldiers at that time on guard there]1724-the little red - legged french soldiers at that time on guard there]1723-one of the little red - legged french soldiers at that time on guard there had approached [her]649-a young woman and was gallantly making [himself]1723-one of the little red - legged french soldiers at that time on guard there agreeable . [She]649-a young woman smiled brilliantly , and [Rowland]281-rowland recognized the smile it had always pleased [him]3484-the prince of [a certain comely Assunta , who sometimes opened the door for [[Mrs. Light]253-mrs. light 's visitors]1726-mrs. light 's visitors]1725-a certain comely assunta , who sometimes opened the door for mrs. light 's visitors . [He]3484-the prince wondered what [she]649-a young woman was doing alone in [the Coliseum]1719-the coliseum , and conjectured that [Assunta]282-assunta had [admirers]1728-admirers as well as [[her]282-assunta young mistress]1729-her young mistress , but that , being without the same domiciliary conveniencies , [she]649-a young woman was using this massive heritage of [[her]649-a young woman Latin ancestors]1730-her latin ancestors as a boudoir . In other words , [she]649-a young woman had an appointment with [[her]649-a young woman lover]1731-her lover , who had better , from present appearances , be punctual . It was a long time since [Rowland]281-rowland had ascended to [the ruinous upper tiers of [the great circus]1733-the great circus]1732-the ruinous upper tiers of the great circus , and , as the day was radiant and the distant views promised to be particularly clear , [he]3484-the prince determined to give [himself]3484-the prince the pleasure . [The custodian]1734-the custodian unlocked the great wooden wicket , and [he]3484-the prince climbed through the winding shafts , where [the eager Roman crowds]1735-the eager roman crowds had billowed and trampled , not pausing till [he]3484-the prince reached [the highest accessible point of [the ruin]1737-the ruin]1736-the highest accessible point of the ruin . The views were as fine as [he]3484-the prince had supposed ; the lights on [the Sabine Mountains]1614-the sabine mountains had never been more lovely . [He]3484-the prince gazed to [his]3484-the prince satisfaction and retraced [his]3484-the prince steps . In a moment [he]3484-the prince paused again on an abutment somewhat lower , from which the glance dropped dizzily into the interior . There are chance anfractuosities of ruin in [the upper portions of [the Coliseum]113-the coliseum]1739-the upper portions of the coliseum which offer a very fair imitation of [the rugged face of [an Alpine cliff]1741-an alpine cliff]1740-the rugged face of an alpine cliff . In those days a multitude of delicate flowers and sprays of wild herbage had found a friendly soil in the hoary crevices , and they bloomed and nodded amid the antique masonry as freely as [they]1742-they would have done in [the virgin rock]1743-the virgin rock . [Rowland]281-rowland was turning away , when [he]3484-the prince heard a sound of voices rising up from below . [He]3484-the prince had but to step slightly forward to find [himself]3484-the prince overlooking two persons who had seated [themselves]1744-they on a narrow ledge , in a sunny corner . [They]1744-they had apparently had an eye to extreme privacy , but [they]1744-they had not observed that [their]1744-they position was commanded by [Rowland]281-rowland 's stand - point . [One of [these airy adventurers]1746-these airy adventurers]1745-one of these airy adventurers was [a lady]1205-a lady , thickly veiled , so that , even if [he]3484-the prince had not been standing directly above [her]1205-a lady , [Rowland]281-rowland could not have seen [her]1205-a lady face . [The other]1748-the other was [a young man]470-a young man , whose face was also invisible , but who , as [Rowland]281-rowland stood there , gave a toss of [his]3484-the prince clustering locks which was equivalent to the signature - Roderick [Hudson]172-mr. hudson . A moment 's reflection , hereupon , satisfied [him]3484-the prince of the identity of [the lady]845-the lady . [He]3484-the prince had been unjust to poor [Assunta]282-assunta , sitting patient in [the gloomy arena]1751-the gloomy arena ; [she]282-assunta had not come on [her]282-assunta own errand . [Rowland]281-rowland 's discoveries made [him]3484-the prince hesitate . Should [he]3484-the prince retire as noiselessly as possible , or should [he]3484-the prince call out a friendly good morning ? While [he]3484-the prince was debating the question , [he]3484-the prince found [himself]3484-the prince distinctly hearing [[his]3484-the prince friends]714-his friends ' words . They were of such a nature as to make [him]3484-the prince unwilling to retreat , and yet to make it awkward to be discovered in a position where it would be apparent that [he]3484-the prince had heard [them]714-his friends .

" If what [you]281-rowland say is true , "[192-christina] said [Christina]192-christina , with [her]192-christina usual soft deliberateness - it made [her]192-christina words rise with peculiar distinctness to [Rowland]281-rowland 's ear - " [you]281-rowland are simply weak . " Incomplete , then ! "[192-christina] said [Christina]192-christina , with a laugh . " It 's the same thing , so long as it keeps [you]281-rowland from splendid achievement . " What have [you]192-christina dreamed of ? "[186-roderick]

" Ah , [the man who is strong with what [I]192-christina call strength]4383-the man who is strong with what i call strength , "[192-christina] [Christina]192-christina replied , " would neither rise nor fall by anything [I]192-christina could say ! [I]192-christina am [a poor , weak woman]4384-a poor , weak woman ; [I]192-christina have no strength [myself]192-christina , and [I]192-christina can give no strength . [I]192-christina am a miserable medley of vanity and folly . [I]192-christina am silly , [I]192-christina am ignorant , [I]192-christina am affected , [I]192-christina am false . [I]192-christina am the fruit of a horrible education , sown on a worthless soil . [I]192-christina am all that , and yet [I]192-christina believe [I]192-christina have one merit ! [I]192-christina should know a great character when [I]192-christina saw it , and [I]192-christina should delight in it with a generosity which would do something toward the remission of [my]192-christina sins . For [a man who should really give [me]192-christina a certain feeling - which [I]192-christina have never had , but which [I]192-christina should know when it came]4385-a man who should really give me a certain feeling - which i have never had , but which i should know when it came - [I]192-christina would send [Prince Casamassima]273-prince casamassima and [[his]273-prince casamassima millions]4386-his millions to perdition . [I]192-christina do n't know what [you]4387-you think of [me]192-christina for saying all this ; [I]192-christina suppose [we]4388-we have not climbed up here under the skies to play propriety .
