"[281-rowland]

" This is happiness , this present , palpable moment , "[186-roderick] said [Roderick]186-roderick ; " though [you]186-roderick have such a genius for saying the things that torture [me]186-roderick ! "[186-roderick]

" It 's greater happiness than [you]186-roderick deserve , then ! [You]186-roderick have never chosen , [I]186-roderick say ; [you]186-roderick have been afraid to choose . [You]186-roderick have never really faced the fact that [you]186-roderick are false , that [you]186-roderick have broken [your]186-roderick faith . [You]186-roderick have never looked at it and seen that it was hideous , and yet said , ' No matter , [I]186-roderick 'll brave the penalty , [I]186-roderick 'll bear the shame ! ' [You]186-roderick have closed [your]186-roderick eyes ; [you]186-roderick have tried to stifle remembrance , to persuade [yourself]186-roderick that [you]186-roderick were not behaving as badly as [you]186-roderick seemed to be , and there would be some way , after all , of compassing bliss and yet escaping trouble . [You]186-roderick have faltered and drifted , [you]186-roderick have gone on from accident to accident , and [I]186-roderick am sure that at this present moment [you]186-roderick ca n't tell what it is [you]186-roderick really desire ! "[186-roderick]

[Roderick]186-roderick was sitting with [his]186-roderick knees drawn up and bent , and [his]186-roderick hands clapsed around [his]186-roderick legs . [He]186-roderick bent [his]186-roderick head and rested [his]186-roderick forehead on [his]186-roderick knees .

[Christina]192-christina went on with a sort of infernal calmness : " [I]192-christina believe that , really , [you]186-roderick do n't greatly care for [[your]186-roderick friend]3646-your friend in [America]25-america any more than [you]186-roderick do for [me]192-christina . [You]186-roderick are one of [the men who care only for [themselves]4396-the men who care only for themselves and for what they can make of themselves and for what [they]4396-the men who care only for themselves and for what they can make of themselves can make of [themselves]4396-the men who care only for themselves and for what they can make of themselves]4396-the men who care only for themselves and for what they can make of themselves . That 's very well when [they]4396-the men who care only for themselves and for what they can make of themselves can make something great , and [I]192-christina could interest [myself]192-christina in [a man of extraordinary power who should wish to turn all [his]4397-a man of extraordinary power who should wish to turn all his passions to account passions to account]4397-a man of extraordinary power who should wish to turn all his passions to account . But if the power should turn out to be , after all , rather ordinary ? Fancy feeling [one]3107-one 's self ground in the mill of a third - rate talent ! If [you]186-roderick have doubts about [yourself]186-roderick , [I]192-christina ca n't reassure [you]186-roderick ; [I]192-christina have too many doubts [myself]192-christina , about everything in this weary world . [You]186-roderick have gone up like a rocket , in [your]186-roderick profession , [they]4399-they tell [me]192-christina ; are [you]186-roderick going to come down like the stick ? [I]192-christina do n't pretend to know ; [I]192-christina repeat frankly what [I]192-christina have said before - that all modern sculpture seems to [me]192-christina weak , and that the only things [I]192-christina care for are some of the most battered of the antiques of [the Vatican]12-the vatican . No , no , [I]192-christina ca n't reassure [you]186-roderick ; and when [you]186-roderick tell [me]192-christina - with a confidence in [my]192-christina discretion of which , certainly , [I]192-christina am duly sensible - that at times [you]186-roderick feel terribly small , why , [I]192-christina can only answer , ' Ah , then , [[my]192-christina poor friend]4400-my poor friend , [I]192-christina am afraid [you]186-roderick are small . ' The language [I]192-christina should like to hear , from [a certain person]4401-a certain person , would be the language of absolute decision . "[192-christina]

[Roderick]186-roderick raised [his]186-roderick head , but [he]186-roderick said nothing ; [he]186-roderick seemed to be exchanging a long glance with [[his]186-roderick companion]555-his companion . The result of it was to make [him]186-roderick fling [himself]186-roderick back with an inarticulate murmur . [Rowland]281-rowland , admonished by the silence , was on the point of turning away , but [he]186-roderick was arrested by a gesture of [the young girl]659-the young girl . [She]281-rowland pointed for a moment into the blue air . [Roderick]186-roderick followed the direction of [her]281-rowland gesture .

" Is that little flower [we]4402-we see outlined against that dark niche , "[281-rowland] [she]281-rowland asked , " as intensely blue as it looks through [my]281-rowland veil ? "[281-rowland] [She]281-rowland spoke apparently with the amiable design of directing the conversation into a less painful channel .

[Rowland]281-rowland , from where [he]186-roderick stood , could see the flower [she]281-rowland meant - a delicate plant of radiant hue , which sprouted from the top of an immense fragment of wall some twenty feet from [[Christina]192-christina 's place]1756-christina 's place .

[Roderick]186-roderick turned [his]186-roderick head and looked at it without answering . At last , glancing round , " Put up [your]192-christina veil ! "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick said . [Christina]192-christina complied . " Does it look as blue now ? "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick asked .

" Ah , what a lovely color ! "[192-christina] [she]192-christina murmured , leaning [her]192-christina head on one side .

" Would [you]186-roderick like to have it ? "[192-christina]

[She]192-christina stared a moment and then broke into a light laugh .

" Would [you]192-christina like to have it ? "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick repeated in a ringing voice .

" Do n't look as if [you]186-roderick would eat [me]192-christina up , "[192-christina] [she]192-christina answered . " It 's harmless if [I]192-christina say yes ! "[192-christina]

[Roderick]186-roderick rose to [his]186-roderick feet and stood looking at the little flower . It was separated from the ledge on which [he]186-roderick stood by a rugged surface of vertical wall , which dropped straight into the dusky vaults behind [the arena]1757-the arena . Suddenly [he]186-roderick took off [his]186-roderick hat and flung it behind [him]186-roderick . [Christina]192-christina then sprang to [her]192-christina feet .

" [I]186-roderick will bring it [you]192-christina , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick said .

[She]192-christina seized [his]186-roderick arm . " Are [you]186-roderick crazy ? Do [you]186-roderick mean to kill [yourself]186-roderick ? "[192-christina]

" [I]192-christina shall not kill [myself]192-christina . Sit down ! "[192-christina]

" Excuse [me]192-christina . Not till [you]186-roderick do ! "[192-christina] And [she]192-christina grasped [his]186-roderick arm with both hands .

[Roderick]186-roderick shook [her]192-christina off and pointed with a violent gesture to [her]192-christina former place . " Go there ! "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick cried fiercely .

" [You]186-roderick can never , never ! "[192-christina] [she]192-christina murmured beseechingly , clasping [her]192-christina hands . " [I]192-christina implore [you]186-roderick ! "[192-christina]

[Roderick]186-roderick turned and looked at [her]192-christina , and then in a voice which [Rowland]281-rowland had never heard [him]186-roderick use , a voice almost thunderous , a voice which awakened the echoes of the mighty ruin , [he]186-roderick repeated , " Sit down ! "[186-roderick] [She]192-christina hesitated a moment and then [she]192-christina dropped on the ground and buried [her]192-christina face in [her]192-christina hands .

[Rowland]281-rowland had seen all this , and [he]186-roderick saw more . [He]186-roderick saw [Roderick]186-roderick clasp in [his]186-roderick left arm the jagged corner of the vertical partition along which [he]186-roderick proposed to pursue [his]186-roderick crazy journey , stretch out [his]186-roderick leg , and feel for a resting - place for [his]186-roderick foot . [Rowland]281-rowland had measured with a glance the possibility of [his]186-roderick sustaining [himself]186-roderick , and pronounced it absolutely nil . The wall was garnished with a series of narrow projections , the remains apparently of a brick cornice supporting the arch of a vault which had long since collapsed . It was by lodging [his]186-roderick toes on these loose brackets and grasping with [his]186-roderick hands at certain mouldering protuberances on a level with [his]186-roderick head , that [Roderick]186-roderick intended to proceed . The relics of the cornice were utterly worthless as a support . [Rowland]281-rowland had observed this , and yet , for a moment , [he]186-roderick had hesitated . If the thing were possible , [he]186-roderick felt a sudden admiring glee at the thought of [Roderick]186-roderick 's doing it . It would be finely done , it would be gallant , it would have a sort of masculine eloquence as an answer to [Christina]192-christina 's sinister persiflage . But it was not possible ! [Rowland]281-rowland left [his]186-roderick place with a bound , and scrambled down [some neighboring steps]1758-some neighboring steps , and the next moment a stronger pair of hands than [Christina]192-christina 's were laid upon [Roderick]186-roderick 's shoulder .

[He]186-roderick turned , staring , pale and angry . [Christina]192-christina rose , pale and staring , too , but beautiful in [her]192-christina wonder and alarm . " [[My]281-rowland dear]3110-my dear [Roderick]186-roderick , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland , " [I]281-rowland am only preventing [you]186-roderick from doing a very foolish thing . That 's an exploit for spiders , not for [young sculptors of promise]4404-young sculptors of promise . "[281-rowland]

[Roderick]186-roderick wiped [his]186-roderick forehead , looked back at the wall , and then closed [his]186-roderick eyes , as if with a spasm , of retarded dizziness . " [I]186-roderick wo n't resist [you]192-christina , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick said . " But [I]186-roderick have made [you]192-christina obey , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick added , turning to [Christina]192-christina . " Am [I]186-roderick weak now ? "[186-roderick]

[She]192-christina had recovered [her]192-christina composure ; [she]192-christina looked straight past [him]186-roderick and addressed [Rowland]281-rowland : " Be so good as to show [me]192-christina the way out of [this horrible place]4405-this horrible place ! "[192-christina]

[He]186-roderick helped [her]192-christina back into [the corridor]1759-the corridor ; [Roderick]186-roderick followed after a short interval . Of course , as [they]1760-they were descending the steps , came questions for [Rowland]281-rowland to answer , and more or less surprise . Where had [he]186-roderick come from ? how happened [he]186-roderick to have appeared at just that moment ? [Rowland]281-rowland answered that [he]186-roderick had been rambling overhead , and that , looking out of an aperture , [he]186-roderick had seen [a gentleman preparing to undertake a preposterous gymnastic feat]1761-a gentleman preparing to undertake a preposterous gymnastic feat , and [a lady]1205-a lady swooning away in consequence . [Interference]283-interference seemed justifiable , and [he]186-roderick had made it as prompt as possible . [Roderick]186-roderick was far from hanging [his]186-roderick head , like [a man who has been caught in the perpetration of an extravagant folly]1763-a man who has been caught in the perpetration of an extravagant folly ; but if [he]186-roderick held it more erect than usual [Rowland]281-rowland believed that this was much less because [he]186-roderick had made a show of personal daring than because [he]186-roderick had triumphantly proved to [Christina]192-christina that , like [a certain person [she]192-christina had dreamed of]1764-a certain person she had dreamed of , [he]186-roderick too could speak the language of decision . [Christina]192-christina descended to [the arena]1757-the arena in silence , apparently occupied with [her]192-christina own thoughts . [She]192-christina betrayed no sense of the privacy of [her]192-christina interview with [Roderick]186-roderick needing an explanation . [Rowland]281-rowland had seen stranger things in [New York]21-new york ! The only evidence of [her]192-christina recent agitation was that , on being joined by [[her]192-christina maid]1766-her maid , [she]192-christina declared that [she]192-christina was unable to walk [home]349-home ; [she]192-christina must have [a carriage]4293-a carriage . [A fiacre]1769-a fiacre was found resting in the shadow of [the Arch of [Constantine]114-constantine]1770-the arch of constantine , and [Rowland]281-rowland suspected that after [she]192-christina had got into it [she]192-christina disburdened [herself]192-christina , under [her]192-christina veil , of a few natural tears .

[Rowland]281-rowland had played eavesdropper to so good a purpose that [he]186-roderick might justly have omitted the ceremony of denouncing [himself]186-roderick to [Roderick]186-roderick . [He]186-roderick preferred , however , to let [him]186-roderick know that [he]186-roderick had overheard a portion of [his]186-roderick talk with [Christina]192-christina .

" Of course it seems to [you]281-rowland , "[186-roderick] [Roderick]186-roderick said , " a proof that [I]186-roderick am utterly infatuated . "[186-roderick]

" [Miss Light]254-miss light seemed to [me]281-rowland to know very well how far [she]254-miss light could go , "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland answered . " [She]254-miss light was twisting [you]186-roderick round [her]254-miss light finger . [I]281-rowland do n't think [she]254-miss light exactly meant to defy [you]186-roderick ; but [your]186-roderick crazy pursuit of that flower was a proof that [she]254-miss light could go all lengths in the way of making a fool of [you]186-roderick . "[281-rowland]

" Yes , "[186-roderick] said [Roderick]186-roderick , meditatively ; ' [she]1771-she is making a fool of [me]0-i . "[1771-she]

" And what do [you]186-roderick expect to come of it ? "[281-rowland]

" Nothing good ! "[186-roderick] And [Roderick]186-roderick put [his]186-roderick hands into [his]186-roderick pockets and looked as if [he]186-roderick had announced the most colorless fact in [the world]483-the world .

" And in the light of [your]281-rowland late interview , what do [you]281-rowland make of [[your]281-rowland young lady]4406-your young lady ? "[186-roderick]

" If [I]186-roderick could tell [you]281-rowland that , it would be plain sailing . But [she]1771-she 'll not tell [me]186-roderick again [I]186-roderick am weak ! "[186-roderick]

" Are [you]281-rowland very sure [you]281-rowland are not weak ? "[186-roderick]

" [I]186-roderick may be , but [she]1771-she shall never know it . "[186-roderick]

[Rowland]281-rowland said no more until [they]1773-they reached [the Corso]53-the corso , when [he]186-roderick asked [[his]186-roderick companion]555-his companion whether [he]186-roderick was going to [[his]186-roderick studio]873-his studio .

[Roderick]186-roderick started out of a reverie and passed [his]186-roderick hands over [his]186-roderick eyes . " Oh no , [I]186-roderick ca n't settle down to work after such a scene as that . [I]186-roderick was not afraid of breaking [my]186-roderick neck then , but [I]186-roderick feel all in a tremor now . [I]186-roderick will go - [I]186-roderick will go and sit in the sun on [the Pincio]109-the pincio ! "[186-roderick]

" Promise [me]281-rowland this , first , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland , very solemnly : " that the next time [you]186-roderick meet [Miss Light]254-miss light , it shall be on [the earth]3264-the earth and not in the air . "[281-rowland]

Since [his]186-roderick return from [Frascati]99-frascati , [Roderick]186-roderick had been working doggedly at the statue ordered by [Mr. Leavenworth]269-mr. leavenworth . To [Rowland]281-rowland 's eye [he]186-roderick had made a very fair beginning , but [he]186-roderick had [himself]186-roderick insisted , from the first , that [he]186-roderick liked neither [[his]186-roderick subject]1776-his subject nor [[his]186-roderick patron]1453-his patron , and that it was impossible to feel any warmth of interest in a work which was to be incorporated into the ponderous personality of [Mr. Leavenworth]269-mr. leavenworth . It was all against the grain ; [he]186-roderick wrought without love . Nevertheless after a fashion [he]186-roderick wrought , and the figure grew beneath [his]186-roderick hands . [[Miss Blanchard]216-miss blanchard 's friend]1778-miss blanchard 's friend was ordering works of art on every side , and [[his]186-roderick purveyors]1779-his purveyors were in many cases persons whom [Roderick]186-roderick declared it was infamy to be paired with . There had been [grand tailors]1780-grand tailors , [he]186-roderick said , who declined to make [you]1781-you a coat unless [you]1781-you got the hat [you]1781-you were to wear with it from [an artist of [their]1780-grand tailors own choosing]1782-an artist of their own choosing . It seemed to [him]186-roderick that [he]186-roderick had an equal right to exact that [his]186-roderick statue should not form part of the same system of ornament as the " Pearl of [Perugia]115-perugia , "[186-roderick] a picture by [an American confrere who had , in [Mr. Leavenworth]269-mr. leavenworth 's opinion]1783-an american confrere who had , in mr. leavenworth 's opinion , a prodigious eye for color . As [a customer]3661-a customer , [Mr. Leavenworth]269-mr. leavenworth used to drop into [[Roderick]186-roderick 's studio]574-roderick 's studio , to see how things were getting on , and give a friendly hint or so . [He]186-roderick would seat [himself]186-roderick squarely , plant [his]186-roderick gold - topped cane between [his]186-roderick legs , which [he]186-roderick held very much apart , rest [his]186-roderick large white hands on the head , and enunciate the principles of spiritual art , as [he]186-roderick hoisted them one by one , as [you]1786-you might say , out of the depths of [his]186-roderick moral consciousness . [His]186-roderick benignant and imperturbable pomposity gave [Roderick]186-roderick the sense of suffocating beneath a large fluffy bolster , and the worst of the matter was that [the good gentleman]1787-the good gentleman 's placid vanity had an integument whose toughness no sarcastic shaft could pierce . [Roderick]186-roderick admitted that in thinking over the tribulations of struggling genius , the danger of dying of over - patronage had never occurred to [him]186-roderick .

The deterring effect of the episode of [the Coliseum]1719-the coliseum was apparently of long continuance ; if [Roderick]186-roderick 's nerves had been shaken [his]186-roderick hand needed time to recover its steadiness . [He]186-roderick cultivated composure upon principles of [his]186-roderick own ; by frequenting entertainments from which [he]186-roderick returned at four o'clock in the morning , and lapsing into habits which might fairly be called irregular . [He]186-roderick had hitherto made [few friends]1789-few friends among [the artistic fraternity]1017-the artistic fraternity ; chiefly because [he]186-roderick had taken no trouble about it , and there was in [his]186-roderick demeanor an elastic independence of the favor of [[his]186-roderick fellow - mortals]1791-his fellow - mortals which made social advances on [his]186-roderick own part peculiarly necessary . [Rowland]281-rowland had told [him]186-roderick more than once that [he]186-roderick ought to fraternize a trifle more with [the other artists]1792-the other artists , and [he]186-roderick had always answered that [he]186-roderick had not the smallest objection to fraternizing : let [them]1792-the other artists come ! But [they]1792-the other artists came on rare occasions , and [Roderick]186-roderick was not punctilious about returning [their]1792-the other artists visits . [He]186-roderick declared there was not one of [them]1792-the other artists whose works gave [him]186-roderick the smallest desire to make acquaintance with the insides of [their]1792-the other artists heads . For [Gloriani]213-gloriani [he]186-roderick professed a superb contempt , and , having been once to look at [his]186-roderick wares , never crossed [his]186-roderick threshold again . [The only one of the fraternity for whom by [his]186-roderick own admission [he]186-roderick cared a straw]1793-the only one of the fraternity for whom by his own admission he cared a straw was little [Singleton]214-singleton ; but [he]186-roderick expressed [his]186-roderick regard only in a kind of sublime hilarity whenever [he]186-roderick encountered [this humble genius]1794-this humble genius , and quite forgot [his]186-roderick existence in the intervals . [He]186-roderick had never been to see [him]214-singleton , but [Singleton]214-singleton edged [his]214-singleton way , from time to time , timidly , into [[Roderick]186-roderick 's studio]574-roderick 's studio , and agreed with characteristic modesty that [brilliant fellows]1796-brilliant fellows like [the sculptor]524-the sculptor might consent to receive homage , but could hardly be expected to render it . [Roderick]186-roderick never exactly accepted homage , and apparently did not quite observe whether [poor Singleton]214-singleton spoke in admiration or in blame . [Roderick]186-roderick 's taste as to [companions]4155-companions was singularly capricious . There were [very good fellows]1799-very good fellows , who were disposed to cultivate [him]186-roderick , who bored [him]186-roderick to death ; and there were others , in whom even [Rowland]281-rowland 's good - nature was unable to discover a pretext for tolerance , in whom [he]186-roderick appeared to find the highest social qualities . [He]186-roderick used to give the most fantastic reasons for [his]186-roderick likes and dislikes . [He]186-roderick would declare [he]186-roderick could n't speak a civil word to [a man who brushed [his]186-roderick hair in a certain fashion]1800-a man who brushed his hair in a certain fashion , and [he]186-roderick would explain [his]186-roderick unaccountable fancy for [an individual of imperceptible merit]1801-an individual of imperceptible merit by telling [you]1802-you that [he]186-roderick had [an ancestor who in the thirteenth century]1803-an ancestor who in the thirteenth century had walled up [[his]186-roderick wife]3167-his wife alive . " [I]186-roderick like to talk to [a man whose ancestor has walled up [[his]186-roderick wife]3167-his wife alive]4408-a man whose ancestor has walled up his wife alive , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick would say . " [You]1802-you may not see the fun of it , and think poor P - - is [a very dull fellow]4410-a very dull fellow . It 's very possible ; [I]186-roderick do n't ask [you]1802-you to admire [him]4410-a very dull fellow . But , for reasons of [my]186-roderick own , [I]186-roderick like to have [him]4410-a very dull fellow about . [The old fellow]4411-the old fellow left [her]3167-his wife for three days with [her]3167-his wife face uncovered , and placed a long mirror opposite to [her]3167-his wife , so that [she]3167-his wife could see , as [he]4411-the old fellow said , if [her]3167-his wife gown was a fit ! "[186-roderick]

[His]186-roderick relish for an odd flavor in [[his]186-roderick friends]714-his friends had led [him]186-roderick to make the acquaintance of [a number of people outside of [[Rowland]281-rowland 's well - ordered circle]1807-rowland 's well - ordered circle]1806-a number of people outside of rowland 's well - ordered circle , and [he]186-roderick made no secret of [their]1806-a number of people outside of rowland 's well - ordered circle being very queer fish . [He]186-roderick formed an intimacy , among others , with [a crazy fellow who had come to [Rome]4-rome as an emissary of [one of [the Central American republics]1810-the central american republics]1809-one of the central american republics]1808-a crazy fellow who had come to rome as an emissary of one of the central american republics , to drive some ecclesiastical bargain with [the papal government]1811-the papal government . [The Pope]284-the pope had given [him]186-roderick the cold shoulder , but since [he]186-roderick had not prospered as [a diplomatist]1812-a diplomatist , [he]186-roderick had sought compensation as [a man of [the world]483-the world]1813-a man of the world , and [[his]186-roderick great flamboyant curricle and [negro lackeys]1816-negro lackeys]1815-his great flamboyant curricle and negro lackeys were for several weeks one of the striking ornaments of [the Pincian]259-the pincian . [He]186-roderick spoke a queer jargon of Italian , Spanish , French , and English , humorously relieved with scraps of ecclesiastical Latin , and to [those who inquired of [Roderick]186-roderick what [he]186-roderick found to interest [him]186-roderick in such a fantastic jackanapes , [the latter]652-the latter would reply , looking at [[his]186-roderick interlocutor]1819-his interlocutor with [his]186-roderick lucid blue eyes]1817-those who inquired of roderick what he found to interest him in such a fantastic jackanapes , the latter would reply , looking at his interlocutor with his lucid blue eyes , that it was worth any sacrifice to hear [him]186-roderick talk nonsense ! [The two]1820-the two had gone together one night to a ball given by [a lady of some renown in [the Spanish colony]1822-the spanish colony]1821-a lady of some renown in the spanish colony , and very late , on [his]186-roderick way [home]349-home , [Roderick]186-roderick came up to [[Rowland]281-rowland 's rooms]1824-rowland 's rooms , in whose windows [he]186-roderick had seen a light . [Rowland]281-rowland was going to bed , but [Roderick]186-roderick flung [himself]186-roderick into an armchair and chattered for an hour . [The friends of [the Costa Rican envoy]1826-the costa rican envoy]1825-the friends of the costa rican envoy were as amusing as [himself]186-roderick , and in very much the same line . [The mistress of [the house]3246-the house]1827-the mistress of the house had worn a yellow satin dress , and gold heels to [her]1827-the mistress of the house slippers , and at the close of the entertainment had sent for a pair of castanets , tucked up [her]1827-the mistress of the house petticoats , and danced a fandango , while [the gentlemen]1472-the gentlemen sat cross - legged on the floor . " It was awfully low , "[186-roderick] [Roderick]186-roderick said ; " all of a sudden [I]186-roderick perceived it , and bolted . Nothing of that kind ever amuses [me]186-roderick to the end : before it 's half over it bores [me]186-roderick to death ; it makes [me]186-roderick sick . Hang it , why ca n't [a poor fellow]4412-a poor fellow enjoy things in peace ? [My]186-roderick illusions are all broken - winded ; they wo n't carry [me]186-roderick twenty paces ! [I]186-roderick ca n't laugh and forget ; [my]186-roderick laugh dies away before it begins . [[Your]4413-your friend]3646-your friend [Stendhal]285-stendhal writes on [his]285-stendhal book - covers [I]186-roderick never got farther that [he]285-stendhal has seen too early in life la beaute parfaite . [I]186-roderick do n't know how early [he]285-stendhal saw it ; [I]186-roderick saw it before [I]186-roderick was born - in another state of being ! [I]186-roderick ca n't describe it positively ; [I]186-roderick can only say [I]186-roderick do n't find it anywhere now . Not at the bottom of champagne glasses ; not , strange as it may seem , in that extra half - yard or so of shoulder that [some women]4415-some women have [their]4415-some women ball - dresses cut to expose . [I]186-roderick do n't find it at merry supper - tables , where half [a dozen ugly men with pomatumed heads are rapidly growing uglier still with heat and wine]4416-a dozen ugly men with pomatumed heads are rapidly growing uglier still with heat and wine ; not when [I]186-roderick come away and walk through [these squalid black streets]4417-these squalid black streets , and go out into [the Forum]4418-the forum and see a few old battered stone posts standing there like gnawed bones stuck into the earth . Everything is mean and dusky and shabby , and [the men]4419-the men and [women who make up this so - called brilliant society]4420-women who make up this so - called brilliant society are [the meanest and shabbiest of all]4421-the meanest and shabbiest of all . [They]4419-the men have no real spontaneity ; [they]4419-the men are [all cowards]4422-all cowards and [popinjays]4423-popinjays . [They]4419-the men have no more dignity than so many grasshoppers . Nothing is good but one ! "[186-roderick] And [he]1830-he jumped up and stood looking at one of [his]1830-he statues , which shone vaguely across [the room]487-the room in the dim lamplight .

" Yes , do tell [us]4424-us , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland , " what to hold on by ! "[281-rowland]

" Those things of [mine]281-rowland were tolerably good , "[1830-he] [he]1830-he answered . " But [my]1830-he idea was better - and that 's what [I]1830-he mean ! "[1830-he]

[Rowland]281-rowland said nothing . [He]1830-he was willing to wait for [Roderick]186-roderick to complete the circle of [his]186-roderick metamorphoses , but [he]1830-he had no desire to officiate as [chorus to the play]1832-chorus to the play . If [Roderick]186-roderick chose to fish in [troubled waters]1833-troubled waters , [he]186-roderick must land [his]186-roderick prizes [himself]186-roderick .

" [You]281-rowland think [I]652-the latter ' m [an impudent humbug]4425-an impudent humbug , "[652-the latter] [the latter]652-the latter said at last , " coming up to moralize at this hour of the night . [You]281-rowland think [I]652-the latter want to throw dust into [your]281-rowland eyes , to put [you]281-rowland off the scent . That 's [your]281-rowland eminently rational view of the case . [Christina]192-christina flushed faintly ; then , very gently , " [I]192-christina am not so bad as [you]281-rowland think , "[192-christina] [she]192-christina said .

" It is not a question of badness ; it is a question of whether circumstances do n't make the thing an extreme improbability . "[192-christina]

" Worse and worse . [I]192-christina can be bullied , then , or bribed ! "[192-christina]

" [You]192-christina are not so candid , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland , " as [you]192-christina pretend to be . [My]281-rowland feeling is this . [Hudson]172-mr. hudson , as [I]281-rowland understand [him]172-mr. hudson , does not need , as [an artist , the stimulus of strong emotion , of passion]4482-an artist , the stimulus of strong emotion , of passion . [He]172-mr. hudson 's better without it ; [he]172-mr. hudson 's emotional and passionate enough when [he]172-mr. hudson 's left to [himself]172-mr. hudson . The sooner passion is at rest , therefore , the sooner [he]172-mr. hudson will settle down to work , and the fewer emotions [he]172-mr. hudson has that are mere emotions and nothing more , the better for [him]172-mr. hudson . If [you]192-christina cared for [him]172-mr. hudson enough to marry [him]172-mr. hudson , [I]281-rowland should have nothing to say ; [I]281-rowland would never venture to interfere . But [I]281-rowland strongly suspect [you]192-christina do n't , and therefore [I]281-rowland would suggest , most respectfully , that [you]192-christina should let [him]172-mr. hudson alone . "[281-rowland]

" And if [I]192-christina let [him]172-mr. hudson alone , as [you]192-christina say , all will be well with [him]172-mr. hudson for ever more ? "[192-christina]

" Not immediately and not absolutely , but things will be easier . [He]172-mr. hudson will be better able to concentrate [himself]172-mr. hudson . "[281-rowland]

" What is [he]172-mr. hudson doing now ? Wherein does [he]172-mr. hudson dissatisfy [you]192-christina ? "[192-christina]

" [I]281-rowland can hardly say . [He]172-mr. hudson 's like a watch that 's running down . [He]172-mr. hudson is moody , desultory , idle , irregular , fantastic . "[281-rowland]

" Heavens , what a list ! And it 's all poor [me]192-christina ? "[192-christina]

" No , not all . But [you]192-christina are a part of it , and [I]281-rowland turn to [you]192-christina because [you]192-christina are a more tangible , sensible , responsible cause than [the others]4483-the others . "[281-rowland]

[Christina]192-christina raised [her]192-christina hand to [her]192-christina eyes , and bent [her]192-christina head thoughtfully . [Rowland]281-rowland was puzzled to measure the effect of [his]1882-you venture ; [she]192-christina rather surprised [him]1882-you by [her]192-christina gentleness . At last , without moving , " If [I]192-christina were to marry [him]1882-you , "[192-christina] [she]192-christina asked , " what would have become of [[his]1882-you fiancee]4484-his fiancee ? "[192-christina]

" [I]192-christina am bound to suppose that [she]4484-his fiancee would be extremely unhappy . "[192-christina]

[Christina]192-christina said nothing more , and [Rowland]281-rowland , to let [her]192-christina make [her]192-christina reflections , left [his]1882-you place and strolled away . [Poor Assunta]282-assunta , sitting patiently on a stone bench , and unprovided , on this occasion , with military consolation , gave [him]1882-you a bright , frank smile , which might have been construed as an expression of regret for [herself]282-assunta , and of sympathy for [[her]282-assunta mistress]1867-her mistress . [Rowland]281-rowland presently seated [himself]281-rowland again near [Christina]192-christina .

" What do [you]1882-you think , "[192-christina] [she]192-christina asked , looking at [him]1882-you , " of [[your]1882-you friend]3646-your friend 's infidelity ? "[192-christina]

" [I]192-christina do n't like it . "[192-christina]

" Was [he]1882-you very much in love with [her]3646-your friend ? "[192-christina]

" [He]1882-you asked [her]3646-your friend to marry [him]1882-you . [You]1882-you may judge . "[192-christina]

" Is [she]3646-your friend rich ? "[192-christina]

" No , [she]3646-your friend is poor . "[192-christina]

" Is [she]3646-your friend very much in love with [him]1882-you ? "[192-christina]

" [I]192-christina know [her]3646-your friend too little to say . "[192-christina]

[She]192-christina paused again , and then resumed : " [You]1882-you have settled in [your]1882-you mind , then , that [I]192-christina will never seriously listen to [him]1882-you ? "[192-christina]

" [I]192-christina think it unlikely , until the contrary is proved . "[192-christina]

" How shall it be proved ? How do [you]192-christina know what passes between [us]4486-us ? "[192-christina]

" [I]192-christina can judge , of course , but from appearance ; but , like [you]1882-you , [I]192-christina am [an observer]3419-an observer . [Hudson]172-mr. hudson has not at all the air of [a prosperous suitor]4488-a prosperous suitor . "[192-christina]

" If [he]1882-you is depressed , there is a reason . [He]1882-you has a bad conscience . [One]3107-one must hope so , at least . On the other hand , simply as [a friend]3219-a friend , "[192-christina] [she]192-christina continued gently , " [you]281-rowland think [I]192-christina can do [him]1882-you no good ? "[192-christina]

The humility of [her]192-christina tone , combined with [her]192-christina beauty , as [she]192-christina made this remark , was inexpressibly touching , and [Rowland]281-rowland had an uncomfortable sense of being put at a disadvantage . " There are doubtless many good things [you]1882-you might do , if [you]1882-you had proper opportunity , "[1884-he] [he]1884-he said . " But [you]1882-you seem to be sailing with a current which leaves [you]1882-you little leisure for quiet benevolence . [You]1882-you live in the whirl and hurry of a world into which [a poor artist]4491-a poor artist can hardly find it to [his]4491-a poor artist advantage to follow [you]1882-you . "[1884-he]

" In plain English , [I]192-christina am hopelessly frivolous . [You]281-rowland put it very generously . "[192-christina]

" [I]281-rowland wo n't hesitate to say all [my]281-rowland thought , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland . " For better or worse , [you]1882-you seem to [me]281-rowland to belong , both by character and by circumstance , to what is called [the world]483-the world , [the great world]4493-the great world . [You]1882-you are made to ornament [it]4493-the great world magnificently . [You]1882-you are not made to be [[an artist]3186-an artist 's wife]4495-an artist 's wife . "[281-rowland]

" [I]192-christina see . But even from [your]1882-you point of view , that would depend upon [the artist]3153-the artist . Extraordinary talent might make [him]3153-the artist a member of [the great world]4493-the great world ! "[192-christina]

[Rowland]281-rowland smiled . " That is very true . "[281-rowland]

" If , as it is , "[192-christina] [Christina]192-christina continued in a moment , " [you]1882-you take a low view of [me]192-christina - no , [you]1882-you need n't protest - [I]192-christina wonder what [you]1882-you would think if [you]1882-you knew certain things . "[192-christina]

" What things do [you]1882-you mean ? "[281-rowland]

" Well , for example , how [I]192-christina was brought up . [I]192-christina have had a horrible education . There must be some good in [me]192-christina , since [I]192-christina have perceived it , since [I]192-christina have turned and judged [my]192-christina circumstances . "[192-christina]

" [[My]281-rowland dear]3110-my dear [Miss Light]254-miss light ! "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland murmured .

[She]192-christina gave a little , quick laugh . " [You]1885-you do n't want to hear ? [you]1885-you do n't want to have to think about that ? "[192-christina]

" Have [I]192-christina a right to ? [You]1885-you need n't justify [yourself]1885-you . "[192-christina]

[She]192-christina turned upon [him]1885-you a moment the quickened light of [her]192-christina beautiful eyes , then fell to musing again . " Is there not some novel or some play , "[192-christina] [she]192-christina asked at last , " in which [some beautiful , wicked woman who has ensnared [a young man]470-a young man sees [[his]470-a young man father]345-his father]4499-some beautiful , wicked woman who has ensnared a young man sees his father come to [her]4499-some beautiful , wicked woman who has ensnared a young man sees his father and beg [her]4499-some beautiful , wicked woman who has ensnared a young man sees his father to let [him]470-a young man go ? "[192-christina]

" Very likely , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland . " [I]281-rowland hope [she]4499-some beautiful , wicked woman who has ensnared a young man sees his father consents . "[281-rowland]

" [I]192-christina forget . But tell [me]192-christina , "[192-christina] [she]192-christina continued , ' shall [you]1885-you consider - admitting [your]1885-you proposition - that in ceasing to flirt with [Mr. Hudson]172-mr. hudson , so that [he]172-mr. hudson may go about [his]172-mr. hudson business , [I]0-i do something magnanimous , heroic , sublime - something with a fine name like that ? "[0-i]

[Rowland]281-rowland , elated with the prospect of gaining [his]1885-you point , was about to reply that [she]192-christina would deserve the finest name in [the world]483-the world ; but [he]1885-you instantly suspected that this tone would not please [her]192-christina , and , besides , it would not express [his]1885-you meaning .

" [You]192-christina do something [I]1885-you shall greatly respect , "[1885-you] [he]1885-you contented [himself]1885-you with saying .

[She]192-christina made no answer , and in a moment [she]192-christina beckoned to [[her]192-christina maid]1766-her maid . " What have [I]192-christina to do to - day ? "[192-christina] [she]192-christina asked .

[Assunta]282-assunta meditated . " Eh , it 's a very busy day ! Fortunately [I]192-christina have a better memory than [the signorina]4207-the signorina , "[192-christina] [she]192-christina said , turning to [Rowland]281-rowland . [She]192-christina began to count on [her]192-christina fingers . " [We]4503-we have to go to [the Pie di Marmo]4504-the pie di marmo to see about those laces that were sent to be washed . [You]192-christina said also that [you]192-christina wished to say three sharp words to [the Buonvicini]289-the buonvicini about [your]192-christina pink dress . [You]192-christina want some moss - rosebuds for to - night , and [you]192-christina wo n't get them for nothing ! [You]192-christina dine at [the Austrian Embassy]4505-the austrian embassy , and [that Frenchman]4506-that frenchman is to powder [your]192-christina hair . [You]192-christina 're to come [home]349-home in time to receive , for [the signora]3983-the signora gives a dance . And so away , away till morning ! "[192-christina]

" Ah , yes , the moss - roses ! "[192-christina] [Christina]192-christina murmured , caressingly . " [I]192-christina must have a quantity - at least a hundred . Nothing but buds , eh ? [You]192-christina must sew them in a kind of immense apron , down the front of [my]192-christina dress . Packed tight together , eh ? It will be delightfully barbarous . And then twenty more or so for [my]192-christina hair . They go very well with powder ; do n't [you]281-rowland think so ? "[192-christina] And [she]192-christina turned to [Rowland]281-rowland . " [I]192-christina am going en [Pompadour]118-pompadour . "[192-christina]

" Going where ? "[192-christina]

" To [the Spanish Embassy]4509-the spanish embassy , or whatever it is . "[192-christina]

" All down the front , [signorina]4510-signorina ? [Dio buono]119-dio buono ! [You]192-christina must give [me]282-assunta time ! "[282-assunta] [Assunta]282-assunta cried .

" Yes , [we]4511-we 'll go ! "[192-christina] And [she]192-christina left [her]192-christina place . [She]192-christina walked slowly to the door of [the church]4439-the church , looking at [the pavement]1880-the pavement , and [Rowland]281-rowland could not guess whether [she]192-christina was thinking of [her]192-christina apron of moss - rosebuds or of [her]192-christina opportunity for moral sublimity . Before reaching the door [she]192-christina turned away and stood gazing at an old picture , indistinguishable with blackness , over an altar . At last [they]1890-they passed out into [the court]1891-the court . Glancing at [her]192-christina in the open air , [Rowland]281-rowland was startled ; [he]1892-he imagined [he]1892-he saw the traces of hastily suppressed tears . [They]1890-they had lost time , [she]192-christina said , and [they]1890-they must hurry ; [she]192-christina sent [Assunta]282-assunta to look for [a fiacre]1769-a fiacre . [She]192-christina remained silent a while , scratching the ground with the point of [her]192-christina parasol , and then at last , looking up , [she]192-christina thanked [Rowland]281-rowland for [his]1892-he confidence in [her]192-christina " reasonableness . "[192-christina] " It 's really very comfortable to be asked , to be expected , to do something good , after all the horrid things [one]3107-one has been used to doing - instructed , commanded , forced to do ! [I]192-christina 'll think over what [you]192-christina have said to [me]192-christina . "[192-christina] In [that deserted quarter fiacres]1894-that deserted quarter fiacres are rare , and there was some delay in [Assunta]282-assunta 's procuring one . [Christina]192-christina talked of [the church]4439-the church , of [the picturesque old court]1896-the picturesque old court , of [that strange , decaying corner of [Rome]4-rome]1897-that strange , decaying corner of rome . [Rowland]281-rowland was perplexed ; [he]1892-he was ill at ease . At last [the fiacre]1898-the fiacre arrived , but [she]192-christina waited a moment longer . " So , decidedly , "[192-christina] [she]192-christina suddenly asked , " [I]192-christina can only harm [him]1898-the fiacre ? "[192-christina]

" [You]192-christina make [me]281-rowland feel very brutal , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland .

" And [he]1898-the fiacre is such [a fine fellow]4513-a fine fellow that it would be really a great pity , eh ? "[192-christina]

" [I]281-rowland shall praise [him]1898-the fiacre no more , "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland said .

[She]192-christina turned away quickly , but [she]192-christina lingered still . " Do [you]281-rowland remember promising [me]192-christina , soon after [we]4514-we first met , that at the end of six months [you]281-rowland would tell [me]192-christina definitely what [you]281-rowland thought of [me]192-christina ? "[192-christina]

" It was a foolish promise . "[281-rowland]

" [You]281-rowland gave it . Bear it in mind . [I]192-christina will think of what [you]281-rowland have said to [me]192-christina . Farewell . "[192-christina] [She]192-christina stepped into [the carriage]3735-the carriage , and it rolled away . [Rowland]281-rowland stood for some minutes , looking after [it]3735-the carriage , and then went [his]1900-he way with a sigh . If this expressed general mistrust , [he]1900-he ought , three days afterward , to have been reassured . [He]1900-he received by the post a note containing these words : -

" [I]1901-the old serving - woman have done it . Begin and respect [me]1901-the old serving - woman ![1901-the old serving - woman]

" - C. L. "[1900-he]

To be perfectly satisfactory , indeed , the note required a commentary . [He]1900-he called that evening upon [Roderick]186-roderick , and found one in the information offered [him]1900-he at the door , by [the old serving - woman]1901-the old serving - woman - the startling information that [the signorino]1902-the signorino had gone to [Naples]52-naples .

CHAPTER VIII . Provocation

About a month later , [Rowland]281-rowland addressed to [[his]1900-he cousin]343-his cousin Cecilia a letter of which the following is a portion : -

... " So much for [myself]281-rowland ; yet [I]281-rowland tell [you]4515-you but a tithe of [my]281-rowland own story unless [I]281-rowland let [you]4515-you know how matters stand with [poor [Hudson]172-mr. hudson]4516-poor hudson , for [he]172-mr. hudson gives [me]281-rowland more to think about just now than anything else in [the world]483-the world . [I]281-rowland need a good deal of courage to begin this chapter . [You]4515-you warned [me]281-rowland , [you]4515-you know , and [I]281-rowland made rather light of [your]4515-you warning . [I]281-rowland have had all kinds of hopes and fears , but hitherto , in writing to [you]4515-you , [I]281-rowland have resolutely put the hopes foremost . Now , however , [my]281-rowland pride has forsaken [me]281-rowland , and [I]281-rowland should like hugely to give expression to a little comfortable despair . [I]281-rowland should like to say , ' [[My]281-rowland dear wise woman]4518-my dear wise woman , [you]4515-you were right and [I]281-rowland was wrong ; [you]4515-you were [a shrewd observer]4519-a shrewd observer and [I]281-rowland was [a meddlesome donkey]4520-a meddlesome donkey ! ' When [I]281-rowland think of a little talk [we]4521-we had about the ' salubrity of genius , ' [I]281-rowland feel [my]281-rowland ears tingle . If this is salubrity , give [me]281-rowland raging disease ! [I]281-rowland ' m pestered to death ; [I]281-rowland go about with a chronic heartache ; there are moments when [I]281-rowland could shed salt tears . There 's a pretty portrait of [the most placid of [men]3287-men]4522-the most placid of men ! [I]281-rowland wish [I]281-rowland could make [you]4515-you understand ; or rather , [I]281-rowland wish [you]4515-you could make [me]281-rowland ! [I]281-rowland do n't understand a jot ; it 's a hideous , mocking mystery ; [I]281-rowland give it up ! [I]281-rowland do n't in the least give it up , [you]4515-you know ; [I]281-rowland ' m incapable of giving it up . [I]281-rowland sit holding [my]281-rowland head by the hour , racking [my]281-rowland brain , wondering what under heaven is to be done . [You]4515-you told [me]281-rowland at [Northampton]2-northampton that [I]281-rowland took the thing too easily ; [you]4515-you would tell [me]281-rowland now , perhaps , that [I]281-rowland take it too hard . [I]281-rowland do , altogether ; but it ca n't be helped . Without flattering [myself]281-rowland , [I]281-rowland may say [I]281-rowland ' m sympathetic . [Many another man]387-many another man before this would have cast [his]387-many another man perplexities to the winds and declared that [Mr. Hudson]172-mr. hudson must lie on [his]387-many another man bed as [he]387-many another man had made it . [Some men]4142-some men , perhaps , would even say that [I]281-rowland am making a mighty ado about nothing ; that [I]281-rowland have only to give [him]387-many another man rope , and [he]387-many another man will tire [himself]387-many another man out . But [he]387-many another man tugs at [his]387-many another man rope altogether too hard for [me]281-rowland to hold it comfortably . [I]281-rowland certainly never pretended the thing was anything else than an experiment ; [I]281-rowland promised nothing , [I]281-rowland answered for nothing ; [I]281-rowland only said the case was hopeful , and that it would be a shame to neglect it . [I]281-rowland have done [my]281-rowland best , and if the machine is running down [I]281-rowland have a right to stand aside and let it scuttle . Amen , amen ! No , [I]281-rowland can write that , but [I]281-rowland ca n't feel it . [I]281-rowland ca n't be just ; [I]281-rowland can only be generous . [I]281-rowland love [the poor fellow]3562-the poor fellow and [I]281-rowland ca n't give [him]3562-the poor fellow up . As for understanding [him]3562-the poor fellow , that 's another matter ; nowadays [I]281-rowland do n't believe even [you]4527-you would . [One]290-one 's wits are sadly pestered over here , [I]281-rowland assure [you]4527-you , and [I]281-rowland ' m in the way of seeing more than [one puzzling specimen of human nature]4528-one puzzling specimen of human nature . [Roderick]186-roderick and [Miss Light]254-miss light , between [them]4529-them ! ... Have n't [I]281-rowland already told [you]4527-you about [Miss Light]254-miss light ? Last winter everything was perfection . [Roderick]186-roderick struck out bravely , did really great things , and proved [himself]186-roderick , as [I]281-rowland supposed , thoroughly solid . [He]186-roderick was strong , [he]186-roderick was first - rate ; [I]281-rowland felt perfectly secure and sang private paeans of joy . [We]4530-we had passed at a bound into [the open sea]4531-the open sea , and left danger behind . But in the summer [I]281-rowland began to be puzzled , though [I]281-rowland succeeded in not being alarmed . When [we]4530-we came back to [Rome]4-rome , however , [I]281-rowland saw that the tide had turned and that [we]4530-we were close upon [the rocks]4532-the rocks . It is , in fact , another case of [Ulysses]291-ulysses alongside of [the Sirens]292-the sirens ; only [Roderick]186-roderick refuses to be tied to the mast . [He]186-roderick is [the most extraordinary being , the strangest mixture of qualities]4533-the most extraordinary being , the strangest mixture of qualities . [I]281-rowland do n't understand so much force going with so much weakness - such a brilliant gift being subject to such lapses . [The poor fellow]3562-the poor fellow is incomplete , and it is really not [his]3562-the poor fellow own fault ; [Nature]201-nature has given [him]3562-the poor fellow the faculty out of hand and bidden [him]3562-the poor fellow be hanged with it . [I]281-rowland never knew [a man]3214-a man harder to advise or assist , if [he]3214-a man is not in the mood for listening . [I]281-rowland suppose there is some key or other to [his]186-roderick character , but [I]281-rowland try in vain to find it ; and yet [I]281-rowland ca n't believe that [Providence]222-providence is so cruel as to have turned the lock and thrown the key away . [He]186-roderick perplexes [me]281-rowland , as [I]281-rowland say , to death , and though [he]186-roderick tires out [my]281-rowland patience , [he]186-roderick still fascinates [me]281-rowland . Sometimes [I]281-rowland think [he]186-roderick has n't a grain of conscience , and sometimes [I]281-rowland think that , in a way , [he]186-roderick has an excess . [He]186-roderick takes things at once too easily and too hard ; [he]186-roderick is both too lax and too tense , too reckless and too ambitious , too cold and too passionate . [He]186-roderick has developed faster even than [you]4536-you prophesied , and for good and evil alike [he]186-roderick takes up a formidable space . There 's too much of [him]186-roderick for [me]281-rowland , at any rate . Yes , [he]186-roderick is hard ; there is no mistake about that . [He]186-roderick 's inflexible , [he]186-roderick 's brittle ; and though [he]186-roderick has plenty of spirit , plenty of soul , [he]186-roderick has n't what [I]281-rowland call a heart . [He]186-roderick has something that [Miss Garland]182-miss garland took for one , and [I]281-rowland ' m pretty sure [she]182-miss garland 's [a judge]3192-a judge . But [she]182-miss garland judged on scanty evidence . [He]186-roderick has something that [Christina Light]192-christina , here , makes believe at times that [she]182-miss garland takes for one , but [she]182-miss garland is [no judge at all]4538-no judge at all ! [I]281-rowland think it is established that , in the long run , egotism makes a failure in conduct : is it also true that it makes a failure in the arts ? ... [Roderick]186-roderick 's standard is immensely high ; [I]281-rowland must do [him]186-roderick that justice . [He]186-roderick will do nothing beneath it , and while [he]186-roderick is waiting for inspiration , [his]186-roderick imagination , [his]186-roderick nerves , [his]186-roderick senses must have something to amuse [them]4539-them . This is a highly philosophical way of saying that [he]186-roderick has taken to dissipation , and that [he]186-roderick has just been spending a month at [Naples]52-naples - [a city where ' pleasure ' is actively cultivated]4540-a city where ' pleasure ' is actively cultivated - in very bad company . Are [they]4539-them all like that , [all the men of genius]4541-all the men of genius ? There are [a great many artists here who hammer away at [their]4542-a great many artists here who hammer away at their trade with exemplary industry trade with [exemplary industry]4543-exemplary industry]4542-a great many artists here who hammer away at their trade with exemplary industry ; in fact [I]281-rowland am surprised at [their]4542-a great many artists here who hammer away at their trade with exemplary industry success in reducing the matter to a steady , daily grind : but [I]281-rowland really do n't think that one of [them]4542-a great many artists here who hammer away at their trade with exemplary industry has [his]186-roderick exquisite quality of talent . It is in the matter of quantity that [he]186-roderick has broken down . The bottle wo n't pour ; [he]186-roderick turns it upside down ; it 's no use ! Sometimes [he]186-roderick declares it 's empty - that [he]186-roderick has done all [he]186-roderick was made to do . This [I]281-rowland consider great nonsense ; but [I]281-rowland would nevertheless take [him]186-roderick on [his]186-roderick own terms if it was only [I]281-rowland that was concerned . But [I]281-rowland keep thinking of [those two praying , trusting neighbors of yours]4544-those two praying , trusting neighbors of yours , and [I]281-rowland feel wretchedly like [a swindler]4545-a swindler . If [his]186-roderick working mood came but once in five years [I]281-rowland would willingly wait for it and maintain [him]186-roderick in leisure , if need be , in the intervals ; but that would be a sorry account to present to [them]4544-those two praying , trusting neighbors of yours . Five years of this sort of thing , moreover , would effectually settle the question . [I]281-rowland wish [he]186-roderick were less of [a genius]951-a genius and more of [a charlatan]4547-a charlatan ! [He]186-roderick 's too confoundedly all of one piece ; [he]186-roderick wo n't throw overboard a grain of the cargo to save the rest . Fancy [him]186-roderick thus with all [his]186-roderick brilliant personal charm , [his]186-roderick handsome head , [his]186-roderick careless step , [his]186-roderick look as of [a nervous nineteenth - century Apollo]4548-a nervous nineteenth - century apollo , and [you]4549-you will understand that there is mighty little comfort in seeing [him]186-roderick in a bad way . [He]186-roderick was tolerably foolish last summer at [Baden Baden]245-baden - baden , but [he]186-roderick got on [his]186-roderick feet , and for a while [he]186-roderick was steady . Then [he]186-roderick began to waver again , and at last toppled over . Now , literally , [he]186-roderick 's lying prone . [He]186-roderick came into [[my]281-rowland room]3272-my room last night , miserably tipsy . [I]281-rowland assure [you]4549-you , it did n't amuse [me]281-rowland ..... About [Miss Light]254-miss light it 's a long story . [She]254-miss light is one of the great beauties of all time , and worth coming barefoot to [Rome]4-rome , like [the pilgrims of old]4551-the pilgrims of old , to see . [Her]254-miss light complexion , [her]254-miss light glance , [her]254-miss light step , [her]254-miss light dusky tresses , may have been seen before in [a goddess]3741-a goddess , but never in [a woman]3607-a woman . And [you]4549-you may take this for truth , because [I]281-rowland ' m not in love with [her]254-miss light . On the contrary ! [Her]254-miss light education has been simply infernal . [She]254-miss light is corrupt , perverse , as proud as [the queen of [Sheba]121-sheba]4554-the queen of sheba , and [an appalling coquette]4555-an appalling coquette ; but [she]254-miss light is generous , and with patience and skill [you]4549-you may enlist [her]254-miss light imagination in a good cause as well as in a bad one . The other day [I]281-rowland tried to manipulate it a little . [Chance]293-chance offered [me]281-rowland an interview to which it was possible to give a serious turn , and [I]281-rowland boldly broke ground and begged [her]254-miss light to suffer [[my]281-rowland poor friend]4400-my poor friend to go in peace . After a good deal of finessing [she]254-miss light consented , and the next day , with a single word , packed [him]4400-my poor friend off to [Naples]52-naples to drown [his]4400-my poor friend sorrow in debauchery . [I]281-rowland have come to the conclusion that [she]254-miss light is more dangerous in [her]254-miss light virtuous moods than in [her]254-miss light vicious ones , and that [she]254-miss light probably has a way of turning [her]254-miss light back which is the most provoking thing in [the world]483-the world . [She]254-miss light 's [an actress]3960-an actress , [she]254-miss light could n't forego doing the thing dramatically , and it was the dramatic touch that made it fatal . [I]281-rowland wished [her]254-miss light , of course , to let [him]4400-my poor friend down easily ; but [she]254-miss light desired to have the curtain drop on an attitude , and [her]254-miss light attitudes deprive [inflammable young artists]4559-inflammable young artists of [their]4559-inflammable young artists reason ..... [Roderick]186-roderick made an admirable bust of [her]254-miss light at the beginning of the winter , and [a dozen women]4560-a dozen women came rushing to [him]4400-my poor friend to be done , mutatis mutandis , in the same style . [They]4560-a dozen women were [all great ladies]4561-all great ladies and ready to take [him]4400-my poor friend by the hand , but [he]4400-my poor friend told [them]4560-a dozen women all [their]4560-a dozen women faces did n't interest [him]4400-my poor friend , and sent [them]4560-a dozen women away vowing [his]4400-my poor friend destruction . "[281-rowland]

At this point of [his]1904-i long effusion , [Rowland]281-rowland had paused and put by [his]1904-i letter . [He]1904-i kept it three days and then read it over . [He]1904-i was disposed at first to destroy it , but [he]1904-i decided finally to keep it , in the hope that it might strike a spark of useful suggestion from the flint of [Cecilia]169-cecilia 's good sense . [We]1905-we know [he]1904-i had a talent for taking advice . And then it might be , [he]1904-i reflected , that [[his]1904-i cousin]343-his cousin 's answer would throw some light on [Mary Garland]193-mary garland 's present vision of things . In [his]1904-i altered mood [he]1904-i added these few lines : -

" [I]1904-i unburdened [myself]1904-i the other day of this monstrous load of perplexity ; [I]1904-i think it did [me]1904-i good , and [I]1904-i let it stand . [I]1904-i was in a melancholy muddle , and [I]1904-i was trying to work [myself]1904-i free . [You]4562-you know [I]1904-i like discussion , in a quiet way , and there is [no one with whom]4563-no one with whom [I]1904-i can have it as quietly as with [you]4562-you , [most sagacious of [cousins]4565-cousins]4564-most sagacious of cousins ! There is [an excellent old lady with whom [I]1904-i often chat]4566-an excellent old lady with whom i often chat , and who talks very much to the point . But [Madame Grandoni]217-madame grandoni has disliked [Roderick]186-roderick from the first , and if [I]1904-i were to take [her]217-madame grandoni advice [I]1904-i would wash [my]1904-i hands of [him]186-roderick . [You]4562-you will laugh at [me]1904-i for [my]1904-i long face , but [you]4562-you would do that in any circumstances . [I]1904-i am half ashamed of [my]1904-i letter , for [I]1904-i have a faith in [[my]1904-i friend]4209-my friend that is deeper than [my]1904-i doubts . [He]4209-my friend was here last evening , talking about [the Naples Museum]4568-the naples museum , [the Aristides]294-the aristides , the bronzes , the Pompeian frescoes , with such a beautiful intelligence that doubt of the ultimate future seemed blasphemy . [I]1904-i walked back to [[his]4209-my friend lodging]1000-his lodging with [him]4209-my friend , and [he]4209-my friend was as mild as midsummer moonlight . [He]4209-my friend has the ineffable something that charms and convinces ; [my]1904-i last word about [him]4209-my friend shall not be a harsh one . "[1904-i]

Shortly after sending [his]1907-his letter , going one day into [[[his]1907-his friend]606-his friend 's studio]1909-his friend 's studio , [he]1907-his found [Roderick]186-roderick suffering from the grave infliction of a visit from [Mr. Leavenworth]269-mr. leavenworth . [Roderick]186-roderick submitted with extreme ill grace to being bored , and [he]186-roderick was now evidently in a state of high exasperation . [He]186-roderick had lately begun a representation of [a lazzarone lounging in the sun]1910-a lazzarone lounging in the sun ; an image of serene , irresponsible , sensuous life . [The real lazzarone]1911-the real lazzarone , [he]186-roderick had admitted , was [a vile fellow]1912-a vile fellow ; but [the ideal lazzarone]1913-the ideal lazzarone - and [his]186-roderick own had been subtly idealized - was a precursor of the millennium .

[Mr. Leavenworth]269-mr. leavenworth had apparently just transferred [his]269-mr. leavenworth unhurrying gaze to [the figure]1914-the figure .

" Something in the style of [the Dying Gladiator]4570-the dying gladiator ? "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick sympathetically observed .

" Oh no , "[186-roderick] said [Roderick]186-roderick seriously , " [he]186-roderick 's not dying , [he]186-roderick 's only drunk ! "[186-roderick]

" Ah , but intoxication , [you]186-roderick know , "[269-mr. leavenworth] [Mr. Leavenworth]269-mr. leavenworth rejoined , " is not a proper subject for sculpture . Sculpture should not deal with transitory attitudes . "[269-mr. leavenworth]

" Lying dead drunk is not a transitory attitude ! Nothing is more permanent , more sculpturesque , more monumental ! "[186-roderick]

" An entertaining paradox , "[269-mr. leavenworth] said [Mr. Leavenworth]269-mr. leavenworth , " if [we]4571-we had time to exercise [our]4571-we wits upon it . [I]269-mr. leavenworth remember at [Florence]46-florence an intoxicated figure by [Michael Angelo]203-michael angelo which seemed to [me]269-mr. leavenworth a deplorable aberration of a great mind . [I]269-mr. leavenworth [myself]269-mr. leavenworth touch liquor in no shape whatever . [I]269-mr. leavenworth have traveled through [Europe]1-europe on cold water . The most varied and attractive lists of wines are offered [me]269-mr. leavenworth , but [I]269-mr. leavenworth brush them aside . No cork has ever been drawn at [my]269-mr. leavenworth command ! "[269-mr. leavenworth]

" The movement of drawing a cork calls into play a very pretty set of muscles , "[186-roderick] said [Roderick]186-roderick . " [I]186-roderick think [I]186-roderick will make a figure in that position . "[186-roderick]

" A Bacchus , realistically treated ! [[My]269-mr. leavenworth dear young friend]3545-my dear young friend , never trifle with [your]3545-my dear young friend lofty mission . " Ah , [our]4576-our great American beauty ! Not [a pagan goddess]4580-a pagan goddess - [an American , Christian lady]4581-an american , christian lady ! Yes , [I]186-roderick have had the pleasure of conversing with [Miss Light]254-miss light . [Her]254-miss light conversational powers are not remarkable , but [her]254-miss light beauty is of a high order . [I]186-roderick observed [her]254-miss light the other evening at a large party , where [some of [the proudest members of the European aristocracy]4583-the proudest members of the european aristocracy]4582-some of the proudest members of the european aristocracy were present - [duchesses]4584-duchesses , [princesses]4585-princesses , [countesses]4586-countesses , and [others distinguished by similar titles]4587-others distinguished by similar titles . [You]4592-you see [more beautiful girls]4593-more beautiful girls in an hour on [Broadway]122-broadway than in the whole tour of [Europe]1-europe . " [She]254-miss light has never been [there]3420-there ! "[186-roderick] cried [Roderick]186-roderick , triumphantly .

" [I]186-roderick ' m afraid [she]254-miss light never will be [there]3420-there . [I]186-roderick suppose [you]4592-you have heard the news about [her]254-miss light . "[186-roderick]

" It 's the news of the hour , [I]186-roderick believe . [Miss Light]254-miss light is admired by [the highest people]4596-the highest people [here]3130-here . Though [Mr. Leavenworth]269-mr. leavenworth had not observed [Roderick]186-roderick 's emotion , it was not lost upon [Rowland]281-rowland , who was making certain uncomfortable reflections upon it . [He]269-mr. leavenworth saw that it had instantly become one with the acute irritation produced by [the poor gentleman]1917-the poor gentleman 's oppressive personality , and that an explosion of some sort was imminent . " And now for [[our]4623-our Culture]4624-our culture ! "[269-mr. leavenworth] [he]269-mr. leavenworth said in the same sonorous tones , demanding with a gesture the unveiling of the figure , which stood somewhat apart , muffled in a great sheet .

[Roderick]186-roderick stood looking at [him]269-mr. leavenworth for a moment with concentrated rancor , and then strode to the statue and twitched off the cover . " [The figure]1914-the figure has considerable majesty , and [the countenance]4626-the countenance wears a fine , open expression . [Roderick]186-roderick looked at [him]269-mr. leavenworth with eyes that still inexorableness made almost tender . " [You]269-mr. leavenworth too ! "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick simply said .

[Rowland]281-rowland felt that [he]186-roderick might as well attempt to squeeze water from a polished crystal as hope to move [him]186-roderick . [He]186-roderick turned away and walked into [the adjoining room]1919-the adjoining room with a sense of sickening helplessness . " Absolutely . "[186-roderick]

" There 's one more point - that [you]186-roderick should n't , for a month , go to [Mrs. Light]253-mrs. light 's . "[281-rowland]

" [I]186-roderick go [there]3420-there this evening . "[186-roderick]

" That too is an utter folly . "[281-rowland]

" There are such things as necessary follies . "[186-roderick]

" [You]186-roderick are not reflecting ; [you]186-roderick are speaking in passion . "[281-rowland]

" Why then do [you]281-rowland make [me]186-roderick speak ? "[186-roderick]

[Rowland]281-rowland meditated a moment . " Is it also necessary that [you]186-roderick should lose [the best friend [you]186-roderick have]4640-the best friend you have ? "[281-rowland]

[Roderick]186-roderick looked up . " That 's for [you]186-roderick to settle ! "[186-roderick]

[[His]186-roderick best friend]1920-his best friend clapped on [his]1920-his best friend hat and strode away ; in a moment the door closed behind [him]1920-his best friend . [Rowland]281-rowland walked hard for nearly a couple of hours . [He]1920-his best friend passed up [the Corso]53-the corso , out of [the Porta del Popolo]1921-the porta del popolo and into [the Villa Borghese]1922-the villa borghese , of which [he]1920-his best friend made a complete circuit . The keenness of [his]1920-his best friend irritation subsided , but it left [him]1920-his best friend with an intolerable weight upon [his]1920-his best friend heart . When dusk had fallen , [he]1920-his best friend found [himself]1920-his best friend near [the lodging of [[his]1920-his best friend friend]606-his friend [Madame Grandoni]217-madame grandoni]1923-the lodging of his friend madame grandoni . [He]1920-his best friend frequently paid [her]217-madame grandoni a visit during the hour which preceded dinner , and [he]1920-his best friend now ascended [her]217-madame grandoni unillumined staircase and rang at [her]217-madame grandoni relaxed bell - rope with an especial desire for diversion . [He]1920-his best friend was told that , for the moment , [she]217-madame grandoni was occupied , but that if [he]1920-his best friend would come in and wait , [she]217-madame grandoni would presently be with [him]1920-his best friend . [He]1920-his best friend had not sat musing in the firelight for ten minutes when [he]1920-his best friend heard the jingle of the door - bell and then a rustling and murmuring in [the hall]1925-the hall . The door of [the little saloon]1926-the little saloon opened , but before [the visitor]1927-the visitor appeared [he]1920-his best friend had recognized [her]217-madame grandoni voice . [Christina Light]192-christina swept forward , preceded by [her]217-madame grandoni poodle , and almost filling [the narrow parlor]1928-the narrow parlor with the train of [her]217-madame grandoni dress . [She]217-madame grandoni was colored here and there by the flicking firelight .

" [They]4641-they told [me]217-madame grandoni [you]1920-his best friend were [here]3130-here , "[217-madame grandoni] [she]217-madame grandoni said simply , as [she]217-madame grandoni took a seat .

" And yet [you]217-madame grandoni came in ? It is very brave , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland .

" [You]217-madame grandoni are [the brave one]4643-the brave one , when one thinks of it ! Where is [the padrona]4644-the padrona ? "[217-madame grandoni]

" Occupied for the moment . But [she]4644-the padrona is coming . "[217-madame grandoni]

" How soon ? "[217-madame grandoni]

" [I]217-madame grandoni have already waited ten minutes ; [I]217-madame grandoni expect [her]4644-the padrona from moment to moment . "[217-madame grandoni]

" Meanwhile [we]4645-we are alone ? "[217-madame grandoni] And [she]217-madame grandoni glanced into the dusky corners of [the room]487-the room .

" [Unless Stenterello]252-stenterello counts , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland .

" Oh , [he]4644-the padrona knows [my]217-madame grandoni secrets - [unfortunate brute]4646-unfortunate brute ! "[217-madame grandoni] [She]217-madame grandoni sat silent awhile , looking into the firelight . Then at last , glancing at [Rowland]281-rowland , " Come ! say something pleasant ! "[217-madame grandoni] [she]217-madame grandoni exclaimed .

" [I]217-madame grandoni have been very happy to hear of [your]281-rowland engagement . "[217-madame grandoni]

" No , [I]217-madame grandoni do n't mean that . [I]217-madame grandoni have heard that so often , only since breakfast , that it has lost all sense . " [I]281-rowland offended [you]281-rowland , then , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland . " [I]281-rowland was afraid [I]281-rowland had . "[281-rowland]

" Really , [I]1930-i do n't know . "[1930-i] And [he]1930-i began to hesitate for an explanation . " [I]1930-i have called , but [you]281-rowland have never been at [home]349-home . "[1930-i]

" [You]281-rowland were careful to choose the wrong times . [You]281-rowland have a way with [a poor girl]3964-a poor girl ! [You]281-rowland sit down and inform [her]3964-a poor girl that [she]3964-a poor girl is [a person with whom [a respectable young man]4650-a respectable young man can not associate without contamination]4649-a person with whom a respectable young man can not associate without contamination ; [[your]281-rowland friend]3646-your friend is [a very nice fellow]4652-a very nice fellow , [you]281-rowland are very careful of [his]3646-your friend morals , [you]281-rowland wish [him]3646-your friend to know none but [nice people]4653-nice people , and [you]281-rowland beg [me]217-madame grandoni therefore to desist . [You]281-rowland request [me]217-madame grandoni to take these suggestions to heart and to act upon them as promptly as possible . They are not particularly flattering to [my]217-madame grandoni vanity . Vanity , however , is a sin , and [I]217-madame grandoni listen submissively , with an immense desire to be just . If [I]217-madame grandoni have many faults [I]217-madame grandoni know it , in a general way , and [I]217-madame grandoni try on the whole to do [my]217-madame grandoni best . ' [Voyons]298-voyons , ' [I]217-madame grandoni say to [myself]217-madame grandoni , ' it is n't particularly charming to hear [one]3107-one 's self made out such [a low person]4655-a low person , but it is worth thinking over ; there 's probably a good deal of truth in it , and at any rate [we]4656-we must be as good [a girl]4269-a girl as [we]4656-we can . That 's the great point ! And then here 's a magnificent chance for humility . If there 's doubt in the matter , let the doubt count against [one]3107-one 's self . That is what [Saint Catherine]287-saint catherine did , and [Saint Theresa]299-saint theresa , and [all the others]4659-all the others , and [they]4659-all the others are said to have had in consequence the most ineffable joys . Let [us]4656-we go in for a little ineffable joy ! ' [I]217-madame grandoni tried it ; [I]217-madame grandoni swallowed [my]217-madame grandoni rising sobs , [I]217-madame grandoni made [you]298-voyons [my]217-madame grandoni courtesy , [I]217-madame grandoni determined [I]217-madame grandoni would not be spiteful , nor passionate , nor vengeful , nor anything that is supposed to be particularly feminine . [I]217-madame grandoni was [a better girl]4660-a better girl than [you]298-voyons made out - better at least than [you]298-voyons thought ; but [I]217-madame grandoni would let the difference go and do magnificently right , lest [I]217-madame grandoni should not do right enough . [I]217-madame grandoni thought of it a deal for six hours when [I]217-madame grandoni know [I]217-madame grandoni did n't seem to be , and then at last [I]217-madame grandoni did it ! " [[My]281-rowland dear]3110-my dear [Miss Light]254-miss light , [[my]281-rowland dear]3110-my dear [Miss Light]254-miss light ! "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland , pleadingly .

" [I]192-christina do n't know - [I]192-christina do n't care ! "[192-christina] [She]192-christina stood with [her]192-christina hand in [Madame Grandoni]217-madame grandoni 's , but looking askance at [Rowland]281-rowland .

" That 's a pretty state of mind , "[1935-the old lady] said [the old lady]1935-the old lady , " for [a young person who is going to become a princess]4672-a young person who is going to become a princess . "[1935-the old lady]

[Christina]192-christina shrugged [her]192-christina shoulders . " [Every one]3105-every one expects [me]192-christina to go into ecstacies over that ! Could anything be more vulgar ? " If [you]192-christina can dine on a risotto . But [I]192-christina imagine [you]192-christina are expected at [home]349-home . "[192-christina]
