[This shrewd woman]1936-this shrewd woman gave [Rowland]281-rowland a significant nod , and a little shrug , over [the young girl]659-the young girl 's beautiful bowed head , and then led [Christina]192-christina tenderly away into [the adjoining room]1919-the adjoining room . [Rowland]281-rowland , left alone , stood there for an instant , intolerably puzzled , face to face with [Miss Light]254-miss light 's poodle , who had set up a sharp , unearthly cry of sympathy with [[his]1936-this shrewd woman mistress]850-his mistress . [Rowland]281-rowland vented [his]1936-this shrewd woman confusion in dealing a rap with [his]1936-this shrewd woman stick at the animal 's unmelodious muzzle , and then rapidly left [the house]3246-the house . [He]1936-this shrewd woman saw [[Mrs. Light]253-mrs. light 's carriage]1941-mrs. light 's carriage waiting at the door , and heard afterwards that [Christina]192-christina went [home]349-home to dinner .

A couple of days later [he]1936-this shrewd woman went , for a fortnight , to [Florence]46-florence . [He]1936-this shrewd woman had twenty minds to leave [Italy]24-italy altogether ; and at [Florence]46-florence [he]1936-this shrewd woman could at least more freely decide upon [his]1936-this shrewd woman future movements . [He]1936-this shrewd woman felt profoundly , incurably disgusted . Reflective benevolence stood prudently aside , and for the time touched the source of [his]1936-this shrewd woman irritation with no softening side - lights .

It was the middle of March , and by the middle of March in [Florence]46-florence the spring is already warm and deep . [He]1936-this shrewd woman had an infinite relish for [the place]3197-the place and the season , but as [he]1936-this shrewd woman strolled by [the Arno]126-the arno and paused here and there in [the great galleries]1944-the great galleries , they failed to soothe [his]1936-this shrewd woman irritation . [He]1936-this shrewd woman was sore at heart , and as the days went by the soreness deepened rather than healed . [He]1936-this shrewd woman felt as if [he]1936-this shrewd woman had a complaint against fortune ; good - natured as [he]1936-this shrewd woman was , [his]1936-this shrewd woman good - nature this time quite declined to let it pass . [He]1936-this shrewd woman had tried to be wise , [he]1936-this shrewd woman had tried to be kind , [he]1936-this shrewd woman had embarked upon an estimable enterprise ; but [his]1936-this shrewd woman wisdom , [his]1936-this shrewd woman kindness , [his]1936-this shrewd woman energy , had been thrown back in [his]1936-this shrewd woman face . [He]1936-this shrewd woman was disappointed , and [his]1936-this shrewd woman disappointment had an angry spark in it . The sense of wasted time , of wasted hope and faith , kept [him]1936-this shrewd woman constant company . There were times when the beautiful things about [him]1936-this shrewd woman only exasperated [his]1936-this shrewd woman discontent . [He]1936-this shrewd woman went to [the Pitti Palace]125-the pitti palace , and [Raphael]301-raphael 's Madonna of the Chair seemed , in its soft serenity , to mock [him]1936-this shrewd woman with the suggestion of unattainable repose . [He]1936-this shrewd woman lingered on [the bridges]1945-the bridges at sunset , and knew that the light was enchanting and [the mountains]1946-the mountains divine , but there seemed to be something horribly invidious and unwelcome in the fact . [He]1936-this shrewd woman felt , in a word , like [a man who has been cruelly defrauded and who wishes to have [his]1936-this shrewd woman revenge]1947-a man who has been cruelly defrauded and who wishes to have his revenge . Life owed [him]1936-this shrewd woman , [he]1936-this shrewd woman thought , a compensation , and [he]1936-this shrewd woman would be restless and resentful until [he]1936-this shrewd woman found it . [He]1936-this shrewd woman knew - or [he]1936-this shrewd woman seemed to know - where [he]1936-this shrewd woman should find it ; but [he]1936-this shrewd woman hardly told [himself]1936-this shrewd woman , and thought of the thing under mental protest , as [a man in want of money]1948-a man in want of money may think of certain funds that [he]1948-a man in want of money holds in trust . In [his]1936-this shrewd woman melancholy meditations the idea of something better than all this , something that might softly , richly interpose , something that might reconcile [him]1936-this shrewd woman to the future , something that might make [one]3107-one 's tenure of life deep and zealous instead of harsh and uneven - the idea of concrete compensation , in a word - shaped itself sooner or later into the image of [Mary Garland]193-mary garland .

Very odd , [you]1950-you may say , that at this time of day [Rowland]281-rowland should still be brooding over [a plain girl of whom [he]1936-this shrewd woman had had but the lightest of glimpses two years before]1951-a plain girl of whom he had had but the lightest of glimpses two years before ; very odd that so deep an impression should have been made by so lightly - pressed an instrument . [We]1952-we must admit the oddity and offer simply in explanation that [his]1936-this shrewd woman sentiment apparently belonged to that species of emotion of which , by the testimony of [the poets]1953-the poets , the very name and essence is oddity . One night [he]1936-this shrewd woman slept but half an hour ; [he]1936-this shrewd woman found [his]1936-this shrewd woman thoughts taking a turn which excited [him]1936-this shrewd woman portentously . [He]1936-this shrewd woman walked up and down [[his]1936-this shrewd woman room]1954-his room half the night . It looked out on [the Arno]126-the arno ; the noise of [the river]548-the river came in at the open window ; [he]1936-this shrewd woman felt like dressing and going down into [the streets]959-the streets . Toward morning [he]1936-this shrewd woman flung [himself]1936-this shrewd woman into a chair ; though [he]1936-this shrewd woman was wide awake [he]1936-this shrewd woman was less excited . It seemed to [him]1936-this shrewd woman that [he]1936-this shrewd woman saw [his]1936-this shrewd woman idea from the outside , that [he]1936-this shrewd woman judged it and condemned it ; yet it stood there before [him]1936-this shrewd woman , distinct , and in a certain way imperious . During the day [he]1936-this shrewd woman tried to banish it and forget it ; but it fascinated , haunted , at moments frightened [him]1936-this shrewd woman . [He]1936-this shrewd woman tried to amuse [himself]1936-this shrewd woman , paid visits , resorted to several rather violent devices for diverting [his]1936-this shrewd woman thoughts . If on the morrow [he]1936-this shrewd woman had committed a crime , [the persons whom [he]1936-this shrewd woman had seen that day]1957-the persons whom he had seen that day would have testified that [he]1936-this shrewd woman had talked strangely and had not seemed like [himself]1936-this shrewd woman . [He]1936-this shrewd woman felt certainly very unlike [himself]1936-this shrewd woman ; long afterwards , in retrospect , [he]1936-this shrewd woman used to reflect that during those days [he]1936-this shrewd woman had for a while been literally beside [himself]1936-this shrewd woman . [His]1936-this shrewd woman idea persisted ; it clung to [him]1936-this shrewd woman like [a sturdy beggar]1958-a sturdy beggar . The sense of the matter , roughly expressed , was this : If [Roderick]186-roderick was really going , as [he]1936-this shrewd woman [himself]1936-this shrewd woman had phrased it , to " fizzle out , "[1936-this shrewd woman] one might help [him]186-roderick on the way - one might smooth [the descensus Averno]1959-the descensus averno . For forty - eight hours there swam before [Rowland]281-rowland 's eyes a vision of [Roderick]186-roderick , graceful and beautiful as [he]186-roderick passed , plunging , like a diver , from an eminence into [a misty gulf]1960-a misty gulf . [The gulf]1961-the gulf was destruction , annihilation , death ; but if death was decreed , why should not the agony be brief ? Beyond this vision there faintly glimmered another , as in [the children]1962-the children 's game of the " magic lantern "[1962-the children] a picture is superposed on the white wall before the last one has quite faded . It represented [Mary Garland]193-mary garland standing there with eyes in which the horror seemed slowly , slowly to expire , and hanging , motionless hands which at last made no resistance when [his]1936-this shrewd woman own offered to take [them]1963-them . When , of old , [a man]3214-a man was burnt at the stake it was cruel to have to be present ; but if [one]3107-one was present it was kind to lend a hand to pile up the fuel and make the flames do their work quickly and the smoke muffle up [the victim]1966-the victim . With all deference to [your]1967-you kindness , this was perhaps an obligation [you]1967-you would especially feel if [you]1967-you had a reversionary interest in something [the victim]1966-the victim was to leave behind [him]1966-the victim .

One morning , in the midst of all this , [Rowland]281-rowland walked heedlessly out of one of the city gates and found [himself]281-rowland on [the road to [Fiesole]127-fiesole]1969-the road to fiesole . It was a completely lovely day ; the March sun felt like May , as [the English poet of [Florence]46-florence]1970-the english poet of florence says ; the thick - blossomed shrubs and vines that hung over the walls of [villa and podere]1971-villa and podere flung their odorous promise into the warm , still air . [Rowland]281-rowland followed [the winding , climbing lanes]1972-the winding , climbing lanes ; lingered , as [he]1936-this shrewd woman got higher , beneath the rusty cypresses , beside the low parapets , where [you]1967-you look down on [the charming city]1973-the charming city and sweep [the vale of [the Arno]126-the arno]1974-the vale of the arno ; reached [the little square before [the cathedral]1976-the cathedral]1975-the little square before the cathedral , and rested awhile in [the massive , dusky church]1977-the massive , dusky church ; then climbed higher , to [the Franciscan convent]1978-the franciscan convent which is poised on [the very apex of [the mountain]1980-the mountain]1979-the very apex of the mountain . [He]1936-this shrewd woman rang at [the little gateway]1981-the little gateway ; [a shabby , senile , red - faced brother]1982-a shabby , senile , red - faced brother admitted [him]1936-this shrewd woman with almost maudlin friendliness . There was a dreary chill in [the chapel]1983-the chapel and [the corridors]1984-the corridors , and [he]1936-this shrewd woman passed rapidly through [them]1985-them into [the delightfully steep and tangled old garden which runs wild over]1986-the delightfully steep and tangled old garden which runs wild over [the forehead of [the great hill]1988-the great hill]1987-the forehead of the great hill . [He]1936-this shrewd woman had been in [it]1986-the delightfully steep and tangled old garden which runs wild over before , and [he]1936-this shrewd woman was very fond of [it]1986-the delightfully steep and tangled old garden which runs wild over . [The garden]3242-the garden hangs in the air , and [you]1990-you ramble from [terrace]1991-terrace to [terrace]1991-terrace and wonder how it keeps from slipping down , in full consummation of its bereaved forlornness , into [the nakedly romantic gorge beneath]1993-the nakedly romantic gorge beneath . It was just noon when [Rowland]281-rowland went in , and after roaming about awhile [he]1936-this shrewd woman flung [himself]1936-this shrewd woman in the sun on a mossy stone bench and pulled [his]1936-this shrewd woman hat over [his]1936-this shrewd woman eyes . The short shadows of the brown - coated cypresses above [him]1936-this shrewd woman had grown very long , and yet [he]1936-this shrewd woman had not passed back through [the convent]1994-the convent . [One of [the monks]1996-the monks]1995-one of the monks , in [his]1995-one of the monks faded snuff - colored robe , came wandering out into [the garden]3242-the garden , reading [his]1995-one of the monks greasy little breviary . Suddenly [he]1995-one of the monks came toward the bench on which [Rowland]281-rowland had stretched [himself]1936-this shrewd woman , and paused a moment , attentively . [Rowland]281-rowland was lingering there still ; [he]1936-this shrewd woman was sitting with [his]1936-this shrewd woman head in [his]1936-this shrewd woman hands and [his]1936-this shrewd woman elbows on [his]1936-this shrewd woman knees . [He]1936-this shrewd woman seemed not to have heard the sandaled tread of [the good brother]1998-the good brother , but as [the monk]1999-the monk remained watching [him]1936-this shrewd woman , [he]1936-this shrewd woman at last looked up . [It]2000-it was not [the ignoble old man who had admitted [him]1936-this shrewd woman]2001-the ignoble old man who had admitted him , but [a pale , gaunt personage , of a graver and more ascetic , and yet of a benignant , aspect]2002-a pale , gaunt personage , of a graver and more ascetic , and yet of a benignant , aspect . [Rowland]281-rowland 's face bore the traces of extreme trouble . [The frate]2003-the frate kept [his]2003-the frate finger in [his]2003-the frate little book , and folded [his]2003-the frate arms picturesquely across [his]2003-the frate breast . It can hardly be determined whether [his]2003-the frate attitude , as [he]2003-the frate bent [his]2003-the frate sympathetic Italian eye upon [Rowland]281-rowland , was a happy accident or the result of an exquisite spiritual discernment . To [Rowland]281-rowland , at any rate , under the emotion of that moment , it seemed blessedly opportune . [He]1936-this shrewd woman rose and approached [the monk]1999-the monk , and laid [his]1936-this shrewd woman hand on [his]1999-the monk arm .

" [[My]1936-this shrewd woman brother]3237-my brother , "[1936-this shrewd woman] [he]1936-this shrewd woman said , " did [you]3237-my brother ever see [the Devil]3660-the devil ? "[1936-this shrewd woman]

[The frate]2003-the frate gazed , gravely , and crossed [himself]2003-the frate . " Heaven forbid ! "[2003-the frate]

" [He]3660-the devil was here , "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland went on , " here in [this lovely garden]4679-this lovely garden , as [he]3660-the devil was once in [Paradise]128-paradise , half an hour ago . But have no fear ; [I]281-rowland drove [him]3660-the devil out . "[281-rowland] And [Rowland]281-rowland stooped and picked up [his]1936-this shrewd woman hat , which had rolled away into a bed of cyclamen , in vague symbolism of an actual physical tussle .

" [You]281-rowland have been tempted , [[my]2006-the friar brother]3237-my brother ? "[2006-the friar] asked [the friar]2006-the friar , tenderly .

" Hideously ! "[2003-the frate]

" And [you]281-rowland have resisted - and conquered ! "[2003-the frate]

" [I]2003-the frate believe [I]2003-the frate have conquered . "[2003-the frate]

" [The blessed Saint Francis]302-the blessed saint francis be praised ! It is well done . If [you]281-rowland like , [we]4681-we will offer a mass for [you]281-rowland . "[2003-the frate]

" [I]281-rowland am not [a Catholic]4682-a catholic , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland .

[The frate]2003-the frate smiled with dignity . " That is a reason the more . "[2003-the frate]

" But it 's for [you]2003-the frate , then , to choose . Shake hands with [me]281-rowland , "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland added ; " that will do as well ; and suffer [me]281-rowland , as [I]281-rowland go out , to stop a moment in [[your]2003-the frate chapel]4683-your chapel . "[281-rowland]

[They]2008-they shook hands and separated . [The frate]2003-the frate crossed [himself]2003-the frate , opened [his]2003-the frate book , and wandered away , in relief against the western sky . [Rowland]281-rowland passed back into [the convent]1994-the convent , and paused long enough in [the chapel]1983-the chapel to look for the alms - box . [He]2012-he had had what is vulgarly termed a great scare ; [he]2012-he believed , very poignantly for the time , in [the Devil]129-the devil , and [he]2012-he felt an irresistible need to subscribe to any institution which engaged to keep [him]2012-he at a distance .

The next day [he]2012-he returned to [Rome]4-rome , and the day afterwards [he]2012-he went in search of [Roderick]186-roderick . [He]2012-he found [him]2012-he on [the Pincian]51-the pincian with [his]2012-he back turned to [the crowd]1507-the crowd , looking at the sunset . " [I]281-rowland went to [Florence]46-florence , "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland said , " and [I]281-rowland thought of going farther ; but [I]281-rowland came back on purpose to give [you]186-roderick another piece of advice . Once more , [you]186-roderick refuse to leave [Rome]4-rome ? "[281-rowland]

" Never ! "[186-roderick] said [Roderick]186-roderick .

" The only chance that [I]281-rowland see , then , of [your]186-roderick reviving [your]186-roderick sense of responsibility to - to those various sacred things [you]186-roderick have forgotten , is in sending for [[your]186-roderick mother]3145-your mother to join [you]186-roderick here . "[281-rowland]

[Roderick]186-roderick stared . " For [[my]186-roderick mother]3224-my mother ? "[186-roderick]

" For [[your]186-roderick mother]3145-your mother - and for [Miss Garland]182-miss garland . "[281-rowland]

[Roderick]186-roderick still stared ; and then , slowly and faintly , [his]186-roderick face flushed . " For [Mary Garland]193-mary garland - for [[my]186-roderick mother]3224-my mother ? "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick repeated . " Send for [them]4688-them ? "[186-roderick]

" Tell [me]281-rowland this ; [I]281-rowland have often wondered , but till now [I]281-rowland have forborne to ask . [You]186-roderick are still engaged to [Miss Garland]182-miss garland ? "[281-rowland]

[Roderick]186-roderick frowned darkly , but assented .

" It would give [you]186-roderick pleasure , then , to see [her]182-miss garland ? "[281-rowland]

[Roderick]186-roderick turned away and for some moments answered nothing . " Pleasure ! "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick said at last , huskily . " Call it pain . "[186-roderick]

" [I]281-rowland regard [you]186-roderick as [a sick man]4689-a sick man , "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland continued . " In such a case [Miss Garland]182-miss garland would say that [her]182-miss garland place was at [your]186-roderick side . "[281-rowland]

[Roderick]186-roderick looked at [him]2014-him some time askance , mistrustfully . " Is this a deep - laid snare ? "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick asked slowly .

[Rowland]281-rowland had come back with all [his]2014-him patience rekindled , but these words gave it an almost fatal chill . " Heaven forgive [you]186-roderick ! "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick cried bitterly . " [My]186-roderick idea has been simply this . Try , in decency , to understand it . [I]186-roderick have tried to befriend [you]186-roderick , to help [you]186-roderick , to inspire [you]186-roderick with confidence , and [I]186-roderick have failed . [I]186-roderick took [you]186-roderick from the hands of [[your]186-roderick mother]3145-your mother and [[your]186-roderick betrothed]4691-your betrothed , and it seemed to [me]186-roderick [my]186-roderick duty to restore [you]186-roderick to [their]4692-their hands . That 's all [I]186-roderick have to say . "[186-roderick]

[He]186-roderick was going , but [Roderick]186-roderick forcibly detained [him]186-roderick . It would have been but a rough way of expressing it to say that [one]3107-one could never know how [Roderick]186-roderick would take a thing . It had happened more than once that when hit hard , deservedly , [he]186-roderick had received the blow with touching gentleness . On the other hand , [he]186-roderick had often resented the softest taps . The secondary effect of [Rowland]281-rowland 's present admonition seemed reassuring . " [I]186-roderick beg [you]281-rowland to wait , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick said , " to forgive that shabby speech , and to let [me]186-roderick reflect . "[186-roderick] And [he]186-roderick walked up and down awhile , reflecting . At last [he]186-roderick stopped , with a look in [his]186-roderick face that [Rowland]281-rowland had not seen all winter . It was a strikingly beautiful look .

" How strange it is , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick said , " that the simplest devices are the last that occur to one ! "[186-roderick] And [he]186-roderick broke into a light laugh . " To see [Mary Garland]193-mary garland is just what [I]186-roderick want . And [[my]186-roderick mother]3224-my mother - [[my]186-roderick mother]3224-my mother ca n't hurt [me]186-roderick now . "[186-roderick]

" [You]186-roderick will write , then ? "[186-roderick]

" [I]186-roderick will telegraph . [They]656-the two ladies must come , at whatever cost . [Striker]185-mr. striker can arrange it all for [them]656-the two ladies . "[186-roderick]

In a couple of days [he]186-roderick told [Rowland]281-rowland that [he]186-roderick had received a telegraphic answer to [his]186-roderick message , informing [him]186-roderick that [the two ladies]656-the two ladies were to sail immediately for [Leghorn]130-leghorn , in [one of the small steamers which ply between [that port]2018-that port and [New York]21-new york]2017-one of the small steamers which ply between that port and new york . [They]656-the two ladies would arrive , therefore , in less than a month . [Rowland]281-rowland passed this month of expectation in no very serene frame of mind . [His]186-roderick suggestion had had its source in the deepest places of [his]186-roderick agitated conscience ; but there was something intolerable in the thought of the suffering to which the event was probably subjecting [those undefended women]2019-those undefended women . [They]656-the two ladies had scraped together [their]656-the two ladies scanty funds and embarked , at twenty - four hours ' notice , upon [the dreadful sea]2020-the dreadful sea , to journey tremulously to [shores darkened by the shadow of deeper alarms]2021-shores darkened by the shadow of deeper alarms . [He]186-roderick could only promise [himself]186-roderick to be [[their]656-the two ladies devoted friend]2022-their devoted friend and servant . Preoccupied as [he]186-roderick was , [he]186-roderick was able to observe that expectation , with [Roderick]186-roderick , took a form which seemed singular even among [his]186-roderick characteristic singularities . If [redemption]303-redemption - [Roderick]186-roderick seemed to reason - was to arrive with [[his]186-roderick mother]448-his mother and [[his]186-roderick affianced bride]2024-his affianced bride , these last moments of error should be doubly erratic . [He]186-roderick did nothing ; but inaction , with [him]186-roderick , took on an unwonted air of gentle gayety . [He]186-roderick laughed and whistled and went often to [[Mrs. Light]253-mrs. light 's]2025-mrs. light 's ; though [Rowland]281-rowland knew not in what fashion present circumstances had modified [his]186-roderick relations with [Christina]192-christina . The month ebbed away and [Rowland]281-rowland daily expected to hear from [Roderick]186-roderick that [he]186-roderick had gone to [Leghorn]130-leghorn to meet [the ship]702-the ship . [He]186-roderick heard nothing , and late one evening , not having seen [[his]186-roderick friend]606-his friend in three or four days , [he]186-roderick stopped at [[Roderick]186-roderick 's lodging]1535-roderick 's lodging to assure [himself]186-roderick that [he]186-roderick had gone at last . [A cab]2029-a cab was standing in [the street]1564-the street , but as it was a couple of doors off [he]186-roderick hardly heeded it . [The hall at the foot of the staircase]2031-the hall at the foot of the staircase was dark , like [most Roman halls]2032-most roman halls , and [he]186-roderick paused in [the street]1564-the street - doorway on hearing the advancing footstep of [a person with whom [he]186-roderick wished to avoid coming into collision]2034-a person with whom he wished to avoid coming into collision . While [he]186-roderick did so [he]186-roderick heard another footstep behind [him]186-roderick , and turning round found that [Roderick]186-roderick in [person]1057-person had just overtaken [him]186-roderick . At the same moment [a woman]3607-a woman 's figure advanced from within , into the light of the street - lamp , and a face , half - startled , glanced at [him]186-roderick out of the darkness . [He]186-roderick gave a cry - it was the face of [Mary Garland]193-mary garland . [Her]193-mary garland glance flew past [him]186-roderick to [Roderick]186-roderick , and in a second a startled exclamation broke from [her]193-mary garland own lips . It made [Rowland]281-rowland turn again . [Roderick]186-roderick stood there , pale , apparently trying to speak , but saying nothing . [His]186-roderick lips were parted and [he]186-roderick was wavering slightly with a strange movement - the movement of a man who has drunk too much . Then [Rowland]281-rowland 's eyes met [Miss Garland]182-miss garland 's again , and [her]193-mary garland own , which had rested a moment on [Roderick]186-roderick 's , were formidable !

CHAPTER IX . [Mary Garland]193-mary garland

How it befell that [Roderick]186-roderick had failed to be in [Leghorn]130-leghorn on [[his]186-roderick mother]448-his mother 's arrival never clearly transpired ; for [he]186-roderick undertook to give no elaborate explanation of [his]186-roderick fault . [He]186-roderick never indulged in professions touching personal conduct as to the future , or in remorse as to the past , and as [he]186-roderick would have asked no praise if [he]186-roderick had traveled night and day to embrace [[his]186-roderick mother]448-his mother as [she]448-his mother set foot on [shore]2039-shore , [he]186-roderick made in [Rowland]281-rowland 's presence , at least no apology for having left [her]281-rowland to come in search of [him]186-roderick . It was to be said that , thanks to an unprecedentedly fine season , the voyage of [the two ladies]656-the two ladies had been surprisingly rapid , and that , according to common probabilities , if [Roderick]186-roderick had left [Rome]4-rome on the morrow as [he]186-roderick declared that [he]186-roderick had intended , [he]186-roderick would have had a day or two of waiting at [Leghorn]130-leghorn . [Rowland]281-rowland 's silent inference was that [Christina Light]192-christina had beguiled [him]186-roderick into letting the time slip , and it was accompanied with a silent inquiry whether [she]192-christina had done so unconsciously or maliciously . [He]186-roderick had told [her]281-rowland , presumably , that [[his]186-roderick mother]448-his mother and [[his]186-roderick cousin]343-his cousin were about to arrive ; and it was pertinent to remember hereupon that [she]192-christina was [a young lady of mysterious impulses]2043-a young lady of mysterious impulses . [Rowland]281-rowland heard in due time the story of the adventures of [the two ladies from [Northampton]2-northampton]2044-the two ladies from northampton . [Miss Garland]182-miss garland 's wish , at [Leghorn]130-leghorn , on finding [they]2044-the two ladies from northampton were left at the mercy of circumstances , had been to telegraph to [Roderick]186-roderick and await an answer ; for [she]182-miss garland knew that [their]2044-the two ladies from northampton arrival was a trifle premature . But [Mrs. Hudson]191-mrs. hudson 's maternal heart had taken the alarm . [Roderick]186-roderick 's sending for [them]2044-the two ladies from northampton was , to [her]191-mrs. hudson imagination , a confession of illness , and [his]186-roderick not being at [Leghorn]130-leghorn , a proof of it ; an hour 's delay was therefore cruel both to [herself]191-mrs. hudson and to [him]186-roderick . [She]191-mrs. hudson insisted on immediate departure ; and , unskilled as [they]2044-the two ladies from northampton were in the mysteries of foreign or even of domestic travel , [they]2044-the two ladies from northampton had hurried in trembling eagerness to [Rome]4-rome . [They]2044-the two ladies from northampton had arrived late in the evening , and , knowing nothing of [inns]2045-inns , had got into [a cab]2029-a cab and proceeded to [[Roderick]186-roderick 's lodging]1535-roderick 's lodging . At the door , [poor Mrs. Hudson]191-mrs. hudson 's frightened anxiety had overcome [her]191-mrs. hudson , and [she]191-mrs. hudson had sat quaking and crying in [the vehicle]2048-the vehicle , too weak to move . [Miss Garland]182-miss garland had bravely gone in , groped [her]182-miss garland way up the dusky staircase , reached [Roderick]186-roderick 's door , and , with the assistance of such acquaintance with the Italian tongue as [she]182-miss garland had culled from a phrase - book during the calmer hours of the voyage , had learned from [the old woman who had [[her]191-mrs. hudson cousin]370-her cousin 's household economy in charge]2049-the old woman who had her cousin 's household economy in charge that [he]186-roderick was in the best of health and spirits , and had gone forth a few hours before with [his]186-roderick hat on [his]186-roderick ear , per divertirsi .

These things [Rowland]281-rowland learned during a visit [he]186-roderick paid [the two ladies]656-the two ladies the evening after [their]656-the two ladies arrival . [Mrs. Hudson]191-mrs. hudson spoke of [them]656-the two ladies at great length and with an air of clinging confidence in [Rowland]281-rowland which told [him]186-roderick how faithfully time had served [him]186-roderick , in [her]191-mrs. hudson imagination . But [her]191-mrs. hudson fright was over , though [she]191-mrs. hudson was still catching [her]191-mrs. hudson breath a little , like [a person dragged ashore]2052-a person dragged ashore out of [waters uncomfortably deep]2053-waters uncomfortably deep . [She]191-mrs. hudson was excessively bewildered and confused , and seemed more than ever to demand a tender handling from [[her]191-mrs. hudson friends]2054-her friends . Before [Miss Garland]182-miss garland , [Rowland]281-rowland was distinctly conscious that [he]186-roderick trembled . [He]186-roderick wondered extremely what was going on in [her]191-mrs. hudson mind ; what was [her]191-mrs. hudson silent commentary on the incidents of the night before . [He]186-roderick wondered all the more , because [he]186-roderick immediately perceived that [she]191-mrs. hudson was greatly changed since [their]2055-their parting , and that the change was by no means for the worse . [She]191-mrs. hudson was older , easier , more free , more like [a young woman who went sometimes into company]2056-a young woman who went sometimes into company . [She]191-mrs. hudson had more beauty as well , inasmuch as [her]191-mrs. hudson beauty before had been the depth of [her]191-mrs. hudson expression , and the sources from which this beauty was fed had in these two years evidently not wasted themselves . [Rowland]281-rowland felt almost instantly - [he]186-roderick could hardly have said why : it was in [her]191-mrs. hudson voice , in [her]191-mrs. hudson tone , in the air - that a total change had passed over [her]191-mrs. hudson attitude towards [himself]281-rowland . [She]191-mrs. hudson trusted [him]186-roderick now , absolutely ; whether or no [she]191-mrs. hudson liked [him]186-roderick , [she]191-mrs. hudson believed [he]186-roderick was solid . [He]186-roderick felt that during the coming weeks [he]186-roderick would need to be solid . [Mrs. Hudson]191-mrs. hudson was at [one of [the smaller hotels]2058-the smaller hotels]2057-one of the smaller hotels , and [[her]191-mrs. hudson sitting - room]2059-her sitting - room was frugally lighted by a couple of candles . [Rowland]281-rowland made the most of this dim illumination to try to detect the afterglow of that frightened flash from [Miss Garland]182-miss garland 's eyes the night before . It had been but a flash , for what provoked it had instantly vanished . [Rowland]281-rowland had murmured a rapturous blessing on [Roderick]186-roderick 's head , as [he]186-roderick perceived [him]186-roderick instantly apprehend the situation . If [he]186-roderick had been drinking , its gravity sobered [him]186-roderick on the spot ; in a single moment [he]186-roderick collected [his]186-roderick wits . The next moment , with a ringing , jovial cry , [he]186-roderick was folding [the young girl]659-the young girl in [his]186-roderick arms , and the next [he]186-roderick was beside [[his]186-roderick mother]448-his mother 's carriage , half smothered in [her]191-mrs. hudson sobs and caresses . [Rowland]281-rowland had recommended [a hotel]2062-a hotel close at hand , and had then discreetly withdrawn . [Roderick]186-roderick was at this time doing [his]186-roderick part superbly , and [Miss Garland]182-miss garland 's brow was serene . It was serene now , twenty - four hours later ; but nevertheless , [her]182-miss garland alarm had lasted an appreciable moment . What had become of it ? It had dropped down deep into [her]182-miss garland memory , and it was lying there for the present in the shade . But with another week , [Rowland]281-rowland said to [himself]281-rowland , it would leap erect again ; the lightest friction would strike a spark from it . [Rowland]281-rowland thought [he]186-roderick had schooled [himself]186-roderick to face the issue of [Mary Garland]193-mary garland 's advent , casting it even in a tragical phase ; but in [her]182-miss garland personal presence - in which [he]186-roderick found a poignant mixture of the familiar and the strange - [he]186-roderick seemed to face it and all that it might bring with it for the first time . In vulgar parlance , [he]186-roderick stood uneasy in [his]186-roderick shoes . [He]186-roderick felt like walking on tiptoe , not to arouse the sleeping shadows . [He]186-roderick felt , indeed , almost like saying that [they]2063-they might have [their]2063-they own way later , if [they]2063-they would only allow to these first few days the clear light of ardent contemplation . For [Rowland]281-rowland at last was ardent , and all the bells within [his]186-roderick soul were ringing bravely in jubilee . [Roderick]186-roderick , [he]186-roderick learned , had been the whole day with [[his]186-roderick mother]448-his mother , and had evidently responded to [her]448-his mother purest trust . [He]186-roderick appeared to [her]448-his mother appealing eyes still unspotted by [the world]483-the world . That is what it is , thought [Rowland]281-rowland , to be " gifted , "[281-rowland] to escape not only the superficial , but the intrinsic penalties of misconduct . [The two ladies]656-the two ladies had spent the day within doors , resting from the fatigues of travel . [Miss Garland]182-miss garland , [Rowland]281-rowland suspected , was not so fatigued as [she]182-miss garland suffered it to be assumed . [She]182-miss garland had remained with [Mrs. Hudson]191-mrs. hudson , to attend to [her]182-miss garland personal wants , which [the latter]652-the latter seemed to think , now that [she]182-miss garland was in [a foreign land]556-a foreign land , with a southern climate and a Catholic religion , would forthwith become very complex and formidable , though as yet [they]656-the two ladies had simply resolved [themselves]656-the two ladies into a desire for a great deal of tea and for a certain extremely familiar old black and white shawl across [her]182-miss garland feet , as [she]182-miss garland lay on the sofa . But the sense of novelty was evidently strong upon [Miss Garland]182-miss garland , and the light of expectation was in [her]182-miss garland eye . [She]182-miss garland was restless and excited ; [she]182-miss garland moved about [the room]487-the room and went often to the window ; [she]182-miss garland was observing keenly ; [she]182-miss garland watched [the Italian servants]2070-the italian servants intently , as [they]2070-the italian servants came and went ; [she]182-miss garland had already had a long colloquy with [the French chambermaid , who had expounded [her]182-miss garland views on the Roman question]2071-the french chambermaid , who had expounded her views on the roman question ; [she]182-miss garland noted the small differences in the furniture , in the food , in the sounds that came in from [the street]1564-the street . [Rowland]281-rowland felt , in all this , that [her]182-miss garland intelligence , here , would have a great unfolding . [He]2073-he wished immensely [he]2073-he might have a share in it ; [he]2073-he wished [he]2073-he might show [her]182-miss garland [Rome]4-rome . That , of course , would be [[Roderick]186-roderick 's office]2074-roderick 's office . But [he]2073-he promised [himself]2073-he at least to take advantage of off - hours .

" It behooves [you]182-miss garland to appreciate [your]182-miss garland good fortune , "[2073-he] [he]2073-he said to [her]182-miss garland . " To be young and elastic , and yet old enough and wise enough to discriminate and reflect , and to come to [Italy]24-italy for the first time - that is one of the greatest pleasures that life offers [us]4695-we . It is but right to remind [you]182-miss garland of it , so that [you]182-miss garland make the most of opportunity and do not accuse [yourself]182-miss garland , later , of having wasted the precious season . "[2073-he]

[Miss Garland]182-miss garland looked at [him]2073-he , smiling intently , and went to the window again . " [I]182-miss garland expect to enjoy it , "[182-miss garland] [she]182-miss garland said . " Do n't be afraid ; [I]182-miss garland am not wasteful . "[182-miss garland]

" [I]191-mrs. hudson am afraid [we]4695-we are not qualified , [you]2073-he know , "[191-mrs. hudson] said [Mrs. Hudson]191-mrs. hudson . " [We]4695-we are told that [you]2073-he must know so much , that [you]2073-he must have read so many books . [Our]4695-we taste has not been cultivated . When [I]191-mrs. hudson was [a young lady at school]4696-a young lady at school , [I]191-mrs. hudson remember [I]191-mrs. hudson had a medal , with a pink ribbon , for ' proficiency in Ancient History ' - the seven kings , or is it [the seven hills]4697-the seven hills ? and [Quintus Curtius]304-quintus curtius and [Julius Caesar]305-julius caesar and - and that period , [you]2073-he know . [I]191-mrs. hudson believe [I]191-mrs. hudson have [my]191-mrs. hudson medal somewhere in a drawer , now , but [I]191-mrs. hudson have forgotten all about [the kings]4698-the kings . But after [Roderick]186-roderick came to [Italy]24-italy [we]4695-we tried to learn something about it . Last winter [Mary]193-mary garland used to read ' [Corinne]306-corinne ' to [me]191-mrs. hudson in the evenings , and in the mornings [she]193-mary garland used to read another book , to [herself]193-mary garland . What was it , [Mary]193-mary garland , that book that was so long , [you]193-mary garland know , - in fifteen volumes ? "[191-mrs. hudson]

" It was [[Sismondi]307-sismondi 's Italian Republics]4699-sismondi 's italian republics , "[193-mary garland] said [Mary]193-mary garland , simply .

[Rowland]281-rowland could not help laughing ; whereupon [Mary]193-mary garland blushed . " Did [you]193-mary garland finish it ? "[2075-he] [he]2075-he asked .

" Yes , and began another - a shorter one - [Roscoe]308-roscoe 's [Leo the Tenth]309-leo the tenth . "[191-mrs. hudson]

" Did [you]193-mary garland find them interesting ? "[191-mrs. hudson]

" Oh yes . "[191-mrs. hudson]

" Do [you]193-mary garland like history ? "[191-mrs. hudson]

" Some of it . "[191-mrs. hudson]

" That 's [a woman]3607-a woman 's answer ! And do [you]193-mary garland like art ? "[191-mrs. hudson]

[She]193-mary garland paused a moment . " [I]193-mary garland have never seen it ! "[193-mary garland]

" [You]193-mary garland have great advantages , now , [[my]191-mrs. hudson dear]3110-my dear , with [Roderick]186-roderick and [Mr. Mallet]170-mr. mallet , "[191-mrs. hudson] said [Mrs. Hudson]191-mrs. hudson . " [I]191-mrs. hudson am sure [no young lady]4702-no young lady ever had such advantages . [You]193-mary garland come straight to [the highest authorities]4703-the highest authorities . [Roderick]186-roderick , [I]191-mrs. hudson suppose , will show [you]193-mary garland the practice of art , and [Mr. Mallet]170-mr. mallet , perhaps , if [he]170-mr. mallet will be so good , will show [you]193-mary garland the theory . As [[an artist]3186-an artist 's wife]4495-an artist 's wife , [you]193-mary garland ought to know something about it . "[191-mrs. hudson]

" [One]3107-one learns a good deal about it , here , by simply living , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland ; " by going and coming about [one]3107-one 's daily avocations . "[281-rowland]

" [Dear]3392-dear , [dear]3392-dear , how wonderful that [we]4710-we should be here in the midst of it ! "[191-mrs. hudson] murmured [Mrs. Hudson]191-mrs. hudson . " To think of art being out there in [the streets]959-the streets ! [We]4710-we did n't see much of it last evening , as [we]4710-we drove from [the depot]4712-the depot . But [the streets]959-the streets were so dark and [we]4710-we were so frightened ! But [we]4710-we are very easy now ; are n't [we]4710-we , [Mary]193-mary garland ? "[191-mrs. hudson]

" [I]193-mary garland am very happy , "[193-mary garland] said [Mary]193-mary garland , gravely , and wandered back to the window again .

[Roderick]186-roderick came in at this moment and kissed [[his]186-roderick mother]448-his mother , and then went over and joined [Miss Garland]182-miss garland . [Rowland]281-rowland sat with [Mrs. Hudson]191-mrs. hudson , who evidently had a word which [she]281-rowland deemed of some value for [his]186-roderick private ear . [She]281-rowland followed [Roderick]186-roderick with intensely earnest eyes .

" [I]281-rowland wish to tell [you]186-roderick , [sir]3318-sir , "[281-rowland] [she]281-rowland said , " how very grateful - how very thankful - what [a happy mother]4715-a happy mother [I]281-rowland am ! [Rowland]281-rowland wore , in response to this speech , a rather haggard brow . [He]2077-he could only murmur that [he]2077-he was glad [she]281-rowland found [Roderick]186-roderick looking well . [He]2077-he had of course promptly asked [himself]2077-he whether the best discretion dictated that [he]2077-he should give [her]281-rowland a word of warning - just turn the handle of the door through which , later , disappointment might enter . [He]2077-he had determined to say nothing , but simply to wait in silence for [Roderick]186-roderick to find effective inspiration in those confidently expectant eyes . It was to be supposed that [he]2077-he was seeking for it now ; [he]2077-he remained sometime at the window with [[his]2077-he cousin]343-his cousin . But at last [he]2077-he turned away and came over to [the fireside]2079-the fireside with a contraction of the eyebrows which seemed to intimate that [Miss Garland]182-miss garland 's influence was for the moment , at least , not soothing . [She]281-rowland presently followed [him]2077-he , and for an instant [Rowland]281-rowland observed [her]281-rowland watching [him]2077-he as if [she]281-rowland thought [him]2077-he strange . [Rowland]281-rowland returned the next day , with plenty of zeal for the part [Roderick]186-roderick had assigned to [him]186-roderick . [Roderick]186-roderick was in high good - humor , and , in [the carriage]3735-the carriage , was watching [[his]186-roderick mother]448-his mother with a fine mixture of filial and professional tenderness . [Mrs. Hudson]191-mrs. hudson looked up mistrustfully at [the tall , shabby houses]2088-the tall , shabby houses , and grasped the side of the barouche in [her]191-mrs. hudson hand , as if [she]191-mrs. hudson were in [a sail - boat]2089-a sail - boat , in [dangerous waters]2090-dangerous waters . [Rowland]281-rowland sat opposite to [Miss Garland]182-miss garland . [She]281-rowland was totally oblivious of [[her]281-rowland companions]751-her companions ; from the moment [the carriage]3735-the carriage left [the hotel]2093-the hotel , [she]281-rowland sat gazing , wide - eyed and absorbed , at the objects about [them]2085-they . If [Rowland]281-rowland had felt disposed [he]2094-he might have made a joke of [her]281-rowland intense seriousness . From time to time [he]2094-he told [her]281-rowland the name of [a place]2095-a place or [a building]2096-a building , and [she]281-rowland nodded , without looking at [him]2094-he . This was a great deal , but [she]281-rowland listened attentively , keeping [her]281-rowland eyes fixed on the dome . To [Rowland]281-rowland [himself]281-rowland it had never seemed so radiantly sublime as at these moments ; [he]2094-he felt almost as if [he]2094-he had contrived it [himself]2094-he and had a right to be proud of it . " Well , what do [you]182-miss garland think of [Europe]1-europe ? "[2094-he] [he]2094-he asked , smiling .

" [I]182-miss garland think it 's horrible ! "[182-miss garland] [she]182-miss garland said abruptly .

" Horrible ? "[182-miss garland]

" [I]182-miss garland feel so strangely - [I]182-miss garland could almost cry . "[182-miss garland]

" How is it that [you]182-miss garland feel ? "[182-miss garland]

" So sorry for the poor past , that seems to have died here , in [my]182-miss garland heart , in an hour ! "[182-miss garland]

"[182-miss garland]

" Do n't mind the pain , and it will cease to trouble [you]182-miss garland . Enjoy , enjoy ; it is [your]182-miss garland duty . [Yours]182-miss garland especially ! "[182-miss garland]

" Why [mine]182-miss garland especially ? "[182-miss garland]

" [One]3107-one is in for it in one way or another , and one might as well do it with a good grace as with a bad ! Since one ca n't escape life , it is better to take it by the hand . "[182-miss garland]

If [Rowland]281-rowland was not frightened , neither , perhaps , was [Miss Garland]182-miss garland ; but [she]182-miss garland seemed at least slightly disturbed . [She]182-miss garland proposed that [they]2113-our should join [[their]2113-our companions]2108-their companions .

[A young lady]648-a young lady had approached the sacred effigy , after having wandered away from [a group of companions]2122-a group of companions . [She]191-mrs. hudson kissed [the brazen toe]2123-the brazen toe , touched it with [her]191-mrs. hudson forehead , and turned round , facing [[our]2117-our friends]839-our friends . [Rowland]281-rowland then recognized [Christina Light]192-christina . [He]2119-a squalid , savage - looking peasant was stupefied : had [she]192-christina suddenly embraced the Catholic faith ? It was but a few weeks before that [she]192-christina had treated [him]2119-a squalid , savage - looking peasant to a passionate profession of indifference . " [You]281-rowland told [me]193-mary garland , "[193-mary garland] [she]193-mary garland said gently , to [Rowland]281-rowland , " that [Rome]4-rome contained some of the most beautiful things in [the world]483-the world .
