At this moment [Christina]192-christina 's eye met [Rowland]281-rowland 's and before giving [him]2119-a squalid , savage - looking peasant any sign of recognition [she]281-rowland glanced rapidly at [[his]2119-a squalid , savage - looking peasant companions]654-his companions . [She]281-rowland saw [Roderick]186-roderick , but [she]281-rowland gave [him]186-roderick no bow ; [she]281-rowland looked at [Mrs. Hudson]191-mrs. hudson , [she]281-rowland looked at [Mary Garland]193-mary garland . At [Mary Garland]193-mary garland [she]281-rowland looked fixedly , piercingly , from head to foot , as the slow pace at which [she]281-rowland was advancing made possible . Then suddenly , as if [she]281-rowland had perceived [Roderick]186-roderick for the first time , [she]281-rowland gave [him]186-roderick a charming nod , a radiant smile . In a moment [he]186-roderick was at [her]281-rowland side . [She]281-rowland stopped , and [he]186-roderick stood talking to [her]281-rowland ; [she]281-rowland continued to look at [Miss Garland]182-miss garland .

" Why , [Roderick]186-roderick knows [her]182-miss garland ! "[191-mrs. hudson] cried [Mrs. Hudson]191-mrs. hudson , in an awe - struck whisper . " [I]191-mrs. hudson supposed [she]182-miss garland was [some great princess]4766-some great princess . "[191-mrs. hudson]

" [She]182-miss garland is - almost ! "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland . " [She]182-miss garland is [the most beautiful girl in [Europe]1-europe]4767-the most beautiful girl in europe , and [Roderick]186-roderick has made [her]182-miss garland bust . "[281-rowland]

" [Her]182-miss garland bust ? Dear , [dear]3392-dear ! "[191-mrs. hudson] murmured [Mrs. Hudson]191-mrs. hudson , vaguely shocked . " What a strange bonnet ! "[191-mrs. hudson]

" [She]182-miss garland has very strange eyes , "[193-mary garland] said [Mary]193-mary garland , and turned away .

[The two ladies]656-the two ladies , with [Rowland]281-rowland , began to descend toward the door of [the church]4439-the church . On [their]656-the two ladies way [they]656-the two ladies passed [Mrs. Light]253-mrs. light , [the Cavaliere]1279-the cavaliere , and the poodle , and [Rowland]281-rowland informed [[his]2133-his companions]654-his companions of the relation in which [these personages]2135-these personages stood to [[Roderick]186-roderick 's young lady]2136-roderick 's young lady .

" Think of it , [Mary]193-mary garland ! "[191-mrs. hudson] said [Mrs. Hudson]191-mrs. hudson . " [What splendid people [he]186-roderick must know]4769-what splendid people he must know ! No wonder [he]186-roderick found [Northampton dull]2-northampton ! "[191-mrs. hudson]

" [I]193-mary garland like [the poor little old gentleman]4770-the poor little old gentleman , "[193-mary garland] said [Mary]193-mary garland .

" Why do [you]281-rowland call [him]186-roderick poor ? "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland asked , struck with the observation .

" [He]186-roderick seems so ! "[281-rowland] [she]281-rowland answered simply .

As [they]2137-they were reaching the door [they]2137-they were overtaken by [Roderick]186-roderick , whose interview with [Miss Light]254-miss light had perceptibly brightened [his]186-roderick eye . " So [you]186-roderick are acquainted with [princesses]4585-princesses ! "[448-his mother] said [[his]186-roderick mother]448-his mother softly , as [they]2137-they passed into [the portico]2139-the portico .

" [Miss Light]254-miss light is not [a princess]356-a princess ! "[186-roderick] said [Roderick]186-roderick , curtly .

" But [Mr. Mallet]170-mr. mallet says so , "[191-mrs. hudson] urged [Mrs. Hudson]191-mrs. hudson , rather disappointed .

" [I]281-rowland meant that [she]254-miss light was going to be ! "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland .

" It 's by no means certain that [she]254-miss light is even going to be ! "[186-roderick] [Roderick]186-roderick answered .

" Ah , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland , " [I]281-rowland give it up ! "[281-rowland]

[Roderick]186-roderick almost immediately demanded that [[his]186-roderick mother]448-his mother should sit to [him]186-roderick , at [[his]186-roderick studio]873-his studio , for [her]448-his mother portrait , and [Rowland]281-rowland ventured to add another word of urgency . If [Roderick]186-roderick 's idea really held [him]186-roderick , it was an immense pity that [his]186-roderick inspiration should be wasted ; inspiration , in these days , had become too precious a commodity . It was arranged therefore that , for the present , during the mornings , [Mrs. Hudson]191-mrs. hudson should place [herself]191-mrs. hudson at [[her]191-mrs. hudson son]459-her son 's service . This involved but little sacrifice , for [the good lady]2143-the good lady 's appetite for antiquities was diminutive and bird - like , the usual round of [galleries]2144-galleries and [churches]784-churches fatigued [her]2143-the good lady , and [she]2143-the good lady was glad to purchase immunity from sight - seeing by a regular afternoon drive . It became natural in this way that , [Miss Garland]182-miss garland having [her]182-miss garland mornings free , [Rowland]281-rowland should propose to be [[the younger lady]2146-the younger lady 's guide]2147-the younger lady 's guide in whatever explorations [she]182-miss garland might be disposed to make . [She]182-miss garland said [she]182-miss garland knew nothing about it , but [she]182-miss garland had a great curiosity , and would be glad to see anything that [he]186-roderick would show [her]182-miss garland . [Rowland]281-rowland could not find it in [his]186-roderick heart to accuse [Roderick]186-roderick of neglect of [the young girl]659-the young girl ; for it was natural that the inspirations of [a capricious man of genius]2149-a capricious man of genius , when they came , should be imperious ; but of course [he]186-roderick wondered how [Miss Garland]182-miss garland felt , as [[the young man]347-the young man 's promised wife]2151-the young man 's promised wife , on being thus expeditiously handed over to [another man to be entertained]2152-another man to be entertained . However [she]182-miss garland felt , [he]186-roderick was certain [he]186-roderick would know little about it . There had been , between [them]2153-they , none but indirect allusions to [her]182-miss garland engagement , and [Rowland]281-rowland had no desire to discuss it more largely ; for [he]186-roderick had no quarrel with matters as [they]2153-they stood . [They]2153-they wore the same delightful aspect through the lovely month of May , and the ineffable charm of [Rome]4-rome at that period seemed but the radiant sympathy of nature with [his]186-roderick happy opportunity . The weather was divine ; each particular morning , as [he]186-roderick walked from [[his]186-roderick lodging]1000-his lodging to [[Mrs. Hudson]191-mrs. hudson 's modest inn]2155-mrs. hudson 's modest inn , seemed to have a blessing upon it . [The elder lady]632-the elder lady had usually gone off to [the studio]3654-the studio , and [he]186-roderick found [Miss Garland]182-miss garland sitting alone at the open window , turning the leaves of some book of artistic or antiquarian reference that [he]186-roderick had given [her]182-miss garland . [She]182-miss garland always had a smile , [she]182-miss garland was always eager , alert , responsive . [She]182-miss garland might be grave by nature , [she]182-miss garland might be sad by circumstance , [she]182-miss garland might have secret doubts and pangs , but [she]182-miss garland was essentially young and strong and fresh and able to enjoy . [Her]182-miss garland enjoyment was not especially demonstrative , but it was curiously diligent . [Rowland]281-rowland felt that it was not amusement and sensation that [she]182-miss garland coveted , but knowledge - facts that [she]182-miss garland might noiselessly lay away , piece by piece , in the perfumed darkness of [her]182-miss garland serious mind , so that , under this head at least , [she]182-miss garland should not be [a perfectly portionless bride]2158-a perfectly portionless bride . [She]182-miss garland never merely pretended to understand ; [she]182-miss garland let things go , in [her]182-miss garland modest fashion , at the moment , but [she]182-miss garland watched [them]2159-them on [their]2159-them way , over [the crest of [the hill]3455-the hill]2160-the crest of the hill , and when [her]182-miss garland fancy seemed not likely to be missed it went hurrying after [them]2159-them and ran breathless at [their]2159-them side , as it were , and begged [them]2159-them for the secret . [Rowland]281-rowland took an immense satisfaction in observing that [she]182-miss garland never mistook the second - best for the best , and that when [she]182-miss garland was in the presence of a masterpiece , [she]182-miss garland recognized the occasion as a mighty one . [She]182-miss garland said many things which [he]2162-he thought very profound - that is , if they really had the fine intention [he]2162-he suspected . This point [he]2162-he usually tried to ascertain ; but [he]2162-he was obliged to proceed cautiously , for in [her]182-miss garland mistrustful shyness it seemed to [her]182-miss garland that cross - examination must necessarily be ironical . [She]182-miss garland wished to know just where [she]182-miss garland was going - what [she]182-miss garland would gain or lose . This was partly on account of [a native intellectual purity]2163-a native intellectual purity , a temper of mind that had not lived with [its]2164-its door ajar , as one might say , upon the high - road of thought , for passing ideas to drop in and out at [their]2159-them pleasure ; but had made much of a few long visits from [guests cherished and honored - guests whose presence was a solemnity]2165-guests cherished and honored - guests whose presence was a solemnity . But it was even more because [she]182-miss garland was conscious of a sort of growing self - respect , a sense of devoting [her]182-miss garland life not to [her]182-miss garland own ends , but to those of [another , whose life would be large and brilliant]2166-another , whose life would be large and brilliant . [She]182-miss garland had been brought up to think a great deal of " nature "[281-rowland] and nature 's innocent laws ; but now [Rowland]281-rowland had spoken to [her]182-miss garland ardently of culture ; [her]182-miss garland strenuous fancy had responded , and [she]182-miss garland was pursuing culture into retreats where the need for some intellectual effort gave a noble severity to [her]182-miss garland purpose . [She]182-miss garland wished to be very sure , to take only the best , knowing it to be the best . There was something exquisite in this labor of pious self - adornment , and [Rowland]281-rowland helped it , though its fruits were not for [him]2167-him . In spite of [her]182-miss garland lurking rigidity and angularity , it was very evident that a nervous , impulsive sense of beauty was constantly at play in [her]182-miss garland soul , and that [her]182-miss garland actual experience of beautiful things moved [her]182-miss garland in some very deep places . For all that [she]182-miss garland was not demonstrative , that [her]182-miss garland manner was simple , and [her]182-miss garland small - talk of no very ample flow ; for all that , as [she]182-miss garland had said , [she]182-miss garland was [a young woman from [the country]438-the country]4758-a young woman from the country , and [the country]438-the country was [West Nazareth]36-west nazareth , and [West Nazareth]36-west nazareth was in its way a stubborn little fact , [she]182-miss garland was feeling the direct influence of the great amenities of [the world]483-the world , and [they]2172-they were shaping [her]182-miss garland with a divinely intelligent touch . " Oh exquisite virtue of circumstance ! "[281-rowland] cried [Rowland]281-rowland to [himself]281-rowland , " that takes [us]4773-us by the hand and leads [us]4773-us forth out of corners where , perforce , [our]4773-us attitudes are a trifle contracted , and beguiles [us]4773-us into testing mistrusted faculties ! "[281-rowland] When [he]2173-he said to [Mary Garland]193-mary garland that [he]2173-he wished [he]2173-he might see [her]193-mary garland ten years hence , [he]2173-he was paying mentally an equal compliment to circumstance and to [the girl]3228-the girl [herself]3228-the girl . [Capacity]312-capacity was there , it could be freely trusted ; observation would have but to sow its generous seed . " [A superior woman]4774-a superior woman "[2173-he] - the idea had harsh associations , but [he]2173-he watched it imaging itself in the vagueness of the future with a kind of hopeless confidence .

[They]2175-they went a great deal to [[Saint Peter]265-saint peter 's]2176-saint peter 's , for which [Rowland]281-rowland had an exceeding affection , a large measure of which [he]2173-he succeeded in infusing into [[his]2173-he companion]555-his companion . [She]555-his companion confessed very speedily that to climb the long , low , yellow steps , beneath the huge florid facade , and then to push the ponderous leathern apron of the door , to find [one 's self confronted with that builded , luminous sublimity]2178-one 's self confronted with that builded , luminous sublimity , was a sensation of which the keenness renewed itself with surprising generosity . In those days the hospitality of [the Vatican]943-the vatican had not been curtailed , and it was an easy and delightful matter to pass from [the gorgeous church]2180-the gorgeous church to the solemn company of the antique marbles . Here [Rowland]281-rowland had with [[his]2173-he companion]555-his companion a great deal of talk , and found [himself]2173-he expounding aesthetics a perte de vue . [He]2173-he discovered that [she]555-his companion made notes of [her]555-his companion likes and dislikes in a new - looking little memorandum book , and [he]2173-he wondered to what extent [she]555-his companion reported [his]2173-he own discourse . These were charming hours . [The galleries]2182-the galleries had been so cold all winter that [Rowland]281-rowland had been an exile from [them]2182-the galleries ; but now that the sun was already scorching in [the great square]2183-the great square between the colonnades , where the twin fountains flashed almost fiercely , the marble coolness of the long , image - bordered vistas made [them]2182-the galleries a delightful refuge . [The great herd of tourists]2184-the great herd of tourists had almost departed , and [[our]2185-our two friends]2186-our two friends often found [themselves]2186-our two friends , for half an hour at a time , in sole and tranquil possession of [the beautiful Braccio Nuovo]135-the beautiful braccio nuovo . Here and there was an open window , where [they]2186-our two friends lingered and leaned , looking out into the warm , dead air , over [the towers of [the city]832-the city]2187-the towers of the city , at [the soft - hued , historic hills]2189-the soft - hued , historic hills , at [the stately shabby gardens of [the palace]1405-the palace]2190-the stately shabby gardens of the palace , or at [some sunny , empty , grass - grown court]2192-some sunny , empty , grass - grown court , lost in the heart of the labyrinthine pile . [They]2186-our two friends went sometimes into [the chambers painted by [Raphael]301-raphael , and of course paid [their]2186-our two friends respects to [the Sistine Chapel]2194-the sistine chapel]2193-the chambers painted by raphael , and of course paid their respects to the sistine chapel ; but [Mary]193-mary garland 's evident preference was to linger among the statues . Once , when [they]2186-our two friends were standing before that noblest of sculptured portraits , the so - called [Demosthenes]313-demosthenes , in [the Braccio Nuovo]135-the beautiful braccio nuovo , [she]193-mary garland made the only spontaneous allusion to [her]193-mary garland projected marriage , direct or indirect , that had yet fallen from [her]193-mary garland lips . " [I]193-mary garland am so glad , "[193-mary garland] [she]193-mary garland said , " that [Roderick]186-roderick is [a sculptor]3131-a sculptor and not [a painter]3872-a painter . "[193-mary garland]

The allusion resided chiefly in the extreme earnestness with which the words were uttered . [Rowland]281-rowland immediately asked [her]193-mary garland the reason of [her]193-mary garland gladness .

" It 's not that painting is not fine , "[193-mary garland] [she]193-mary garland said , " but that sculpture is finer . It is more manly . "[193-mary garland]

[Rowland]281-rowland tried at times to make [her]193-mary garland talk about [herself]193-mary garland , but in this [she]193-mary garland had little skill . [She]193-mary garland seemed to [him]2195-you so much older , so much more pliant to social uses than when [he]2195-you had seen [her]193-mary garland at [home]349-home , that [he]2195-you had a desire to draw from [her]193-mary garland some categorical account of [her]193-mary garland occupation and thoughts . [He]2195-you told [her]193-mary garland [his]2195-you desire and what suggested it . " It appears , then , "[193-mary garland] [she]193-mary garland said , " that , after all , [one]3107-one can grow at [home]349-home ! "[193-mary garland]

" Unquestionably , if [one]3107-one has a motive . [Your]2195-you growth , then , was unconscious ? [You]2195-you did not watch [yourself]2195-you and water [your]2195-you roots ? "[2195-you]

[She]193-mary garland paid no heed to [his]2195-you question . " [I]193-mary garland am willing to grant , "[193-mary garland] [she]193-mary garland said , " that [Europe]1-europe is more delightful than [I]193-mary garland supposed ; and [I]193-mary garland do n't think that , mentally , [I]193-mary garland had been stingy . But [you]2195-you must admit that [America]25-america is better than [you]2195-you have supposed . "[193-mary garland]

" [I]281-rowland have not a fault to find with [the country which produced [you]2195-you]4780-the country which produced you ! "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland thought [he]2195-you might risk this , smiling .

" And yet [you]2195-you want [me]281-rowland to change - to assimilate [Europe]1-europe , [I]281-rowland suppose [you]2195-you would call it . "[281-rowland]

" [I]281-rowland have felt that desire only on general principles . Shall [I]281-rowland tell [you]2195-you what [I]281-rowland feel now ? [America]25-america has made [you]2195-you thus far ; let [America]25-america finish [you]2195-you ! [I]281-rowland should like to ship [you]2195-you back without delay and see what becomes of [you]2195-you . That sounds unkind , and [I]281-rowland admit there is a cold intellectual curiosity in it . "[281-rowland]

[She]281-rowland shook [her]281-rowland head . " The charm is broken ; the thread is snapped ! [I]281-rowland prefer to remain [here]3130-here . "[281-rowland]

Invariably , when [he]2197-he was inclined to make of something [they]2198-they were talking of a direct application to [herself]281-rowland , [she]281-rowland wholly failed to assist [him]2197-he ; [she]281-rowland made no response . Whereupon , once , with a spark of ardent irritation , [he]2197-he told [her]281-rowland [she]281-rowland was very ' secretive . " At this [she]281-rowland colored a little , and [he]2197-he said that in default of any larger confidence it would at least be a satisfaction to make [her]281-rowland confess to that charge . But even this satisfaction [she]281-rowland denied [him]2197-he , and [his]2197-he only revenge was in making , two or three times afterward , a softly ironical allusion to [her]281-rowland slyness . [He]2197-he told [her]281-rowland that [she]281-rowland was what is called in French a sournoise . "[2197-he] Very good , " [she]281-rowland answered , almost indifferently , "[2197-he] and now please tell [me]0-i again - [I]0-i have forgotten it - what [you]2197-he said [an ' architrave]2199-an ' architrave ' was . "[2197-he]

It was on the occasion of [her]281-rowland asking [him]2197-he a question of this kind that [he]2197-he charged [her]281-rowland , with a humorous emphasis in which , also , if [she]281-rowland had been curious in the matter , [she]281-rowland might have detected a spark of restless ardor , with having an insatiable avidity for facts . " [You]281-rowland are always snatching at information , "[2197-he] [he]2197-he said ; " [you]281-rowland will never consent to have any disinterested conversation . "[2197-he]

[She]281-rowland frowned a little , as [she]281-rowland always did when [he]2197-he arrested [their]2200-their talk upon something personal . But this time [she]281-rowland assented , and said that [she]281-rowland knew [she]281-rowland was eager for facts . " [One]3107-one must make hay while the sun shines , "[281-rowland] [she]281-rowland added . " [I]281-rowland must lay up a store of learning against dark days . Somehow , [my]281-rowland imagination refuses to compass the idea that [I]281-rowland may be in [Rome]4-rome indefinitely . "[281-rowland]

[He]2197-he knew [he]2197-he had divined [her]281-rowland real motives ; but [he]2197-he felt that if [he]2197-he might have said to [her]281-rowland - what it seemed impossible to say - that fortune possibly had in store for [her]281-rowland a bitter disappointment , [she]281-rowland would have been capable of answering , immediately after the first sense of pain , " Say then that [I]281-rowland am laying up resources for solitude ! "[281-rowland]

But all the accusations were not [his]2197-he . [He]2197-he had been watching , once , during some brief argument , to see whether [she]281-rowland would take [her]281-rowland forefinger out of [her]281-rowland Murray , into which [she]281-rowland had inserted it to keep a certain page . It would have been hard to say why this point interested [him]2197-he , for [he]2197-he had not the slightest real apprehension that [she]281-rowland was dry or pedantic . The simple human truth was , [the poor fellow]3562-the poor fellow was jealous of science . In preaching science to [her]281-rowland , [he]2197-he had over - estimated [his]2197-he powers of self - effacement . Suddenly , sinking science for the moment , [she]281-rowland looked at [him]2197-he very frankly and began to frown . At the same time [she]281-rowland let [the Murray]314-the murray slide down to the ground , and [he]2197-he was so charmed with this circumstance that [he]2197-he made no movement to pick it up .

" [You]2197-he are singularly inconsistent , [Mr. Mallet]170-mr. mallet , "[281-rowland] [she]281-rowland said .

" How ? "[281-rowland]

" That first day that [we]4783-we were in [Saint Peter]265-saint peter 's [you]2197-he said things that inspired [me]281-rowland . [You]2197-he bade [me]281-rowland plunge into all this . [I]281-rowland was all ready ; [I]281-rowland only wanted a little push ; [yours]2197-he was a great one ; here [I]281-rowland am in [mid - ocean]765-mid - ocean ! And now , as a reward for [my]281-rowland bravery , [you]2197-he have repeatedly snubbed [me]281-rowland . "[281-rowland]

" Distinctly , then , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland , " [I]281-rowland strike [you]2197-he as inconsistent ? "[281-rowland]

" That is the word . "[281-rowland]

" Then [I]281-rowland have played [my]281-rowland part very ill . "[281-rowland]

" [Your]281-rowland part ? What is [your]281-rowland part supposed to have been ? "[281-rowland]

[He]2202-i hesitated a moment . " That of usefulness , pure and simple . "[2202-i]

" [I]2203-you do n't understand [you]2202-i ! "[2203-you] [she]2203-you said ; and picking up [her]2203-you Murray , [she]2203-you fairly buried [herself]2203-you in it .

That evening [he]2202-i said something to [her]2203-you which necessarily increased [her]2203-you perplexity , though it was not uttered with such an intention . " Do [you]2203-you remember , "[2202-i] [he]2202-i asked , " [my]2202-i begging [you]2203-you , the other day , to do occasionally as [I]2202-i told [you]2203-you ? It seemed to [me]2202-i [you]2203-you tacitly consented . "[2202-i]

" Very tacitly . "[2202-i]

" [I]2202-i have never yet really presumed on [your]2203-you consent . But now [I]2202-i would like [you]2203-you to do this : whenever [you]2203-you catch [me]2202-i in the act of what [you]2203-you call inconsistency , ask [me]2202-i the meaning of some architectural term . [I]2202-i will know what [you]2203-you mean ; a word to the wise ! "[2202-i]

One morning [they]2204-they spent among [the ruins of [the Palatine]2206-the palatine]3108-the ruins of the palatine , that sunny desolation of crumbling , over - tangled fragments , half excavated and half identified , known as [the Palace of [the Caesars]2208-the caesars]2207-the palace of the caesars . Nothing in [Rome]4-rome is more interesting , and [no locality]2209-no locality has such a confusion of picturesque charms . [It]2210-it is [a vast , rambling garden]2211-a vast , rambling garden , where [you]2212-you stumble at every step on the disinterred bones of the past ; where [damp , frescoed corridors]2213-damp , frescoed corridors , relics , possibly , of [[Nero]315-nero 's [Golden House]137-golden house]2214-nero 's golden house , serve as gigantic bowers , and where , in the springtime , [you]2212-you may sit on a Latin inscription , in the shade of a flowering almond - tree , and admire the composition of [the Campagna]59-the campagna . The day left a deep impression on [Rowland]281-rowland 's mind , partly owing to its intrinsic sweetness , and partly because [[his]2215-his companion]555-his companion , on this occasion , let [her]281-rowland Murray lie unopened for an hour , and asked several questions irrelevant to [the Consuls]2217-the consuls and [the Caesars]2208-the caesars . [She]281-rowland had begun by saying that it was coming over [her]281-rowland , after all , that [Rome]4-rome was [a ponderously sad place]2219-a ponderously sad place . The sirocco was gently blowing , the air was heavy , [she]281-rowland was tired , [she]281-rowland looked a little pale .

" Everything , "[281-rowland] [she]281-rowland said , ' seems to say that all things are vanity . If [one]3107-one is doing something , [I]0-i suppose [one]3107-one feels a certain strength within one to contradict it . But if [one]3107-one is idle , surely it is depressing to live , year after year , among the ashes of things that once were mighty . If [I]0-i were to remain [here]3130-here [I]0-i should either become permanently ' low , ' as [they]2224-i say , or [I]0-i would take refuge in some dogged daily work . "[2224-i]

" What work ? "[281-rowland]

" [I]2224-i would open [a school for [those beautiful little beggars]4786-those beautiful little beggars]4785-a school for those beautiful little beggars ; though [I]2224-i am sadly afraid [I]2224-i should never bring [myself]2224-i to scold [them]4786-those beautiful little beggars . "[2224-i]

" [I]281-rowland am idle , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland , " and yet [I]281-rowland have kept up a certain spirit . "[281-rowland]

" [I]281-rowland do n't call [you]281-rowland idle , "[281-rowland] [she]281-rowland answered with emphasis .

" It is very good of [you]281-rowland . Do [you]281-rowland remember [our]4787-our talking about that in [Northampton]2-northampton ? "[2224-i]

" During that picnic ? Perfectly . Has [your]281-rowland coming abroad succeeded , for [yourself]281-rowland , as well as [you]281-rowland hoped ? "[2224-i]

" [I]2224-i think [I]2224-i may say that it has turned out as well as [I]2224-i expected . "[2224-i]

" Are [you]281-rowland happy ? "[2224-i]

" Do n't [I]2224-i look so ? "[2224-i]

" So it seems to [me]281-rowland . But "[281-rowland] - and [she]281-rowland hesitated a moment - " [I]281-rowland imagine [you]281-rowland look happy whether [you]281-rowland are so or not . "[281-rowland]

" [I]2224-i ' m like that ancient comic mask that [we]4787-our saw just now in [yonder]138-yonder excavated fresco : [I]2224-i am made to grin . "[2224-i]

" Shall [you]281-rowland come back here next winter ? "[281-rowland]

" Very probably . "[2224-i]

" Are [you]281-rowland settled [here]3130-here forever ? "[281-rowland]

" ' Forever ' is a long time . [I]2224-i live only from year to year . "[2224-i]

" Shall [you]281-rowland never marry ? "[281-rowland]

[Rowland]281-rowland gave a laugh . " ' Forever ' - ' never ! ' [You]281-rowland handle large ideas . [I]281-rowland have not taken a vow of celibacy . "[281-rowland]

" Would n't [you]281-rowland like to marry ? "[2224-i]

" [I]281-rowland should like it immensely . "[281-rowland]

To this [she]281-rowland made no rejoinder : but presently [she]281-rowland asked , " Why do n't [you]281-rowland write a book ? "[281-rowland]

[Rowland]281-rowland laughed , this time more freely . " A book ! What book should [I]281-rowland write ? "[281-rowland]

" A history ; something about art or antiquities . "[281-rowland]

" [I]281-rowland have neither the learning nor the talent . "[281-rowland]

[She]281-rowland made no attempt to contradict [him]2225-him ; [she]281-rowland simply said [she]281-rowland had supposed otherwise . " [You]281-rowland ought , at any rate , "[281-rowland] [she]281-rowland continued in a moment , " to do something for [yourself]281-rowland . "[281-rowland]

" For [myself]281-rowland ? [I]281-rowland should have supposed that if ever [a man]3214-a man seemed to live for [himself]3214-a man "[281-rowland] -

" [I]281-rowland do n't know how it seems , "[281-rowland] [she]281-rowland interrupted , " to [careless observers]4790-careless observers . But [we]4791-we know - [we]4791-we know that [you]281-rowland have lived - a great deal - for [us]4791-we . "[281-rowland]

[Her]281-rowland voice trembled slightly , and [she]281-rowland brought out the last words with a little jerk .

" [She]281-rowland has had that speech on [her]281-rowland conscience , "[281-rowland] thought [Rowland]281-rowland ; ' [she]281-rowland has been thinking [she]281-rowland owed it to [me]0-i , and it seemed to [her]281-rowland that now was [her]281-rowland time to make it and have done with it . "[281-rowland]

[She]281-rowland went on in a way which confirmed these reflections , speaking with due solemnity . " [You]281-rowland ought to be made to know very well what [we]4791-we all feel . [Mrs. Hudson]191-mrs. hudson tells [me]281-rowland that [she]281-rowland has told [you]281-rowland what [she]281-rowland feels . Of course [Roderick]186-roderick has expressed [himself]186-roderick . [I]281-rowland have been wanting to thank [you]281-rowland too ; [I]281-rowland do , from [my]281-rowland heart . "[281-rowland]

[Rowland]281-rowland made no answer ; [his]2226-he face at this moment resembled the tragic mask much more than the comic . But [Miss Garland]182-miss garland was not looking at [him]2226-he ; [she]182-miss garland had taken up [her]182-miss garland Murray again .

In the afternoon [she]182-miss garland usually drove with [Mrs. Hudson]191-mrs. hudson , but [Rowland]281-rowland frequently saw [her]182-miss garland again in the evening . [He]2226-he was apt to spend half an hour in [the little sitting - room at [the hotel]2093-the hotel - pension on [the slope of [the Pincian]51-the pincian]2229-the slope of the pincian]2227-the little sitting - room at the hotel - pension on the slope of the pincian , and [Roderick]186-roderick , who dined regularly with [[his]186-roderick mother]448-his mother , was present on these occasions . [Rowland]281-rowland saw [him]2226-he little at other times , and for three weeks no observations passed between [them]2231-them on the subject of [Mrs. Hudson]191-mrs. hudson 's advent . To [Rowland]281-rowland 's vision , as the weeks elapsed , the benefits to proceed from the presence of [the two ladies]656-the two ladies remained shrouded in mystery . [Roderick]186-roderick was peculiarly inscrutable . [He]2226-he was preoccupied with [his]2226-he work on [[his]2226-he mother]448-his mother 's portrait , which was taking a very happy turn ; and often , when [he]2226-he sat silent , with [his]2226-he hands in [his]2226-he pockets , [his]2226-he legs outstretched , [his]2226-he head thrown back , and [his]2226-he eyes on vacancy , it was to be supposed that [his]2226-he fancy was hovering about the half - shaped image in [[his]2226-he studio]873-his studio , exquisite even in its immaturity . [He]2226-he said little , but [his]2226-he silence did not of necessity imply disaffection , for [he]2226-he evidently found it a deep personal luxury to lounge away the hours in an atmosphere so charged with feminine tenderness . [He]2226-he was not alert , [he]2226-he suggested nothing in the way of excursions [Rowland]281-rowland was the prime mover in such as were attempted , but [he]2226-he conformed passively at least to the tranquil temper of [the two women]675-the two women , and made no harsh comments nor sombre allusions . [Rowland]281-rowland wondered whether [he]2226-he had , after all , done [[his]2226-he friend]606-his friend injustice in denying [him]2226-he the sentiment of duty . [He]2226-he refused invitations , to [Rowland]281-rowland 's knowledge , in order to dine at [the jejune little table - d'hote]2237-the jejune little table - d'hote ; wherever [his]2226-he spirit might be , [he]2226-he was present in the flesh with religious constancy . [[Mrs. Hudson]191-mrs. hudson 's felicity]2238-mrs. hudson 's felicity betrayed itself in a remarkable tendency to finish [her]191-mrs. hudson sentences and wear [her]191-mrs. hudson best black silk gown . [Her]191-mrs. hudson tremors had trembled away ; [she]191-mrs. hudson was like [a child who discovers that the shaggy monster it has so long been afraid to touch]2239-a child who discovers that the shaggy monster it has so long been afraid to touch is an inanimate terror , compounded of straw and saw - dust , and that it is even a safe audacity to tickle its nose . As to whether the love - knot of which [Mary Garland]193-mary garland had the keeping still held firm , who should pronounce ? [The young girl]659-the young girl , as [we]2241-we know , did not wear it on [her]659-the young girl sleeve . [She]659-the young girl always sat at the table , near the candles , with a piece of needle - work . This was the attitude in which [Rowland]281-rowland had first seen [her]659-the young girl , and [he]2226-he thought , now that [he]2226-he had seen [her]659-the young girl in several others , it was not the least becoming .

CHAPTER X. The Cavaliere

There befell at last a couple of days during which [Rowland]281-rowland was unable to go to [the hotel]2093-the hotel . Late in the evening of the second one [Roderick]186-roderick came into [[his]186-roderick room]1954-his room . In a few moments [he]186-roderick announced that [he]186-roderick had finished the bust of [[his]186-roderick mother]448-his mother .

" And it 's magnificent ! "[2226-he] [he]2226-he declared . " It 's one of the best things [I]2226-he have done . "[2226-he]

" [I]281-rowland believe it , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland . " Never again talk to [me]281-rowland about [your]281-rowland inspiration being dead . "[281-rowland]

" Why not ? This may be its last kick ! [I]2226-he feel very tired . But it 's a masterpiece , though [I]2226-he do say it . [They]4792-they tell [us]4793-us [we]4793-us owe so much to [[our]4793-us parents]4794-our parents . Well , [I]2226-he ' ve paid the filial debt handsomely ! "[2226-he] [He]2226-he walked up and down [the room]487-the room a few moments , with the purpose of [his]2226-he visit evidently still undischarged . " There 's one thing more [I]2226-he want to say , "[2226-he] [he]2226-he presently resumed . " [I]2226-he feel as if [I]2226-he ought to tell [you]281-rowland ! "[2226-he] [He]2226-he stopped before [Rowland]281-rowland with [his]2226-he head high and [his]2226-he brilliant glance unclouded . " [Your]281-rowland invention is a failure ! "[2226-he]

" [My]281-rowland invention ? "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland repeated .

" Bringing out [[my]2226-he mother]3224-my mother and [Mary]193-mary garland . "[2226-he]

" A failure ? "[2226-he]

" It 's no use ! [They]4796-them do n't help [me]2226-he . "[2226-he]

[Rowland]281-rowland had fancied that [Roderick]186-roderick had no more surprises for [him]186-roderick ; but [he]186-roderick was now staring at [him]186-roderick , wide - eyed .

" [They]4796-them bore [me]186-roderick ! "[186-roderick] [Roderick]186-roderick went on .

" Oh , oh ! "[281-rowland] cried [Rowland]281-rowland .

" Listen , listen ! "[186-roderick] said [Roderick]186-roderick with perfect gentleness . " [I]186-roderick am not complaining of [them]4796-them ; [I]186-roderick am simply stating a fact . [I]186-roderick am very sorry for [them]4796-them ; [I]186-roderick am greatly disappointed . "[186-roderick]

" Have [you]2226-he given [them]4796-them a fair trial ? "[186-roderick]

" Should n't [you]2226-he say so ? It seems to [me]186-roderick [I]186-roderick have behaved beautifully . "[186-roderick]

" [You]2226-he have done very well ; [I]186-roderick have been building great hopes on it . "[186-roderick]

" [I]186-roderick have done too well , then . After the first forty - eight hours [my]186-roderick own hopes collapsed . But [I]186-roderick determined to fight it out ; to stand within [the temple]3223-the temple ; to let the spirit of [the Lord]3617-the lord descend ! Do [you]2226-he want to know the result ? Another week of it , and [I]186-roderick shall begin to hate [them]4796-them . [I]186-roderick shall want to poison [them]4796-them . "[186-roderick]

" [Miserable boy]4799-miserable boy ! "[281-rowland] cried [Rowland]281-rowland . " [They]4796-them are the loveliest of [women]3288-women ! "[281-rowland]

" Very likely ! But [they]4796-them mean no more to [me]186-roderick than a Bible text to [an atheist]4801-an atheist ! "[186-roderick]

" [I]281-rowland utterly fail , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland , in a moment , " to understand [your]186-roderick relation to [Miss Garland]182-miss garland . "[281-rowland]

[Roderick]186-roderick shrugged [his]186-roderick shoulders and let [his]186-roderick hands drop at [his]186-roderick sides . " [She]182-miss garland adores [me]186-roderick ! That 's [my]186-roderick relation . "[186-roderick] And [he]186-roderick smiled strangely .

" Have [you]281-rowland broken [your]281-rowland engagement ? "[186-roderick]

" Broken it ? [You]281-rowland ca n't break a ray of moonshine . "[186-roderick]

" Have [you]281-rowland absolutely no affection for [her]182-miss garland ? "[186-roderick]

[Roderick]186-roderick placed [his]186-roderick hand on [his]186-roderick heart and held it there a moment . " Dead - dead - dead ! "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick said at last .

" [I]281-rowland wonder , "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland asked presently , " if [you]186-roderick begin to comprehend the beauty of [Miss Garland]182-miss garland 's character . [She]182-miss garland is [a person of the highest merit]4802-a person of the highest merit . "[281-rowland]

" Evidently - or [I]186-roderick would not have cared for [her]182-miss garland ! "[186-roderick]

" Has that no charm for [you]281-rowland now ? "[281-rowland]

" Oh , do n't force [a fellow]3651-a fellow to say rude things ! "[186-roderick]

" Well , [I]281-rowland can only say that [you]281-rowland do n't know what [you]281-rowland are giving up . "[281-rowland]

[Roderick]186-roderick gave a quickened glance . " Do [you]281-rowland know , so well ? "[186-roderick]

" [I]186-roderick admire [her]182-miss garland immeasurably . "[186-roderick]

[Roderick]186-roderick smiled , [we]2246-we may almost say sympathetically . " [You]281-rowland have not wasted time . "[186-roderick]

[Rowland]281-rowland 's thoughts were crowding upon [him]186-roderick fast . If [Roderick]186-roderick was resolute , why oppose [him]186-roderick ? If [Mary]193-mary garland was to be sacrificed , why , in that way , try to save [her]193-mary garland ? There was another way ; it only needed a little presumption to make it possible . [Rowland]281-rowland tried , mentally , to summon presumption to [his]186-roderick aid ; but whether it came or not , it found conscience there before it . [Conscience]316-conscience had only three words , but they were cogent . " For [her]182-miss garland sake - for [her]182-miss garland sake , "[281-rowland] it dumbly murmured , and [Rowland]281-rowland resumed [his]186-roderick argument . " [I]186-roderick do n't know what [I]186-roderick would n't do , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick said , " rather than that [Miss Garland]182-miss garland should suffer . "[186-roderick]

" There is one thing to be said , "[186-roderick] [Roderick]186-roderick answered reflectively . " [She]182-miss garland is very strong . "[186-roderick]

" Well , then , if [she]182-miss garland 's strong , believe that with a longer chance , a better chance , [she]182-miss garland will still regain [your]186-roderick affection . "[186-roderick]

" Do [you]281-rowland know what [you]281-rowland ask ? "[186-roderick] cried [Roderick]186-roderick . " Make love to [a girl [I]186-roderick hate]4804-a girl i hate ? "[186-roderick]

" [You]281-rowland hate ? "[186-roderick]

" As [[her]182-miss garland lover]1731-her lover , [I]186-roderick should hate [her]182-miss garland ! "[186-roderick]

" Listen to [me]281-rowland ! "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland with vehemence .

" No , listen [you]186-roderick to [me]186-roderick ! Do [you]186-roderick really urge [my]186-roderick marrying a woman who would bore [me]186-roderick to death ? [I]186-roderick would let [her]182-miss garland know it in very good season , and then where would [she]182-miss garland be ? "[186-roderick]

[Rowland]281-rowland walked the length of [the room]487-the room a couple of times and then stopped suddenly . " Go [your]186-roderick way , then ! Say all this to [her]182-miss garland , not to [me]281-rowland ! "[281-rowland]

" To [her]182-miss garland ? [I]281-rowland am afraid of [her]182-miss garland ; [I]281-rowland want [you]281-rowland to help [me]281-rowland . "[281-rowland]

" [[My]281-rowland dear]3110-my dear [Roderick]186-roderick , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland with an eloquent smile , " [I]281-rowland can help [you]186-roderick no more ! "[281-rowland]

[Roderick]186-roderick frowned , hesitated a moment , and then took [his]186-roderick hat . " Oh , well , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick said , " [I]186-roderick am not so afraid of [her]182-miss garland as all that ! "[186-roderick] And [he]186-roderick turned , as if to depart .

" Stop ! "[281-rowland] cried [Rowland]281-rowland , as [he]186-roderick laid [his]186-roderick hand on the door .

[Roderick]186-roderick paused and stood waiting , with [his]186-roderick irritated brow .

" Come back ; sit down there and listen to [me]186-roderick . Of anything [you]281-rowland were to say in [your]281-rowland present state of mind [you]281-rowland would live most bitterly to repent . [You]281-rowland do n't know what [you]281-rowland really think ; [you]281-rowland do n't know what [you]281-rowland really feel . [You]281-rowland do n't know [your]281-rowland own mind ; [you]281-rowland do n't do justice to [Miss Garland]182-miss garland . All this is impossible here , under these circumstances . [You]281-rowland 're blind , [you]281-rowland 're deaf , [you]281-rowland 're under a spell . To break it , [you]281-rowland must leave [Rome]4-rome . "[186-roderick]

" Leave [Rome]4-rome ! [Rome]4-rome was never so dear to [me]606-his friend . "[606-his friend]

" That 's not of the smallest consequence . Leave it instantly . "[186-roderick]

" And where shall [I]606-his friend go ? "[606-his friend]

" Go to some place where [you]281-rowland may be alone with [[your]281-rowland mother]3145-your mother and [Miss Garland]182-miss garland . "[186-roderick]

" Alone ? [You]606-his friend will not come ? "[606-his friend]

" Oh , if [you]606-his friend desire it , [I]186-roderick will come . "[186-roderick]

[Roderick]186-roderick inclining [his]186-roderick head a little , looked at [[his]186-roderick friend]606-his friend askance . " [I]186-roderick do n't understand [you]281-rowland , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick said ; " [I]186-roderick wish [you]281-rowland liked [Miss Garland]182-miss garland either a little less , or a little more . "[186-roderick]

[Rowland]281-rowland felt [himself]281-rowland coloring , but [he]606-his friend paid no heed to [Roderick]186-roderick 's speech . " [You]281-rowland ask [me]606-his friend to help [you]281-rowland , "[606-his friend] [he]606-his friend went on . " On these present conditions [I]606-his friend can do nothing . But if [you]281-rowland will postpone all decision as to the continuance of [your]281-rowland engagement a couple of months longer , and meanwhile leave [Rome]4-rome , leave [Italy]24-italy , [I]606-his friend will do what [I]606-his friend can to ' help [you]281-rowland , ' as [you]281-rowland say , in the event of [your]281-rowland still wishing to break it . "[606-his friend]

" [I]606-his friend must do without [your]281-rowland help then ! [Your]281-rowland conditions are impossible . [I]606-his friend will leave [Rome]4-rome at the time [I]606-his friend have always intended - at the end of June . [[My]606-his friend rooms]4808-my rooms and [[my]606-his friend mother]3224-my mother 's are taken till then ; all [my]606-his friend arrangements are made accordingly . Then , [I]606-his friend will depart ; not before . "[606-his friend]

" [You]281-rowland are [not frank]4810-not frank , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland . " [Your]281-rowland real reason for staying has nothing to do with [[your]281-rowland rooms]4811-your rooms . "[281-rowland]

[Roderick]186-roderick 's face betrayed neither embarrassment nor resentment . " If [I]186-roderick ' m not frank , it 's for the first time in [my]186-roderick life . Since [you]281-rowland know so much about [my]186-roderick real reason , let [me]186-roderick hear it ! No , stop ! "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick suddenly added , " [I]186-roderick wo n't trouble [you]281-rowland . [You]281-rowland are right , [I]186-roderick have a motive . On the twenty - fourth of [June Miss Light]254-miss light is to be married . [I]186-roderick take an immense interest in all that concerns [her]254-miss light , and [I]186-roderick wish to be present at [her]254-miss light wedding . "[186-roderick]

" But [you]281-rowland said the other day at [Saint Peter]265-saint peter 's that it was by no means certain [her]254-miss light marriage would take place . "[281-rowland]

" Apparently [I]186-roderick was wrong : the invitations , [I]186-roderick am told , are going out . "[186-roderick]

[Rowland]281-rowland felt that it would be utterly vain to remonstrate , and that the only thing for [him]186-roderick was to make the best terms possible . " If [I]186-roderick offer no further opposition to [your]281-rowland waiting for [Miss Light]254-miss light 's marriage , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick said , " will [you]281-rowland promise , meanwhile and afterwards , for a certain period , to defer to [my]186-roderick judgment - to say nothing that may be a cause of suffering to [Miss Garland]182-miss garland ? "[186-roderick]

" For a certain period ? What period ? "[186-roderick] [Roderick]186-roderick demanded .

" Ah , do n't drive so close a bargain ! Do n't [you]281-rowland understand that [I]186-roderick have taken [you]281-rowland away from [her]254-miss light , that [I]186-roderick suffer in every nerve in consequence , and that [I]186-roderick must do what [I]186-roderick can to restore [you]281-rowland ? "[186-roderick]

" Do what [you]281-rowland can , then , "[186-roderick] said [Roderick]186-roderick gravely , putting out [his]186-roderick hand . " Do what [you]281-rowland can ! "[186-roderick] [His]186-roderick tone and [his]186-roderick hand - shake seemed to constitute a promise , and upon this [they]2249-they parted .

[Roderick]186-roderick 's bust of [[his]186-roderick mother]448-his mother , whether or no it was a discharge of what [he]186-roderick called the filial debt , was at least a most admirable production . [Rowland]281-rowland , at the time it was finished , met [Gloriani]213-gloriani one evening , and [this unscrupulous genius]2251-this unscrupulous genius immediately began to ask questions about it . " [I]186-roderick am told [[our]2249-they high - flying friend]4812-our high - flying friend has come down , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick said . " [He]4812-our high - flying friend has been doing [a queer little old woman]4813-a queer little old woman . "[186-roderick]

" [A queer little old woman]4813-a queer little old woman ! "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland exclaimed . " [[My]281-rowland dear sir]3524-my dear sir , [she]4813-a queer little old woman is [[Hudson]191-mrs. hudson 's mother]4816-hudson 's mother . "[281-rowland]

" All the more reason for [her]4813-a queer little old woman being queer ! It is a bust for terra - cotta , eh ? "[281-rowland]

" By no means ; it is for marble . "[281-rowland]

" That 's a pity . It was described to [me]281-rowland as a charming piece of quaintness : [a little demure , thin - lipped old lady , with [her]4813-a queer little old woman head on one side , and the prettiest wrinkles in [the world]483-the world]4817-a little demure , thin - lipped old lady , with her head on one side , and the prettiest wrinkles in the world - a sort of fairy godmother . "[281-rowland]

" Go and see it , and judge for [yourself]3524-my dear sir , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland .

" No , [I]281-rowland see [I]281-rowland shall be disappointed . It 's quite the other thing , the sort of thing [they]4819-they put into [the campo - santos]4820-the campo - santos . [I]281-rowland wish [that boy]4821-that boy would listen to [me]281-rowland an hour ! "[281-rowland]

But a day or two later [Rowland]281-rowland met [him]2252-him again in [the street]1564-the street , and , as [they]2254-they were near , proposed [they]2254-they should adjourn to [[Roderick]186-roderick 's studio]574-roderick 's studio . [He]2252-him consented , and on entering [they]2254-they found [the young master]1013-the young master . [Roderick]186-roderick 's demeanor to [Gloriani]213-gloriani was never conciliatory , and on this occasion supreme indifference was apparently all [he]186-roderick had to offer . But [Gloriani]213-gloriani , like [a genuine connoisseur]2257-a genuine connoisseur , cared nothing for [his]186-roderick manners ; [he]186-roderick cared only for [his]186-roderick skill . In the bust of [Mrs. Hudson]191-mrs. hudson there was something almost touching ; it was an exquisite example of a ruling sense of beauty . [The poor lady]651-the poor lady 's small , neat , timorous face had certainly no great character , but [Roderick]186-roderick had reproduced its sweetness , its mildness , its minuteness , its still maternal passion , with the most unerring art . It was perfectly unflattered , and yet admirably tender ; it was the poetry of fidelity . [Gloriani]213-gloriani stood looking at it a long time most intently . [Roderick]186-roderick wandered away into [the neighboring room]2259-the neighboring room .

" [I]524-the sculptor give it up ! "[524-the sculptor] said [the sculptor]524-the sculptor at last . " [I]524-the sculptor do n't understand it . "[524-the sculptor]

" But [you]186-roderick like it ? "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland .

" Like it ? It 's a pearl of pearls . "[186-roderick] And [he]186-roderick gave [Rowland]281-rowland a sharp look .

" Why , [she]448-his mother adores [him]186-roderick , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland , smiling .

" That 's not an answer ! But it 's none of [my]186-roderick business . [She]192-christina needs to think well of [herself]192-christina ; [she]192-christina knows a fine character , easily , when [she]192-christina meets [one]3107-one ; [she]192-christina hates to suffer by comparison , even though the comparison is made by [herself]192-christina alone ; and when the estimate [she]192-christina may have made of [herself]192-christina grows vague , [she]192-christina needs to do something to give it definite , impressive form . " [Rowland]281-rowland also received a summons to [Madame Grandoni]217-madame grandoni 's tea - drinking , and went betimes , as [he]2278-he had been requested . It was a friendly and easy assembly , like all [Madame Grandoni]217-madame grandoni 's parties , and in the course of the evening there was some excellent music . [People]3189-people played and sang for [Madame Grandoni]217-madame grandoni , on easy terms , who , elsewhere , were not to be heard for the asking . [She]217-madame grandoni was [herself]217-madame grandoni [a superior musician]4868-a superior musician , and [singers]4869-singers found it a privilege to perform to [her]217-madame grandoni accompaniment . [Rowland]281-rowland talked to [various persons]4870-various persons , but for the first time in [his]2278-he life [his]2278-he attention visibly wandered ; [he]2278-he could not keep [his]2278-he eyes off [Mary Garland]193-mary garland . [Madame Grandoni]217-madame grandoni had said that [he]186-roderick sometimes spoke of [her]193-mary garland as pretty and sometimes as plain ; to - night , if [he]2278-he had had occasion to describe [her]193-mary garland appearance , [he]2278-he would have called [her]193-mary garland beautiful . [She]193-mary garland was dressed more than [he]2278-he had ever seen [her]193-mary garland ; it was becoming , and gave [her]193-mary garland a deeper color and an ampler presence . [Two or three persons]4871-two or three persons were introduced to [her]193-mary garland who were apparently [witty people]4872-witty people , for [she]193-mary garland sat listening to [them]4871-two or three persons with [her]193-mary garland brilliant natural smile . [Rowland]281-rowland , from an opposite corner , reflected that [he]2278-he had never varied in [his]2278-he appreciation of [Miss Blanchard]216-miss blanchard 's classic contour , but that somehow , to - night , it impressed [him]2278-he hardly more than an effigy stamped upon a coin of low value . [Roderick]186-roderick could not be accused of rancor , for [he]186-roderick had approached [Mr. Leavenworth]269-mr. leavenworth with unstudied familiarity , and , lounging against the wall , with hands in pockets , was discoursing to [him]186-roderick with candid serenity . Now that [he]186-roderick had done [him]186-roderick an impertinence , [he]186-roderick evidently found [him]186-roderick less intolerable . [Mr. Leavenworth]269-mr. leavenworth stood stirring [his]269-mr. leavenworth tea and silently opening and shutting [his]269-mr. leavenworth mouth , without looking at [the young sculptor]492-the young sculptor , like a large , drowsy dog snapping at flies . [Rowland]281-rowland had found it disagreeable to be told [Miss Blanchard]216-miss blanchard would have married [him]2278-he for the asking , and [he]2278-he would have felt some embarrassment in going to speak to [her]216-miss blanchard if [his]2278-he modesty had not found incredulity so easy . The facile side of a union with [Miss Blanchard]216-miss blanchard had never been present to [his]2278-he mind ; it had struck [him]2278-he as a thing , in all ways , to be compassed with a great effort . [He]2278-he had half an hour 's talk with [her]216-miss blanchard ; a farewell talk , as it seemed to [him]2278-he - a farewell not to a real illusion , but to the idea that for [him]2278-he , in that matter , there could ever be [an acceptable pis - aller]4874-an acceptable pis - aller . [He]2278-he congratulated [Miss Blanchard]216-miss blanchard upon [her]216-miss blanchard engagement , and [she]216-miss blanchard received [his]2278-he compliment with a touch of primness . But [she]216-miss blanchard was always a trifle prim , even when [she]216-miss blanchard was quoting [Mrs. Browning]319-mrs. browning and [George Sand]320-george sand , and this harmless defect did not prevent [her]216-miss blanchard responding on this occasion that [Mr. Leavenworth]269-mr. leavenworth had a "[2276-this enlightened woman] glorious heart . " [Rowland]281-rowland wished to manifest an extreme regard , but toward the end of the talk [his]2278-he zeal relaxed , and [he]2278-he fell a - thinking that a certain natural ease in [a woman]3607-a woman was the most delightful thing in [the world]483-the world . There was [Christina Light]192-christina , who had too much , and here was [Miss Blanchard]216-miss blanchard , who had too little , and there was [Mary Garland]193-mary garland in whom the quality was wholly uncultivated , who had just the right amount .[2276-this enlightened woman]

[He]2280-he went to [Madame Grandoni]217-madame grandoni in [an adjoining room]2281-an adjoining room , where [she]217-madame grandoni was pouring out tea .

" [I]217-madame grandoni will make [you]2280-he an excellent cup , "[217-madame grandoni] [she]217-madame grandoni said , " because [I]217-madame grandoni have forgiven [you]2280-he . "[217-madame grandoni]

" Well , then , "[281-rowland] cried [Rowland]281-rowland , ' [she]2317-she 's too good ! "[281-rowland]

The opportunity presenting itself the next day , [he]2318-you failed not , as [you]2319-you may imagine , to ask [Mary Garland]193-mary garland what [she]193-mary garland thought of [Miss Light]254-miss light . It was a Saturday afternoon , the time at which the beautiful marbles of [the Villa Borghese]1922-the villa borghese are thrown open to the public . [Mary]193-mary garland had told [him]2318-you that [Roderick]186-roderick had promised to take [her]193-mary garland to see [them]2321-them , with [[his]186-roderick mother]448-his mother , and [he]186-roderick joined the party in [the splendid Casino]2323-the splendid casino . The warm weather had left [so few strangers in [Rome]4-rome]2324-so few strangers in rome that [they]2324-so few strangers in rome had [the place]3197-the place almost to [themselves]2324-so few strangers in rome . [Mrs. Hudson]191-mrs. hudson had confessed to an invincible fear of treading , even with the help of [[her]191-mrs. hudson son]459-her son 's arm , the polished marble floors , and was sitting patiently on a stool , with folded hands , looking shyly , here and there , at the undraped paganism around [her]191-mrs. hudson . [Roderick]186-roderick had sauntered off alone , with an irritated brow , which seemed to betray the conflict between the instinct of observation and the perplexities of circumstance . [Miss Garland]182-miss garland was wandering in another direction , and though [she]182-miss garland was consulting [her]182-miss garland catalogue , [Rowland]281-rowland fancied it was from habit ; [she]182-miss garland too was preoccupied . [He]186-roderick joined [her]182-miss garland , and [she]182-miss garland presently sat down on a divan , rather wearily , and closed [her]182-miss garland Murray . Then [he]186-roderick asked [her]182-miss garland abruptly how [Christina]192-christina had pleased [her]182-miss garland .

[She]182-miss garland started the least bit at the question , and [he]186-roderick felt that [she]182-miss garland had been thinking of [Christina]192-christina .

" [I]182-miss garland do n't like [her]192-christina ! "[182-miss garland] [she]182-miss garland said with decision .

" What do [you]186-roderick think of [her]192-christina ? "[182-miss garland]

" [I]182-miss garland think [she]192-christina 's false . "[182-miss garland] This was said without petulance or bitterness , but with a very positive air .

" But [she]192-christina wished to please [you]186-roderick ; [she]192-christina tried , "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland rejoined , in a moment .

" [I]281-rowland think not . [She]192-christina wished to please [herself]192-christina ! "[281-rowland]

[Rowland]281-rowland felt [himself]281-rowland at liberty to say no more . No allusion to [Christina]192-christina had passed between [them]2327-them since the day [they]2327-them met [her]192-christina at [Saint Peter 's]265-saint peter , but [he]2328-he knew that [she]182-miss garland knew , by that infallible sixth sense of [a woman who loves]2329-a woman who loves , that [this strange , beautiful girl]2330-this strange , beautiful girl had the power to injure [her]182-miss garland . To what extent [she]182-miss garland had the will , [Mary]193-mary garland was uncertain ; but last night 's interview , apparently , had not reassured [her]182-miss garland . It was , under these circumstances , equally unbecoming for [Rowland]281-rowland either to depreciate or to defend [Christina]192-christina , and [he]2328-he had to content [himself]2328-he with simply having verified [the girl]3228-the girl 's own assurance that [she]3228-the girl had made a bad impression . [He]2328-he tried to talk of indifferent matters - about the statues and the frescoes ; but to - day , plainly , aesthetic curiosity , with [Miss Garland]182-miss garland , had folded its wings . Curiosity of another sort had taken its place . [Mary]193-mary garland was longing , [he]2328-he was sure , to question [him]2328-he about [Christina]192-christina ; but [she]193-mary garland found a dozen reasons for hesitating . [Her]193-mary garland questions would imply that [Roderick]186-roderick had not treated [her]193-mary garland with confidence , for information on this point should properly have come from [him]2328-he . They would imply that [she]193-mary garland was jealous , and to betray [her]193-mary garland jealousy was intolerable to [her]193-mary garland pride . For some minutes , as [she]193-mary garland sat scratching [the brilliant pavement]2332-the brilliant pavement with the point of [her]193-mary garland umbrella , it was to be supposed that [her]193-mary garland pride and [her]193-mary garland anxiety held an earnest debate . At last anxiety won .

" A propos of [Miss Light]254-miss light , "[193-mary garland] [she]193-mary garland asked , " do [you]2328-he know [her]192-christina well ? "[193-mary garland]

" [I]193-mary garland can hardly say that . But [I]193-mary garland have seen [her]192-christina repeatedly . "[193-mary garland]

" Do [you]2328-he like [her]192-christina ? "[193-mary garland]

" Yes and no . [I]193-mary garland think [I]193-mary garland am sorry for [her]192-christina . "[193-mary garland]

[Mary]193-mary garland had spoken with [her]193-mary garland eyes on [the pavement]1880-the pavement . At this [she]193-mary garland looked up . " Sorry for [her]192-christina ? Why ? "[193-mary garland]

" Well - [she]192-christina is unhappy . "[193-mary garland]

" What are [her]192-christina misfortunes ? "[193-mary garland]

" Well - [she]192-christina has [a horrible mother]4926-a horrible mother , and [she]192-christina has had a most injurious education . "[193-mary garland]

For a moment [Miss Garland]182-miss garland was silent . Then , " Is n't [she]192-christina very beautiful ? "[182-miss garland] [she]182-miss garland asked .

" Do n't [you]182-miss garland think so ? "[193-mary garland]

" That 's measured by what [men]3287-men think ! [She]192-christina is extremely clever , too . "[193-mary garland]

" Oh , incontestably . "[193-mary garland]

" [She]192-christina has beautiful dresses . "[193-mary garland]

" Yes , any number of them . "[193-mary garland]

" Yes - sometimes . "[193-mary garland]

" And plenty of money . "[193-mary garland]

[Miss Garland]182-miss garland rose and turned to rejoin [[her]182-miss garland companions]751-her companions , commenting these admissions with a pregnant silence . " [Poor Miss Light]254-miss light ! "[182-miss garland] [she]182-miss garland said at last , simply . And in this it seemed to [Rowland]281-rowland there was a touch of bitterness .

Very late on the following evening [[his]2335-he servant]2336-his servant brought [him]2335-he the card of [a visitor]2337-a visitor . [He]2335-he was surprised at a visit at such an hour , but it may be said that when [he]2335-he read the inscription - [Cavaliere Giuseppe Giacosa]255-the cavaliere - [his]2335-he surprise declined . [He]2335-he had had an unformulated conviction that there was to be a sequel to the apparition at [[Madame Grandoni]217-madame grandoni 's]2338-madame grandoni 's ; [the Cavaliere]1279-the cavaliere had come to usher it in .

[He]1279-the cavaliere had come , evidently , on a portentous errand . [He]1279-the cavaliere was as pale as ashes and prodigiously serious ; [his]1279-the cavaliere little cold black eye had grown ardent , and [he]1279-the cavaliere had left [his]1279-the cavaliere caressing smile at [home]349-home . [He]1279-the cavaliere saluted [Rowland]281-rowland , however , with [his]1279-the cavaliere usual obsequious bow .

[The Cavaliere]1279-the cavaliere sniffed imperceptibly the fragrant weed , and then declared that , if [[his]1279-the cavaliere kind host]2342-his kind host would allow [him]1279-the cavaliere , [he]1279-the cavaliere would reserve it for consumption at another time . [He]1279-the cavaliere apparently desired to intimate that the solemnity of [his]1279-the cavaliere errand left [him]1279-the cavaliere no breath for idle smoke - puffings . [Rowland]281-rowland heard [his]1279-the cavaliere news with a kind of fierce disgust ; it seemed the sinister counterpart of [Christina]192-christina 's preternatural mildness at [Madame Grandoni]217-madame grandoni 's tea - party . [She]192-christina had been too plausible to be honest . Without being able to trace the connection , [he]1279-the cavaliere yet instinctively associated [her]192-christina present rebellion with [her]192-christina meeting with [Mary Garland]193-mary garland . If [she]192-christina had not seen [Mary]193-mary garland , [she]192-christina would have let things stand . " In pity 's name , "[191-mrs. hudson] [she]191-mrs. hudson cried , " what is the matter with [[my]191-mrs. hudson boy]3929-my boy ? If [he]3929-my boy is ill , [I]191-mrs. hudson entreat [you]2359-him to take [me]191-mrs. hudson to [him]3929-my boy ! "[191-mrs. hudson]

" Why , it means , "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland commented , " that [he]2365-he has taken up a piece of work , and that it is all - absorbing . That 's very good news . " [He]2365-he does not work in the evening , "[191-mrs. hudson] said [Mrs. Hudson]191-mrs. hudson . " Ca n't [he]2365-he come for five minutes ? "[191-mrs. hudson] And [the poor lady]651-the poor lady 's suppressed mistrust of the Eternal City broke out passionately . " Oh , dear [Mr. Mallet]170-mr. mallet , "[182-miss garland] [she]182-miss garland went on , " [I]182-miss garland am sure [he]2365-he has the fever and [he]2365-he 's already delirious ! "[182-miss garland]

" [I]182-miss garland am very sure it 's not that , "[182-miss garland] said [Miss Garland]182-miss garland , with a certain dryness .

[She]182-miss garland was still looking at [Rowland]281-rowland ; [his]2367-he eyes met [hers]182-miss garland , and [his]2367-he own glance fell . This made [him]2367-he angry , and to carry off [his]2367-he confusion [he]2367-he pretended to be looking at the floor , in meditation . After all , what had [he]2367-he to be ashamed of ? For a moment [he]2367-he was on the point of making a clean breast of it , of crying out , " [Dearest friends]4960-dearest friends , [I]2367-he abdicate : [I]2367-he ca n't help [you]4960-dearest friends ! "[2367-he] But [he]2367-he checked [himself]2367-he ; [he]2367-he felt so impatient to have [his]2367-he three words with [Christina]192-christina . [He]2367-he grasped [his]2367-he hat .

" [I]2367-he will see what it is ! "[2367-he] [he]2367-he cried . And then [he]2367-he was glad [he]2367-he had not abdicated , for as [he]2367-he turned away [he]2367-he glanced again at [Mary]193-mary garland and saw that , though [her]193-mary garland eyes were full of trouble , they were not hard and accusing , but charged with appealing friendship .

[He]2367-he went straight to [[Roderick]186-roderick 's apartment]2368-roderick 's apartment , deeming this , at an early hour , [the safest place to seek [him]186-roderick]2369-the safest place to seek him . [He]2367-he found [him]186-roderick in [[his]186-roderick sitting - room]2370-his sitting - room , which had been closely darkened to keep out the heat . The carpets and rugs had been removed , the floor of speckled concrete was bare and lightly sprinkled with water . Here and there , over [it]2371-it , certain strongly perfumed flowers had been scattered . [Roderick]186-roderick was lying on [his]186-roderick divan in a white dressing - gown , staring up at the frescoed ceiling . [The room]487-the room was deliciously cool , and filled with the moist , sweet odor of the circumjacent roses and violets . All this seemed highly fantastic , and yet [Rowland]281-rowland hardly felt surprised .

" [[Your]186-roderick mother]3145-your mother was greatly alarmed at [your]186-roderick note , "[2367-he] [he]2367-he said , " and [I]2367-he came to satisfy [myself]2367-he that , as [I]2367-he believed , [you]186-roderick are not ill . "[2367-he] [Roderick]186-roderick lay motionless , except that [he]186-roderick slightly turned [his]186-roderick head toward [[his]186-roderick friend]606-his friend . [He]186-roderick was smelling a large white rose , and [he]186-roderick continued to present it to [his]186-roderick nose . In the darkness of [the room]487-the room [he]186-roderick looked exceedingly pale , but [his]186-roderick handsome eyes had an extraordinary brilliancy . [He]186-roderick let them rest for some time on [Rowland]281-rowland , lying there like [a Buddhist in an intellectual swoon , whose perception should be slowly ebbing back to temporal matters]2375-a buddhist in an intellectual swoon , whose perception should be slowly ebbing back to temporal matters . " Oh , [I]186-roderick ' m not ill , "[186-roderick] [he]186-roderick said at last . " [I]186-roderick have never been better . "[186-roderick]

" [Your]186-roderick note , nevertheless , and [your]186-roderick absence , "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland said , " have very naturally alarmed [[your]186-roderick mother]3145-your mother . " Go to [her]3145-your mother ? Going to [her]3145-your mother would be worse than staying away . Staying away at present is a kindness . "[186-roderick] And [he]186-roderick inhaled deeply [his]186-roderick huge rose , looking up over it at [Rowland]281-rowland . " [My]186-roderick presence , in fact , would be indecent . "[186-roderick]

" Why , [you]281-rowland see , as regards [Mary Garland]193-mary garland . [I]186-roderick am divinely happy ! Does n't it strike [you]281-rowland ? " [I]281-rowland heard it , too , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland with brevity . " And it 's in honor of this piece of news that [you]281-rowland have taken to [your]281-rowland bed in this fashion ? "[281-rowland]

" [Casamassima]281-rowland 's loss , then , is to a certainty [your]281-rowland gain ? "[281-rowland]

" [I]186-roderick do n't talk about certainties . [I]186-roderick do n't want to be arrogant , [I]186-roderick do n't want to offend [the immortal gods]4965-the immortal gods . " [I]186-roderick congratulate [you]281-rowland , [I]186-roderick envy [you]281-rowland ! "[186-roderick] [Roderick]186-roderick murmured , imperturbably .

" [You]281-rowland deserve [I]281-rowland should tell [her]253-mrs. light [you]281-rowland are [a very shabby fellow]4969-a very shabby fellow . "[281-rowland]

" [You]281-rowland mean to lie here , then , smelling [your]281-rowland roses and nursing [your]281-rowland visions , and leaving [[your]281-rowland mother]3145-your mother and [Miss Garland]182-miss garland to fall ill with anxiety ? "[281-rowland]

On this [Rowland]281-rowland left [him]186-roderick and repaired directly to [Mrs. Light]253-mrs. light 's . [This afflicted lady]2376-this afflicted lady hurried forward to meet [him]186-roderick . [Rowland]281-rowland greatly pitied [her]2376-this afflicted lady , for there is something respectable in passionate grief , even in a very bad cause ; and as pity is akin to love , [he]186-roderick endured [her]2376-this afflicted lady rather better than [he]186-roderick had done hitherto .

" Speak to [her]2376-this afflicted lady , plead with [her]2376-this afflicted lady , command [her]2376-this afflicted lady ! " [She]2376-this afflicted lady 'll not heed [us]4975-us , no more than if [we]4975-us were a pair of clocks a - ticking . " [She]2376-this afflicted lady always disliked [me]281-rowland , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland . " But that does n't matter now . " Oh , [cruel , deadly man]4977-cruel , deadly man ! "[3820-the poor woman] [the poor woman]3820-the poor woman passionately retorted . " Look at [me]3820-the poor woman in [my]3820-the poor woman misery and refuse to help [me]3820-the poor woman ! Oh , [you]4977-cruel , deadly man need n't be afraid , [I]3820-the poor woman know [I]3820-the poor woman ' m a fright , [I]3820-the poor woman have n't an idea what [I]3820-the poor woman have on . If this goes on , [we]4979-we may both as well turn [scarecrows]4980-scarecrows . If ever [a woman]3607-a woman was desperate , frantic , heart - broken , [I]3820-the poor woman am [that woman]4982-that woman . [I]3820-the poor woman ca n't begin to tell [you]4977-cruel , deadly man . To have nourished a serpent , [sir]3318-sir , all these years ! to have lavished [one]3107-one 's self upon a viper that turns and stings [[her]3107-one own poor mother]4985-her own poor mother ! To have toiled and prayed , to have pushed and struggled , to have eaten the bread of bitterness , and all the rest of it , [sir]3318-sir - and at the end of all things to find [myself]3820-the poor woman at this pass . It ca n't be , it 's too cruel , such things do n't happen , [the Lord]3617-the lord do n't allow it . [I]3820-the poor woman ' m [a religious woman]4988-a religious woman , [sir]3318-sir , and [the Lord]3617-the lord knows all about [me]3820-the poor woman . With [his]3617-the lord own hand [he]3617-the lord had given [me]3820-the poor woman [his]3617-the lord reward ! [I]3820-the poor woman would have lain down in the dust and let [her]4985-her own poor mother walk over [me]3820-the poor woman ; [I]3820-the poor woman would have given [her]4985-her own poor mother the eyes out of [my]3820-the poor woman head , if [she]4985-her own poor mother had taken a fancy to them . No , [she]4985-her own poor mother 's [a cruel , wicked , heartless , unnatural girl]4991-a cruel , wicked , heartless , unnatural girl ! There is n't a creature here that [I]3820-the poor woman can look to - not one of [them]4993-them all that [I]3820-the poor woman have faith in . But [I]3820-the poor woman always admired [you]3318-sir . [I]3820-the poor woman feel so terribly alone , [you]192-christina see ; [I]3820-the poor woman feel what a nasty , hard , heartless world it is that has come and devoured [my]3820-the poor woman dinners and danced to [my]3820-the poor woman fiddles , and yet that has n't a word to throw to [me]3820-the poor woman in [my]3820-the poor woman agony ! Oh , the money , alone , that [I]3820-the poor woman have put into this thing , would melt the heart of [a Turk]4995-a turk ! "[3820-the poor woman]

During this frenzied outbreak [Rowland]281-rowland had had time to look round [the room]487-the room , and to see [the Cavaliere]1279-the cavaliere sitting in a corner , like [a major - domo on the divan of an antechamber]2381-a major - domo on the divan of an antechamber , pale , rigid , and inscrutable .

" [I]281-rowland have it at heart to tell [you]192-christina , "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland said , " that if [you]192-christina consider [[my]281-rowland friend]4209-my friend [Hudson]191-mrs. hudson "[281-rowland] -

[Mrs. Light]253-mrs. light burst into angry tears . " Because [the poor boy]5001-the poor boy is [a prince]3813-a prince , eh ? because [he]5001-the poor boy 's of [a great family]5003-a great family , and has an income of millions , eh ? [He]273-prince casamassima has been driven hither and thither till [he]273-prince casamassima did n't know where [he]273-prince casamassima was . ' And [he]273-prince casamassima would come back , and [he]273-prince casamassima would come back , and go through it all again , and take all that was given [him]273-prince casamassima , and only want [the girl]3228-the girl the more ! "[253-mrs. light]

" It would seem , then , that in the interest of [Prince Casamassima]273-prince casamassima [himself]273-prince casamassima [I]281-rowland ought to refuse to interfere , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland .

[Mrs. Light]253-mrs. light looked at [him]2382-him hard , slowly drying [her]253-mrs. light eyes .
