" Very good , [sir]3318-sir , "[253-mrs. light] [she]253-mrs. light said . " [I]253-mrs. light ' m sorry [your]3318-sir heart is not so tender as [your]3318-sir conscience . [My]253-mrs. light compliments to [your]3318-sir conscience ! It must give [you]3318-sir great happiness . [Heaven]244-heaven help [me]253-mrs. light ! Since [you]3318-sir fail [us]5024-us , [we]5024-us are indeed driven to the wall . But [I]253-mrs. light have fought [my]253-mrs. light own battles before , and [I]253-mrs. light have never lost courage , and [I]253-mrs. light do n't see why [I]253-mrs. light should break down now . [Cavaliere]255-the cavaliere , come here ! "[253-mrs. light]

[Giacosa]255-the cavaliere rose at [her]253-mrs. light summons and advanced with [his]255-the cavaliere usual deferential alacrity . [He]255-the cavaliere shook hands with [Rowland]281-rowland in silence .

" [Mr. Mallet]170-mr. mallet refuses to say a word , "[253-mrs. light] [Mrs. Light]253-mrs. light went on . " Time presses , every moment is precious . [Heaven]244-heaven knows what [that poor boy]5025-that poor boy may be doing . If at this moment [a clever woman]5026-a clever woman should get hold of [him]5025-that poor boy [she]5026-a clever woman might be as ugly as [she]5026-a clever woman pleased ! It 's horrible to think of it . "[253-mrs. light]

[The Cavaliere]255-the cavaliere fixed [his]255-the cavaliere eyes on [Rowland]281-rowland , and [his]255-the cavaliere look , which the night before had been singular , was now most extraordinary . There was a nameless force of anguish in it which seemed to grapple with [the young man]347-the young man 's reluctance , to plead , to entreat , and at the same time to be glazed over with a reflection of strange things .

Suddenly , though most vaguely , [Rowland]281-rowland felt the presence of a new element in the drama that was going on before [him]347-the young man . [He]347-the young man looked from [the Cavaliere]1279-the cavaliere to [Mrs. Light]253-mrs. light , whose eyes were now quite dry , and were fixed in stony hardness on the floor .

" If [you]281-rowland could bring [yourself]281-rowland , "[1279-the cavaliere] [the Cavaliere]1279-the cavaliere said , in a low , soft , caressing voice , " to address a few words of solemn remonstrance to [Miss Light]254-miss light , [you]281-rowland would , perhaps , do more for [us]5027-us than [you]281-rowland know . [You]281-rowland would save [several persons]1495-several persons a great pain . [The dear signora]5029-the dear signora , first , and then [Christina]192-christina [herself]192-christina . [Christina]192-christina in particular . [Me]1279-the cavaliere too , [I]1279-the cavaliere might take the liberty to add ! "[1279-the cavaliere]

There was , to [Rowland]281-rowland , something acutely touching in this humble petition . [He]347-the young man had always felt a sort of imaginative tenderness for [poor little unexplained Giacosa]255-the cavaliere , and these words seemed a supreme contortion of the mysterious obliquity of [his]347-the young man life . All of a sudden , as [he]347-the young man watched [the Cavaliere]1279-the cavaliere , something occurred to [him]347-the young man ; it was something very odd , and it stayed [his]347-the young man glance suddenly from again turning to [Mrs. Light]253-mrs. light . [His]347-the young man idea embarrassed [him]347-the young man , and to carry off [his]347-the young man embarrassment , [he]347-the young man repeated that it was folly to suppose that [his]347-the young man words would have any weight with [Christina]192-christina .

[The Cavaliere]1279-the cavaliere stepped forward and laid two fingers on [Rowland]281-rowland 's breast . " Do [you]281-rowland wish to know the truth ? [You]281-rowland are [the only man whose words [she]192-christina remembers]5030-the only man whose words she remembers . "[1279-the cavaliere]

[Rowland]281-rowland was going from surprise to surprise . " [I]347-the young man will say what [I]347-the young man can ! "[347-the young man] [he]347-the young man said . By this time [he]347-the young man had ventured to glance at [Mrs. Light]253-mrs. light . [She]253-mrs. light was looking at [him]347-the young man askance , as if , upon this , [she]253-mrs. light was suddenly mistrusting [his]347-the young man motives .

" If [you]347-the young man fail , "[253-mrs. light] [she]253-mrs. light said sharply , " [we]5031-we have something else ! But please to lose no time . "[253-mrs. light]

[She]253-mrs. light had hardly spoken when the sound of a short , sharp growl caused [the company]718-the company to turn . " For all of [us]5081-us . At any rate remember this : [I]255-the cavaliere worship [the Christina]192-christina ! "[255-the cavaliere]

[Rowland]281-rowland heard the rustle of [Mrs. Light]253-mrs. light 's dress ; [he]255-the cavaliere turned away , and [the Cavaliere]1279-the cavaliere went , as [he]1279-the cavaliere said , to [[his]1279-the cavaliere post]2428-his post . [Rowland]281-rowland for the next couple of days pondered [his]255-the cavaliere riddle .

CHAPTER XI . [Mrs. Hudson

Of Roderick]325-roderick , meanwhile , [Rowland]281-rowland saw nothing ; but [he]255-the cavaliere immediately went to [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick and assured [her]325-roderick that [[her]325-roderick son]459-her son was in even exceptionally good health and spirits . After this [he]255-the cavaliere called again on [the two ladies]656-the two ladies from [Northampton]2-northampton , but , as [Roderick]325-roderick 's absence continued , [he]255-the cavaliere was able neither to furnish nor to obtain much comfort . [Miss Garland]182-miss garland 's apprehensive face seemed to [him]255-the cavaliere an image of [his]255-the cavaliere own state of mind . [He]255-the cavaliere was profoundly depressed ; [he]255-the cavaliere felt that there was a storm in the air , and [he]255-the cavaliere wished it would come , without more delay , and perform its ravages . On the afternoon of the third day [he]255-the cavaliere went into [[Saint Peter]265-saint peter 's]2176-saint peter 's , [his]255-the cavaliere frequent resort whenever [the outer world]2432-the outer world was disagreeable . From a heart - ache to a Roman rain there were few importunate pains [the great church]1179-the great church did not help [him]255-the cavaliere to forget . [He]255-the cavaliere had wandered [there]3420-there for half an hour , when [he]255-the cavaliere came upon a short figure , lurking in the shadow of one of [the great piers]2435-the great piers . [He]255-the cavaliere saw it was that of [an artist]3186-an artist , hastily transferring to [his]3186-an artist sketch - book a memento of some fleeting variation in the scenery of [the basilica]2437-the basilica ; and in a moment [he]255-the cavaliere perceived that [the artist]3153-the artist was [little Sam Singleton]214-singleton .

[Singleton]214-singleton pocketed [his]214-singleton sketch - book with a guilty air , as if it cost [his]214-singleton modesty a pang to be detected in this greedy culture of opportunity . [Rowland]281-rowland always enjoyed meeting [him]214-singleton ; talking with [him]214-singleton , in these days , was as good as a wayside gush of clear , cold water , on a long , hot walk . There was , perhaps , no drinking - vessel , and [you]2439-you had to apply [your]2439-you lips to some simple natural conduit ; but the result was always a sense of extreme moral refreshment . On this occasion [he]255-the cavaliere mentally blessed [the ingenuous little artist]2440-the ingenuous little artist , and heard presently with keen regret that [he]214-singleton was to leave [Rome]4-rome on the morrow . [Singleton]214-singleton had come to bid farewell to [[Saint Peter]265-saint peter 's]2176-saint peter 's , and [he]214-singleton was gathering a few supreme memories . [He]214-singleton had earned a purse - full of money , and [he]214-singleton was meaning to take a summer 's holiday ; going to [Switzerland]74-switzerland , to [Germany]75-germany , to [Paris]9-paris . In the autumn [he]214-singleton was to return [home]349-home ; [[his]214-singleton family]676-his family - composed , as [Rowland]281-rowland knew , of [a father who was cashier in [a bank]2445-a bank]2444-a father who was cashier in a bank and [five unmarried sisters]2446-five unmarried sisters , [one of whom gave lyceum - lectures on [woman]4614-woman 's rights]2447-one of whom gave lyceum - lectures on woman 's rights , [the whole resident at [Buffalo]143-buffalo , [New York]21-new york]2449-the whole resident at buffalo , new york - had been writing [him]214-singleton peremptory letters and appealing to [him]214-singleton as [a son]2450-a son , [brother]2451-brother , and [fellow - citizen]2452-fellow - citizen . [He]214-singleton would have been grateful for another year in [Rome]4-rome , but what must be must be , and [he]214-singleton had laid up treasure which , in [Buffalo]143-buffalo , would seem infinite . [They]2453-they talked some time ; [Rowland]281-rowland hoped [they]2453-they might meet in [Switzerland]74-switzerland , and take a walk or two together . [Singleton]214-singleton seemed to feel that [Buffalo]143-buffalo had marked [him]214-singleton for [her]2454-her own ; [he]214-singleton was afraid [he]214-singleton should not see [Rome]4-rome again for many a year .

" So [you]214-singleton expect to live at [Buffalo]143-buffalo ? "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland asked sympathetically .

" Well , it will depend upon the views - upon the attitude - of [[my]214-singleton family]5082-my family , "[214-singleton] [Singleton]214-singleton replied . " Oh , [I]214-singleton think [I]214-singleton shall get on ; [I]214-singleton think it can be done . If [I]214-singleton find it can be done , [I]214-singleton shall really be quite proud of it ; as [an artist of course]5083-an artist of course [I]214-singleton mean , [you]281-rowland know . Do [you]281-rowland know [I]214-singleton have some nine hundred sketches ? [I]214-singleton shall live in [[my]214-singleton portfolio]5084-my portfolio . And so long as [one]3107-one is not in [Rome]4-rome , pray what does it matter where [one]3107-one is ? But how [I]214-singleton shall envy all [you]281-rowland Romans - [you]281-rowland and [Mr. Gloriani]327-mr. gloriani , and [Mr. Hudson]172-mr. hudson , especially ! "[214-singleton]

" Do n't envy [Hudson]172-mr. hudson ; [he]172-mr. hudson has nothing to envy . "[281-rowland]

[Singleton]214-singleton grinned at what [he]214-singleton considered a harmless jest . " Yes , [he]172-mr. hudson 's going to be [the great man of [our]5088-our time]5087-the great man of our time ! And [I]214-singleton say , [Mr. Mallet]170-mr. mallet , is n't it a mighty comfort that it 's [we]5088-our who have turned [him]172-mr. hudson out ? "[214-singleton]

" Between [ourselves]5088-our , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland , " [he]172-mr. hudson has disappointed [me]281-rowland . "[281-rowland]

[Singleton]214-singleton stared , open - mouthed . " Dear [me]214-singleton , what did [you]281-rowland expect ? "[214-singleton]

" Truly , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland to [himself]281-rowland , " what did [I]281-rowland expect ? "[281-rowland]

" [I]214-singleton confess , "[214-singleton] cried [Singleton]214-singleton , " [I]214-singleton ca n't judge [him]172-mr. hudson rationally . [He]172-mr. hudson fascinates [me]214-singleton ; [he]172-mr. hudson 's [the sort of man one makes [one]3107-one 's hero]5089-the sort of man one makes one 's hero of . "[214-singleton]

" Strictly speaking , [he]172-mr. hudson is not [a hero]5091-a hero , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland .

[Singleton]214-singleton looked intensely grave , and , with almost tearful eyes , " Is there anything amiss - anything out of the way , about [him]172-mr. hudson ? "[214-singleton] [he]214-singleton timidly asked . Then , as [Rowland]281-rowland hesitated to reply , [he]214-singleton quickly added , " Please , if there is , do n't tell [me]214-singleton ! [I]214-singleton want to know no evil of [him]172-mr. hudson , and [I]214-singleton think [I]214-singleton should hardly believe it . In [my]214-singleton memories of [this Roman artist]5092-this roman artist - life , [he]172-mr. hudson will be the central figure . [He]172-mr. hudson will stand there in radiant relief , as beautiful and unspotted as one of [his]172-mr. hudson own statues ! "[214-singleton]

" Amen ! "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland , gravely . [He]214-singleton remembered afresh that [the sea]425-the sea is inhabited by big fishes and little , and that [the latter]652-the latter often find their way down the throats of [the former]1602-the former . [Singleton]214-singleton was going to spend the afternoon in taking last looks at [certain other places]2458-certain other places , and [Rowland]281-rowland offered to join [him]214-singleton on [his]214-singleton sentimental circuit . But as [they]2459-they were preparing to leave [the church]4439-the church , [he]214-singleton heard [himself]214-singleton suddenly addressed from behind . Turning , [he]214-singleton beheld [a young woman whom [he]214-singleton immediately recognized as [[Madame Grandoni]217-madame grandoni 's maid]2462-madame grandoni 's maid]2461-a young woman whom he immediately recognized as madame grandoni 's maid . [[Her]217-madame grandoni mistress]1867-her mistress was present , [she]1867-her mistress said , and begged to confer with [him]214-singleton before [he]214-singleton departed .

This summons obliged [Rowland]281-rowland to separate from [Singleton]214-singleton , to whom [he]214-singleton bade farewell . [He]214-singleton followed [the messenger]2464-the messenger , and presently found [Madame Grandoni]217-madame grandoni occupying [a liberal area on the steps of [the tribune]2466-the tribune]2465-a liberal area on the steps of the tribune , behind the great altar , where , spreading a shawl on the polished red marble , [she]217-madame grandoni had comfortably seated [herself]217-madame grandoni . [He]214-singleton expected that [she]217-madame grandoni had something especial to impart , and [she]217-madame grandoni lost no time in bringing forth [her]217-madame grandoni treasure .

" Do n't shout very loud , "[217-madame grandoni] [she]217-madame grandoni said , " remember that [we]5093-we are in [church]539-church ; there 's a limit to the noise one may make even in [Saint Peter]265-saint peter 's . [Christina Light]192-christina was married this morning to [Prince Casamassima]273-prince casamassima . "[217-madame grandoni]

[Rowland]281-rowland did not shout at all ; [he]214-singleton gave a deep , short murmur : " Married - this morning ? "[214-singleton]

" Married this morning , at seven o'clock , le plus tranquillement du monde , before [three or four persons]5095-three or four persons . [The young couple]5096-the young couple left [Rome]4-rome an hour afterwards . "[214-singleton]

For some moments this seemed to [him]214-singleton really terrible ; the dark little drama of which [he]214-singleton had caught a glimpse had played itself out . [He]214-singleton had believed that [Christina]192-christina would resist ; that [she]192-christina had succumbed was a proof that the pressure had been cruel . [Rowland]281-rowland 's imagination followed [her]192-christina forth with an irresistible tremor into the world toward which [she]192-christina was rolling away , with [[her]192-christina detested husband]2467-her detested husband and [her]192-christina stifled ideal ; but it must be confessed that if the first impulse of [his]214-singleton compassion was for [Christina]192-christina , the second was for [Prince Casamassima]273-prince casamassima . [Madame Grandoni]217-madame grandoni acknowledged an extreme curiosity as to the secret springs of these strange doings : [Casamassima]273-prince casamassima 's sudden dismissal , [his]273-prince casamassima still more sudden recall , the hurried private marriage . " Listen , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland , hereupon , " and [I]281-rowland will tell [you]217-madame grandoni something . "[281-rowland] And [he]214-singleton related , in detail , [his]214-singleton last visit to [Mrs. Light]253-mrs. light and [his]214-singleton talk with [this lady]346-this lady , with [Christina]192-christina , and with [the Cavaliere]255-the cavaliere .

" Good , "[217-madame grandoni] [she]217-madame grandoni said ; " it 's all very curious . But it 's a riddle , and [I]217-madame grandoni only half guess it . "[217-madame grandoni]

" Well , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland , " [I]281-rowland desire to harm [no one]629-no one ; but certain suppositions have taken shape in [my]281-rowland mind which serve as a solvent to several ambiguities . "[281-rowland]

" It is very true , "[217-madame grandoni] [Madame Grandoni]217-madame grandoni answered , " that [the Cavaliere]1279-the cavaliere , as [he]1279-the cavaliere stands , has always needed to be explained . "[217-madame grandoni]

" [He]1279-the cavaliere is explained by the hypothesis that , three - and - twenty years ago , at [Ancona]93-ancona , [Mrs. Light]253-mrs. light had [a lover]1366-a lover . "[217-madame grandoni]

" [I]217-madame grandoni see . [Ancona]93-ancona was dull , [Mrs. Light]253-mrs. light was lively , and - three - and - twenty years ago - perhaps , [the Cavaliere]1279-the cavaliere was fascinating . Doubtless it would be fairer to say that [he]1279-the cavaliere was fascinated . [Poor Giacosa]255-the cavaliere ! "[217-madame grandoni]

" [He]1279-the cavaliere has had [his]1279-the cavaliere compensation , "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland said . " [He]1279-the cavaliere has been passionately fond of [Christina]192-christina . "[281-rowland]

" Naturally . But has [Christina]192-christina never wondered why ? "[217-madame grandoni]

" If [she]192-christina had been near guessing , [[her]192-christina mother]369-her mother 's shabby treatment of [him]1279-the cavaliere would have put [her]192-christina off the scent . [Mrs. Light]253-mrs. light 's conscience has apparently told [her]192-christina that [she]192-christina could expiate an hour 's too great kindness by twenty years ' contempt . So [she]192-christina kept [her]192-christina secret . But what is the profit of having a secret unless [you]5102-you can make some use of it ? The day at last came when [she]192-christina could turn [hers]192-christina to account ; [she]192-christina could let the skeleton out of [the closet]5103-the closet and create a panic . "[281-rowland]

" [I]217-madame grandoni do n't understand . "[217-madame grandoni]

" Neither do [I]281-rowland morally , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland . " [I]281-rowland only conceive that there was a horrible , fabulous scene . [The poor Cavaliere]255-the cavaliere stood outside , at the door , white as a corpse and as dumb . [The mother]1240-the mother and [daughter]5105-daughter had it out together . [Mrs. Light]253-mrs. light burnt [[her]253-mrs. light ships]5106-her ships . When [she]253-mrs. light came out [she]253-mrs. light had three lines of writing in [[her]253-mrs. light daughter]491-her daughter 's hand , which [the Cavaliere]1279-the cavaliere was dispatched with to [the prince]3484-the prince . [They]5110-they overtook [the young man]347-the young man in time , and , when [he]347-the young man reappeared , [he]347-the young man was delighted to dispense with further waiting . [I]281-rowland do n't know what [he]347-the young man thought of the look in [[his]347-the young man bride]5112-his bride 's face ; but that is how [I]281-rowland roughly reconstruct history . "[281-rowland]

" [Christina]192-christina was forced to decide , then , that [she]192-christina could not afford not to be [a princess]356-a princess ? "[217-madame grandoni]

" [She]192-christina was reduced by humiliation . [She]192-christina was assured that it was not for [her]192-christina to make conditions , but to thank [her]192-christina stars that there were none made for [her]192-christina . If [she]192-christina persisted , [she]192-christina might find it coming to pass that there would be conditions , and the formal rupture - the rupture that [the world]483-the world would hear of and pry into - would then proceed from [the prince]3484-the prince and not from [her]192-christina . "[281-rowland]

" That 's all nonsense ! "[217-madame grandoni] said [Madame Grandoni]217-madame grandoni , energetically .

" To [us]5116-us , yes ; but not to [the proudest girl in [the world]483-the world]5117-the proudest girl in the world , deeply wounded in [her]5117-the proudest girl in the world pride , and not stopping to calculate probabilities , but muffling [her]5117-the proudest girl in the world shame , with an almost sensuous relief , in a splendor that stood within [her]5117-the proudest girl in the world grasp and asked no questions . Is it not possible that [the late Mr. Light]261-mr. light had made an outbreak before [witnesses who are still living]5119-witnesses who are still living ? "[281-rowland]

" Certainly [her]5117-the proudest girl in the world marriage now , "[217-madame grandoni] said [Madame Grandoni]217-madame grandoni , less analytically , " has the advantage that it takes [her]5117-the proudest girl in the world away from [[her]5117-the proudest girl in the world - parents]5120-her - parents ! "[217-madame grandoni]

[This lady]346-this lady 's farther comments upon the event are not immediately pertinent to [our]2470-our history ; there were some other comments of which [Rowland]281-rowland had a deeply oppressive foreboding . [He]2471-his called , on the evening of the morrow upon [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick , and found [Roderick]325-roderick with [the two ladies]656-the two ladies . [[Their]656-the two ladies companion]699-their companion had apparently but lately entered , and [Rowland]281-rowland afterwards learned that it was [his]2471-his first appearance since the writing of the note which had so distressed [[his]2471-his mother]448-his mother . [He]2471-his had flung [himself]2471-his upon a sofa , where [he]2471-his sat with [his]2471-his chin upon [his]2471-his breast , staring before [him]2471-his with a sinister spark in [his]2471-his eye . [He]2471-his fixed [his]2471-his gaze on [Rowland]281-rowland , but gave [him]2471-his no greeting . [He]2471-his had evidently been saying something to startle [the women]2475-the women ; [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick had gone and seated [herself]325-roderick , timidly and imploringly , on the edge of the sofa , trying to take [his]2471-his hand . [Miss Garland]182-miss garland was applying [herself]182-miss garland to some needlework with conscious intentness .

[Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick gave [Rowland]281-rowland , on [his]2471-his entrance , a touching look of gratitude . " Oh , [we]5121-we have such blessed news ! "[325-roderick] [she]325-roderick said . " [Roderick]325-roderick is ready to leave [Rome]4-rome . "[325-roderick]

" It 's not blessed news ; it 's most damnable news ! "[325-roderick] cried [Roderick]325-roderick .

" Oh , but [we]5121-we are very glad , [[my]325-roderick son]3311-my son , and [I]325-roderick am sure [you]3311-my son will be when [you]3311-my son get away . [You]3311-my son 're looking most dreadfully thin ; is n't [he]2471-his , [Mr. Mallet]170-mr. mallet ? It 's plain enough [you]3311-my son need a change . [I]325-roderick ' m sure [we]5121-we will go wherever [you]3311-my son like . Where would [you]3311-my son like to go ? "[325-roderick]

[Roderick]325-roderick turned [his]2476-his head slowly and looked at [her]325-roderick . [He]2476-his had let [her]325-roderick take [his]2476-his hand , which [she]325-roderick pressed tenderly between [her]325-roderick own . [He]2476-his gazed at [her]325-roderick for some time in silence . " [Poor mother]5123-poor mother ! "[2476-his] [he]2476-his said at last , in a portentous tone .

" [[My]325-roderick own dear son]5124-my own dear son ! "[325-roderick] murmured [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick in all the innocence of [her]325-roderick trust .

" [I]325-roderick do n't care a straw where [you]325-roderick go ! [I]325-roderick do n't care a straw for anything ! "[325-roderick]

" Oh , [[my]325-roderick dear boy]3628-my dear boy , [you]325-roderick must not say that before all of [us]5126-us here - before [Mary]193-mary garland , before [Mr. Mallet]170-mr. mallet ! "[325-roderick]

" [Mary]193-mary garland - [Mr. Mallet]170-mr. mallet ? "[325-roderick] [Roderick]325-roderick repeated , almost savagely . [He]2476-his released [himself]2476-his from the clasp of [[his]2476-his mother]448-his mother 's hand and turned away , leaning [his]2476-his elbows on [his]2476-his knees and holding [his]2476-his head in [his]2476-his hands . There was a silence ; [Rowland]281-rowland said nothing because [he]2476-his was watching [Miss Garland]182-miss garland . " Why should [I]325-roderick stand on ceremony with [Mary]193-mary garland and [Mr. Mallet]170-mr. mallet ? "[325-roderick] [Roderick]325-roderick presently added . " [Mary]193-mary garland pretends to believe [I]325-roderick ' m [a fine fellow]4513-a fine fellow , and if [she]193-mary garland believes it as [she]193-mary garland ought to , nothing [I]325-roderick can say will alter [her]193-mary garland opinion . [Mallet]170-mr. mallet knows [I]325-roderick ' m [a hopeless humbug]5128-a hopeless humbug ; so [I]325-roderick need n't mince [my]325-roderick words with [him]170-mr. mallet . "[325-roderick]

" Ah , [[my]325-roderick dear]3110-my dear , do n't use such dreadful language ! "[325-roderick] said [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick . " Are n't [we]5130-we all devoted to [you]325-roderick , and proud of [you]325-roderick , and waiting only to hear what [you]325-roderick want , so that [we]5130-we may do it ? "[325-roderick]

[Roderick]325-roderick got up , and began to walk about [the room]487-the room ; [he]2479-he was evidently in a restless , reckless , profoundly demoralized condition . [Rowland]281-rowland felt that it was literally true that [he]2479-he did not care a straw for anything , but [he]2479-he observed with anxiety that [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick , who did not know on what delicate ground [she]325-roderick was treading , was disposed to chide [him]2479-he caressingly , as a mere expression of tenderness . [He]2479-he foresaw that [she]325-roderick would bring down the hovering thunderbolt on [her]325-roderick head .

" In [God]195-god 's name , "[325-roderick] [Roderick]325-roderick cried , " do n't remind [me]325-roderick of [my]325-roderick obligations ! It 's intolerable to [me]325-roderick , and [I]325-roderick do n't believe it 's pleasant to [Mallet]170-mr. mallet . [I]325-roderick know [they]5131-they 're tremendous - [I]325-roderick know [I]325-roderick shall never repay [them]5131-they . [I]325-roderick ' m bankrupt ! Do [you]651-the poor lady know what that means ? "[325-roderick]

[The poor lady]651-the poor lady sat staring , dismayed , and [Rowland]281-rowland angrily interfered . " Do n't talk such stuff to [[your]651-the poor lady mother]3145-your mother ! "[2481-he] [he]2481-he cried . " Do n't [you]651-the poor lady see [you]651-the poor lady 're frightening [her]3145-your mother ? "[2481-he]

" Frightening [her]3145-your mother ? [she]3145-your mother may as well be frightened first as last . Do [I]325-roderick frighten [you]651-the poor lady , [mother]5133-mother ? "[325-roderick] [Roderick]325-roderick demanded .

" Oh , [Roderick]325-roderick , what do [you]325-roderick mean ? "[651-the poor lady] whimpered [the poor lady]651-the poor lady . " [Mr. Mallet]170-mr. mallet , what does [he]170-mr. mallet mean ? "[651-the poor lady]

" [I]325-roderick mean that [I]325-roderick ' m [an angry , savage , disappointed , miserable man]5134-an angry , savage , disappointed , miserable man ! "[325-roderick] [Roderick]325-roderick went on . " [I]325-roderick mean that [I]325-roderick ca n't do a stroke of work nor think a profitable thought ! [I]325-roderick mean that [I]325-roderick ' m in a state of helpless rage and grief and shame ! Helpless , helpless - that 's what it is . [You]651-the poor lady ca n't help [me]325-roderick , [poor mother]5123-poor mother - not with kisses , nor tears , nor prayers ! [Mary]193-mary garland ca n't help [me]325-roderick - not for all the honor [she]193-mary garland does [me]325-roderick , nor all the big books on art that [she]193-mary garland pores over . [Mallet]170-mr. mallet ca n't help [me]325-roderick - not with all [his]170-mr. mallet money , nor all [his]170-mr. mallet good example , nor all [his]170-mr. mallet friendship , which [I]325-roderick ' m so profoundly well aware of : not with it all multiplied a thousand times and repeated to all eternity ! [I]325-roderick thought [you]651-the poor lady would help [me]325-roderick , [you]651-the poor lady and [Mary]193-mary garland ; that 's why [I]325-roderick sent for [you]651-the poor lady . But [you]651-the poor lady ca n't , do n't think it ! The sooner [you]651-the poor lady give up the idea the better for [you]651-the poor lady . Give up being proud of [me]325-roderick , too ; there 's nothing left of [me]325-roderick to be proud of ! A year ago [I]325-roderick was [a mighty fine fellow]5136-a mighty fine fellow ; but do [you]651-the poor lady know what has become of [me]325-roderick now ? [I]325-roderick have gone to the devil ! "[325-roderick]

There was something in the ring of [Roderick]325-roderick 's voice , as [he]2483-he uttered these words , which sent them [home]349-home with convincing force . [He]2483-he was not talking for effect , or the mere sensuous pleasure of extravagant and paradoxical utterance , as had often enough been the case ere this ; [he]2483-he was not even talking viciously or ill - humoredly . [He]2483-he was talking passionately , desperately , and from an irresistible need to throw off the oppressive burden of [[his]2483-he mother]448-his mother 's confidence . [His]2483-he cruel eloquence brought [the poor lady]651-the poor lady to [her]651-the poor lady feet , and [she]651-the poor lady stood there with clasped hands , petrified and voiceless . [Mary Garland]193-mary garland quickly left [her]193-mary garland place , came straight to [Roderick]325-roderick , and laid [her]193-mary garland hand on [his]2483-he arm , looking at [him]2483-he with all [her]193-mary garland tormented heart in [her]193-mary garland eyes . [He]2483-he made no movement to disengage [himself]2483-he ; [he]2483-he simply shook [his]2483-he head several times , in dogged negation of [her]193-mary garland healing powers . [Rowland]281-rowland had been living for the past month in such intolerable expectancy of disaster that now that the ice was broken , and the fatal plunge taken , [his]2483-he foremost feeling was almost elation ; but in a moment [his]2483-he orderly instincts and [his]2483-he natural love of superficial smoothness overtook it .

" [I]2483-he really do n't see , [Roderick]325-roderick , "[2483-he] [he]2483-he said , " the profit of [your]325-roderick talking in just this way at just this time . Do n't [you]325-roderick see how [you]325-roderick are making [[your]325-roderick mother]3145-your mother suffer ? "[2483-he]

" Do [I]325-roderick enjoy it [myself]325-roderick ? "[325-roderick] cried [Roderick]325-roderick . " Is the suffering all on [your]325-roderick side and [theirs]5138-theirs ? Do [I]325-roderick look as if [I]325-roderick were happy , and were stirring [you]325-roderick up with a stick for [my]325-roderick amusement ? Here [we]5139-we all are in [the same boat]5140-the same boat ; [we]5139-we might as well understand [each other]645-each other ! [These women]5142-these women must know that [I]325-roderick ' m not to be counted on . That sounds remarkably cool , no doubt , and [I]325-roderick certainly do n't deny [your]325-roderick right to be utterly disgusted with [me]325-roderick . "[325-roderick]

" Will [you]325-roderick keep what [you]325-roderick have got to say till another time , "[193-mary garland] said [Mary]193-mary garland , " and let [me]193-mary garland hear it alone ? "[193-mary garland]

" Oh , [I]325-roderick 'll let [you]325-roderick hear it as often as [you]325-roderick please ; but what 's the use of keeping it ? [I]325-roderick ' m in the humor ; it wo n't keep ! It 's a very simple matter . [I]325-roderick ' m [a failure]5143-a failure , that 's all ; [I]325-roderick ' m not [a first - rate man]5144-a first - rate man . [I]325-roderick ' m second - rate , tenth - rate , anything [you]325-roderick please . After that , it 's all one ! "[325-roderick]

[Mary Garland]193-mary garland turned away and buried [her]193-mary garland face in [her]193-mary garland hands ; but [Roderick]325-roderick , struck , apparently , in some unwonted fashion with [her]193-mary garland gesture , drew [her]193-mary garland towards [him]2487-he again , and went on in a somewhat different tone . " It 's hardly worth while [we]5145-we should have any private talk about this , [Mary]193-mary garland , "[2487-he] [he]2487-he said . " The thing would be comfortable for [neither of [us]5145-we]5146-neither of us . It 's better , after all , that it be said once for all and dismissed . There are things [I]2487-he ca n't talk to [you]193-mary garland about . Can [I]2487-he , at least ? [You]193-mary garland are such [a queer creature]5147-a queer creature ! "[2487-he]

" [I]193-mary garland can imagine nothing [you]2487-he should n't talk to [me]193-mary garland about , "[193-mary garland] said [Mary]193-mary garland .

" [You]193-mary garland are not afraid ? "[2487-he] [he]2487-he demanded , sharply , looking at [her]193-mary garland .

[She]193-mary garland turned away abruptly , with lowered eyes , hesitating a moment . " Anything [you]2487-he think [I]193-mary garland should hear , [I]193-mary garland will hear , "[193-mary garland] [she]193-mary garland said . And then [she]193-mary garland returned to [her]193-mary garland place at the window and took up [her]193-mary garland work .

" [I]325-roderick have had a great blow , "[325-roderick] said [Roderick]325-roderick . " [I]325-roderick was [a great ass]4826-a great ass , but it does n't make the blow any easier to bear . "[325-roderick]

" [Mr. Mallet]170-mr. mallet , tell [me]325-roderick what [Roderick]325-roderick means ! "[325-roderick] said [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick , who had found [her]325-roderick voice , in a tone more peremptory than [Rowland]281-rowland had ever heard [her]325-roderick use .

" [He]2487-he ought to have told [you]281-rowland before , "[325-roderick] said [Roderick]325-roderick . " Really , [Rowland]281-rowland , if [you]281-rowland will allow [me]325-roderick to say so , [you]281-rowland ought ! [You]281-rowland could have given a much better account of all this than [I]325-roderick [myself]325-roderick ; better , especially , in that it would have been more lenient to [me]325-roderick . [You]281-rowland ought to have let [them]5149-them down gently ; it would have saved [them]5149-them a great deal of pain . But [you]281-rowland always want to keep things so smooth ! Allow [me]325-roderick to say that it 's very weak of [you]281-rowland . "[325-roderick]

" [I]281-rowland hereby renounce such weakness ! "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland .

" Oh , what is it , [sir]3318-sir ; what is it ? "[325-roderick] groaned [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick , insistently .

" It 's what [Roderick]325-roderick says : [he]5151-he 's a failure ! "[325-roderick]

[Mary Garland]193-mary garland , on hearing this declaration , gave [Rowland]281-rowland a single glance and then rose , laid down [her]193-mary garland work , and walked rapidly out of [the room]487-the room . [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick tossed [her]325-roderick head and timidly bristled . " This from [you]3318-sir , [Mr. Mallet]170-mr. mallet ! "[325-roderick] [she]325-roderick said with an injured air which [Rowland]281-rowland found harrowing .

But [Roderick]325-roderick , most characteristically , did not in the least resent [[his]2489-his friend]606-his friend 's assertion ; [he]2489-his sent [him]606-his friend , on the contrary , one of those large , clear looks of [his]2489-his , which seemed to express a stoical pleasure in [Rowland]281-rowland 's frankness , and which set [[his]2489-his companion]555-his companion , then and there , wondering again , as [he]2489-his had so often done before , at the extraordinary contradictions of [his]2489-his temperament . "[325-roderick]

" [Roderick]325-roderick , what have [you]325-roderick done with all [your]325-roderick money ? "[448-his mother] [[his]2493-his mother]448-his mother demanded .

" Thrown it away ! It was no such great amount . [I]325-roderick have done nothing this winter . "[325-roderick]

" [You]325-roderick have done nothing ? "[325-roderick]

" [I]281-rowland have no doubt [Miss Garland]182-miss garland saw , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland .

" [Mary]193-mary garland has said nothing ! "[325-roderick] cried [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick .

" Oh , [she]193-mary garland 's [a fine girl]5156-a fine girl ! "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland said .

" Have [you]325-roderick done anything that will hurt poor [Mary]193-mary garland ? "[325-roderick] [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick asked .

" [I]325-roderick have only been thinking night and day of [another woman]5157-another woman ! "[325-roderick]

[Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick dropped helplessly into [her]325-roderick seat again . " Oh dear , [dear]3392-dear , had n't [we]5159-we better go [home]349-home ? "[325-roderick]

" Not to get out of [her]5157-another woman way ! "[325-roderick] [Roderick]325-roderick said . " [She]5157-another woman has started on a career of [her]5157-another woman own , and [she]5157-another woman does n't care a straw for [me]325-roderick . [My]325-roderick head was filled with [her]5157-another woman ; [I]325-roderick could think of nothing else ; [I]325-roderick would have sacrificed everything to [her]5157-another woman - [you]5161-you , [Mary]193-mary garland , [Mallet]170-mr. mallet , [my]325-roderick work , [my]325-roderick fortune , [my]325-roderick future , [my]325-roderick honor ! [I]325-roderick was in a fine state , eh ? [I]325-roderick do n't pretend to be giving [you]5161-you good news ; but [I]325-roderick ' m telling the simple , literal truth , so that [you]5161-you may know why [I]325-roderick have gone to the dogs . [She]5157-another woman pretended to care greatly for all this , and to be willing to make any sacrifice in return ; [she]5157-another woman had a magnificent chance , for [she]5157-another woman was being forced into a mercenary marriage with [a man [she]5157-another woman detested]5162-a man she detested . [She]5157-another woman led [me]325-roderick to believe that [she]5157-another woman would give this up , and break short off , and keep [herself]5157-another woman free and sacred and pure for [me]325-roderick . This was a great honor , and [you]5161-you may believe that [I]325-roderick valued it . It turned [my]325-roderick head , and [I]325-roderick lived only to see [my]325-roderick happiness come to pass . [She]5157-another woman did everything to encourage [me]325-roderick to hope it would ; everything that [her]5157-another woman infernal coquetry and falsity could suggest . "[325-roderick]

" Oh , [I]281-rowland say , this is too much ! "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland broke out .

" Do [you]281-rowland defend [her]5157-another woman ? "[325-roderick] [Roderick]325-roderick cried , with a renewal of [his]2495-his passion . " Do [you]281-rowland pretend to say that [she]5157-another woman gave [me]2495-his no hopes ? "[2495-his] [He]2495-his had been speaking with growing bitterness , quite losing sight of [[his]2495-his mother]448-his mother 's pain and bewilderment in the passionate joy of publishing [his]2495-his wrongs . Since [he]2495-his was hurt , [he]2495-his must cry out ; since [he]2495-his was in pain , [he]2495-his must scatter [his]2495-his pain abroad . Of [his]2495-his never thinking of [others]914-others , save as [they]914-others spoke and moved from [his]2495-his cue , as it were , this extraordinary insensibility to the injurious effects of [his]2495-his eloquence was a capital example ; the more so as the motive of [his]2495-his eloquence was never an appeal for sympathy or compassion , things to which [he]2495-his seemed perfectly indifferent and of which [he]2495-his could make no use . The great and characteristic point with [him]2495-his was the perfect absoluteness of [his]2495-his own emotions and experience . [He]2495-his never saw [himself]2495-his as part of a whole ; only as [the clear - cut , sharp - edged , isolated individual]2498-the clear - cut , sharp - edged , isolated individual , rejoicing or raging , as the case might be , but needing in any case absolutely to affirm [himself]2495-his . All this , to [Rowland]281-rowland , was ancient history , but [his]2495-his perception of it stirred within [him]2495-his afresh , at the sight of [Roderick]325-roderick 's sense of having been betrayed . That [he]2495-his , under the circumstances , should not in fairness be [the first to lodge a complaint of betrayal]2499-the first to lodge a complaint of betrayal was a point to which , at [his]2495-his leisure , [Rowland]281-rowland was of course capable of rendering impartial justice ; but [Roderick]325-roderick 's present desperation was so peremptory that it imposed itself on [one]3107-one 's sympathies . " Do [you]281-rowland pretend to say , "[2495-his] [he]2495-his went on , " that [she]281-rowland did n't lead [me]2495-his along to the very edge of fulfillment and stupefy [me]2495-his with all that [she]281-rowland suffered [me]2495-his to believe , all that [she]281-rowland sacredly promised ? It amused [her]281-rowland to do it , and [she]281-rowland knew perfectly well what [she]281-rowland really meant . [She]281-rowland never meant to be sincere ; [she]281-rowland never dreamed [she]281-rowland could be . [She]281-rowland 's [a ravenous flirt]5163-a ravenous flirt , and why [a flirt]5164-a flirt is [a flirt]5164-a flirt is more than [I]2495-his can tell [you]281-rowland . [I]2495-his ca n't understand playing with those matters ; for [me]2495-his [they]5166-they 're serious , whether [I]2495-his take them up or lay them down . [I]2495-his do n't see what 's in [your]281-rowland head , [Rowland]281-rowland , to attempt to defend [Miss Light]254-miss light ; [you]281-rowland were the first to cry out against [her]254-miss light ! [You]281-rowland told [me]2495-his [she]254-miss light was dangerous , and [I]2495-his pooh - poohed [you]281-rowland . [You]281-rowland were right ; [you]281-rowland 're always right . [She]254-miss light 's as cold and false and heartless as [she]254-miss light 's beautiful , and [she]254-miss light has sold [her]254-miss light heartless beauty to [the highest bidder]3966-the highest bidder . [I]2495-his hope [he]3966-the highest bidder knows what [he]3966-the highest bidder gets ! "[2495-his]

" Oh , [[my]325-roderick son]3311-my son , "[325-roderick] cried [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick , plaintively , " how could [you]3311-my son ever care for [such a dreadful creature]5169-such a dreadful creature ? "[325-roderick]

" It would take long to tell [you]3311-my son , [dear mother]5170-dear mother ! "[2495-his]

[Rowland]281-rowland 's lately - deepened sympathy and compassion for [Christina]192-christina was still throbbing in [his]2501-he mind , and [he]2501-he felt that , in loyalty to it , [he]2501-he must say a word for [her]192-christina . " [You]3311-my son believed in [her]192-christina too much at first , "[2501-he] [he]2501-he declared , " and [you]3311-my son believe in [her]192-christina too little now . "[2501-he]

[Roderick]325-roderick looked at [him]2501-he with eyes almost lurid , beneath lowering brows . " [She]192-christina is [an angel]3803-an angel , then , after all ? - that 's what [you]3311-my son want to prove ! "[2501-he] [he]2501-he cried . " That 's consoling for [me]2501-he , who have lost [her]192-christina ! [You]3311-my son 're always right , [I]2501-he say ; but , [dear friend]3619-dear friend , in mercy , be wrong for once ! "[2501-he]

" Oh yes , [Mr. Mallet]170-mr. mallet , be merciful ! "[325-roderick] said [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick , in a tone which , for all its gentleness , made [Rowland]281-rowland stare . [The poor fellow]3562-the poor fellow 's stare covered a great deal of concentrated wonder and apprehension - a presentiment of what [a small , sweet , feeble , elderly lady]2503-a small , sweet , feeble , elderly lady might be capable of , in the way of suddenly generated animosity . There was no space in [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick 's tiny maternal mind for complications of feeling , and one emotion existed only by turning another over flat and perching on top of it . [She]325-roderick was evidently not following [Roderick]325-roderick at all in [his]3562-the poor fellow dusky aberrations . Sitting without , in dismay , [she]325-roderick only saw that all was darkness and trouble , and as [Roderick]325-roderick 's glory had now quite outstripped [her]325-roderick powers of imagination and urged [him]3562-the poor fellow beyond [her]325-roderick jurisdiction , so that [he]3562-the poor fellow had become a thing too precious and sacred for blame , [she]325-roderick found it infinitely comfortable to lay the burden of [their]2504-their common affliction upon [Rowland]281-rowland 's broad shoulders . Had [he]3562-the poor fellow not promised to make [them]2504-their all rich and happy ? And this was the end of it ! [Rowland]281-rowland felt as if [his]3562-the poor fellow trials were , in a sense , only beginning . " Had n't [you]325-roderick better forget all this , [[my]325-roderick dear]3110-my dear ? "[325-roderick] [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick said . " Had n't [you]325-roderick better just quietly attend to [your]325-roderick work ? "[325-roderick]

" Work , [madame]3522-madame ? "[325-roderick] cried [Roderick]325-roderick . " [My]3562-the poor fellow work 's over . [I]3562-the poor fellow ca n't work - [I]3562-the poor fellow have n't worked all winter . If [I]3562-the poor fellow were fit for anything , this sentimental collapse would have been just the thing to cure [me]3562-the poor fellow of [my]3562-the poor fellow apathy and break the spell of [my]3562-the poor fellow idleness . But there 's a perfect vacuum here ! "[3562-the poor fellow] And [he]3562-the poor fellow tapped [his]3562-the poor fellow forehead . " It 's bigger than ever ; it grows bigger every hour ! "[3562-the poor fellow]

" [I]325-roderick ' m sure [you]325-roderick have made a beautiful likeness of [[your]325-roderick poor little mother]5175-your poor little mother , "[325-roderick] said [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick , coaxingly .

" [I]3562-the poor fellow had done nothing before , and [I]3562-the poor fellow have done nothing since ! [I]3562-the poor fellow quarreled with [an excellent man]5176-an excellent man , the other day , from mere exasperation of [my]3562-the poor fellow nerves , and threw away five thousand dollars ! "[3562-the poor fellow]

" Threw away - five thousand dollars ! "[325-roderick] [Roderick]325-roderick had been wandering among formidable abstractions and allusions too dark to penetrate . But here was a concrete fact , lucidly stated , and poor [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick , for a moment , looked it in the face . [She]325-roderick repeated [[her]325-roderick son]459-her son 's words a third time with a gasping murmur , and then , suddenly , [she]325-roderick burst into tears . [Roderick]325-roderick went to [her]325-roderick , sat down beside [her]325-roderick , put [his]3562-the poor fellow arm round [her]325-roderick , fixed [his]3562-the poor fellow eyes coldly on the floor , and waited for [her]325-roderick to weep [herself]325-roderick out . [She]325-roderick leaned [her]325-roderick head on [his]3562-the poor fellow shoulder and sobbed broken - heartedly . [She]325-roderick said not a word , [she]325-roderick made no attempt to scold ; but the desolation of [her]325-roderick tears was overwhelming . It lasted some time - too long for [Rowland]281-rowland 's courage . [He]3562-the poor fellow had stood silent , wishing simply to appear very respectful ; but the elation that was mentioned a while since had utterly ebbed , and [he]3562-the poor fellow found [his]3562-the poor fellow situation intolerable . [He]3562-the poor fellow walked away - not , perhaps , on tiptoe , but with a total absence of bravado in [his]3562-the poor fellow tread .

The next day , while [he]3562-the poor fellow was at [home]349-home , [the servant]4885-the servant brought [him]3562-the poor fellow the card of [a visitor]2337-a visitor . [He]3562-the poor fellow read with surprise the name of [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick , and hurried forward to meet [her]325-roderick . [He]3562-the poor fellow found [her]325-roderick in [[his]3562-the poor fellow sitting - room]2370-his sitting - room , leaning on the arm of [[her]325-roderick son]459-her son and looking very pale , [her]325-roderick eyes red with weeping , and [her]325-roderick lips tightly compressed . [Her]325-roderick advent puzzled [him]3562-the poor fellow , and it was not for some time that [he]3562-the poor fellow began to understand the motive of it . [Roderick]325-roderick 's countenance threw no light upon it ; but [Roderick]325-roderick 's countenance , full of light as it was , in a way , itself , had never thrown light upon anything . [He]3562-the poor fellow had not been in [[Rowland]281-rowland 's rooms]1824-rowland 's rooms for several weeks , and [he]3562-the poor fellow immediately began to look at those of [his]3562-the poor fellow own works that adorned them . [He]3562-the poor fellow lost [himself]3562-the poor fellow in silent contemplation . [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick had evidently armed [herself]325-roderick with dignity , and , so far as [she]325-roderick might , [she]325-roderick meant to be impressive . [Her]325-roderick success may be measured by the fact that [Rowland]281-rowland 's whole attention centred in the fear of seeing [her]325-roderick begin to weep . [She]325-roderick told [him]3562-the poor fellow that [she]325-roderick had come to [him]3562-the poor fellow for practical advice ; [she]325-roderick begged to remind [him]3562-the poor fellow that [she]325-roderick was [a stranger in [the land]2513-the land]2512-a stranger in the land . Where were [they]2514-they to go , please ? what were [they]2514-they to do ? [Rowland]281-rowland glanced at [Roderick]325-roderick , but [Roderick]325-roderick had [his]3562-the poor fellow back turned and was gazing at [[his]3562-the poor fellow Adam]2515-his adam with the intensity with which [he]3562-the poor fellow might have examined [Michael Angelo]203-michael angelo 's [Moses]328-moses .

" [Roderick]325-roderick says [he]3562-the poor fellow does n't know , [he]3562-the poor fellow does n't care , "[325-roderick] [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick said ; " [he]3562-the poor fellow leaves it entirely to [you]5177-you . "[325-roderick]

[Many another man]387-many another man , in [[Rowland]281-rowland 's place]2517-rowland 's place , would have greeted this information with an irate and sarcastic laugh , and told [[his]387-many another man visitors]2518-his visitors that [he]387-many another man thanked [them]2518-his visitors infinitely for [their]2518-his visitors confidence , but that , really , as things stood now , [they]2518-his visitors must settle these matters between [themselves]2518-his visitors ; [many another man]387-many another man might have so demeaned [himself]387-many another man , even if , like [Rowland]281-rowland , [he]387-many another man had been in love with [Mary Garland]193-mary garland and pressingly conscious that [her]193-mary garland destiny was also part of the question . But [Rowland]281-rowland swallowed all hilarity and all sarcasm , and let [himself]281-rowland seriously consider [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick 's petition . [His]387-many another man wits , however , were but indifferently at [his]387-many another man command ; they were dulled by [his]387-many another man sense of the inexpressible change in [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick 's attitude . [Her]325-roderick visit was evidently intended as a formal reminder of the responsiblities [Rowland]281-rowland had worn so lightly . [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick was doubtless too sincerely humble [a person]4024-a person to suppose that if [he]387-many another man had been recreant to [his]387-many another man vows of vigilance and tenderness , [her]325-roderick still , small presence would operate as a chastisement . But by some diminutive logical process of [her]325-roderick own [she]325-roderick had convinced [herself]325-roderick that [she]325-roderick had been weakly trustful , and that [she]325-roderick had suffered [Rowland]281-rowland to think too meanly , not only of [her]325-roderick understanding , but of [her]325-roderick social consequence . A visit in [her]325-roderick best gown would have an admonitory effect as regards both of these attributes ; it would cancel some favors received , and show [him]387-many another man that [she]325-roderick was [no such fool]2521-no such fool ! These were the reflections of [a very shy woman]2522-a very shy woman , who , determining for once in [her]2522-a very shy woman life to hold up [her]2522-a very shy woman head , was perhaps carrying it a trifle extravagantly .

" [You]387-many another man know [we]5178-we have very little money to spend , "[325-roderick] [she]325-roderick said , as [Rowland]281-rowland remained silent . " [Roderick]325-roderick tells [me]325-roderick that [he]387-many another man has debts and nothing at all to pay [them]5179-them with . [He]387-many another man says [I]325-roderick must write to [Mr. Striker]185-mr. striker to sell [[my]325-roderick house]5018-my house for what it will bring , and send [me]325-roderick out the money . When the money comes [I]325-roderick must give it to [him]387-many another man . [I]325-roderick ' m sure [I]325-roderick do n't know ; [I]325-roderick never heard of anything so dreadful ! [[My]325-roderick house]5018-my house is all [I]325-roderick have . But that is all [Roderick]325-roderick will say . [We]5182-we must be very economical . "[325-roderick]

Before this speech was finished [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick 's voice had begun to quaver softly , and [her]325-roderick face , which had no capacity for the expression of superior wisdom , to look as humbly appealing as before . [Rowland]281-rowland turned to [Roderick]325-roderick and spoke like [a school - master]2523-a school - master . " Come away from those statues , and sit down here and listen to [me]281-rowland ! "[281-rowland]

[Roderick]325-roderick started , but obeyed with the most graceful docility .

" What do [you]325-roderick propose to [[your]325-roderick mother]3145-your mother to do ? "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland asked .

" Propose ? "[325-roderick] said [Roderick]325-roderick , absently . " Oh , [I]325-roderick propose nothing . "[325-roderick]

The tone , the glance , the gesture with which this was said were horribly irritating though obviously without the slightest intention of being so , and for an instant an imprecation rose to [Rowland]281-rowland 's lips . But [he]2524-he checked it , and [he]2524-he was afterwards glad [he]2524-he had done so . " [You]325-roderick must do something , "[2524-he] [he]2524-he said . " Choose , select , decide ! "[2524-he]

" [[My]325-roderick dear]3110-my dear [Rowland]281-rowland , how [you]281-rowland talk ! "[325-roderick] [Roderick]325-roderick cried . " The very point of the matter is that [I]325-roderick ca n't do anything . [I]325-roderick will do as [I]325-roderick ' m told , but [I]325-roderick do n't call that doing . [We]5185-we must leave [Rome]4-rome , [I]325-roderick suppose , though [I]325-roderick do n't see why . [We]5185-we have got no money , and [you]281-rowland have to pay money on [the railroads]3710-the railroads . "[325-roderick]

[Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick surreptitiously wrung [her]325-roderick hands . " Listen to [him]5187-him , please ! "[325-roderick] [she]325-roderick cried . " Not leave [Rome]4-rome , when [we]5185-we have staid [here]3130-here later than [any Christians]5189-any christians ever did before ! It 's [this dreadful place that has made [us]5185-we so unhappy]5190-this dreadful place that has made us so unhappy . "[325-roderick]

" That 's very true , "[325-roderick] said [Roderick]325-roderick , serenely . " If [I]325-roderick had not come to [Rome]4-rome , [I]325-roderick would n't have risen , and if [I]325-roderick had not risen , [I]325-roderick should n't have fallen . "[325-roderick]

" Fallen - fallen ! "[325-roderick] murmured [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick . " Just hear [him]5187-him ! "[325-roderick]

" [I]325-roderick will do anything [you]325-roderick say , [Rowland]281-rowland , "[325-roderick] [Roderick]325-roderick added . " [I]325-roderick will do anything [you]325-roderick want . [I]325-roderick have not been unkind to [[my]325-roderick mother]3224-my mother - have [I]325-roderick , [mother]5133-mother ? [I]325-roderick was unkind yesterday , without meaning it ; for after all , all that had to be said . Murder will out , and [my]325-roderick low spirits ca n't be hidden . But [we]5193-we talked it over and made it up , did n't [we]5193-we ? It seemed to [me]325-roderick [we]5193-we did . Let [Rowland]281-rowland decide it , [mother]5133-mother ; whatever [he]2525-his suggests will be the right thing . "[325-roderick] And [Roderick]325-roderick , who had hardly removed [his]2525-his eyes from the statues , got up again and went back to look at [them]2526-them .

[Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick fixed [her]325-roderick eyes upon the floor in silence . There was not a trace in [Roderick]325-roderick 's face , or in [his]2525-his voice , of the bitterness of [his]2525-his emotion of the day before , and not a hint of [his]2525-his having the lightest weight upon [his]2525-his conscience . [He]2525-his looked at [Rowland]281-rowland with [his]2525-his frank , luminous eye as if there had never been a difference of opinion between [them]2527-them ; as if each had ever been for both , unalterably , and both for each .

[Rowland]281-rowland had received a few days before a letter from [a lady of [his]2525-his acquaintance]2528-a lady of his acquaintance , a worthy Scotswoman domiciled in [a villa upon one of [the olive - covered hills near [Florence]46-florence]2530-the olive - covered hills near florence]2529-a villa upon one of the olive - covered hills near florence . [She]2528-a lady of his acquaintance held [[her]2528-a lady of his acquaintance apartment]2531-her apartment in [the villa]841-the villa upon a long lease , and [she]2528-a lady of his acquaintance enjoyed for a sum not worth mentioning the possession of [an extraordinary number of noble , stone - floored rooms , with ceilings vaulted and frescoed , and barred windows commanding the loveliest view in [the world]483-the world]2533-an extraordinary number of noble , stone - floored rooms , with ceilings vaulted and frescoed , and barred windows commanding the loveliest view in the world . [She]2528-a lady of his acquaintance was [a needy and thrifty spinster , who never hesitated to declare that the lovely view]2535-a needy and thrifty spinster , who never hesitated to declare that the lovely view was all very well , but that for [her]2528-a lady of his acquaintance own part [she]2528-a lady of his acquaintance lived in [the villa]841-the villa for cheapness , and that if [she]2528-a lady of his acquaintance had a clear three hundred pounds a year [she]2528-a lady of his acquaintance would go and really enjoy life near [[her]2528-a lady of his acquaintance sister]2537-her sister , [[a baronet]2538-a baronet 's lady]2539-a baronet 's lady , at [Glasgow]144-glasgow . [She]2528-a lady of his acquaintance was now proposing to make a visit to [that exhilarating city]2540-that exhilarating city , and [she]2528-a lady of his acquaintance desired to turn an honest penny by sub - letting for a few weeks [[her]2528-a lady of his acquaintance historic Italian chambers]2541-her historic italian chambers . The terms on which [she]2528-a lady of his acquaintance occupied them enabled [her]2528-a lady of his acquaintance to ask a rent almost jocosely small , and [she]2528-a lady of his acquaintance begged [Rowland]281-rowland to do what [she]2528-a lady of his acquaintance called a little genteel advertising for [her]2528-a lady of his acquaintance . Would [he]2542-he say a good word for [[her]2528-a lady of his acquaintance rooms]2543-her rooms to [[his]2542-he numerous friends]2544-his numerous friends , as [they]2544-his numerous friends left [Rome]4-rome ? [He]2542-he said a good word for [them]2544-his numerous friends now to [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick , and told [her]325-roderick in dollars and cents how cheap a summer 's lodging [she]325-roderick might secure . [He]2542-he dwelt upon the fact that [she]325-roderick would strike a truce with tables - d'hote and have [a cook of [her]325-roderick own]2545-a cook of her own , amenable possibly to instruction in the Northampton mysteries . [He]2542-he had touched a tender chord ; [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick became almost cheerful . [Her]325-roderick sentiments upon the table - d'hote system and upon foreign household habits generally were remarkable , and , if [we]2546-we had space for it , would repay analysis ; and the idea of reclaiming a lost soul to the Puritanic canons of cookery quite lightened the burden of [her]325-roderick depression . While [Rowland]281-rowland set forth [his]2542-he case [Roderick]325-roderick was slowly walking round [the magnificent Adam]2547-the magnificent adam , with [his]2542-he hands in [his]2542-he pockets . [Rowland]281-rowland waited for [him]2542-he to manifest an interest in [their]2548-their discussion , but the statue seemed to fascinate [him]2542-he and [he]2542-he remained calmly heedless . [Rowland]281-rowland was [a practical man]3218-a practical man ; [he]2542-he possessed conspicuously what is called the sense of detail . [He]2542-he entered into [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick 's position minutely , and told [her]325-roderick exactly why it seemed good that [she]325-roderick should remove immediately to [the Florentine villa]2550-the florentine villa . [She]325-roderick received [his]2542-he advice with great frigidity , looking hard at the floor and sighing , like [a person well on [her]325-roderick guard against an insidious optimism]2551-a person well on her guard against an insidious optimism . But [she]325-roderick had nothing better to propose , and [Rowland]281-rowland received [her]281-rowland permission to write to [[his]2542-he friend]606-his friend that [he]2542-he had let [the rooms]2553-the rooms .

[Roderick]325-roderick assented to this decision without either sighs or smiles . " [A Florentine villa]5195-a florentine villa is a good thing ! "[2542-he] [he]2542-he said . " [I]2542-he am at [your]448-his mother service . "[2542-he]

" [I]448-his mother ' m sure [I]448-his mother hope [you]2542-he 'll get better [there]3420-there , "[448-his mother] moaned [[his]2542-he mother]448-his mother , gathering [her]448-his mother shawl together .

[Roderick]325-roderick laid one hand on [her]448-his mother arm and with the other pointed to [Rowland]281-rowland 's statues . " Better or worse , remember this : [I]2542-he did those things ! "[2542-he] [he]2542-he said .

[Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick gazed at [them]2555-them vaguely , and [Rowland]281-rowland said , " Remember it [yourself]325-roderick ! "[281-rowland]

" They are horribly good ! "[325-roderick] said [Roderick]325-roderick .

[Rowland]281-rowland solemnly shrugged [his]2542-he shoulders ; it seemed to [him]2542-he that [he]2542-he had nothing more to say . But as [the others]4483-the others were going , a last light pulsation of the sense of undischarged duty led [him]2542-he to address to [Roderick]325-roderick a few words of parting advice . " [You]325-roderick 'll find [the Villa Pandolfini]5197-the villa pandolfini very delightful , very comfortable , "[2542-he] [he]2542-he said . [I]2542-he hope [you]325-roderick will work . "[2542-he]

" [I]325-roderick hope [I]325-roderick may ! "[325-roderick] said [Roderick]325-roderick with a magnificent smile .

" When [we]5200-we meet again , have something to show [me]2542-he . "[2542-he]

" Oh , [I]2542-he hardly know ; over [the Alps]78-the alps . "[2542-he]

" Over [the Alps]78-the alps ! [You]281-rowland 're going to leave [me]325-roderick ? "[325-roderick] [Roderick]325-roderick cried .

[Rowland]281-rowland had most distinctly meant to leave [him]2557-you , but [his]2557-you resolution immediately wavered . [He]2557-you glanced at [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick and saw that [her]325-roderick eyebrows were lifted and [her]325-roderick lips parted in soft irony . [She]325-roderick seemed to accuse [him]2557-you of a craven shirking of trouble , to demand of [him]2557-you to repair [his]2557-you cruel havoc in [her]325-roderick life by a solemn renewal of zeal . But [Roderick]325-roderick 's expectations were the oddest ! Such as they were , [Rowland]281-rowland asked [himself]2557-you why [he]2557-you should n't make a bargain with [them]2558-them . " [You]2557-you desire [me]2557-you to go with [you]2557-you ? "[2557-you] [he]2557-you asked .

" If [you]2557-you do n't go , [I]325-roderick wo n't - that 's all ! How in [the world]483-the world shall [I]325-roderick get through the summer without [you]2557-you ? "[325-roderick]

" How will [you]2557-you get through it with [me]281-rowland ? That 's the question . "[281-rowland]

" [I]325-roderick do n't pretend to say ; the future is a dead blank . But without [you]2557-you it 's not a blank - it 's certain damnation ! "[325-roderick]

" Mercy , mercy ! "[325-roderick] murmured [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick .

[Rowland]281-rowland made an effort to stand firm , and for a moment succeeded . " If [I]281-rowland go with [you]325-roderick , will [you]325-roderick try to work ? "[281-rowland]

[Roderick]325-roderick , up to this moment , had been looking as unperturbed as if the deep agitation of the day before were a thing of the remote past . But at these words [his]2557-you face changed formidably ; [he]2557-you flushed and scowled , and all [his]2557-you passion returned . " Try to work ! "[2557-you] [he]2557-you cried . " Try - try ! work - work ! In [God]195-god 's name do n't talk that way , or [you]2557-you 'll drive [me]2557-you mad ! Do [you]2557-you suppose [I]2557-you ' m trying not to work ? Do [you]2557-you suppose [I]2557-you stand rotting [here]3130-here for the fun of it ?
