" [Mr. Mallet]170-mr. mallet , "[325-roderick] cried [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick , piteously , " will [you]170-mr. mallet leave [me]325-roderick alone with this ? "[325-roderick]

[Rowland]281-rowland turned to [her]325-roderick and informed [her]325-roderick , gently , that [he]2559-he would go with [her]325-roderick to [Florence]46-florence . After [he]2559-he had so pledged [himself]2559-he [he]2559-he thought not at all of the pain of [his]2559-he position as mediator between [the mother]1240-the mother 's resentful grief and [the son]2561-the son 's incurable weakness ; [he]2559-he drank deep , only , of the satisfaction of not separating from [Mary Garland]193-mary garland . If the future was a blank to [Roderick]325-roderick , it was hardly less so to [himself]2559-he . [He]2559-he had at moments a lively foreboding of impending calamity . [He]2559-he paid it no especial deference , but it made [him]2559-he feel indisposed to take the future into [his]2559-he account . When , on [his]2559-he going to take leave of [Madame Grandoni]217-madame grandoni , [this lady]346-this lady asked at what time [he]2559-he would come back to [Rome]4-rome , [he]2559-he answered that [he]2559-he was coming back either never or forever . When [she]346-this lady asked [him]2559-he what [he]2559-he meant , [he]2559-he said [he]2559-he really could n't tell [her]346-this lady , and parted from [her]346-this lady with much genuine emotion ; the more so , doubtless , that [she]346-this lady blessed [him]2559-he in a quite loving , maternal fashion , and told [him]2559-he [she]346-this lady honestly believed [him]2559-he to be [the best fellow in [the world]483-the world]2563-the best fellow in the world .

[The Villa Pandolfini]145-the villa pandolfini stood directly upon [a small grass - grown piazza]2565-a small grass - grown piazza , on the top of a hill which sloped straight from [one of the gates of [Florence]46-florence]2566-one of the gates of florence . [It]145-the villa pandolfini offered to [the outer world]2432-the outer world a long , rather low facade , colored a dull , dark yellow , and pierced with windows of various sizes , no one of which , save those on the ground floor , was on the same level with any other . Within , [it]145-the villa pandolfini had a great , cool , gray cortile , with high , light arches around [it]145-the villa pandolfini , heavily - corniced doors , of majestic altitude , opening out of [it]145-the villa pandolfini , and [a beautiful mediaeval well on one side of [it]145-the villa pandolfini]2568-a beautiful mediaeval well on one side of it . [[Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick 's rooms]2569-mrs. hudson 's rooms opened into [a small garden supported on immense substructions , which were planted on the farther side of [the hill]3455-the hill]2570-a small garden supported on immense substructions , which were planted on the farther side of the hill , as [it]2570-a small garden supported on immense substructions , which were planted on the farther side of the hill sloped steeply away . [This garden]2572-this garden was [a charming place]2573-a charming place . [Its]2572-this garden south wall was curtained with a dense orange vine , a dozen fig - trees offered [you]2574-you [their]2575-their large - leaved shade , and over the low parapet the soft , grave Tuscan landscape kept [you]2574-you company . [The rooms]2553-the rooms [themselves]2553-the rooms were as high as [chapels]2577-chapels and as cool as royal sepulchres . Silence , peace , and security seemed to abide in [the ancient house]2578-the ancient house and make [it]2578-the ancient house an ideal refuge for aching hearts . [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick had [a stunted , brown - faced Maddalena]2579-a stunted , brown - faced maddalena , who wore a crimson handkerchief passed over [her]2579-a stunted , brown - faced maddalena coarse , black locks and tied under [her]2579-a stunted , brown - faced maddalena sharp , pertinacious chin , and a smile which was as brilliant as a prolonged flash of lightning . [She]2579-a stunted , brown - faced maddalena smiled at everything in life , especially the things [she]2579-a stunted , brown - faced maddalena did n't like and which kept [her]2579-a stunted , brown - faced maddalena talent for mendacity in healthy exercise . A glance , a word , a motion was sufficient to make [her]2579-a stunted , brown - faced maddalena show [her]2579-a stunted , brown - faced maddalena teeth at [you]2574-you like a cheerful she - wolf . This inexpugnable smile constituted [her]2579-a stunted , brown - faced maddalena whole vocabulary in [her]2579-a stunted , brown - faced maddalena dealings with [[her]2579-a stunted , brown - faced maddalena melancholy mistress]2580-her melancholy mistress , to whom [she]2579-a stunted , brown - faced maddalena had been bequeathed by [the late occupant of [the apartment]2582-the apartment]2581-the late occupant of the apartment , and who , to [Rowland]281-rowland 's satisfaction , promised to be diverted from [her]2579-a stunted , brown - faced maddalena maternal sorrows by the still deeper perplexities of [Maddalena]329-maddalena 's theory of roasting , sweeping , and bed - making .

[Rowland]281-rowland took rooms at [a villa]2583-a villa a trifle nearer [Florence]46-florence , whence in the summer mornings [he]2584-he had five minutes ' walk in the sharp , black , shadow - strip projected by winding , flower - topped walls , to join [[his]2584-he friends]714-his friends . The life at [the Villa Pandolfini]145-the villa pandolfini , when [it]2586-it had fairly defined itself , was tranquil and monotonous , but it might have borrowed from exquisite circumstance an absorbing charm . If a sensible shadow rested upon it , this was because it had an inherent vice ; it was feigning a repose which it very scantily felt . [Roderick]325-roderick had lost no time in giving the full measure of [his]2584-he uncompromising chagrin , and as [he]2584-he was [the central figure of [the little group]1647-the little group]2587-the central figure of the little group , as [he]2584-he held its heart - strings all in [his]2584-he own hand , it reflected faithfully the eclipse of [his]2584-he own genius . [No one]629-no one had ventured upon the cheerful commonplace of saying that the change of air and of scene would restore [his]2584-he spirits ; this would have had , under the circumstances , altogether too silly a sound . The change in question had done nothing of the sort , and [[his]2584-he companions]654-his companions had , at least , the comfort of [their]654-his companions perspicacity . An essential spring had dried up within [him]2584-he , and there was no visible spiritual law for making it flow again . [He]2584-he was rarely violent , [he]2584-he expressed little of the irritation and ennui that [he]2584-he must have constantly felt ; it was as if [he]2584-he believed that a spiritual miracle for [his]2584-he redemption was just barely possible , and was therefore worth waiting for . The most that [one]3107-one could do , however , was to wait grimly and doggedly , suppressing an imprecation as , from time to time , [one]3107-one looked at [one]3107-one 's watch . An attitude of positive urbanity toward life was not to be expected ; it was doing [one]3107-one 's duty to hold [one]3107-one 's tongue and keep [one]3107-one 's hands off [one]3107-one 's own windpipe , and [other people]3286-other people 's . [Roderick]325-roderick had long silences , fits of profound lethargy , almost of stupefaction . [He]2584-he used to sit in [the garden]3242-the garden by the hour , with [his]2584-he head thrown back , [his]2584-he legs outstretched , [his]2584-he hands in [his]2584-he pockets , and [his]2584-he eyes fastened upon the blinding summer sky . [He]2584-he would gather a dozen books about [him]2584-he , tumble them out on the ground , take one into [his]2584-he lap , and leave it with the pages unturned . These moods would alternate with hours of extreme restlessness , during which [he]2584-he mysteriously absented [himself]2584-he . [He]2584-he bore the heat of the Italian summer like a salamander , and used to start off at high noon for long walks over [the hills]1573-the hills . [He]2584-he often went down into [Florence]46-florence , rambled through [[her]46-florence close , [dim streets]2602-dim streets]2601-her close , dim streets , and lounged away mornings in [the churches]2603-the churches and [galleries]2144-galleries . On many of these occasions [Rowland]281-rowland bore [him]2584-he company , for they were the times when [he]2584-he was most like [[his]2584-he former self]2605-his former self . Before [Michael Angelo]203-michael angelo 's statues and the pictures of the early Tuscans , [he]2584-he quite forgot [his]2584-he own infelicities , and picked up the thread of [his]2584-he old aesthetic loquacity . [He]2584-he had a particular fondness for [Andrea del Sarto]330-andrea del sarto , and affirmed that if [he]2584-he had been [a painter]3872-a painter [he]2584-he would have taken [the author of the Madonna del Sacco]2607-the author of the madonna del sacco for [[his]2584-he model]3939-his model . [He]2584-he found in [Florence]46-florence [some of [[his]2584-he Roman friends]2610-his roman friends]2609-some of his roman friends , and went down on certain evenings to meet [them]2609-some of his roman friends . More than once [he]2584-he asked [Mary Garland]193-mary garland to go with [him]2584-he into [town]2611-town , and showed [her]193-mary garland the things [he]2584-he most cared for . [He]2584-he had some modeling clay brought up to [the villa]841-the villa and deposited in [a room suitable for [his]2584-he work]2613-a room suitable for his work ; but when this had been done [he]2584-he turned the key in the door and the clay never was touched . [His]2584-he eye was heavy and [his]2584-he hand cold , and [[his]2584-he mother]448-his mother put up a secret prayer that [he]2584-he might be induced to see [a doctor]2615-a doctor . But on a certain occasion , when [her]448-his mother prayer became articulate , [he]2584-he had a great outburst of anger and begged [her]448-his mother to know , once for all , that [his]2584-he health was better than it had ever been . On the whole , and most of the time , [he]2584-he was a sad spectacle ; [he]2584-he looked so hopelessly idle . If [he]2584-he was not querulous and bitter , it was because [he]2584-he had taken an extraordinary vow not to be ; a vow heroic , for [him]2584-he , a vow which [those who knew [him]2584-he well]2616-those who knew him well had the tenderness to appreciate . Talking with [him]2584-he was like skating on thin ice , and [[his]2584-he companions]654-his companions had a constant mental vision of spots designated " dangerous . "[2584-he]

This was a difficult time for [Rowland]281-rowland ; [he]2584-he said to [himself]2584-he that [he]2584-he would endure it to the end , but that it must be [his]2584-he last adventure of the kind . [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick divided [her]325-roderick time between looking askance at [[her]325-roderick son]459-her son , with [her]325-roderick hands tightly clasped about [her]325-roderick pocket - handkerchief , as if [she]325-roderick were wringing it dry of the last hour 's tears , and turning [her]325-roderick eyes much more directly upon [Rowland]281-rowland , in the mutest , the feeblest , the most intolerable reproachfulness . [She]325-roderick never phrased [her]325-roderick accusations , but [he]2584-he felt that in the unillumined void of [the poor lady]651-the poor lady 's mind [they]2620-they loomed up like vaguely - outlined monsters . [Her]325-roderick demeanor caused [him]2584-he the acutest suffering , and if , at the outset of [his]2584-he enterprise , [he]2584-he had seen , how dimly soever , one of those plaintive eye - beams in the opposite scale , the brilliancy of [Roderick]325-roderick 's promises would have counted for little . [They]2620-they made [their]2620-they way to the softest spot in [his]2584-he conscience and kept it chronically aching . If [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick had been loquacious and vulgar , [he]2584-he would have borne even a less valid persecution with greater fortitude . But somehow , [neat and noiseless and dismally lady]2621-neat and noiseless and dismally lady - like , as [she]325-roderick sat there , keeping [her]325-roderick grievance green with [her]325-roderick soft - dropping tears , [her]325-roderick displeasure conveyed an overwhelming imputation of brutality . [He]2584-he felt like [a reckless trustee who has speculated with the widow]2622-a reckless trustee who has speculated with the widow 's mite , and is haunted with the reflection of ruin that [he]2584-he sees in [her]325-roderick tearful eyes . [He]2584-he did everything conceivable to be polite to [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick , and to treat [her]325-roderick with distinguished deference . Perhaps [his]2584-he exasperated nerves made [him]2584-he overshoot the mark , and rendered [his]2584-he civilities a trifle peremptory . [She]325-roderick seemed capable of believing that [he]2584-he was trying to make a fool of [her]325-roderick ; [she]325-roderick would have thought [him]2584-he cruelly recreant if [he]2584-he had suddenly departed in desperation , and yet [she]325-roderick gave [him]2584-he no visible credit for [his]2584-he constancy . [Women]3288-women are said by [some authorities]2624-some authorities to be cruel ; [I]0-i do n't know how true this is , but it may at least be pertinent to remark that [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick was very much of [a woman]3607-a woman . It often seemed to [Rowland]281-rowland that [he]2584-he had too decidedly forfeited [his]2584-he freedom , and that there was something positively grotesque in [a man of [his]2584-he age and circumstances living in such a moral bondage]2626-a man of his age and circumstances living in such a moral bondage .

But [Mary Garland]193-mary garland had helped [him]2584-he before , and [she]325-roderick helped [him]2584-he now - helped [him]2584-he not less than [he]2584-he had assured [himself]2584-he [she]325-roderick would when [he]2584-he found [himself]2584-he drifting to [Florence]46-florence . Yet [her]325-roderick help was rendered in the same unconscious , unacknowledged fashion as before ; there was no explicit change in [their]2627-their relations . After that distressing scene in [Rome]4-rome which had immediately preceded [their]2627-their departure , it was of course impossible that there should not be on [Miss Garland]182-miss garland 's part some frankness of allusion to [Roderick]325-roderick 's sad condition . [She]325-roderick had been present , [the reader]388-the reader will remember , during only half of [his]2584-he unsparing confession , and [Rowland]281-rowland had not seen [her]325-roderick confronted with any absolute proof of [Roderick]325-roderick 's passion for Christina Light . But [he]2584-he knew that [she]325-roderick knew far too much for [her]325-roderick happiness ; [Roderick]325-roderick had told [him]2584-he , shortly after [their]2627-their settlement at [the Villa Pandolfini]145-the villa pandolfini , that [he]2584-he had had a " tremendous talk "[325-roderick] with [[his]2584-he cousin]343-his cousin . [Rowland]281-rowland asked no questions about it ; [he]2584-he preferred not to know what had passed between [them]2627-their . If [their]2627-their interview had been purely painful , [he]2584-he wished to ignore it for [Miss Garland]182-miss garland 's sake ; and if it had sown the seeds of reconciliation , [he]2584-he wished to close [his]2584-he eyes to it for [his]2584-he own - for the sake of that unshaped idea , forever dismissed and yet forever present , which hovered in the background of [his]2584-he consciousness , with a hanging head , as it were , and yet an unshamed glance , and whose lightest motions were an effectual bribe to patience . Was the engagement broken ? [Rowland]281-rowland wondered , yet without asking . But it hardly mattered , for if , as was more than probable , [Miss Garland]182-miss garland had peremptorily released [[her]182-miss garland cousin]370-her cousin , [her]182-miss garland own heart had by no means recovered its liberty . It was very certain to [Rowland]281-rowland 's mind that if [she]182-miss garland had given [him]370-her cousin up [she]182-miss garland had by no means ceased to care for [him]370-her cousin passionately , and that , to exhaust [her]182-miss garland charity for [his]370-her cousin weaknesses , [Roderick]325-roderick would have , as the phrase is , a long row to hoe . [She]182-miss garland spoke of [Roderick]325-roderick as [she]182-miss garland might have done of [a person suffering from a serious malady which demanded much tenderness]2631-a person suffering from a serious malady which demanded much tenderness ; but if [Rowland]281-rowland had found it possible to accuse [her]182-miss garland of dishonesty [he]2584-he would have said now that [she]182-miss garland believed appreciably less than [she]182-miss garland pretended to in [[her]182-miss garland victim]2632-her victim 's being [an involuntary patient]2633-an involuntary patient . There are [women whose love is care - taking and patronizing]2634-women whose love is care - taking and patronizing , and who rather prefer [a weak man]2635-a weak man because [he]2635-a weak man gives [them]2634-women whose love is care - taking and patronizing a comfortable sense of strength . It did not in the least please [Rowland]281-rowland to believe that [Mary Garland]193-mary garland was one of these ; for [he]2584-he held that [such women]2636-such women were only [males]2637-males in petticoats , and [he]2584-he was convinced that [Miss Garland]182-miss garland 's heart was constructed after the most perfect feminine model . That [she]193-mary garland was [a very different woman from [Christina Light]192-christina]2638-a very different woman from christina light did not at all prove that [she]193-mary garland was [less a woman]2639-less a woman , and if [the Princess Casamassima]281-rowland had gone up into a high place to publish [her]281-rowland disrelish of [a man who lacked the virile will]2640-a man who lacked the virile will , it was very certain that [Mary Garland]193-mary garland was not [a person to put up , at any point , with what might be called the princess]2641-a person to put up , at any point , with what might be called the princess 's leavings . It was [Christina]192-christina 's constant practice to remind [you]2642-you of the complexity of [her]192-christina character , of the subtlety of [her]192-christina mind , of [her]192-christina troublous faculty of seeing everything in a dozen different lights . [Mary Garland]193-mary garland had never pretended not to be simple ; but [Rowland]281-rowland had a theory that [she]193-mary garland had really a more multitudinous sense of human things , a more delicate imagination , and a finer instinct of character . [She]193-mary garland did [you]2642-you the honors of [her]193-mary garland mind with a grace far less regal , but was not that faculty of quite as remarkable an adjustment ? If in poor [Christina]192-christina 's strangely commingled nature there was circle within circle , and depth beneath depth , it was to be believed that [Mary Garland]193-mary garland , though [she]193-mary garland did not amuse [herself]193-mary garland with dropping stones into [her]193-mary garland soul , and waiting to hear them fall , laid quite as many sources of spiritual life under contribution . [She]193-mary garland had believed [Roderick]325-roderick was [a fine fellow]4513-a fine fellow when [she]193-mary garland bade [him]4513-a fine fellow farewell beneath the Northampton elms , and this belief , to [her]193-mary garland young , strenuous , concentrated imagination , had meant many things . If it was to grow cold , it would be because disenchantment had become total and won the battle at each successive point .

[Miss Garland]182-miss garland had even in [her]193-mary garland face and carriage something of the preoccupied and wearied look of [a person who is watching at a sick - bed]2644-a person who is watching at a sick - bed ; [Roderick]325-roderick 's broken fortunes , [his]4513-a fine fellow dead ambitions , were a cruel burden to the heart of [a girl who had believed that [he]4513-a fine fellow possessed " genius]5203-a girl who had believed that he possessed " genius , "[182-miss garland] and supposed that genius was to one 's spiritual economy what full pockets were to one 's domestic . And yet , with [her]182-miss garland , [Rowland]281-rowland never felt , as with [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick , that undercurrent of reproach and bitterness toward [himself]281-rowland , that impertinent implication that [he]4513-a fine fellow had defrauded [her]182-miss garland of happiness . Was this justice , in [Miss Garland]182-miss garland , or was it mercy ? The answer would have been difficult , for [she]182-miss garland had almost let [Rowland]281-rowland feel before leaving [Rome]4-rome that [she]182-miss garland liked [him]4513-a fine fellow well enough to forgive [him]4513-a fine fellow an injury . It was partly , [Rowland]281-rowland fancied , that there were occasional lapses , deep and sweet , in [her]182-miss garland sense of injury . When , on arriving at [Florence]46-florence , [she]182-miss garland saw [the place [Rowland]281-rowland had brought [them]2646-them to in [their]2646-them trouble]2645-the place rowland had brought them to in their trouble , [she]182-miss garland had given [him]4513-a fine fellow a look and said a few words to [him]4513-a fine fellow that had seemed not only a remission of guilt but a positive reward . This happened in [the court of [the villa]841-the villa]2647-the court of the villa - [the large gray quadrangle]2649-the large gray quadrangle , overstretched , from edge to edge of the red - tiled roof , by the soft Italian sky . [Mary]193-mary garland had felt on the spot the sovereign charm of [the place]3197-the place ; it was reflected in [her]193-mary garland deeply intelligent glance , and [Rowland]281-rowland immediately accused [himself]281-rowland of not having done [the villa]841-the villa justice . [Miss Garland]182-miss garland took a mighty fancy to [Florence]46-florence , and used to look down wistfully at [the towered city]2652-the towered city from the windows and [garden]2653-garden . [Roderick]325-roderick having now no pretext for not being [[her]182-miss garland cicerone]2654-her cicerone , [Rowland]281-rowland was no longer at liberty , as [he]4513-a fine fellow had been in [Rome]4-rome , to propose frequent excursions to [her]182-miss garland . [Roderick]325-roderick 's own invitations , however , were not frequent , and [Rowland]281-rowland more than once ventured to introduce [her]182-miss garland to [a gallery]2655-a gallery or [a church]1033-a church . These expeditions were not so blissful , to [his]4513-a fine fellow sense , as the rambles [they]2657-they had taken together in [Rome]4-rome , for [[his]4513-a fine fellow companion]555-his companion only half surrendered [herself]555-his companion to [her]555-his companion enjoyment , and seemed to have but a divided attention at [her]555-his companion command . Often , when [she]555-his companion had begun with looking intently at a picture , [her]555-his companion silence , after an interval , made [him]4513-a fine fellow turn and glance at [her]555-his companion . [He]4513-a fine fellow usually found that if [she]555-his companion was looking at the picture still , [she]555-his companion was not seeing it . [Her]555-his companion eyes were fixed , but [her]555-his companion thoughts were wandering , and an image more vivid than any that [Raphael]301-raphael or [Titian]205-titian had drawn had superposed itself upon the canvas . [She]555-his companion asked fewer questions than before , and seemed to have lost heart for consulting guide - books and encyclopaedias . From time to time , however , [she]555-his companion uttered a deep , full murmur of gratification . [Florence]46-florence in midsummer was perfectly void of [travelers]2659-travelers , and [the dense little city]2660-the dense little city gave forth [its]2660-the dense little city aesthetic aroma with a larger frankness , as [the nightingale]2661-the nightingale sings when [the listeners]2662-the listeners have departed . [The churches]2603-the churches were deliciously cool , but [the gray streets]2664-the gray streets were stifling , and the great , dove - tailed polygons of pavement as hot to the tread as molten lava . [Rowland]281-rowland , who suffered from intense heat , would have found all this uncomfortable in solitude ; but [Florence]46-florence had never charmed [him]4513-a fine fellow so completely as during these midsummer strolls with [[his]4513-a fine fellow preoccupied companion]2665-his preoccupied companion . One evening [they]2666-they had arranged to go on the morrow to [the Academy]2667-the academy . [Miss Garland]182-miss garland kept [her]182-miss garland appointment , but as soon as [she]182-miss garland appeared , [Rowland]281-rowland saw that something painful had befallen [her]182-miss garland . [She]182-miss garland was doing [her]182-miss garland best to look at [her]182-miss garland ease , but [her]182-miss garland face bore the marks of tears . [Rowland]281-rowland told [her]182-miss garland that [he]4513-a fine fellow was afraid [she]182-miss garland was ill , and that if [she]182-miss garland preferred to give up the visit to [Florence]46-florence [he]4513-a fine fellow would submit with what grace [he]4513-a fine fellow might . [She]182-miss garland hesitated a moment , and then said [she]182-miss garland preferred to adhere to [their]2668-their plan . " [I]182-miss garland am not well , "[182-miss garland] [she]182-miss garland presently added , " but it 's a moral malady , and in such cases [I]182-miss garland consider [your]281-rowland company beneficial . "[182-miss garland]

" But if [I]281-rowland am to be [[your]182-miss garland doctor]5204-your doctor , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland , " [you]182-miss garland must tell [me]182-miss garland how [your]182-miss garland illness began . "[182-miss garland]

" [I]0-i can tell [you]182-miss garland very little . It began with [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick being unjust to [me]0-i , for the first time in [her]325-roderick life . And now [I]0-i am already better ! "[0-i]

[I]0-i mention this incident because it confirmed an impression of [Rowland]281-rowland 's from which [he]2669-he had derived a certain consolation . [He]2669-he knew that [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick considered [[her]325-roderick son]459-her son 's ill - regulated passion for [Christina Light]192-christina a very regrettable affair , but [he]2669-he suspected that [her]325-roderick manifest compassion had been all for [Roderick]325-roderick , and not in the least for [Mary Garland]193-mary garland . [She]325-roderick was fond of [the young girl]659-the young girl , but [she]325-roderick had valued [her]659-the young girl primarily , during the last two years , as [a kind of assistant priestess at [[Roderick]325-roderick 's shrine]2673-roderick 's shrine]2672-a kind of assistant priestess at roderick 's shrine . [Roderick]325-roderick had honored [her]193-mary garland by asking [her]193-mary garland to become [[his]2669-he wife]3167-his wife , but that poor [Mary]193-mary garland had any rights in consequence [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick was quite incapable of perceiving . [Her]325-roderick sentiment on the subject was of course not very vigorously formulated , but [she]325-roderick was unprepared to admit that [Miss Garland]182-miss garland had any ground for complaint . [Roderick]325-roderick was very unhappy ; that was enough , and [Mary]193-mary garland 's duty was to join [her]193-mary garland patience and [her]193-mary garland prayers to those of [[his]2669-he doting mother]2675-his doting mother . [Roderick]325-roderick might fall in love with whom [he]2669-he pleased ; no doubt that [women trained in the mysterious Roman arts]2676-women trained in the mysterious roman arts were only too proud and too happy to make it easy for [him]2669-he ; and it was very presuming in poor , plain [Mary]193-mary garland to feel any personal resentment . [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick 's philosophy was of too narrow a scope to suggest that [a mother]4100-a mother may forgive where [a mistress]2678-a mistress can not , and [she]325-roderick thought [herself]325-roderick greatly aggrieved that [Miss Garland]182-miss garland was not so disinterested as [herself]182-miss garland . [She]182-miss garland was ready to drop dead in [Roderick]325-roderick 's service , and [she]182-miss garland was quite capable of seeing [[her]182-miss garland companion]1131-her companion falter and grow faint , without a tremor of compassion . [Mary]193-mary garland , apparently , had given some intimation of [her]193-mary garland belief that if constancy is the flower of devotion , reciprocity is the guarantee of constancy , and [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick had rebuked [her]193-mary garland failing faith and called it cruelty . That [Miss Garland]182-miss garland had found it hard to reason with [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick , that [she]182-miss garland suffered deeply from [the elder lady]632-the elder lady 's softly bitter imputations , and that , in short , [he]632-the elder lady had companionship in misfortune - all this made [Rowland]281-rowland find a certain luxury in [his]632-the elder lady discomfort .

The party at [Villa Pandolfini]145-the villa pandolfini used to sit in [the garden]3242-the garden in the evenings , which [Rowland]281-rowland almost always spent with [them]2682-them . [Their]2682-them entertainment was in the heavily perfumed air , in the dim , far starlight , in the crenelated tower of [a neighboring villa]2683-a neighboring villa , which loomed vaguely above [them]2682-them in the warm darkness , and in such conversation as depressing reflections allowed . [Roderick]325-roderick , clad always in white , roamed about like [a restless ghost]2684-a restless ghost , silent for the most part , but making from time to time a brief observation , characterized by the most fantastic cynicism . [Roderick]325-roderick 's contributions to the conversation were indeed always so fantastic that , though half the time [they]2682-them wearied [him]632-the elder lady unspeakably , [Rowland]281-rowland made an effort to treat [them]2682-them humorously . With [Rowland]281-rowland alone [Roderick]325-roderick talked a great deal more ; often about things related to [his]632-the elder lady own work , or about artistic and aesthetic matters in general . [He]632-the elder lady talked as well as ever , or even better ; but [his]632-the elder lady talk always ended in a torrent of groans and curses . When this current set in , [Rowland]281-rowland straightway turned [his]632-the elder lady back or stopped [his]632-the elder lady ears , and [Roderick]325-roderick now witnessed these movements with perfect indifference . When [the latter]652-the latter was absent from the star - lit circle in [the garden]3242-the garden , as often happened , [Rowland]281-rowland knew nothing of [his]632-the elder lady whereabouts ; [he]632-the elder lady supposed [him]632-the elder lady to be in [Florence]46-florence , but [he]632-the elder lady never learned what [he]632-the elder lady did [there]3420-there . All this was not enlivening , but with an even , muffled tread the days followed each other , and brought the month of August to a close . One particular evening at this time was most enchanting ; there was a perfect moon , looking so extraordinarily large that it made everything its light fell upon seem small ; the heat was tempered by a soft west wind , and the wind was laden with the odors of the early harvest . [The hills]1573-the hills , [the vale of [the Arno]126-the arno]1974-the vale of the arno , [the shrunken river]2690-the shrunken river , [the domes of [Florence]46-florence]2691-the domes of florence , were vaguely effaced by the dense moonshine ; they looked as if they were melting out of sight like an exorcised vision . [Rowland]281-rowland had found [the two ladies]656-the two ladies alone at [the villa]841-the villa , and [he]632-the elder lady had sat with [them]656-the two ladies for an hour . [He]632-the elder lady felt absolutely hushed by the solemn splendor of the scene , but [he]632-the elder lady had risked the remark that , whatever life might yet have in store for either of [them]656-the two ladies , this was a night that [they]656-the two ladies would never forget .

" It 's a night to remember on one 's death - bed ! "[182-miss garland] [Miss Garland]182-miss garland exclaimed .

" Oh , [Mary]193-mary garland , how can [you]193-mary garland ! "[325-roderick] murmured [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick , to whom [this savored of profanity , and to whose shrinking sense , indeed , the accumulated loveliness of the night]2694-this savored of profanity , and to whose shrinking sense , indeed , the accumulated loveliness of the night seemed to have something shameless and defiant .

[They]656-the two ladies were silent after this , for some time , but at last [Rowland]281-rowland addressed certain idle words to [Miss Garland]182-miss garland . [She]182-miss garland made no reply , and [he]632-the elder lady turned to look at [her]182-miss garland . [She]182-miss garland was sitting motionless , with [her]182-miss garland head pressed to [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick 's shoulder , and [the latter lady]2695-the latter lady was gazing at [him]632-the elder lady through the silvered dusk with a look which gave a sort of spectral solemnity to the sad , weak meaning of [her]182-miss garland eyes . [She]182-miss garland had the air , for the moment , of [a little old malevolent fairy]2696-a little old malevolent fairy . [Miss Garland]182-miss garland , [Rowland]281-rowland perceived in an instant , was not absolutely motionless ; a tremor passed through [her]182-miss garland figure . [She]182-miss garland was weeping , or on the point of weeping , and [she]182-miss garland could not trust [herself]182-miss garland to speak . [Rowland]281-rowland left [his]632-the elder lady place and wandered to another part of [the garden]3242-the garden , wondering at the motive of [her]182-miss garland sudden tears . Of [women]3288-women 's sobs in general [he]632-the elder lady had a sovereign dread , but these , somehow , gave [him]632-the elder lady a certain pleasure . When [he]632-the elder lady returned to [[his]632-the elder lady place]1668-his place [Miss Garland]182-miss garland had raised [her]182-miss garland head and banished [her]182-miss garland tears . [She]182-miss garland came away from [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick , and [they]2700-they stood for a short time leaning against the parapet .

" It seems to [you]182-miss garland very strange , [I]281-rowland suppose , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland , " that there should be any trouble in such a world as this . "[281-rowland]

" [I]182-miss garland used to think , "[182-miss garland] [she]182-miss garland answered , " that if any trouble came to [me]182-miss garland [I]182-miss garland would bear it like a stoic . But that was at [home]349-home , where things do n't speak to [us]5206-us of enjoyment as [they]5207-they do here . Here it is such a mixture ; [one]3107-one does n't know what to choose , what to believe . Beauty stands there - beauty such as this night and [this place]3129-this place , and all this sad , strange summer , have been so full of - and it penetrates to [one]3107-one 's soul and lodges there , and keeps saying that [man]3648-man was not made to suffer , but to enjoy . [This place]3129-this place has undermined [my]182-miss garland stoicism , but - shall [I]182-miss garland tell [you]182-miss garland ? [I]182-miss garland feel as if [I]182-miss garland were saying something sinful - [I]182-miss garland love it ! "[182-miss garland]

" If it is sinful , [I]281-rowland absolve [you]182-miss garland , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland , " in so far as [I]281-rowland have power . [We]5213-we are made , [I]281-rowland suppose , both to suffer and to enjoy . As [you]182-miss garland say , it 's a mixture . Just now and here , it seems a peculiarly strange one . But [we]5213-we must take things in turn . "[281-rowland]

[His]2701-i words had a singular aptness , for [he]2701-i had hardly uttered them when [Roderick]325-roderick came out from [the house]3246-the house , evidently in [his]2701-i darkest mood . [He]2701-i stood for a moment gazing hard at the view .

" It 's a very beautiful night , [[my]448-his mother son]3311-my son , "[448-his mother] said [[his]2701-i mother]448-his mother , going to [him]2701-i timidly , and touching [his]2701-i arm .

[He]2701-i passed [his]2701-i hand through [his]2701-i hair and let it stay there , clasping [his]2701-i thick locks . " Beautiful ? "[2701-i] [he]2701-i cried ; " of course it 's beautiful ! Everything is beautiful ; everything is insolent , defiant , atrocious with beauty . Nothing is ugly but [me]2701-i - [me]2701-i and [my]2701-i poor dead brain ! "[2701-i]

" Oh , [[my]325-roderick dearest son]5215-my dearest son , "[325-roderick] pleaded [poor Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick , " do n't [you]2701-i feel any better ? "[325-roderick]

[Roderick]325-roderick made no immediate answer ; but at last [he]2701-i spoke in a different voice . " [I]2701-i came expressly to tell [you]5215-my dearest son that [you]5215-my dearest son need n't trouble [yourselves]5215-my dearest son any longer to wait for something to turn up . Nothing will turn up ! It 's all over ! [I]2701-i said when [I]2701-i came [here]3130-here [I]2701-i would give it a chance . [I]2701-i have given it a chance . Have n't [I]2701-i , eh ? Have n't [I]2701-i , [Rowland]281-rowland ? It 's no use ; the thing 's a failure ! Do with [me]2701-i now what [you]281-rowland please . [I]2701-i recommend [you]281-rowland to set [me]2701-i up there at the end of [the garden]3242-the garden and shoot [me]2701-i . "[2701-i]

" [I]281-rowland feel strongly inclined , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland gravely , " to go and get [my]281-rowland revolver . "[281-rowland]

" Oh , mercy on [us]5218-us , what language ! "[325-roderick] cried [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick .

" Why not ? "[325-roderick] [Roderick]325-roderick went on . " This would be a lovely night for it , and [I]325-roderick should be [a lucky fellow]5219-a lucky fellow to be buried in [this garden]2572-this garden . But bury [me]325-roderick alive , if [you]281-rowland prefer . Take [me]325-roderick back to [Northampton]2-northampton . "[325-roderick]

" [Roderick]325-roderick , will [you]325-roderick really come ? "[448-his mother] cried [[his]2704-his mother]448-his mother .

" Oh yes , [I]325-roderick 'll go ! [I]325-roderick might as well be there as anywhere - reverting to idiocy and living upon alms . [I]325-roderick can do nothing with all this ; perhaps [I]325-roderick should really like [Northampton]2-northampton . If [I]325-roderick ' m to vegetate for the rest of [my]325-roderick days , [I]325-roderick can do it there better than here . "[325-roderick]

" Oh , come [home]349-home , come [home]349-home , "[325-roderick] [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick said , " and [we]5223-we shall all be safe and quiet and happy . [[My]325-roderick dearest son]5215-my dearest son , come [home]349-home with [[your]2706-his poor mother]5226-your poor mother ! "[325-roderick]

" Let [us]5223-we go , then , and go quickly ! "[325-roderick]

[Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick flung [herself]325-roderick upon [his]2706-his neck for gratitude . " [We]5223-we 'll go to - morrow ! "[325-roderick] [she]325-roderick cried . " [The Lord]5227-the lord is very good to [me]325-roderick ! "[325-roderick]

[Mary Garland]193-mary garland said nothing to this ; but [she]193-mary garland looked at [Rowland]281-rowland , and [her]193-mary garland eyes seemed to contain a kind of alarmed appeal . [Rowland]281-rowland noted it with exultation , but even without it [he]2706-his would have broken into an eager protest .

" Are [you]281-rowland serious , [Roderick]325-roderick ? "[2706-his] [he]2706-his demanded .

" Serious ? of course not ! How can [a man with a crack in [his]5228-a man with a crack in his brain brain]5228-a man with a crack in his brain be serious ? how can a muddlehead reason ? But [I]193-mary garland ' m not jesting , either ; [I]193-mary garland can no more make jokes than utter oracles ! "[193-mary garland]

" Are [you]281-rowland willing to go [home]349-home ? "[325-roderick]

" Willing ? God forbid ! [I]193-mary garland am simply amenable to force ; if [[my]193-mary garland mother]3224-my mother chooses to take [me]193-mary garland , [I]193-mary garland wo n't resist . [I]193-mary garland ca n't ! [I]193-mary garland have come to that ! "[193-mary garland]

" Let [me]281-rowland resist , then , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland . " Go [home]349-home as [you]281-rowland are now ? [I]281-rowland ca n't stand by and see it . "[281-rowland]

It may have been true that [Roderick]325-roderick had lost [his]2706-his sense of humor , but [he]2706-his scratched [his]2706-his head with a gesture that was almost comical in its effect . " [You]281-rowland are [a queer fellow]5232-a queer fellow ! [I]2706-his should think [I]2706-his would disgust [you]281-rowland horribly . "[2706-his]

" Stay another year , "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland simply said .

" Doing nothing ? "[281-rowland]

" [You]281-rowland shall do something . [I]2706-his am responsible for [your]281-rowland doing something . "[2706-his]

" To whom are [you]281-rowland responsible ? "[281-rowland]

[Rowland]281-rowland , before replying , glanced at [Miss Garland]182-miss garland , and [his]2706-his glance made [her]281-rowland speak quickly . " Not to [me]281-rowland ! "[281-rowland]

" [I]281-rowland ' m responsible to [myself]281-rowland , "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland declared .

" [[My]325-roderick poor , [dear fellow]5234-dear fellow]5233-my poor , dear fellow ! "[325-roderick] said [Roderick]325-roderick .

" Oh , [Mr. Mallet]170-mr. mallet , are n't [you]170-mr. mallet satisfied ? "[325-roderick] cried [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick , in the tone in which [Niobe]332-niobe may have addressed [the avenging archers]2707-the avenging archers , after [she]332-niobe had seen [her]332-niobe eldest - born fall . " It 's out of all nature keeping [him]5233-my poor , dear fellow here . When [we]5235-us 're in a poor way , surely [[our]5235-us own dear [native land]5237-native land]5236-our own dear native land is [the place for [us]5235-us]5238-the place for us . Do leave [us]5235-us to [ourselves]5235-us , [sir]3318-sir ! "[332-niobe]

This just failed of being a dismissal in form , and [Rowland]281-rowland bowed [his]2708-you head to it . [Roderick]325-roderick was silent for some moments ; then , suddenly , [he]2709-me covered [his]2709-me face with [his]2709-me two hands . " Take [me]2709-me at least out of [this terrible Italy]5240-this terrible italy , "[2709-me] [he]2709-me cried , " where everything mocks and reproaches and torments and eludes [me]2709-me ! Take [me]2709-me out of [this land of impossible beauty]5241-this land of impossible beauty and put [me]2709-me in the midst of ugliness . Set [me]2709-me down where nature is coarse and flat , and [men]3287-men and manners are vulgar . There must be something awfully ugly in [Germany]75-germany . Pack [me]2709-me off there ! "[2709-me]

[Rowland]281-rowland answered that if [he]2708-you wished to leave [Italy]24-italy the thing might be arranged ; [he]2708-you would think it over and submit a proposal on the morrow . [He]2708-you suggested to [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick , in consequence , that [she]325-roderick should spend the autumn in [Switzerland]74-switzerland , where [she]325-roderick would find a fine tonic climate , plenty of fresh milk , and several pensions at three francs and a half a day . [Switzerland]74-switzerland , of course , was not ugly , but [one]3107-one could not have everything .

[Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick neither thanked [him]2708-you nor assented ; but [she]325-roderick wept and packed [her]325-roderick trunks . [Rowland]281-rowland had a theory , after the scene which led to these preparations , that [Mary Garland]193-mary garland was weary of waiting for [Roderick]325-roderick to come to [his]2708-you senses , that the faith which had bravely borne [his]2708-you manhood company hitherto , on the tortuous march [he]2708-you was leading it , had begun to believe it had gone far enough . This theory was not vitiated by something [she]281-rowland said to [him]2708-you on the day before that on which [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick had arranged to leave [Florence]46-florence .

" [Cousin Sarah]333-cousin sarah , the other evening , "[281-rowland] [she]281-rowland said , " asked [you]2708-you to please leave [us]5243-us . [I]281-rowland think [she]281-rowland hardly knew what [she]281-rowland was saying , and [I]281-rowland hope [you]2708-you have not taken offense . "[281-rowland]

" By no means ; but [I]281-rowland honestly believe that [my]281-rowland leaving [you]2708-you would contribute greatly to [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick 's comfort . [I]281-rowland can be [your]2708-you hidden providence , [you]2708-you know ; [I]281-rowland can watch [you]2708-you at a distance , and come upon the scene at critical moments . "[281-rowland]

[Miss Garland]182-miss garland looked for a moment at the ground ; and then , with sudden earnestness , " [I]182-miss garland beg [you]281-rowland to come with [us]2711-us ! "[182-miss garland] [she]182-miss garland said .

It need hardly be added that after this [Rowland]281-rowland went with [them]2711-us .

CHAPTER XII . [The Princess Casamassima

Rowland]281-rowland had a very friendly memory of [a little mountain inn , accessible with moderate trouble from [Lucerne]147-lucerne , where [he]2713-he had once spent a blissful ten days]2712-a little mountain inn , accessible with moderate trouble from lucerne , where he had once spent a blissful ten days . [He]2713-he had at that time been trudging , knapsack on back , over half [Switzerland]74-switzerland , and not being , on [his]2713-he legs , a particularly light weight , it was no shame to [him]2713-he to confess that [he]2713-he was mortally tired . [The inn of which [I]0-i speak]2714-the inn of which i speak presented striking analogies with a cow - stable ; but in spite of this circumstance , [it]2714-the inn of which i speak was crowded with [hungry tourists]2715-hungry tourists . [It]2714-the inn of which i speak stood in [a high , shallow valley]2716-a high , shallow valley , with flower - strewn Alpine meadows sloping down to [it]2714-the inn of which i speak from [the base of certain rugged rocks whose outlines were grotesque against the evening sky]2717-the base of certain rugged rocks whose outlines were grotesque against the evening sky . [Rowland]281-rowland had seen [grander places in [Switzerland]74-switzerland]2718-grander places in switzerland that pleased [him]2713-he less , and whenever afterwards [he]2713-he wished to think of Alpine opportunities at their best , [he]2713-he recalled [this grassy concave among the mountain - tops]2719-this grassy concave among the mountain - tops , and the August days [he]2713-he spent [there]3420-there , resting deliciously , at [his]2713-he length , in the lee of a sun - warmed boulder , with the light cool air stirring about [his]2713-he temples , the wafted odors of the pines in [his]2713-he nostrils , the tinkle of the cattle - bells in [his]2713-he ears , the vast progression of the mountain shadows before [his]2713-he eyes , and a volume of Wordsworth in [his]2713-he pocket . [His]2713-he face , on [the Swiss hill]2721-the swiss hill - sides , had been scorched to within a shade of the color nowadays called magenta , and [his]2713-he bed was a pallet in [a loft]2722-a loft , which [he]2713-he shared with [a German botanist of colossal stature]2723-a german botanist of colossal stature - every inch of [him]2713-he quaking at an open window . These had been drawbacks to felicity , but [Rowland]281-rowland hardly cared where or how [he]2713-he was lodged , for [he]2713-he spent the livelong day under the sky , on the crest of [a slope that looked at [the Jungfrau]148-the jungfrau]2724-a slope that looked at the jungfrau . [He]2713-he remembered all this on leaving [Florence]46-florence with [[his]2713-he friends]714-his friends , and [he]2713-he reflected that , as the midseason was over , [accommodations]2726-accommodations would be more ample , and charges more modest . [He]2713-he communicated with [[his]2713-he old friend]669-his old friend [the landlord]2728-the landlord , and , while [September]334-september was yet young , [[his]2713-he companions]654-his companions established [themselves]654-his companions under [his]2713-he guidance in [the grassy valley]2730-the grassy valley .

[He]2713-he had crossed [the Saint Gothard Pass]149-the saint gothard pass with [them]654-his companions , in [the same carriage]2731-the same carriage . During the journey from [Florence]46-florence , and especially during this portion of it , the cloud that hung over [the little party]2732-the little party had been almost dissipated , and [they]654-his companions had looked at [each other]645-each other , in the close contiguity of [the train]2734-the train and [the posting - carriage]2735-the posting - carriage , without either accusing or consoling glances . It was impossible not to enjoy the magnificent scenery of [the Apennines]87-the apennines and [the Italian Alps]150-the italian alps , and there was a tacit agreement among [the travelers]2736-the travelers to abstain from sombre allusions . The effect of this delicate compact seemed excellent ; it ensured [them]2736-the travelers a week 's intellectual sunshine . [Roderick]325-roderick sat and gazed out of the window with a fascinated stare , and with a perfect docility of attitude . [He]2713-he concerned [himself]2713-he not a particle about the itinerary , or about any of the wayside arrangements ; [he]2713-he took no trouble , and [he]2713-he gave none . [He]2713-he assented to everything that was proposed , talked very little , and led for a week a perfectly contemplative life . [[His]2713-he mother]448-his mother rarely removed [her]448-his mother eyes from [him]2713-he ; and if , a while before , this would have extremely irritated [him]2713-he , [he]2713-he now seemed perfectly unconscious of [her]448-his mother observation and profoundly indifferent to anything that might befall [him]2713-he . [They]2738-they spent a couple of days on [the Lake of [Como]151-como]2739-the lake of como , at [a hotel with white porticoes smothered in oleander and myrtle , and the terrace - steps leading down to [little boats]2741-little boats with striped awnings]2740-a hotel with white porticoes smothered in oleander and myrtle , and the terrace - steps leading down to little boats with striped awnings . [They]2738-they agreed it was [the earthly paradise]2742-the earthly paradise , and [they]2738-they passed the mornings strolling through [the perfumed alleys of classic villas]2743-the perfumed alleys of classic villas , and the evenings floating in the moonlight in [a circle of outlined mountains]2744-a circle of outlined mountains , to the music of silver - trickling oars . One day , in the afternoon , [the two young men]608-the two young men took a long stroll together . [They]2738-they followed the winding footway that led toward [Como]151-como , close to [the lake - side]2746-the lake - side , past the gates of [villas]2747-villas and the walls of [vineyards]2748-vineyards , through [little hamlets propped on a dozen arches]2749-little hamlets propped on a dozen arches , and bathing [their]2738-they feet and [their]2738-they pendant tatters in the gray - green ripple ; past frescoed walls and crumbling campaniles and [grassy village piazzas]2750-grassy village piazzas , and the mouth of soft ravines that wound upward , through belts of swinging vine and vaporous olive and splendid chestnut , to high ledges where [white chapels gleamed amid the paler boskage]2751-white chapels gleamed amid the paler boskage , and bare cliff - surfaces , with [their]2738-they sun - cracked lips , drank in the azure light . It all was confoundingly picturesque ; it was [the Italy]24-italy that [we]2752-we know from the steel engravings in old keepsakes and annuals , from the vignettes on music - sheets and the drop - curtains at [theatres]2753-theatres ; [an [Italy]24-italy that [we]2752-we can never confess to [ourselves]2752-we - in spite of [our]2752-we own changes and of [Italy]24-italy 's]2754-an italy that we can never confess to ourselves - in spite of our own changes and of italy 's - that [we]2752-we have ceased to believe in . [Rowland]281-rowland and [Roderick]325-roderick turned aside from the little paved footway that clambered and dipped and wound and doubled beside [the lake]725-the lake , and stretched themselves idly beneath a fig - tree , on a grassy promontory . [Rowland]281-rowland had never known anything so divinely soothing as the dreamy softness of that early autumn afternoon . [The iridescent mountains]2756-the iridescent mountains shut [him]2757-his in ; the little waves , beneath [him]2757-his , fretted the white pebbles at the laziest intervals ; the festooned vines above [him]2757-his swayed just visibly in the all but motionless air .

[Roderick]325-roderick lay observing it all with [his]2757-his arms thrown back and [his]2757-his hands under [his]2757-his head . " This suits [me]2757-his , "[2757-his] [he]2757-his said ; " [I]2757-his could be happy here and forget everything . Why not stay here forever ? "[2757-his] [He]2757-his kept [his]2757-his position for a long time and seemed lost in [his]2757-his thoughts . [Rowland]281-rowland spoke to [him]2757-his , but [he]2757-his made vague answers ; at last [he]2757-his closed [his]2757-his eyes . It seemed to [Rowland]281-rowland , also , [a place to stay in forever]2758-a place to stay in forever ; a place for perfect oblivion of the disagreeable . Suddenly [Roderick]325-roderick turned over on [his]2757-his face , and buried it in [his]2757-his arms . There had been something passionate in [his]2757-his movement ; but [Rowland]281-rowland was nevertheless surprised , when [he]2757-his at last jerked [himself]2757-his back into a sitting posture , to perceive the trace of tears in [his]2757-his eyes . [Roderick]325-roderick turned to [[his]2757-his friend]606-his friend , stretching [his]2757-his two hands out toward [the lake]725-the lake and [mountains]2761-mountains , and shaking them with an eloquent gesture , as if [his]2757-his heart was too full for utterance .

" Pity [me]2757-his , [sir]3318-sir ; pity [me]2757-his ! "[2757-his] [he]2757-his presently cried . " Look at [this lovely world]5245-this lovely world , and think what it must be to be dead to it ! "[2757-his]

" Dead ? "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland .

" Dead , dead ; dead and buried ! Buried in an open grave , where [you]3318-sir lie staring up at the sailing clouds , smelling the waving flowers , and hearing all nature live and grow above [you]3318-sir ! That 's the way [I]2757-his feel ! "[2757-his]

" [I]281-rowland am glad to hear it , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland . " Death of that sort is very near to resurrection . "[281-rowland]

" It 's too horrible , "[325-roderick] [Roderick]325-roderick went on ; " it has all come over [me]325-roderick here tremendously ! If [I]325-roderick were not ashamed , [I]325-roderick could shed a bushel of tears . For one hour of what [I]325-roderick have been , [I]325-roderick would give up anything [I]325-roderick may be ! "[325-roderick]

" Never mind what [you]325-roderick have been ; be something better ! "[325-roderick]

" [I]325-roderick shall never be anything again : it 's no use talking ! But [I]325-roderick do n't know what secret spring has been touched since [I]325-roderick have lain [here]3130-here . Something in [my]325-roderick heart seemed suddenly to open and let in a flood of beauty and desire . [I]325-roderick know what [I]325-roderick have lost , and [I]325-roderick think it horrible ! Mind [you]3318-sir , [I]325-roderick know it , [I]325-roderick feel it ! Remember that hereafter . Do n't say that [he]5247-he was stupefied and senseless ; that [his]5247-he perception was dulled and [his]5247-he aspiration dead . Say that [he]5247-he trembled in every nerve with a sense of the beauty and sweetness of life ; that [he]5247-he rebelled and protested and shrieked ; that [he]5247-he was buried alive , with [his]5247-he eyes open , and [his]5247-he heart beating to madness ; that [he]5247-he clung to every blade of grass and every way - side thorn as [he]5247-he passed ; that it was the most horrible spectacle [you]3318-sir ever witnessed ; that it was an outrage , a murder , a massacre ! "[325-roderick]

" Good heavens , [man]3648-man , are [you]3648-man insane ? "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland cried .

" [I]325-roderick never have been saner . [I]325-roderick do n't want to be bad company , and in [this beautiful spot]5249-this beautiful spot , at this delightful hour , it seems an outrage to break the charm . But [I]325-roderick am bidding farewell to [Italy]24-italy , to beauty , to honor , to life ! [I]325-roderick only want to assure [you]3318-sir that [I]325-roderick know what [I]325-roderick lose . [I]325-roderick know it in every pulse of [my]325-roderick heart ! Here , where these things are all loveliest , [I]325-roderick take leave of [them]2762-them . Farewell , farewell ! "[325-roderick]

During [their]2762-them passage of [the Saint Gothard]153-the saint gothard , [Roderick]325-roderick absented [himself]325-roderick much of the time from [the carriage]3735-the carriage , and rambled far in advance , along the huge zigzags of [the road]541-the road . [He]2765-he displayed an extraordinary activity ; [his]2765-he light weight and slender figure made [him]2765-he [an excellent pedestrian]2766-an excellent pedestrian , and [[his]2765-he friends]714-his friends frequently saw [him]2765-he skirting the edge of [plunging chasms]2768-plunging chasms , loosening the stones on [long , steep slopes]2769-long , steep slopes , or lifting [himself]2765-he against the sky , from the top of rocky pinnacles . [Mary Garland]193-mary garland walked a great deal , but [she]193-mary garland remained near [the carriage]3735-the carriage to be with [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick . [Rowland]281-rowland remained near [it]3735-the carriage to be with [Miss Garland]182-miss garland . [He]2765-he trudged by [her]182-miss garland side up that magnificent ascent from [Italy]24-italy , and found [himself]2765-he regretting that [the Alps]3614-the alps were so low , and that [their]2772-their trudging was not to last a week . [She]182-miss garland was exhilarated ; [she]182-miss garland liked to walk ; in the way of mountains , until within the last few weeks , [she]182-miss garland had seen nothing greater than [Mount Holyoke]23-mount holyoke , and [she]182-miss garland found that [the Alps]3614-the alps amply justified [their]2772-their reputation . [Rowland]281-rowland knew that [she]182-miss garland loved nature , but [he]2765-he was struck afresh with the vivacity of [her]182-miss garland observation of it , and with [her]182-miss garland knowledge of plants and stones . At that season the wild flowers had mostly departed , but a few of them lingered , and [Miss Garland]182-miss garland never failed to espy them in [their outlying corners]2774-their outlying corners . [They]2775-they interested [her]182-miss garland greatly ; [she]182-miss garland was charmed when [they]2775-they were [old friends]549-old friends , and charmed even more when [they]2775-they were new . [She]182-miss garland displayed a very light foot in going in quest of [them]2775-they , and had soon covered the front seat of [the carriage]3735-the carriage with a tangle of strange vegetation . [Rowland]281-rowland of course was alert in [her]182-miss garland service , and [he]2765-he gathered for [her]182-miss garland several botanical specimens which at first seemed inaccessible . One of these , indeed , had at first appeared easier of capture than [his]2765-he attempt attested , and [he]2765-he had paused a moment at the base of [the little peak on which it grew]2778-the little peak on which it grew , measuring the risk of farther pursuit . Suddenly , as [he]2765-he stood there , [he]2765-he remembered [Roderick]325-roderick 's defiance of danger and of [Miss Light]254-miss light , at [the Coliseum]1719-the coliseum , and [he]2765-he was seized with a strong desire to test the courage of [[his]2765-he companion]555-his companion . [She]182-miss garland had just scrambled up [a grassy slope near [him]2765-he]2781-a grassy slope near him , and had seen that the flower was out of reach . As [he]2765-he prepared to approach it , [she]182-miss garland called to [him]2765-he eagerly to stop ; the thing was impossible ! [Poor Rowland]281-rowland , whose passion had been terribly starved , enjoyed immensely the thought of having [her]182-miss garland care , for three minutes , what became of [him]2765-he . [He]2765-he was [the least brutal of [men]3287-men]2782-the least brutal of men , but for a moment [he]2765-he was perfectly indifferent to [her]182-miss garland suffering .

" [I]2765-he can get the flower , "[2765-he] [he]2765-he called to [her]182-miss garland . " Will [you]182-miss garland trust [me]2765-he ? "[2765-he]

" [I]182-miss garland do n't want it ; [I]182-miss garland would rather not have it ! "[182-miss garland] [she]182-miss garland cried .

" Will [you]182-miss garland trust [me]2765-he ? "[2765-he] [he]2765-he repeated , looking at [her]182-miss garland .

[She]182-miss garland looked at [him]2765-he and then at the flower ; [he]2765-he wondered whether [she]182-miss garland would shriek and swoon , as [Miss Light]254-miss light had done . " [I]182-miss garland wish it were something better ! "[182-miss garland] [she]182-miss garland said simply ; and then stood watching [him]2765-he , while [he]2765-he began to clamber . [Rowland]281-rowland was not shaped for [an acrobat]2784-an acrobat , and [his]2765-he enterprise was difficult ; but [he]2765-he kept [his]2765-he wits about [him]2765-he , made the most of narrow foot - holds and coigns of vantage , and at last secured [his]2765-he prize . [He]2765-he managed to stick it into [his]2765-he buttonhole and then [he]2765-he contrived to descend . There was more than one chance for an ugly fall , but [he]2765-he evaded [them]2785-them all . It was doubtless not gracefully done , but it was done , and that was all [he]2765-he had proposed to [himself]2765-he . [He]2765-he was red in the face when [he]2765-he offered [Miss Garland]182-miss garland the flower , and [she]182-miss garland was visibly pale . [She]182-miss garland had watched [him]2765-he without moving . All this had passed without the knowledge of [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick , who was dozing beneath the hood of [the carriage]3735-the carriage . [Mary Garland]193-mary garland 's eyes did not perhaps display that ardent admiration which was formerly conferred by [the queen of beauty]2787-the queen of beauty at a tournament ; but they expressed something in which [Rowland]281-rowland found [his]2765-he reward . " Why did [you]2765-he do that ? "[182-miss garland] [she]182-miss garland asked , gravely .

[He]2765-he hesitated . [He]2765-he felt that it was physically possible to say , " Because [I]2765-he love [you]182-miss garland ! "[2765-he] but that it was not morally possible . [He]2765-he lowered [his]2765-he pitch and answered , simply , " Because [I]2765-he wanted to do something for [you]182-miss garland . "[2765-he]

" Suppose [you]2765-he had fallen , "[182-miss garland] said [Miss Garland]182-miss garland .

" [I]2765-he believed [I]2765-he would not fall . And [you]2765-he believed it , [I]2765-he think . "[2765-he]

" [I]2765-he believed nothing . [I]2765-he simply trusted [you]2765-he , as [you]2765-he asked [me]2765-he . "[2765-he]

" Quod erat demonstrandum ! "[281-rowland] cried [Rowland]281-rowland . " [I]281-rowland think [you]2765-he know Latin . "[281-rowland]

When [[our]2788-our four friends]2118-our four friends were established in what [I]0-i have called [[their]2118-our four friends grassy valley]2790-their grassy valley , there was a good deal of scrambling over slopes both grassy and stony , a good deal of flower - plucking on narrow ledges , a great many long walks , and , thanks to the lucid mountain air , not a little exhilaration . [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick was obliged to intermit [her]325-roderick suspicions of the deleterious atmosphere of [the old world]792-the old world , and to acknowledge the edifying purity of the breezes of [Engelthal]155-engelthal . [She]325-roderick was certainly more placid than [she]325-roderick had been in [Italy]24-italy ; having always lived in [the country]438-the country , [she]325-roderick had missed in [Rome]4-rome and [Florence]46-florence that social solitude mitigated by bushes and rocks which is so dear to [the true New England]2793-the true new england temperament . [The little unpainted inn at [Engelthal]155-engelthal]2794-the little unpainted inn at engelthal , with [its]2794-the little unpainted inn at engelthal plank partitions , [its]2794-the little unpainted inn at engelthal milk - pans standing in the sun , [its]2794-the little unpainted inn at engelthal " help , "[2795-angular young women of the country - side] in the form of [angular young women of [the country - side]2796-the country - side]2795-angular young women of the country - side , reminded [her]325-roderick of places of summer sojourn in [[her]325-roderick native land]2797-her native land ; and [the beautiful historic chambers of [the Villa Pandolfini]5197-the villa pandolfini]2798-the beautiful historic chambers of the villa pandolfini passed from [her]325-roderick memory without a regret , and without having in the least modified [her]325-roderick ideal of domiciliary grace . [Roderick]325-roderick had changed [his]2800-he sky , but [he]2800-he had not changed [his]2800-he mind ; [his]2800-he humor was still that of which [he]2800-he had given [Rowland]281-rowland a glimpse in that tragic explosion on [the Lake of [Como]151-como]2739-the lake of como . [He]2800-he kept [his]2800-he despair to [himself]2800-he , and [he]2800-he went doggedly about the ordinary business of life ; but it was easy to see that [his]2800-he spirit was mortally heavy , and that [he]2800-he lived and moved and talked simply from the force of habit . In that sad half - hour among the Italian olives there had been such a fierce sincerity in [his]2800-he tone , that [Rowland]281-rowland began to abdicate the critical attitude . [He]2800-he began to feel that it was essentially vain to appeal to [the poor fellow]3562-the poor fellow 's will ; there was no will left ; its place was an impotent void . This view of the case indeed was occasionally contravened by certain indications on [Roderick]325-roderick 's part of the power of resistance to disagreeable obligations : [one]3107-one might still have said , if [one]3107-one had been disposed to be didactic at any hazard , that there was a method in [his]2800-he madness , that [his]2800-he moral energy had its sleeping and its waking hours , and that , in a cause that pleased [it]3107-one , it was capable of rising with the dawn . But on the other hand , pleasure , in this case , was quite at one with effort ; evidently the greatest bliss in life , for [Roderick]325-roderick , would have been to have a plastic idea . And then , it was impossible not to feel tenderly to a despair which had so ceased to be aggressive - not to forgive a great deal of apathy to a temper which had so unlearned its irritability . [Roderick]325-roderick said frankly that [Switzerland]74-switzerland made [him]2800-he less miserable than [Italy]24-italy , and [the Alps]78-the alps seemed less to mock at [his]2800-he enforced leisure than [the Apennines]87-the apennines . [He]2800-he indulged in long rambles , generally alone , and was very fond of climbing into dizzy places , where no sound could overtake [him]2800-he , and there , flinging [himself]2800-he on the never - trodden moss , of pulling [his]2800-he hat over [his]2800-he eyes and lounging away the hours in perfect immobility . [Rowland]281-rowland sometimes walked with [him]2800-he ; though [Roderick]325-roderick never invited [him]2800-he , [he]2800-he seemed duly grateful for [his]2800-he society . [Rowland]281-rowland now made it a rule to treat [him]2800-he like [a perfectly sane man]2805-a perfectly sane man , to assume that all things were well with [him]2800-he , and never to allude to the prosperity [he]2800-he had forfeited or to the work [he]2800-he was not doing . [He]2800-he would have still said , had [you]2806-you questioned [him]2800-he , that [Roderick]325-roderick 's condition was a mood - certainly a puzzling one . It might last yet for many a weary hour ; but it was a long lane that had no turning . [Roderick]325-roderick 's blues would not last forever . [Rowland]281-rowland 's interest in [Miss Garland]182-miss garland 's relations with [[her]281-rowland cousin]370-her cousin was still profoundly attentive , and perplexed as [he]2800-he was on all sides , [he]2800-he found nothing transparent here . After [their]2808-their arrival at [Engelthal]155-engelthal , [Roderick]325-roderick appeared to seek [the young girl]659-the young girl 's society more than [he]2800-he had done hitherto , and this revival of ardor could not fail to set [[his]2800-he friend]606-his friend a - wondering . [They]2808-their sat together and strolled together , and [Miss Garland]182-miss garland often read aloud to [him]2800-he . One day , on [their]2808-their coming to dinner , after [he]2800-he had been lying half the morning at [her]182-miss garland feet , in the shadow of a rock , [Rowland]281-rowland asked [him]2800-he what [she]182-miss garland had been reading .

" [I]325-roderick do n't know , "[325-roderick] [Roderick]325-roderick said , " [I]325-roderick do n't heed the sense . "[325-roderick] [Miss Garland]182-miss garland heard this , and [Rowland]281-rowland looked at [her]182-miss garland . [She]281-rowland looked at [Roderick]325-roderick sharply and with a little blush . " [I]325-roderick listen to [Mary]193-mary garland , "[325-roderick] [Roderick]325-roderick continued , " for the sake of [her]193-mary garland voice . It 's distractingly sweet ! "[325-roderick] At this [Miss Garland]182-miss garland 's blush deepened , and [she]281-rowland looked away .

[Rowland]281-rowland , in [Florence]46-florence , as [we]2811-we know , had suffered [his]2800-he imagination to wander in the direction of certain conjectures which [the reader]388-the reader may deem unflattering to [Miss Garland]182-miss garland 's constancy . [He]2800-he had asked [himself]2800-he whether [her]281-rowland faith in [Roderick]325-roderick had not faltered , and that demand of [hers]281-rowland which had brought about [his]2800-he own departure for [Switzerland]74-switzerland had seemed almost equivalent to a confession that [she]281-rowland needed [his]2800-he help to believe . [Rowland]281-rowland was essentially [a modest man]2813-a modest man , and [he]2800-he did not risk the supposition that [Miss Garland]182-miss garland had contrasted [him]2800-he with [Roderick]325-roderick to [his]2800-he own advantage ; but [he]2800-he had a certain consciousness of duty resolutely done which allowed itself to fancy , at moments , that it might be not illogically rewarded by the bestowal of such stray grains of enthusiasm as had crumbled away from [her]281-rowland estimate of [[his]2800-he companion]555-his companion . If some day [she]281-rowland had declared , in a sudden burst of passion , that [she]281-rowland was outwearied and sickened , and that [she]281-rowland gave up [[her]281-rowland recreant lover]2815-her recreant lover , [Rowland]281-rowland 's expectation would have gone half - way to meet [her]281-rowland . And certainly if [her]281-rowland passion had taken this course [no generous critic]2816-no generous critic would utterly condemn [her]281-rowland . [She]281-rowland had been neglected , ignored , forsaken , treated with a contempt which [no girl of a fine temper]2817-no girl of a fine temper could endure . There were [girls]2818-girls , indeed , whose fineness , like that of [Burd Helen]337-burd helen in the ballad , lay in clinging to [the man of [their]2818-girls love]2819-the man of their love through thick and thin , and in bowing [their]2818-girls head to all hard usage . This attitude had often an exquisite beauty of its own , but [Rowland]281-rowland deemed that [he]2800-he had solid reason to believe it never could be [Mary Garland]193-mary garland 's . [She]193-mary garland was not [a passive creature]2820-a passive creature ; [she]193-mary garland was not soft and meek and grateful for chance bounties . With all [her]193-mary garland reserve of manner [she]193-mary garland was proud and eager ; [she]193-mary garland asked much and [she]193-mary garland wanted what [she]193-mary garland asked ; [she]193-mary garland believed in fine things and [she]193-mary garland never could long persuade [herself]193-mary garland that fine things missed were as beautiful as fine things achieved . Once [Rowland]281-rowland passed an angry day . [He]2800-he had dreamed - it was the most insubstantial of dreams - that [she]193-mary garland had given [him]2800-he the right to believe that [she]193-mary garland looked to [him]2800-he to transmute [her]193-mary garland discontent . And yet here [she]193-mary garland was throwing [herself]193-mary garland back into [Roderick]325-roderick 's arms at [his]2800-he lightest overture , and playing with [his]2800-he own half fearful , half shameful hopes ! [Rowland]281-rowland declared to [himself]281-rowland that [his]2800-he position was essentially detestable , and that all the philosophy [he]2800-he could bring to bear upon it would make it neither honorable nor comfortable . [He]2800-he would go away and make an end of it . [He]2800-he did not go away ; [he]2800-he simply took a long walk , stayed away from [the inn]956-the inn all day , and on [his]2800-he return found [Miss Garland]182-miss garland sitting out in the moonlight with [Roderick]325-roderick .

[Rowland]281-rowland , communing with [himself]281-rowland during the restless ramble in question , had determined that [he]2800-he would at least cease to observe , to heed , or to care for what [Miss Garland]182-miss garland and [Roderick]325-roderick might do or might not do together . Nevertheless , some three days afterward , the opportunity presenting itself , [he]2800-he deliberately broached the subject with [Roderick]325-roderick . [He]2800-he knew this was inconsistent and faint - hearted ; it was indulgence to the fingers that itched to handle forbidden fruit . But [he]2800-he said to [himself]2800-he that it was really more logical to be inconsistent than the reverse ; for [they]2822-they had formerly discussed these mysteries very candidly . Was it not perfectly reasonable that [he]2800-he should wish to know the sequel of the situation which [Roderick]325-roderick had then delineated ? [Roderick]325-roderick had made [him]2800-he promises , and it was to be expected that [he]2800-he should ascertain how the promises had been kept . [Rowland]281-rowland could not say to [himself]281-rowland that if the promises had been extorted for [Mary Garland]193-mary garland 's sake , [his]2800-he present attention to [them]2823-them was equally disinterested ; and so [he]2800-he had to admit that [he]2800-he was indeed faint - hearted . [He]2800-he may perhaps be deemed too narrow a casuist , but [we]2824-we have repeated more than once that [he]2800-he was solidly burdened with a conscience .

" [I]2800-he imagine , "[2800-he] [he]2800-he said to [Roderick]325-roderick , " that [you]325-roderick are not sorry , at present , to have allowed [yourself]325-roderick to be dissuaded from making a final rupture with [Miss Garland]182-miss garland . "[2800-he]
