" But [you]281-rowland have done [your]281-rowland best to keep that up . "[281-rowland]

" That 's another matter ! "[281-rowland]

" It 's very strange ! "[325-roderick] said [Roderick]325-roderick , presently . " It 's like something in a novel . "[325-roderick]

" [We]5362-we need n't expatiate on it , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland . " All [I]281-rowland wished to do was to rebut [your]325-roderick charge that [I]281-rowland am [an abnormal being]5363-an abnormal being . "[281-rowland]

But still [Roderick]325-roderick pondered . " All these months , while [I]325-roderick was going on ! [I]325-roderick wish [you]325-roderick had mentioned it . "[325-roderick]

" [I]325-roderick acted as was necessary , and that 's the end of it . "[325-roderick]

" [You]325-roderick have a very high opinion of [her]5364-she ? "[325-roderick]

" The highest . "[325-roderick]

" [I]325-roderick remember now [your]325-roderick occasionally expressing it and [my]325-roderick being struck with it . But [I]325-roderick never dreamed [you]325-roderick were in love with [her]5364-she . It 's a pity [she]5364-she does n't care for [you]325-roderick ! "[325-roderick]

[Rowland]281-rowland had made [his]2969-he point and [he]2969-he had no wish to prolong the conversation ; but [he]2969-he had a desire to hear more of this , and [he]2969-he remained silent .

" [You]325-roderick hope , [I]325-roderick suppose , that some day [she]5364-she may ? "[325-roderick]

" [I]325-roderick should n't have offered to say so ; but since [you]281-rowland ask [me]325-roderick , [I]325-roderick do . "[325-roderick]

" [I]325-roderick do n't believe it . [She]5364-she idolizes [me]325-roderick , and if [she]5364-she never were to see [me]325-roderick again [she]5364-she would idolize [my]325-roderick memory . "[325-roderick]

This might be profound insight , and it might be profound fatuity . [Rowland]281-rowland turned away ; [he]2969-he could not trust [himself]2969-he to speak .

" [My]325-roderick indifference , [my]325-roderick neglect of [her]5364-she , must have seemed to [you]281-rowland horrible . Altogether , [I]325-roderick must have appeared simply hideous . "[325-roderick]

" Do [you]281-rowland really care , "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland asked , " what [you]281-rowland appeared ? "[281-rowland]

" Certainly . [I]325-roderick have been damnably stupid . Is n't [an artist]3186-an artist supposed to be [a man of perceptions]5366-a man of perceptions ? [I]325-roderick am hugely disgusted . "[325-roderick]

" Well , [you]281-rowland understand now , and [we]5367-we can start afresh . "[281-rowland]

" And yet , "[325-roderick] said [Roderick]325-roderick , " though [you]281-rowland have suffered , in a degree , [I]325-roderick do n't believe [you]281-rowland have suffered so much as [some other men]5368-some other men would have done . "[325-roderick]

" Very likely not . In such matters quantitative analysis is difficult . "[281-rowland]

[Roderick]325-roderick picked up [his]2970-he stick and stood looking at the ground . " Nevertheless , [I]2970-he must have seemed hideous , "[2970-he] [he]2970-he repeated - " hideous . "[2970-he] [He]2970-he turned away , scowling , and [Rowland]281-rowland offered no contradiction .

[They]2971-they were both silent for some time , and at last [Roderick]325-roderick gave a heavy sigh and began to walk away . " Where are [you]281-rowland going ? "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland then asked .

" Oh , [I]325-roderick do n't care ! To walk ; [you]281-rowland have given [me]325-roderick something to think of . "[325-roderick] This seemed a salutary impulse , and yet [Rowland]281-rowland felt a nameless perplexity . " To have been so stupid damns [me]325-roderick more than anything ! "[325-roderick] [Roderick]325-roderick went on . " Certainly , [I]325-roderick can shut up shop now . "[325-roderick]

[Rowland]281-rowland felt in no smiling humor , and yet , in spite of [himself]281-rowland , [he]2970-he could almost have smiled at the very consistency of [the fellow]2972-the fellow . It was egotism still : aesthetic disgust at the graceless contour of [his]2970-he conduct , but never a hint of simple sorrow for the pain [he]2970-he had given . [Rowland]281-rowland let [him]2970-he go , and for some moments stood watching [him]2970-he . Suddenly [Mallet]170-mr. mallet became conscious of a singular and most illogical impulse - a desire to stop [him]170-mr. mallet , to have another word with [him]170-mr. mallet - not to lose sight of [him]170-mr. mallet . [He]170-mr. mallet called [him]170-mr. mallet and [Roderick]325-roderick turned . " [I]281-rowland should like to go with [you]325-roderick , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland .

" [I]170-mr. mallet am fit only to be alone . [I]170-mr. mallet am damned ! "[170-mr. mallet]

" [You]325-roderick had better not think of it at all , "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland cried , " than think in that way . "[281-rowland]

" There is only one way . [I]2970-he have been hideous ! "[2970-he] And [he]2970-he broke off and marched away with [his]2970-he long , elastic step , swinging [his]2970-he stick . [Rowland]281-rowland watched [him]2970-he and at the end of a moment called to [him]2970-he . [Roderick]325-roderick stopped and looked at [him]2970-he in silence , and then abruptly turned , and disappeared below [the crest of [a hill]2974-a hill]2973-the crest of a hill .

[Rowland]281-rowland passed the remainder of the day uncomfortably . [He]2970-he was half irritated , half depressed ; [he]2970-he had an insufferable feeling of having been placed in the wrong , in spite of [his]2970-he excellent cause . [Roderick]325-roderick did not come [home]349-home to dinner ; but of this , with [his]2970-he passion for brooding away the hours on [far - off mountain sides]2976-far - off mountain sides , [he]2970-he had almost made a habit . [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick appeared at the noonday repast with a face which showed that [Roderick]325-roderick 's demand for money had unsealed the fountains of [her]325-roderick distress . [Little Singleton]214-singleton consumed an enormous and well - earned dinner . [Miss Garland]182-miss garland , [Rowland]281-rowland observed , had not contributed [her]182-miss garland scanty assistance to [[her]182-miss garland kinsman]2977-her kinsman 's pursuit of [the Princess Casamassima]281-rowland without an effort . The effort was visible in [her]182-miss garland pale face and [her]182-miss garland silence ; [she]182-miss garland looked so ill that when [they]2978-they left the table [Rowland]281-rowland felt almost bound to remark upon it . [They]2978-they had come out upon the grass in front of [the inn]956-the inn .

" [I]182-miss garland have a headache , "[182-miss garland] [she]182-miss garland said . And then suddenly , looking about at the menacing sky and motionless air , " It 's this horrible day ! "[182-miss garland]

[Rowland]281-rowland that afternoon tried to write a letter to [[his]2977-her kinsman cousin]343-his cousin [Cecilia]169-cecilia , but [his]2977-her kinsman head and [his]2977-her kinsman heart were alike heavy , and [he]2977-her kinsman traced upon the paper but a single line . " [I]2977-her kinsman believe there is such a thing as being too reasonable . But when once the habit is formed , what is one to do ? "[2977-her kinsman] [He]2977-her kinsman had occasion to use [his]2977-her kinsman keys and [he]2977-her kinsman felt for them in [his]2977-her kinsman pocket ; they were missing , and [he]2977-her kinsman remembered that [he]2977-her kinsman had left them lying on [the hill - top]2981-the hill - top where [he]2977-her kinsman had had [his]2977-her kinsman talk with [Roderick]325-roderick . [He]2977-her kinsman went forth in search of them and found them where [he]2977-her kinsman had thrown them . [He]2977-her kinsman flung [himself]2977-her kinsman down in the same place again ; [he]2977-her kinsman felt indisposed to walk . [He]2977-her kinsman was conscious that [his]2977-her kinsman mood had vastly changed since the morning ; [his]2977-her kinsman extraordinary , acute sense of [his]2977-her kinsman rights had been replaced by the familiar , chronic sense of [his]2977-her kinsman duties . Only , [his]2977-her kinsman duties now seemed impracticable ; [he]2977-her kinsman turned over and buried [his]2977-her kinsman face in [his]2977-her kinsman arms . [He]2977-her kinsman lay so a long time , thinking of many things ; the sum of them all was that [Roderick]325-roderick had beaten [him]2977-her kinsman . At last [he]2977-her kinsman was startled by an extraordinary sound ; it took [him]2977-her kinsman a moment to perceive that it was a portentous growl of thunder . [He]2977-her kinsman roused [himself]2977-her kinsman and saw that the whole face of the sky had altered . The clouds that had hung motionless all day were moving from their stations , and getting into position , as it were , for a battle . The wind was rising ; the sallow vapors were turning dark and consolidating their masses . It was a striking spectacle , but [Rowland]281-rowland judged best to observe it briefly , as a storm was evidently imminent . [He]2977-her kinsman took [his]2977-her kinsman way down to [the inn]956-the inn and found [Singleton]214-singleton still at [his]214-singleton post , profiting by the last of the rapidly - failing light to finish [his]214-singleton study , and yet at the same time taking rapid notes of the actual condition of the clouds .

" [We]5369-we are going to have a most interesting storm , "[1190-the little painter] [the little painter]1190-the little painter gleefully cried . " [I]1190-the little painter should like awfully to do it . "[1190-the little painter]

[Rowland]281-rowland adjured [him]214-singleton to pack up [his]214-singleton tools and decamp , and repaired to [the house]3246-the house . The air by this time had become portentously dark , and the thunder was incessant and tremendous ; in the midst of it the lightning flashed and vanished , like the treble shrilling upon the bass . [The innkeeper]2985-the innkeeper and [[his]2985-the innkeeper servants]2986-his servants had crowded to the doorway , and were looking at the scene with faces which seemed a proof that it was unprecedented . As [Rowland]281-rowland approached , [the group]1080-the group divided , to let [some one]3618-some one pass from within , and [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick came forth , as white as a corpse and trembling in every limb .

" [[My]325-roderick boy]3929-my boy , [[my]325-roderick boy]3929-my boy , where is [[my]325-roderick boy]3929-my boy ? "[325-roderick] [she]325-roderick cried . " [Mr. Mallet]170-mr. mallet , why are [you]170-mr. mallet here without [him]3929-my boy ? Bring [him]3929-my boy to [me]325-roderick ! "[325-roderick]

" Has [no one]629-no one seen [Mr. Hudson]172-mr. hudson ? "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland asked of [the others]4483-the others . " Has [he]3929-my boy not returned ? "[281-rowland]

[Each one]2990-each one shook [his]2990-each one head and looked grave , and [Rowland]281-rowland attempted to reassure [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick by saying that of course [he]2991-he had taken refuge in [a chalet]2992-a chalet .

" Go and find [him]3929-my boy , go and find [him]3929-my boy ! "[325-roderick] [she]325-roderick cried , insanely . " Do n't stand there and talk , or [I]325-roderick shall die ! "[325-roderick] It was now as dark as evening , and [Rowland]281-rowland could just distinguish the figure of [Singleton]214-singleton scampering homeward with [his]214-singleton box and easel . " And where is [Mary]193-mary garland ? "[214-singleton] [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick went on ; " what in mercy 's name has become of [her]193-mary garland ? [Mr. Mallet]170-mr. mallet , why did [you]281-rowland ever bring [us]2993-us [here]3130-here ? "[325-roderick]

There came a prodigious flash of lightning , and the limitless tumult about [them]2993-us turned clearer than midsummer noonday . The brightness lasted long enough to enable [Rowland]281-rowland to see [a woman]3607-a woman 's figure on the top of [an eminence near [the house]3246-the house]2995-an eminence near the house . It was [Mary Garland]193-mary garland , questioning the lurid darkness for [Roderick]325-roderick . [Rowland]281-rowland sprang out to interrupt [her]325-roderick vigil , but in a moment [he]2997-he encountered [her]325-roderick , retreating . [He]2997-he seized [her]325-roderick hand and hurried [her]325-roderick to [the house]3246-the house , where , as soon as [she]325-roderick stepped into [the covered gallery]2999-the covered gallery , [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick fell upon [her]325-roderick with frantic lamentations .

" Did [you]2997-he see nothing , - nothing ? "[325-roderick] [she]325-roderick cried . " Tell [Mr. Mallet]170-mr. mallet [he]170-mr. mallet must go and find [him]170-mr. mallet , with [some men]4142-some men , some lights , some wrappings . Go , go , go , [sir]3318-sir ! In mercy , go ! "[325-roderick]

[Rowland]281-rowland was extremely perturbed by [the poor lady]651-the poor lady 's vociferous folly , for [he]2997-he deemed [her]651-the poor lady anxiety superfluous . [He]2997-he had offered [his]2997-he suggestion with sincerity ; nothing was more probable than that [Roderick]325-roderick had found shelter in [[a herdsman]3001-a herdsman 's cabin]3002-a herdsman 's cabin . [These]3003-these were numerous on [the neighboring mountains]3004-the neighboring mountains , and the storm had given fair warning of its approach . [Miss Garland]182-miss garland stood there very pale , saying nothing , but looking at [him]2997-he . [He]2997-he expected that [she]182-miss garland would check [[her]182-miss garland cousin]370-her cousin 's importunity . " Could [you]2997-he find [him]370-her cousin ? "[182-miss garland] [she]182-miss garland suddenly asked . " Would it be of use ? "[182-miss garland]

The question seemed to [him]2997-he a flash intenser than the lightning that was raking the sky before [them]3006-them . It shattered [his]2997-he dream that [he]2997-he weighed in the scale ! But before [he]2997-he could answer , the full fury of the storm was upon [them]3006-them ; the rain descended in sounding torrents . [Every one]3105-every one fell back into [the house]3246-the house . There had been no time to light lamps , and in [the little uncarpeted parlor]3009-the little uncarpeted parlor , in the unnatural darkness , [Rowland]281-rowland felt [Mary]193-mary garland 's hand upon [his]2997-he arm . For a moment it had an eloquent pressure ; it seemed to retract [her]193-mary garland senseless challenge , and to say that [she]193-mary garland believed , for [Roderick]325-roderick , what [he]2997-he believed . But nevertheless , thought [Rowland]281-rowland , the cry had come , [her]193-mary garland heart had spoken ; [her]193-mary garland first impulse had been to sacrifice [him]2997-he . [He]2997-he had been uncertain before ; here , at least , was the comfort of certainty !

It must be confessed , however , that the certainty in question did little to enliven the gloom of that formidable evening . There was [a noisy crowd]3010-a noisy crowd about [him]2997-he in [the room]487-the room - noisy even with the accompaniment of the continual thunder - peals ; [lodgers]3012-lodgers and [servants]439-servants , chattering , shuffling , and bustling , and annoying [him]2997-he equally by making too light of the tempest and by vociferating [their]3010-a noisy crowd alarm . In the disorder , it was some time before a lamp was lighted , and the first thing [he]2997-he saw , as it was swung from the ceiling , was the white face of [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick , who was being carried out of [the room]487-the room in a swoon by [two stout maid - servants]3015-two stout maid - servants , with [Mary Garland]193-mary garland forcing a passage . [He]2997-he rendered what help [he]2997-he could , but when [they]3010-a noisy crowd had laid [the poor woman]3820-the poor woman on [her]3820-the poor woman bed , [Miss Garland]182-miss garland motioned [him]2997-he away .

" [I]182-miss garland think [you]281-rowland make [her]3820-the poor woman worse , "[182-miss garland] [she]182-miss garland said .

[Rowland]281-rowland went to [[his]2997-he own chamber]3017-his own chamber . The partitions in [Swiss mountain - inns]3018-swiss mountain - inns are thin , and from time to time [he]2997-he heard [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick moaning , [three rooms]3019-three rooms off . Considering its great fury , the storm took long to expend itself ; it was upwards of three hours before the thunder ceased . But even then the rain continued to fall heavily , and the night , which had come on , was impenetrably black . This lasted till near midnight . [Rowland]281-rowland thought of [Mary Garland]193-mary garland 's challenge in [the porch]3020-the porch , but [he]2997-he thought even more that , although the fetid interior of [a high - nestling chalet]3021-a high - nestling chalet may offer a convenient refuge from an Alpine tempest , there was no possible music in [the universe]3022-the universe so sweet as the sound of [Roderick]325-roderick 's voice . At midnight , through [his]2997-he dripping window - pane , [he]2997-he saw a star , and [he]2997-he immediately went [downstairs]3023-downstairs and out into [the gallery]3024-the gallery . The rain had ceased , the cloud - masses were dissevered here and there , and several stars were visible . In a few minutes [he]2997-he heard a step behind [him]2997-he , and , turning , saw [Miss Garland]182-miss garland . [He]2997-he asked about [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick and learned that [she]325-roderick was sleeping , exhausted by [her]325-roderick fruitless lamentations . [Miss Garland]182-miss garland kept scanning the darkness , but [she]182-miss garland said nothing to cast doubt on [Roderick]325-roderick 's having found a refuge . [Rowland]281-rowland noticed it . " This also have [I]2997-he guaranteed ! "[2997-he] [he]2997-he said to [himself]2997-he . There was something that [Mary]193-mary garland wished to learn , and a question presently revealed it .

" What made [him]2997-he start on a long walk so suddenly ? "[182-miss garland] [she]182-miss garland asked . " [I]182-miss garland saw [him]2997-he at eleven o'clock , and then [he]2997-he meant to go to [Engelberg]158-engelberg , and sleep . "[182-miss garland]

" On [his]2997-he way to [Interlaken]156-interlaken ? "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland said .

" Yes , "[182-miss garland] [she]182-miss garland answered , under cover of the darkness .

" [We]5377-we had some talk , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland , " and [he]2997-he seemed , for the day , to have given up [Interlaken]156-interlaken . "[281-rowland]

" Did [you]182-miss garland dissuade [him]2997-he ? "[281-rowland]

" Not exactly . [We]5377-we discussed another question , which , for the time , superseded [his]2997-he plan . "[281-rowland]

[Miss Garland]182-miss garland was silent . Then - " May [I]182-miss garland ask whether [your]182-miss garland discussion was violent ? "[182-miss garland] [she]182-miss garland said .

" [I]281-rowland am afraid it was agreeable to neither of [us]5377-we . "[281-rowland]

" And [Roderick]325-roderick left [you]182-miss garland in - in irritation ? "[281-rowland]

" [I]281-rowland offered [him]2997-he [my]281-rowland company on [his]2997-he walk . [He]2997-he declined it . "[281-rowland]

[Miss Garland]182-miss garland paced slowly to the end of [the gallery]3024-the gallery and then came back . " If [he]2997-he had gone to [Engelberg]158-engelberg , "[182-miss garland] [she]182-miss garland said , " [he]2997-he would have reached [the hotel]2093-the hotel before the storm began . "[182-miss garland]

[Rowland]281-rowland felt a sudden explosion of ferocity . " Oh , if [you]182-miss garland like , "[3026-he] [he]3026-he cried , " [he]2997-he can start for [Interlaken]156-interlaken as soon as [he]2997-he comes back ! "[3026-he]

But [she]182-miss garland did not even notice [his]3026-he wrath . " Will [he]2997-he come back early ? "[182-miss garland] [she]182-miss garland went on .

" [We]5379-we may suppose so . "[182-miss garland]

" [He]2997-he will know how anxious [we]5379-we are , and [he]2997-he will start with the first light ! "[182-miss garland]

[Rowland]281-rowland was on the point of declaring that [Roderick]325-roderick 's readiness to throw [himself]325-roderick into the feelings of [others]914-others made this extremely probable ; but [he]3026-he checked [himself]3026-he and said , simply , " [I]3026-he expect [him]2997-he at sunrise . "[3026-he]

[Miss Garland]182-miss garland bent [her]182-miss garland eyes once more upon the irresponsive darkness , and then , in silence , went into [the house]3246-the house . [Rowland]281-rowland , it must be averred , in spite of [his]3026-he resolution not to be nervous , found no sleep that night . When the early dawn began to tremble in [the east]1383-the east , [he]3026-he came forth again into the open air . The storm had completely purged the atmosphere , and the day gave promise of cloudless splendor . [Rowland]281-rowland watched the early sun - shafts slowly reaching higher , and remembered that if [Roderick]325-roderick did not come back to breakfast , there were two things to be taken into account . One was the heaviness of the soil on [the mountain - sides]3030-the mountain - sides , saturated with the rain ; this would make [him]3026-he walk slowly : the other was the fact that , speaking without irony , [he]3026-he was not remarkable for throwing [himself]3026-he into the sentiments of [others]914-others . Breakfast , at [the inn]956-the inn , was early , and by breakfast - time [Roderick]325-roderick had not appeared . Then [Rowland]281-rowland admitted that [he]3026-he was nervous . [Neither Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick nor [Miss Garland]182-miss garland had left [[their]3033-them apartment]3034-their apartment ; [Rowland]281-rowland had a mental vision of [them]3033-them sitting there praying and listening ; [he]3026-he had no desire to see [them]3033-them more directly . There were [a couple of men who hung about [the inn]956-the inn as guides for the ascent of [the Titlis]167-the titlis]3035-a couple of men who hung about the inn as guides for the ascent of the titlis ; [Rowland]281-rowland sent each of [them]3035-a couple of men who hung about the inn as guides for the ascent of the titlis forth in a different direction , to ask the news of [Roderick]325-roderick at every chalet door within a morning 's walk . Then [he]3026-he called [Sam Singleton]214-singleton , whose peregrinations had made [him]214-singleton [an excellent mountaineer , and whose zeal and sympathy were now unbounded]3037-an excellent mountaineer , and whose zeal and sympathy were now unbounded , and [the two]1820-the two started together on a voyage of research . By the time [they]1820-the two had lost sight of [the inn]956-the inn , [Rowland]281-rowland was obliged to confess that , decidedly , [Roderick]325-roderick had had time to come back .

[He]3026-he wandered about for several hours , but [he]3026-he found only the sunny stillness of [the mountain - sides]3030-the mountain - sides . Before long [he]3026-he parted company with [Singleton]214-singleton , who , to [his]3026-he suggestion that separation would multiply [their]1820-the two resources , assented with a silent , frightened look which reflected too vividly [his]214-singleton own rapidly - dawning thought . The day was magnificent ; the sun was everywhere ; the storm had lashed [the lower slopes]3041-the lower slopes into a deeper flush of autumnal color , and [the snow - peaks]3042-the snow - peaks reared themselves against the near horizon in glaring blocks and dazzling spires . [Rowland]281-rowland made [his]3026-he way to [several chalets]3043-several chalets , but most of [them]3043-several chalets were empty . [He]3026-he thumped at [their]3043-several chalets low , foul doors with a kind of nervous , savage anger ; [he]3026-he challenged the stupid silence to tell [him]3026-he something about [[his]3026-he friend]606-his friend . [Some of [these places]3046-these places]3045-some of these places had evidently not been open in months . The silence everywhere was horrible ; it seemed to mock at [his]3026-he impatience and to be a conscious symbol of calamity . In the midst of it , at the door of [one of [the chalets]3048-the chalets]3047-one of the chalets , quite alone , sat a hideous cretin , who grinned at [Rowland]281-rowland over [his]3026-he goitre when , hardly knowing what [he]3026-he did , [he]3026-he questioned [him]3026-he . [[The creature]3049-the creature 's family]3050-the creature 's family was scattered on [the mountain - sides]3030-the mountain - sides ; [he]3026-he could give [Rowland]281-rowland no help to find [them]3050-the creature 's family . [Rowland]281-rowland climbed into many awkward places , and skirted , intently and peeringly , many [an ugly chasm]3052-an ugly chasm and steep - dropping ledge . But the sun , as [I]0-i have said , was everywhere ; it illumined the deep places over which , not knowing where to turn next , [he]3026-he halted and lingered , and showed [him]3026-he nothing but [the stony Alpine void]3053-the stony alpine void - nothing so human even as death . At noon [he]3026-he paused in [his]3026-he quest and sat down on a stone ; the conviction was pressing upon [him]3026-he that the worst that was now possible was true . [He]3026-he suspended [his]3026-he search ; [he]3026-he was afraid to go on . [He]3026-he sat there for an hour , sick to the depths of [his]3026-he soul . Without [his]3026-he knowing why , several things , chiefly trivial , that had happened during the last two years and that [he]3026-he had quite forgotten , became vividly present to [his]3026-he mind . [He]3026-he was aroused at last by the sound of a stone dislodged near by , which rattled down [the mountain]1980-the mountain . In a moment , on [a steep , rocky slope opposite to [him]3026-he]3055-a steep , rocky slope opposite to him , [he]3026-he beheld [a figure cautiously descending]3056-a figure cautiously descending - a figure which was not [Roderick]325-roderick . It was [Singleton]214-singleton , who had seen [him]3026-he and began to beckon to [him]3026-he .

" Come down - come down ! "[3057-the painter] cried [the painter]3057-the painter , steadily making [his]3057-the painter own way down . [Rowland]281-rowland saw that as [he]3026-he moved , and even as [he]3026-he selected [his]3026-he foothold and watched [his]3026-he steps , [he]3026-he was looking at something at [the bottom of [the cliff]3059-the cliff]3058-the bottom of the cliff . This was a great rugged wall which had fallen backward from the perpendicular , and the descent , though difficult , was with care sufficiently practicable .

" What do [you]214-singleton see ? "[281-rowland] cried [Rowland]281-rowland .

[Singleton]214-singleton stopped , looked across at [him]3026-he and seemed to hesitate ; then , " Come down - come down ! "[214-singleton] [he]214-singleton simply repeated .

[Rowland]281-rowland 's course was also a steep descent , and [he]3026-he attacked it so precipitately that [he]3026-he afterwards marveled [he]3026-he had not broken [his]3026-he neck . It was a ten minutes ' headlong scramble . Half - way down [he]3026-he saw something that made [him]3026-he dizzy ; [he]3026-he saw what [Singleton]214-singleton had seen . In [the gorge below [them]3061-them]3060-the gorge below them a vague white mass lay tumbled upon the stones . [He]3026-he let [himself]3026-he go , blindly , fiercely . [Singleton]214-singleton had reached [the rocky bottom of [the ravine]3063-the ravine before [him]214-singleton]3062-the rocky bottom of the ravine before him , and had bounded forward and fallen upon [his]214-singleton knees . [Rowland]281-rowland overtook [him]214-singleton and [his]3026-he own legs collapsed . The thing that yesterday was [[his]3026-he friend]606-his friend lay before [him]3026-he as the chance of the last breath had left it , and out of it [Roderick]325-roderick 's face stared upward , open - eyed , at the sky .

[He]3026-he had fallen from a great height , but [he]3026-he was singularly little disfigured . The rain had spent its torrents upon [him]3026-he , and [his]3026-he clothes and hair were as wet as if the billows of [the ocean]760-the ocean had flung [him]3026-he upon [the strand]3066-the strand . An attempt to move [him]3026-he would show some hideous fracture , some horrible physical dishonor ; but what [Rowland]281-rowland saw on first looking at [him]3026-he was only a strangely serene expression of life . The eyes were dead , but in a short time , when [Rowland]281-rowland had closed them , the whole face seemed to awake . The rain had washed away all blood ; it was as if [Violence]341-violence , having done [her]341-violence work , had stolen away in shame . [Roderick]325-roderick 's face might have shamed [her]341-violence ; it looked admirably handsome .

" [He]3026-he was [a beautiful man]5380-a beautiful man ! "[214-singleton] said [Singleton]214-singleton .

[They]3067-they looked up through [their]3067-they horror at the cliff from which [he]3026-he had apparently fallen , and which lifted its blank and stony face above [him]3026-he , with no care now but to drink the sunshine on which [his]3026-he eyes were closed , and then [Rowland]281-rowland had an immense outbreak of pity and anguish . At last [they]3067-they spoke of carrying [him]3026-he back to [the inn]956-the inn . " There must be [three or four men]5381-three or four men , "[281-rowland] [Rowland]281-rowland said , " and [they]5381-three or four men must be brought [here]3130-here quickly . [I]281-rowland have not the least idea where [we]3067-they are . "[281-rowland]

" [We]3067-they are at about three hours ' walk from [home]349-home , "[214-singleton] said [Singleton]214-singleton . " [I]214-singleton will go for help ; [I]214-singleton can find [my]214-singleton way . "[214-singleton]

" Remember , "[281-rowland] said [Rowland]281-rowland , " whom [you]214-singleton will have to face . "[281-rowland]

" [I]3069-the excellent fellow remember , "[3069-the excellent fellow] [the excellent fellow]3069-the excellent fellow answered . " There was nothing [I]3069-the excellent fellow could ever do for [him]3069-the excellent fellow in life ; [I]3069-the excellent fellow will do what [I]3069-the excellent fellow can now . "[3069-the excellent fellow]

[He]3069-the excellent fellow went off , and [Rowland]281-rowland stayed [there]3420-there alone . [He]3069-the excellent fellow watched for seven long hours , and [his]3069-the excellent fellow vigil was forever memorable . [The most rational of [men]3287-men]3071-the most rational of men was for an hour the most passionate . [He]3069-the excellent fellow reviled [himself]3069-the excellent fellow with transcendent bitterness , [he]3069-the excellent fellow accused [himself]3069-the excellent fellow of cruelty and injustice , [he]3069-the excellent fellow would have lain down there in [[Roderick]325-roderick 's place]3073-roderick 's place to unsay the words that had yesterday driven [him]3069-the excellent fellow forth on [his]3069-the excellent fellow lonely ramble . [Roderick]325-roderick had been fond of saying that there are such things as necessary follies , and [Rowland]281-rowland was now proving it . At last [he]3069-the excellent fellow grew almost used to the dumb exultation of [the cliff above [him]3069-the excellent fellow]3074-the cliff above him . [He]3069-the excellent fellow saw that [Roderick]325-roderick was a mass of hideous injury , and [he]3069-the excellent fellow tried to understand what had happened . Not that it helped [him]3069-the excellent fellow ; before that confounding mortality one hypothesis after another faltered and swooned away . [Roderick]325-roderick 's passionate walk had carried [him]3069-the excellent fellow farther and higher than [he]3069-the excellent fellow knew ; [he]3069-the excellent fellow had outstayed , supposably , the first menace of the storm , and perhaps even found a defiant entertainment in watching it . Perhaps [he]3069-the excellent fellow had simply lost [himself]3069-the excellent fellow . The tempest had overtaken [him]3069-the excellent fellow , and when [he]3069-the excellent fellow tried to return , it was too late . [He]3069-the excellent fellow had attempted to descend the cliff in the darkness , [he]3069-the excellent fellow had made the inevitable slip , and whether [he]3069-the excellent fellow had fallen fifty feet or three hundred little mattered . The condition of [his]3069-the excellent fellow body indicated the shorter fall . Now that all was over , [Rowland]281-rowland understood how exclusively , for two years , [Roderick]325-roderick had filled [his]3069-the excellent fellow life . [His]3069-the excellent fellow occupation was gone .

[Singleton]214-singleton came back with [four men]3075-four men - [one of [them]3075-four men [the landlord of [the inn]956-the inn]3077-the landlord of the inn]3076-one of them the landlord of the inn . [They]3075-four men had formed a sort of rude bier of the frame of a chaise a porteurs , and by taking a very round - about course [homeward]3079-homeward were able to follow a tolerably level path and carry [their]3075-four men burden with a certain decency . To [Rowland]281-rowland it seemed as if [the little procession]3080-the little procession would never reach [the inn]956-the inn ; but as [they]3075-four men drew near [it]956-the inn [he]214-singleton would have given [his]214-singleton right hand for a longer delay . [The people of [the inn]956-the inn]3082-the people of the inn came forward to meet [them]3075-four men , in [a little silent , solemn convoy]3084-a little silent , solemn convoy . In the doorway , clinging together , appeared [the two bereaved women]3085-the two bereaved women . [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick tottered forward with outstretched hands and the expression of [a blind person]3086-a blind person ; but before [she]325-roderick reached [[her]325-roderick son]459-her son , [Mary Garland]193-mary garland had rushed past [her]325-roderick , and , in the face of [the staring , pitying , awe - stricken crowd]3088-the staring , pitying , awe - stricken crowd , had flung [herself]193-mary garland , with the magnificent movement of [one whose rights were supreme , and with a loud , tremendous cry]3089-one whose rights were supreme , and with a loud , tremendous cry , upon the senseless vestige of [her]193-mary garland love .

That cry still lives in [Rowland]281-rowland 's ears . It interposes , persistently , against the reflection that when [he]214-singleton sometimes - very rarely - sees [her]193-mary garland , [she]193-mary garland is unreservedly kind to [him]214-singleton ; against the memory that during the dreary journey back to [America]25-america , made of course with [his]214-singleton assistance , there was a great frankness in [her]193-mary garland gratitude , a great gratitude in [her]193-mary garland frankness . [Miss Garland]182-miss garland lives with [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick , at [Northampton]2-northampton , where [Rowland]281-rowland visits [[his]214-singleton cousin]343-his cousin [Cecilia]169-cecilia more frequently than of old . When [he]214-singleton calls upon [Miss Garland]182-miss garland [he]214-singleton never sees [Mrs. Hudson]325-roderick . [Cecilia]169-cecilia , who , having [her]169-cecilia shrewd impression that [he]214-singleton comes to see [Miss Garland]182-miss garland as much as to see [herself]169-cecilia , does not feel obliged to seem unduly flattered , calls [him]214-singleton , whenever [he]214-singleton reappears , the most restless of [mortals]3091-mortals . But [he]214-singleton always says to [her]169-cecilia in answer , " No , [I]214-singleton assure [you]169-cecilia [I]214-singleton am the most patient ! "[214-singleton]
